Correct_Diagnosis: Low TSH; High T4; High T3

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of tremors and movement difficulties in an elderly patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has experienced a tremor in his legs and arms for many years, worsening in the last year. He reports that the tremor is more pronounced at rest and diminishes with movement. His family has noted slower movements and difficulty initiating them. There is no significant past medical history, and he consumes wine, which he claims does not affect his tremors.

Neurological_.Findings: Hunched posture, expressionless face, pill-rolling tremor accentuated by clenching the contralateral hand, alleviated by finger-nose test, difficulty with imaginary piano playing, increased tone in arm muscles bilaterally, resistance to passive movement at elbow, knee, and hip joints.

Objective_for_Doctor: Manage postpartum bleeding in a woman who recently delivered a healthy infant.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient gave birth to a healthy infant 30 minutes ago via vacuum-assisted vaginal delivery. She has a history of type 1 diabetes with good glycemic control throughout her pregnancy. No perineal tear or intentional episiotomy occurred.

Secondary_Symptoms: Soft uterine fundus palpated 4 cm above the umbilicus

Uterine_.Findings: Uterine fundus soft and palpated 4 cm above the umbilicus

Correct_Diagnosis: Perform uterine massage and administer oxytocin

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the pathogen causing vaginal itching, painful urination, and vesicular ulcers in a sexually active female.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with intense vaginal itching, painful urination, lethargy, fevers, and headaches. She is sexually active and occasionally uses condoms.

Genital_.Findings: Red, vesicular ulcers on labia and tender inguinal lymphadenopathy

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of vaginal bleeding and emesis in a pregnant patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is in her 12th week of pregnancy and presents with vaginal bleeding and 3 episodes of non-bloody, non-bilious emesis. She has missed her last 2 prenatal visits due to work. Past medical history includes obesity and type I diabetes mellitus. Family history includes ovarian cancer in mother and endometrial cancer in maternal grandmother.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mild tenderness to palpation in right suprapubic region

Abdominal_.Findings: Uterus at 16 weeks in size with mild tenderness to palpation on right suprapubic region.

Ultrasound.Findings: Intrauterine cystic mass

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of numbness and tingling in the hands, likely related to median nerve compression.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with numbness and tingling on the palmar aspects of both hands, worse on the right. Symptoms are aggravated by activities like driving and brushing her hair. She has a history of rheumatoid arthritis for 9 years, managed with methotrexate.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Numbness and tingling in both hands
Secondary_Symptoms: Pain upon waking requiring hand shaking for relief
Symptoms worse in the right (dominant) hand

Neurological_.Findings: Tingling sensation in the palm upon lightly tapping the anterior aspect of the right wrist

Electromyography.Findings: Focal slowing of conduction velocity in the median nerve in the carpal tunnel

Correct_Diagnosis: Focal slowing of conduction velocity in the median nerve in the carpal tunnel

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of vaginal discharge in a 15-year-old girl with type 1 diabetes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 2-week history of vaginal discharge and has type 1 diabetes mellitus, with insulin as her only medication. She reports menses occurring at 28- to 29-day intervals, with her last menstrual period 3 weeks ago. She is reluctant to discuss sexual activity.

Pelvic_.Findings: White, thin, odorless vaginal discharge; no abnormalities on wet mount

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage unilateral breast pain in a breastfeeding patient to determine the need for intervention.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening unilateral breast pain while breastfeeding her son. Past medical history includes gestational diabetes controlled by diet and exercise.

Breast_.Findings: Erythematous breast with a 3-cm tender and fluctuant mass of the left breast

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of hematuria and weight loss in an elderly male patient with no signs of infection.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with pink urine for the last week, with no pain during urination or associated fevers. He reports occasional dull pressure in his back for the past two months and notes unintentional weight loss.

Secondary_Symptoms: Occasional dull pressure in the back

Abdominal_.Findings: Firm mass appreciated deep in the left abdomen; no back or costovertebral angle tenderness

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of right lower abdominal pain, weight loss, and gastrointestinal symptoms in a patient with a history of travel to Cambodia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has experienced right lower abdominal pain for 6 months, with multiple non-bloody, watery bowel movements daily and abdominal cramping. She reports sudden palpitations, shortness of breath, and facial flushing. Additionally, she has lost 7 kg over the past 3 months and has a history of smoking a pack of cigarettes daily for 15 years. She went on a 3-week hiking trip to Cambodia 6 months ago.

Physical_.Findings: Tiny blood vessels noted on face and arms, bilateral wheezing on lung auscultation, soft and nondistended abdomen with localized tenderness in the right lower quadrant, but no rebound tenderness or guarding.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of inability to breastfeed and hypotension in a postpartum patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Two days after vaginal delivery of a healthy newborn at term, the patient is unable to breastfeed. Her labor was complicated by antepartum hemorrhage, for which she received two units of packed red blood cells.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of diarrhea and gastrointestinal symptoms in a young woman with a family history of colon cancer.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-month history of 3-4 bloody stools per day and 10 pounds of unexpected weight loss. She also reports intermittent mild gnawing lower abdominal pain. Past medical history is unremarkable, takes no medications, and denies drug allergies. Family history includes colon cancer in maternal aunt, rheumatoid arthritis in paternal aunt, and Sjogren syndrome in paternal grandmother.

Secondary_Symptoms: Intermittent mild gnawing lower abdominal pain

Abdominal_.Findings: Mild hypogastric tenderness to palpation

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of worsening jaundice in a 4-day-old girl and decide the appropriate treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with jaundice that has persisted for the last 2 days. Initially diagnosed as neonatal jaundice, parents report worsening yellow color. She is the first child from a healthy pregnancy, born at term via spontaneous transvaginal delivery without complications.

Secondary_Symptoms: Family history of infant mortality and unexplained jaundice in relatives

Vital_Signs.General_Condition: Awake, calm, and appears healthy except for jaundice
Vital_Signs.Skin: Yellow tone of the skin and scleral icterus

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and adjust medications for a patient presenting with erectile dysfunction and a history of hypertension and congestive heart failure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports difficulty maintaining an erection over the past month. He has a history of hypertension and congestive heart failure. His medication regimen includes metoprolol, amlodipine, furosemide, losartan, and aspirin. Lisinopril was switched to losartan three months ago due to a periodic cough, and metoprolol and furosemide were added two months ago for better control of hypertension and edema.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mild pitting edema on the dorsum of both feet

Extremities.Findings: Mild pitting edema on the dorsum of both feet

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying genetic disorder causing acute metabolic crisis in a newborn with projectile vomiting and neurological deterioration.

Patient_Actor.History: Developed projectile vomiting 48 hours after delivery, lethargy, poor muscle tone, and hyperventilation. Experienced rapid neurological decline leading to seizures, coma, and death.

Autopsy_Findings.Diagnosis: Rare genetic disorder leading to low levels of N-acetylglutamate

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of a holosystolic murmur and the patient's lack of symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a holosystolic murmur best heard over the apex, radiating to the axilla. She has no signs of pulmonary hypertension or edema.

Correct_Diagnosis: The left atrium is compensating with increased compliance

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with tremors and signs suggestive of Parkinson's disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a tremor in his left hand that started approximately three months ago. His medical history includes emphysema and myasthenia gravis, along with a significant smoking history of 40 pack-years.

Neurological_.Findings: Slowed movements and shuffling gait observed during gait analysis.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the vascular distribution affected in a patient presenting with slurred speech and difficulty in spontaneous speech production.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presented to the emergency room with slurred speech following a minor headache while watching a movie. His past medical history includes hypertension and hyperlipidemia. He is a retired lawyer with a 25-pack-year smoking history and consumes 4-5 beers per day. Family history includes father died of myocardial infarction and mother died of breast cancer.

Secondary_Symptoms: Minor headache prior to slurred speech

Neurological_.Findings: Patient can understand and repeat statements without difficulty but hesitates with every word, taking 30 seconds to finish a short sentence.

Correct_Diagnosis: Anterior cerebral artery and middle cerebral artery watershed area

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of hematuria and bilateral flank pain in a patient with a history of urinary stones and recurrent urinary tract infections.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented with hematuria and bilateral flank pain. He has a history of passing urinary stones and recurrent urinary tract infections. There is no recent trauma reported. Family history includes a father with kidney failure who underwent a kidney transplant.

Abdominal_.Findings: Palpable bilateral flank masses

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the mode of inheritance for a mitochondrial myopathy in a pediatric patient presenting with neurological and muscular symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient developed muscle weakness and pain, vomiting, seizures, and severe headache. He also exhibits hemiparesis on one side of the body.

Neurological_.Findings: Hemiparesis on one side of the body

Correct_Diagnosis: It is transmitted only through the mother.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of the patient's anemia and jaundice, and assess the risk for complications.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-month history of progressive fatigue and intermittent abdominal pain. She has noticed darker urine in the morning. Five months prior, she was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus and is currently taking metformin.

Physical_.Findings: Pallor and jaundice observed; no splenomegaly.

Urinalysis.Findings: Urine is red, but shows no RBCs.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of hyperkalemia in a patient with diabetes and signs of dehydration.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department with weakness, abdominal pain, and a productive cough for 4 days. She reports increased urination over the past 2 days, nausea, and five episodes of vomiting this morning. She has a history of type 1 diabetes mellitus and hypertension, and admits to forgetting her medications (insulin and lisinopril) in the last few days.

Abdominal_.Findings: Diffuse tenderness with no guarding or rebound; bowel sounds normal.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the management of a 3-year-old girl with cystic fibrosis who presents with multiple falls, dry skin, and ocular findings.

Patient_Actor.History: The child has cystic fibrosis and has had multiple falls over the past 4 months, particularly in the evening. Current medications include pancreatic enzyme supplements, an albuterol inhaler, and acetylcysteine. She is at the 10th percentile for height and the 5th percentile for weight.

Secondary_Symptoms: Cone-shaped elevated papules on the trunk and extremities
Irregularly shaped foamy gray patch on the left conjunctiva

General_.Findings: Dry skin and cone-shaped elevated papules present on the trunk and extremities. An irregularly shaped foamy gray patch noted on the left conjunctiva.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and provide management recommendations for chronic insomnia in an otherwise healthy patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 7-month history of insomnia, characterized by difficulty initiating sleep and a sleep onset latency of about 1 hour. She has been taking melatonin most nights.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of bilateral blurry vision and difficulty driving at night in a patient with diabetes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and hyperlipidemia. He presents with worsening bilateral blurry vision and difficulty driving at night over the past 5 months.

Eye_.Findings: Cloudy opacities of the lenses bilaterally observed via slit-lamp

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of recurrent diarrhea in a 15-month-old infant and assess growth patterns.

Patient_Actor.History: The infant has a history of repeated episodes of diarrhea over the last 9 months, appearing healthy until 6 months of age. No history of lethargy, pedal edema, constipation, or vomiting was reported. The mother has been regularly plotting his weight and length on a growth chart.

Secondary_Symptoms: Repeated episodes of diarrhea over the last 9 months

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of vaginal bleeding and abdominal pain in a pregnant woman presenting in her 38th week of gestation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is in her 38th week of pregnancy with a history of hypertension. She reports feeling painful contractions and vaginal bleeding after falling off her bike this morning.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Lower abdominal and pelvic pain during contractions

Abdominal_.Findings: Gravid and hypertonic uterus, moderate blood in the vaginal vault

Ultrasound.Findings: No abnormalities noted

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of cardiac changes in a deceased homeless man found unresponsive.

Patient_Actor.History: Found unresponsive by police and brought to the emergency department. Despite resuscitation efforts, the patient was apneic and had no palpable pulses upon arrival.

Heart.Description: Normal ventricles with a sigmoid-shaped interventricular septum

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the clinical presentation of a suspected Mycoplasma infection and explain the immune response.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with 1 day of fever and chills and has been coughing for 2 days. His roommate was recently diagnosed with Mycoplasma infection. The patient is otherwise healthy and up to date on vaccinations.

Secondary_Symptoms: Recent exposure to a sick roommate

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose breast lesions in a patient with a significant family history of cancer.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is here for her annual checkup, reporting good health over the past year except for a bout of flu in December. She has a significant smoking history (1 pack/day since age 21) and drinks socially. Family history includes prostate cancer in father at age 51 and ovarian cancer in paternal aunt at age 41.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Firm, immobile, painless lump in the upper outer quadrant of the left breast
Secondary_Symptoms: Two smaller nodules in the lower quadrants of the right breast

Breast_.Findings: Firm, immobile, painless lump in the upper outer quadrant of left breast and two smaller nodules in the lower quadrants of right breast

Biopsy.Findings: Small, atypical, glandular, duct-like cells with stellate morphology

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of severe epigastric pain and associated symptoms following a history of vomiting and significant alcohol use.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with severe epigastric pain that started an hour prior to presentation. He has a history of poorly controlled hypertension, type II diabetes, and alcohol use disorder. He had been vomiting multiple times daily for the past week with yellow emesis and denies seeing blood. He has two prior hospitalizations for acute pancreatitis and smokes 1 pack of cigarettes per day for the last 35 years.

Cardiac_Auscultation.Findings: Mediastinal crackling in synchrony with cardiac contraction in the left lateral decubitus position

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the co-activation signaling molecule required for the activation of a specific lymphocyte cell line binding antigen-presenting cells.

Patient_Actor.History: A researcher is studying interactions between foreign antigens and human immune cells, isolating a line of lymphocytes known to bind antigen-presenting cells.

Secondary_Symptoms: Isolation of a cell surface protein that binds the constant portion of class I major histocompatibility complex
Requirement for co-activation for lymphocyte activation

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of resistant hypertension and other systemic symptoms in a patient with multiple comorbidities.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a follow-up  after being prescribed lisinopril for persistently high blood pressure readings. She has a history of hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, polycystic ovarian disease, and hyperlipidemia. Current medications include amlodipine, hydrochlorothiazide, lisinopril, metformin, glimepiride, and atorvastatin. She has a family history of hyperthyroidism and hypertension. Lifestyle habits include no smoking and moderate alcohol consumption.

General_.Findings: Obese patient with no other abnormalities noted.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with irregular heart rhythm and signs of heart failure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a complaint of his heart racing for the last 8 days, fatigue, difficulty breathing with exertion, and bilateral leg swelling for the last 2 weeks. He has a 25-year history of hypertension and a long history of heavy alcohol consumption. He denies smoking.

Lower_Limb_.Findings: Mild pitting edema of the ankles bilaterally

Test_Results.ECG: Results shown in the image (not provided)

Transesophageal_Echocardiography.Findings: Reduced ejection fraction of 32% and dilatation of all chambers of the heart, no obvious intracardiac thrombus

Correct_Diagnosis: Rivaroxaban for 3–4 weeks followed by cardioversion and continuation of rivaroxaban

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of acute renal failure in a patient with heart failure and identify contributing medications.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department with a 1-week history of progressive shortness of breath, lower extremity edema, and a 4-kg (9-lb) weight gain. Her medical history includes ischemic cardiomyopathy and rheumatoid arthritis.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pitting edema of the lower extremities
Crackles over both lower lung fields

Physical__Findings.Findings: Pitting edema of lower extremities and crackles over both lower lung fields

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of precocious puberty and abnormal vaginal bleeding in a prepubescent girl.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the physician for scant painless vaginal bleeding 6 hours ago. No history of serious illness or trauma. Family history indicates older sister had her first period at age 11.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pubic hair development at Tanner stage 2

Physical__Findings.Findings: Normal external genitalia

Hormonal_Test.Findings: Intravenous leuprolide causes an increase in serum luteinizing hormone

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fever, bleeding, and fatigue in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented with a 3-day history of fever and bleeding after brushing his teeth. He has been fatigued and asked to be picked up early from soccer practice. The mother reports that he appears pale and ill.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Fever and bleeding after brushing teeth
Secondary_Symptoms: Subcutaneous bleeding on abdomen and shins

Abdominal_.Findings: Soft, nontender abdomen with no organomegaly

Skin_.Findings: Several spots of subcutaneous bleeding on the abdomen and shins

Bone_Marrow_Biopsy.Expected_Findings: Hypocellular fat-filled marrow with RBCs of normal morphology

Correct_Diagnosis: Hypocellular fat-filled marrow with RBCs of normal morphology

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a patient with suspected drug overdose and bradycardia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department 3 hours after ingesting approximately 30 tablets of an unknown drug in an apparent suicide attempt.

Secondary_Symptoms: Prolonged PR intervals and narrow QRS complexes on ECG

Respiratory_.Findings: Scattered expiratory wheezing throughout both lung fields

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of persistent dry cough in a patient with a history of asthma and recent medication changes.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with a persistent dry cough that has been ongoing for some time. She was started on lisinopril and metformin three weeks ago for elevated blood pressure and fasting blood glucose. Medical history includes eczema, asthma, and seasonal allergies.

Secondary_Symptoms: Burning sensation in sternum when eating large meals

Physical_Exam.Findings: Painful bumps on lower extremities attributed to 'bumping her shins' during exercise, and obese habitus.

Correct_Diagnosis: Non-caseating granulomas are found on biopsy of mediastinal lymph nodes

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the best practice to decrease complications from central venous access line placement in a critically ill patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was admitted to the intensive care unit with necrotizing pancreatitis and developed profound hypotension two hours after admission.

Correct_Diagnosis: Preparation of the skin with chlorhexidine and alcohol

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and determine the underlying cause of leg swelling and hoarseness in a 51-year-old female patient with a history of hypertension and coronary artery disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with swelling of her legs for 4 months, initially starting on the left leg and then the right. She reports itchy legs and has a 1-month history of hoarseness. She returned from a trip to Mexico 8 months ago and has a medical history of hypertension, constipation, and coronary artery disease. She is a primary school teacher with a family history of type 2 diabetes mellitus. She smoked half a pack of cigarettes daily for 6 years but stopped 11 years ago. She consumes one glass of wine daily and occasionally more on weekends. Current medications include aspirin, bisoprolol, and atorvastatin.

Physical__Findings.Findings: Bilateral pretibial non-pitting edema, skin is indurated, cool, and dry. Peripheral pulses are palpated bilaterally.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of sensory and motor deficits in the patient's upper extremity following an arterial line placement.

Patient_Actor.History: Recently admitted to the MICU for acetaminophen overdose. An axillary arterial line was placed, which became infected and was removed. The patient had substantial swelling and bruising of the upper extremity following this procedure.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Lack of sensation over the palmar and dorsal surface of the small finger and half of the ring finger

Correct_Diagnosis: Compression of ulnar nerve secondary to coagulopathy

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the likelihood of von Willebrand's disease in a pediatric patient with a family history and clinical signs of easy bruising.

Patient_Actor.History: The mother has a history of von Willebrand's disease (vWD) and is concerned her daughter may be affected. The daughter bruises easily, and the bruises last longer than those of her brother. The mother's mother had pulmonary embolism recently. The daughter was born preterm (32 weeks) due to preeclampsia and had a NICU stay of two and a half weeks.

Secondary_Symptoms: Bruises scattered around knees and elbows

General_.Findings: Scattered bruises throughout all extremities, particularly around knees and elbows

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of intermittent palpitations, hypertension, and hypokalemia in a patient with recent changes in medications.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with intermittent palpitations over the past 2 weeks, along with constipation and increased fatigue. She was diagnosed with hypertension 4 weeks ago and started on chlorthalidone.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mild weakness of the upper and lower extremities

Abdominal_.Findings: Soft and nontender abdomen

Neurological_.Findings: Mild weakness of upper and lower extremities, Deep tendon reflexes 1+ bilaterally

ECG.Findings: Premature atrial complexes

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for an elderly patient with decreasing consciousness and a history of monoclonal gammopathy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 2-day history of decreasing level of consciousness and blurred vision for several days. He experienced transient numbness in the right arm for 3 days two weeks ago. He was diagnosed with monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance 2 years ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: Palpable liver and spleen 6 cm below costal margins

Physical_.Findings: Cervical lymphadenopathy, gingival bleeding, and palpable liver and spleen.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage potential abdominal trauma following a motor vehicle accident.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was the restrained driver in a motor vehicle accident and was brought in by fire rescue after a prolonged extraction. He had a GCS of 13 at the scene and was transported with stable ABCs.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Exquisite tenderness to palpation in the abdomen

Abdominal_.Findings: Exquisite tenderness with rebound and guarding, positive FAST exam at Morrison's pouch

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the most appropriate pharmacotherapy for a premenopausal woman with ER-positive and PR-positive invasive ductal carcinoma.

Patient_Actor.History: Underwent lumpectomy after a diagnosis of invasive ductal carcinoma of the breast.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pathologic  shows positive staining for estrogen receptor
Pathologic  shows positive staining for progesterone receptor
Pathologic  shows negative staining for HER2

Correct_Diagnosis: Selective agonist at estrogen receptors in bone tissue

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of exertional chest pain and assess the risk of medication side effects after starting atorvastatin.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 4-month history of chest pain on exertion, described as dull retrosternal pressure that resolves after one minute of rest. She has a history of hypertension managed with lisinopril and metoprolol. She does not smoke or consume alcohol.

Cardiac_.Findings: No murmurs, rubs, or gallops

ECG.Findings: No abnormalities

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the consequences of impaired phagolysosomal acidification on antigen presentation.

Patient_Actor.History: N/A

Correct_Diagnosis: Deficient presentation of pathogens to CD4 T-cells

Objective_for_Doctor: Provide guidance on effective UV protection measures to prevent premature skin aging.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient works as an archaeologist and is concerned about UV exposure while working outdoors for extended periods.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of episodic tremors, headaches, and sweating in a patient with recent type 2 diabetes diagnosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 6-week history of episodic tremors, headaches, and sweating, with a noted weight gain of 2.5 kg (5 lb 8 oz). He was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus two months ago and was started on an oral antidiabetic drug.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying cause of headaches and physical changes in a previously healthy male.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with an 8-month history of headaches that are more severe in the mornings. No significant medical history prior to this episode.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Headache, more severe in the mornings
Secondary_Symptoms: Enlargement of the nose, forehead, jaw, hands, fingers, and feet
Impaired vision in the outer peripheral fields of both eyes

Ophthalmologic_.Findings: Impaired vision in the outer peripheral fields of both eyes

Physical_Exam.Findings: Enlargement of the nose, forehead, jaw, hands, fingers, and feet

Correct_Diagnosis: Elevated serum insulin-like growth factor-1 level

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of acute illness with systemic symptoms and rash in a pediatric patient following nasal packing.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department with vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and dizziness for the past 3 hours, accompanied by fever, chills, and muscle pain for the last day. He had a recent episode of epistaxis due to nasal picking and was treated with anterior nasal packing, which was not removed.

Secondary_Symptoms: Diffuse erythematous macular rash involving palms and soles
Purulent discharge from nasal mucosa upon removal of packing

Physical_Exam.Findings: Conjunctival and oropharyngeal hyperemia with diffuse erythematous macular rash

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of urinary retention and constipation in a patient on antipsychotic medication.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with constipation and difficulty urinating for the past day. He has been drinking a lot of water without relief and reports feeling tired all the time. Past medical history is significant for schizophrenia diagnosed 3 months ago, currently managed on antipsychotic medication. Current medications include sildenafil.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of irregular menses, galactorrhea, and fatigue in a patient with a history of hypothyroidism and recent medication use.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-month history of irregular menses occurring at intervals of 25-40 days, milky discharge from nipples, fatigue, and weight gain. She has a history of schizophrenia and was started on clozapine 5 months ago. She has hypothyroidism and has not taken levothyroxine for the past 6 months.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the immune response activation due to Rhinovirus infection and its outcomes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with symptoms of the common cold following infection of respiratory epithelial cells with Rhinovirus.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of diarrhea and abdominal cramping following recent travel to Mexico.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented with diarrhea for 2 days and abdominal cramps. He returned from a trip to Mexico 3 weeks ago, where he completed a marathon. He has a history of mild anemia and takes fish oil, a multivitamin, and iron supplements to improve athletic performance. He consumes 3-4 beers on weekends.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mild tenderness in the left lower quadrant

Abdominal_.Findings: Mild tenderness to palpation of the left lower quadrant without rebound or guarding

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying cause of hemoptysis, fever, and renal impairment in a patient with a recent history of cough and urinary changes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-week history of fever, fatigue, and hemoptysis, with a preceding 4-month period of weight loss and intermittent dark-colored urine. He has no prior history of cough or hemoptysis and denies contact with anyone with a chronic cough.

General_.Findings: Anxious but tired-looking man with mild respiratory distress and mild pallor.

Urine_Tests.Urine_Microscopy: More than 5 RBC under high power microscopy

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of severe abdominal pain and discomfort in a patient with a history of similar episodes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department with severe abdominal pain radiating to her back, which started 2 days ago and is associated with nausea. She has a history of similar episodes after fatty meals that resolved spontaneously. She drinks socially and has a 15 pack-year smoking history.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness in the right upper quadrant
Epigastric tenderness with guarding and rebound tenderness

Abdominal_.Findings: Tenderness in the right upper quadrant and epigastrium with guarding and rebound tenderness

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the management plan for a patient presenting with symptoms suggestive of primary HIV infection.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 7-day history of headaches, sore throat, diarrhea, fatigue, and low-grade fevers. No significant past medical history, recent travel, or sick contacts. Endorses engaging in sex acts for money and recreational drugs over the last several months.

General_.Findings: No external abnormalities of genitalia; heart and lung sounds normal on auscultation.

Correct_Diagnosis: Retest with ELISA and Western blot in 2.5–8.5 weeks and again in 6 months

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of flank pain and reddish discoloration of urine in a patient with recent antibiotic use.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with flank pain, myalgia, and reddish discoloration of urine for the past 2 days. She had a fever and sore throat a week ago and was prescribed antibiotics. She has no significant past medical history.

Secondary_Symptoms: Faint maculopapular rash over trunk and extremities

Abdominal_.Findings: Soft abdomen with no costovertebral angle tenderness

Oral_.Findings: No abnormalities in mouth and pharynx

Skin_.Findings: Faint maculopapular rash over trunk and extremities

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the cause of involuntary muscle contractions and pain in a child with a history of incomplete vaccination.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department with a 1-day history of involuntary muscle contractions and pain in the back and neck. Two weeks prior, he fell while playing in the sandbox and scraped both knees. He has not received any vaccinations since birth.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Involuntary muscle contractions and pain in back and neck
Secondary_Symptoms: Inability to open mouth beyond 1 cm

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of jaundice and associated symptoms in a young construction worker.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with yellowish discoloration of skin and eyes, nausea, and loss of appetite for the past 2 weeks. His past medical history is insignificant, and he is a smoker but has developed a distaste for smoking recently.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Yellowish discoloration of skin and eyes (jaundice)

Physical__Findings.Findings: Mild hepatomegaly

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of jaundice and weight loss in a previously healthy patient with a liver lesion.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 2-month history of weight loss and yellowing of the skin. He works as a farmer cultivating soybean and corn and does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.

Abdominal_.Findings: Scleral icterus and tender hepatomegaly

Ultrasonography.Findings: 5-cm nodular lesion in the right lobe of the liver

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient's health status and determine the appropriate pneumococcal vaccination based on his medical history.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents for a regular checkup with a complaint of periodic difficulty falling asleep. He has a medical history of tympanoplasty for tympanic membrane rupture, intussusception requiring surgery, and anaphylactic reaction after a Tdap vaccination.

Secondary_Symptoms: Laterally displaced point of maximum impulse

Physical_Exam.Findings: Laterally displaced point of maximum impulse

Correct_Diagnosis: He had an allergic reaction to the Tdap vaccination.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of recurrent swollen joints in a young male, with a focus on a recent episode in the right knee.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-day history of a swollen right knee and has experienced similar episodes in the past few weeks affecting the right knee and sometimes the left elbow, lasting about 5 days. He had a rash that subsided 2 months ago. He resides in Connecticut and works as a landscaper.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness and warmth in the knee
Limited range of motion due to pain

Joint_.Findings: Tender and warm right knee with limited range of motion

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of recurrent nosebleeds and prolonged bleeding following dental procedures.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with recurrent episodes of spontaneous nosebleeds over the past 6 months and a history of prolonged bleeding after wisdom teeth extraction 2 years ago. He does not smoke or consume alcohol and takes no medications.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of jaundice and fatigue in a patient returning from a trip to Guatemala.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient returned from a 2-week class trip to Guatemala 2 days ago, where she experienced watery diarrhea, nausea, and lack of appetite for 3 days, which resolved without treatment. She took primaquine for malaria prophylaxis and had a urinary tract infection treated with nitrofurantoin three weeks prior.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Yellowish discoloration of the eyes (scleral icterus)

Physical__Findings.Findings: Scleral icterus noted, no lymphadenopathy, remainder of  normal

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the psychological impact of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) symptoms on a patient with skin problems.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with skin problems on his hands that are itchy, red, and tender, affecting his work. He has used the same dish soap, hand soap, and industrial cleaner for the past 5 years without significant changes in his environment. He has no past medical or psychiatric history and enjoys his work and family.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Itchy, red, and tender skin problems on hands
Secondary_Symptoms: Compulsive hand washing for up to 20 minutes
Difficulty performing job due to compulsions

Correct_Diagnosis: Patients generally have insight into their condition.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying cause of chronic musculoskeletal pain and associated symptoms in a young woman.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with minor aches and pains in her bones and muscles, which have worsened since moving to college. She maintains a balanced diet, is physically active, and is sexually active with one partner. Increased stress from studying for finals and occasional diarrhea are also noted. She has been on acyclovir for a herpes simplex virus infection with minimal improvement.

Secondary_Symptoms: 4/5 strength in upper and lower extremities

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying cause of anemia and weight loss in a 65-year-old male patient during a routine checkup.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a yearly checkup, reporting good health except for minor fatigue attributed to aging. He has a medical history of hypertension and is currently taking chlorthalidone. He consumes 1 glass of red wine nightly and has lost 5 pounds since his last appointment 4 months ago.

General_.Findings: Obese man in no acute distress

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the correct descriptor for a newly identified pigmented skin lesion.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a recently identified area of flat, intact, pigmented skin, which she believes is a large freckle. The lesion darkens during the summer when she is outdoors. There is no significant past medical, past surgical, family, or social history.

Skin_.Findings: Lesion measured to be 6 mm in diameter, flat, intact, and pigmented

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage the symptoms of premenstrual syndrome (PMS) in a female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with mild anxiety and mood swings lasting several months, which affect her work and personal relationships. Symptoms increase in severity before menses and resolve rapidly on the first day of menses. She reports increased irritability, breast tenderness, bloating, fatigue, binge-eating, and difficulty concentrating for 10 days prior to her menstrual period. Regular periods every 24 days, two normal vaginal deliveries, and uses condoms for contraception. Family history includes her mother having major depressive disorder.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Mood swings affecting work and personal relationships

Physical_Exam.Findings: Unremarkable

Correct_Diagnosis: Oral contraceptive and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs)

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying mechanism of hyperglycemia in a patient with fatigue and headaches.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for an annual health maintenance , reporting fatigue and headaches for the past month. She has a history of mild persistent asthma and anxiety disorder. She has been drinking 2–3 glasses of red wine per night and has a 16-year smoking history of one pack per day. She recently resized her wedding ring due to finger swelling and has been working long hours due to a company merger. Family history includes a father with a pituitary adenoma.

General_.Findings: No abnormalities noted.

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the physiological changes in the oxygen-hemoglobin dissociation curve due to altitude training.

Patient_Actor.History: The athlete trained for 5 months at an altitude of 1.5 km (5,000 feet) to enhance performance.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Increased running pace at sea-level venues

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the effectiveness of a new blood test for detecting antibodies to the EBV virus based on sensitivity and specificity results.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: 2,000 patients in a study, with 1,200 known EBV-infected patients
Patient_Actor.History: The scientist has been developing a new blood test for EBV detection, aiming for improved sensitivity and specificity.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate classification for cancer screening tests in a healthy 65-year-old woman.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has not seen a doctor in 12 years and feels very healthy. She is establishing care with a primary care provider.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of depigmented skin lesions in a 14-year-old boy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has had multiple patches on his trunk and thighs that are lighter than the rest of his skin, gradually increasing in size over the past 2 years. He also has depigmented lesions on his hands, feet, and around the mouth. There are no associated symptoms such as itchiness, redness, numbness, or pain. His family emigrated from Indonesia 8 years ago.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Multiple depigmented patches on the skin
Secondary_Symptoms: Gradual increase in size of patches
Depigmented lesions on hands, feet, and around the mouth

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the implications of changing the cutoff for severe hyponatremia on the prediction of symptomatic patients requiring hypertonic saline.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Patients in an internal medicine ward
Patient_Actor.History: Several patients are noted to have hyponatremia without associated symptoms. The physician observes that some are chronically hyponatremic with serum levels < 120 mEq/L but remain asymptomatic.

Blood_Tests.Serum Sodium: < 120 mEq/L (potentially < 115 mEq/L if cutoff is changed)

Correct_Diagnosis: Increased specificity and decreased negative predictive value

Objective_for_Doctor: Interpret the genetic implications of achondroplasia in a family with a history of intrauterine fetal demise and previous children with varying phenotypes.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Husband and wife, both with achondroplasia
Patient_Actor.History: This couple has experienced their 3rd child loss due to intrauterine fetal demise. Their first son has achondroplasia, while their daughter is phenotypically normal and expected to grow to normal height. Both parents were adopted and do not know the genetic background of their biological families.

Correct_Diagnosis: There is a 75% chance of having a viable offspring

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine which HIV positive patient requires prophylaxis against Mycobacterium avium-intracellulare.

Patient_Actor.History: HIV positive with a CD4 count of 20 cells/microliter and a viral load of < 50 copies/mL.

Correct_Diagnosis: 30-year old HIV positive male with CD4 count of 20 cells/microliter and a viral load of < 50 copies/mL

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the causal organism of bloody diarrhea in a pediatric patient with a recent history of petting zoo exposure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-day history of bloody diarrhea and abdominal pain. She visited a petting zoo four days prior to symptom onset.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness to palpation in the right lower quadrant

Abdominal_.Findings: Tenderness to palpation of the right lower quadrant

Stool_Cultures.Findings: Colonies that turn black after adding phenylenediamine

Correct_Diagnosis: Gram-negative, flagellated bacteria that do not ferment lactose

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the cause of feeding difficulties and respiratory symptoms in a 6-week-old infant.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the pediatrician due to feeding difficulty for the last 4 days. The infant breathes rapidly and sweats profusely while nursing, drinks very little breast milk, and stops feeding as if tired, only to resume after a few minutes. No history of cough, sneezing, nasal congestion, or fever. Born at full term with a birth weight of 3.2 kg (7.0 lb).

Cardiac_.Findings: Precordial murmur starting after S1, maximal intensity at end of systole, waning during late diastole, best heard over second left intercostal space, radiating to left clavicle.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the study design used to investigate the relationship between active cocaine use and the incidence of syphilis in the United States.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Patients identified as active cocaine users
Patient_Actor.History: Patients did not have a prior history of syphilis.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of fever, muscle rigidity, and confusion in a patient with a recent history of new antipsychotic medication.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-day history of fever, muscle rigidity, and confusion. He started a new medication for schizophrenia 2 months ago. There is no history of sore throat, burning micturition, or loose motions.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and identify the cause of lethargy and skin discoloration in a 3-month-old infant after ingestion of potentially contaminated baby food.

Patient_Actor.History: The infant lives in an old house and presents with lethargy and skin discoloration after being fed locally prepared baby food from a farmer's market.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of knee pain and swelling following a sports injury.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient experienced pain and swelling in his right knee after falling during football practice. Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pain and swelling in the right knee

Knee_.Findings: Swollen and tender right knee with limited flexion and observed 8 mm of backward translation of the foreleg upon applying pressure to the proximal tibia.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the risks associated with pregnancy in a patient with poorly controlled type I diabetes mellitus.

Patient_Actor.History: Presenting for first prenatal visit after a positive home pregnancy test one week ago. Last menstrual period was 8 weeks ago. Prescribed lisinopril but has not started taking it. Family history includes an autistic brother; otherwise unremarkable.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate anticoagulant therapy for a patient with suspected deep vein thrombosis (DVT) following a long flight.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with left leg swelling that began after a transcontinental flight. A duplex ultrasound revealed a noncompressible popliteal vein.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and confirm the diagnosis of a major depressive episode based on the patient's symptoms and history.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with depressed mood lasting most days for the past month and has experienced loss of appetite for the past 3 weeks. She reports significant deterioration in job performance and lack of interest in previously enjoyed activities such as dancing and music. Her husband mentions she has had many sleepless nights over the last month. There is no history of smoking, alcohol intake, or illicit substance use, and no significant past medical history.

Secondary_Symptoms: Anhedonia (lack of desire for previously enjoyed activities)

Physical_.Findings: Unremarkable

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the impact of imaging modalities on breast cancer mortality and identify potential biases in the study design.

Patient_Actor.History: Women randomized to receive either conventional mammography or conventional mammography with breast MRI in a study investigating breast cancer mortality.

Secondary_Symptoms: Median survival of 17.0 years in conventional mammography group
Median survival of 19.5 years in MRI plus conventional mammography group

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a patient presenting with right upper quadrant pain, fever, and jaundice.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents to the emergency department with right upper quadrant pain and fever lasting 2 hours. She denies alcohol, cigarette, and drug use and reports no other medical problems. Body mass index is 30 kg/m^2.

Secondary_Symptoms: Jaundice in sclera and at the base of the tongue
Tenderness in the right upper quadrant

Abdominal_.Findings: Tenderness in the right upper quadrant

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the next step in management for a patient with suspected intra-abdominal injury following a motor vehicle accident.

Patient_Actor.History: Involved in a motor vehicle accident during a rainstorm. Past medical history includes hypertension, hyperlipidemia, hypothyroidism, and gout. Home medications include hydrochlorothiazide, simvastatin, levothyroxine, and allopurinol.

Secondary_Symptoms: Cool skin with diffuse bruising over abdomen

Abdominal_.Findings: Diffusely tender to palpation

Test_Results.Intravenous_Fluids: Several liters administered with no improvement in blood pressure

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of severe abdominal pain and shoulder pain following a traumatic injury.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to the emergency room after being tackled on his left side during a rugby game. He has a history of mononucleosis two weeks prior.

Secondary_Symptoms: Exquisite tenderness over the left 8th, 9th, and 10th ribs

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and determine the cause of altered mental status and agitation in a young male patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department after being found incoherent and half dressed in the street. Reports no sleep for 36 hours and has grandiose ideas about becoming a billionaire. Also claims to be pursued by secret agents and hears voices.

Neurological_.Findings: Pupillary dilation and psychomotor agitation

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the anatomical structures involved in achieving hemostasis during a hysterectomy following postpartum hemorrhage.

Patient_Actor.History: Thirty minutes after normal vaginal delivery of twins, the patient experienced heavy vaginal bleeding with clots.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the behavior of synthetic hemoglobin in terms of its oxygen-binding affinity under varying carbon dioxide levels.

Patient_Actor.History: A scientist is studying synthetic hemoglobin to assess its ability to bind oxygen.

Experimental_Findings.Affinity_Curve: Left-shifted curve and increased oxygen binding

Correct_Diagnosis: Left-shifted curve and increased oxygen binding

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of recurrent abdominal pain, bloating, and loose stools in a 32-year-old female.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports recurrent episodes of abdominal pain, bloating, and loose stools lasting several days to weeks, worsening over the last 6 weeks. Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage symptoms of urinary obstruction and diagnose benign prostatic hyperplasia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 1-year history of increased urinary frequency, weak urinary stream, and occasional straining to void urine. He is evaluated for urinary symptoms.

Rectal_.Findings: Large, nontender prostate without asymmetry or nodularity

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cause of acute fatigue and weakness in a young woman with recent gastrointestinal symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with fatigue and weakness, stating that over the past 24 hours she has not felt like herself and feels she has no strength. She has a past medical history notable for a single episode of blood-tinged diarrhea 1 week ago which resolved on its own.

Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased sensation in lower extremities and fingertips

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of bilateral eye pain and associated symptoms in a patient with a history of diabetes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with bilateral eye pain for the past 2 days, initially described as 'sand in the eye' and now sharp and stabbing. She denies any trauma, irritation, or new facial care products, but reports joint pain in her fingers. Her past medical history includes diabetes diagnosed 5 years ago.

Slit_Lamp_.Findings: Yellow-green lesion observed with fluorescein stain

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with blurry vision and severe hypertension, suspecting possible hypertensive emergency.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess developmental milestones in a 6-month-old infant during a routine physical .

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine physical . She can sit momentarily propped on her hands, babbles with consonants, and transfers objects hand to hand.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying cause of failure to thrive in a child with genetic abnormalities.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of respiratory distress in a preterm newborn with a history of maternal poorly controlled diabetes.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Newborn female, born at 33 weeks gestation
Patient_Actor.History: The newborn was delivered via spontaneous vaginal delivery to a 34-year-old G1P1 mother with poorly controlled type 2 diabetes. Birth weight was 3,700 g, APGAR scores were 7 and 8 at 1 and 5 minutes.

Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased breath sounds at the lung bases

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of persistent fevers, night sweats, and cough in a patient with HIV and low CD4 count.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify potential postpartum complications and assess the patient's fatigue.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of preeclampsia in her last pregnancy and is HIV positive (CD4: 441/mm^3) with diabetes mellitus. Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying cause of hepatosplenomegaly, easy bruisability, and abdominal distension in a young male patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with progressively worsening weakness and an increasingly large abdomen. He reports a good appetite and is fairly active. There is no significant medical history and he is not on any medications.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue, lethargy, and weakness in a patient with a history of sarcoidosis and recent medication non-compliance.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of palpitations and chest pain in a patient with a history of alcoholic liver cirrhosis and recent treatment for ascites.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the mechanism of toxicity in a patient presenting with symptoms following smoke inhalation from a fire.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the etiology of acute anxiety symptoms and hypertension in a young female patient.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage pain in a patient with advanced-stage prostate cancer requiring escalating opioid doses.

Localized tenderness over the right hip
Opioid dose escalation required for pain management

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of left lower quadrant pain in a young obese female with a history of gastric bypass surgery and recent urinary symptoms.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pain radiating to the left groin

Abdominal_.Findings: Left lower quadrant tenderness to palpation

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of prolonged bleeding and easy bruising in a teenager following minor trauma.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a hematoma after a fall during gym class. He has a history of prolonged nosebleeds and bruising/bleeding after minor injuries.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Unrevealing except for the presence of a hematoma

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of acute distress and flank pain in a postpartum patient with a history of sickle cell disease after a cesarean section.

The patient has sickle cell disease and has experienced multiple episodes of acute chest syndrome requiring transfusions.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the mechanism of DNA replication associated with the lagging strand.

Patient_Actor.History: N/A

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the genetic mutations leading to a condition characterized by abnormal hemoglobin polymerization and its complications.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Patients with a genetic condition characterized by abnormal hemoglobin
Patient_Actor.History: Patients may present with complications such as stroke, aplastic crisis, and auto-splenectomy due to abnormal hemoglobin that undergoes polymerization under certain conditions.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Distortion of red blood cells acquiring a crescent shape

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the unique function of a specific enzyme involved in the DNA replication process of bacteria isolated from a patient with dysuria and urinary frequency.

Patient_Actor.History: A patient presented with dysuria and urinary frequency.

Microbiological_Test.Findings: Bacteria grow rapidly in pink colonies on MacConkey agar.

Correct_Diagnosis: Excision of nucleotides with 5'→3' exonuclease activity

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the mental health status and develop a treatment plan for a patient presenting with symptoms of depression and fibromyalgia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to a medical clinic by his wife after experiencing poor appetite and a weight loss of 10 kg (22 lb) over the past 3 weeks. He reports waking up very early and feeling extremely despondent, withdrawing from social activities and feeling guilty about disappointing friends and family. He has a history of fibromyalgia and experiences daily pain.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of increasing fatigue, shortness of breath, and prolonged nosebleeds in a patient with a recent travel history.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with increasing fatigue that started after returning from South America 4 weeks ago. He was treated at a local clinic for an infection and given antibiotics. Since then, he has been unable to perform his job due to shortness of breath and has experienced prolonged nosebleeds. His past medical history includes alcoholic hepatitis secondary to alcohol abuse 3 years ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: Shortness of breath after minimal exertion

General_.Findings: Conjunctival pallor and petechiae

Correct_Diagnosis: Hypocellular bone marrow with fatty infiltration

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the interpretation of confidence intervals in clinical trial results.

Patient_Actor.History: N/A

Clinical_Trial_Results.Medication_1_Efficacy: More efficacious in lowering fasting blood glucose than medication 2

Correct_Diagnosis: The range of outcome values resulting from the trial has a 95% probability of encompassing the true value.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the second messenger system used by pancreatic hormone B that antagonizes the actions of hormone A.

Patient_Actor.History: A group of scientists is studying pancreatic hormones in rats, specifically hormone A secreted by β-cells and hormone B secreted by α-cells.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of recurrent episodes of palpitations and sweating in a previously healthy woman.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports recurrent episodes of palpitations and sweating over the past month, typically occurring after swimming practice and alleviated by drinking iced tea and eating candy. She has experienced a weight gain of 5 kg (11 lbs) over the past 3 months and works as a nurse.

Secondary_Symptoms: Improvement of symptoms after consuming sugar

Physical_.Findings: No abnormalities noted

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of fever and easy bruising in a pediatric patient with lymphadenopathy and splenomegaly.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of easy bruising since an upper respiratory infection 3 months ago. She experienced a fever of 101.8°F (38.8°C) that did not respond to acetaminophen. Denies chills, cough, rhinorrhea, pharyngitis, sick contacts, headache, or urinary symptoms.

Secondary_Symptoms: Nontender, firm, and rubbery node along left neck

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of abdominal pain with associated symptoms in a patient with a history of alcoholism.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents to the urgent care center with several hours of worsening abdominal discomfort radiating to the back. She reports malaise, chills, nausea, and vomiting. Notable social history includes alcoholism.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Worsening abdominal discomfort with radiation to the back

Abdominal_.Findings: Diffuse tenderness to abdominal palpation

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of left-sided weakness and confusion in a previously healthy young woman following recent knee surgery.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department due to sudden left-sided weakness and confusion after getting dressed. She has a 3-year history of diabetes mellitus managed with metformin and underwent knee surgery 2 days ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: Diminished muscle strength on the left side
Scattered petechiae over the chest, arms, and legs

Neurologic_.Findings: Diminished muscle strength on left side and confusion

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's neurological symptoms and determine the appropriate treatment for Parkinson's disease.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient has a resting tremor in the left hand for over a year, stiffness in the left arm, and changes in gait described as 'walking funny'. He has a medical history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia, and takes aspirin, amlodipine, and rosuvastatin.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Resting tremor in the left hand
Secondary_Symptoms: Repetitive circular movement of the left index finger and thumb

Neurological_.Findings: Rigidity in passive motion of the left upper extremity; repetitive circular movement of the left index finger and thumb resolved with active movement.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of fatigue, weight loss, and thyroid-related symptoms in a patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-month history of fatigue and a weight loss of 4.5 kg (10 lbs) despite increased food intake.

Secondary_Symptoms: Diffuse, non-tender swelling over the anterior neck

Neck_.Findings: Diffuse, non-tender swelling over the anterior neck

Ophthalmologic_.Findings: Swelling of the eyelids and proptosis bilaterally

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate potential cardiovascular findings in a patient with hypertension and obesity during a general checkup.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient works as a farmer and has no current health concerns. Past medical history includes hypertension and obesity. Current medications are lisinopril and metoprolol.

Secondary_Symptoms: No complaints noted during the checkup

Cardiovascular_.Findings: Murmur after S2 over the left sternal border

Neurological_.Findings: Stable gait and 5/5 strength in upper and lower extremities

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the differentiation process of T cells in the thymus and the implications of MHC binding.

Patient_Actor.History: The investigator is studying T cell differentiation in the thymus, focusing on T cells that do not bind to cortical epithelial cells expressing MHC molecules.

Secondary_Symptoms: T cells undergoing apoptosis within 3-4 days

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of splenomegaly and leukocytosis in a patient presenting with upper left abdominal discomfort.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with discomfort in her upper left abdomen over the past month and has been feeling tired. She has no history of significant illness and takes no medications.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and provide recommendations for a patient with recurrent diarrhea and gastrointestinal symptoms, with findings suggestive of inflammatory bowel disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 4-day history of fever and diarrhea, accompanied by abdominal cramps and frequent bowel movements of small quantities of stool mixed with blood and mucus. She has experienced multiple similar episodes over the past 8 months.

Secondary_Symptoms: Frequent bowel movements with blood and mucus
Left lower quadrant tenderness with guarding

Abdominal_.Findings: Soft abdomen, normal bowel sounds, tenderness to palpation in the left lower quadrant with guarding, no rebound tenderness

Colonoscopy.Findings: Polypoid growths flanked by linear ulcers

Biopsy.Findings: Mucosal edema with distorted crypts and inflammatory cells in the lamina propria

Correct_Diagnosis: Start annual colonoscopy starting in 8 years

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient for possible depression and associated neurotransmitter imbalances.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for an annual checkup, reporting feelings of sadness over the past few months without an apparent reason. She has lost interest in swimming, has trouble sleeping, and is experiencing difficulties with concentration. She has lost 15 pounds since her last visit one year ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: Loss of interest in previously enjoyed activities (swimming)

Correct_Diagnosis: Decreased norepinephrine, decreased serotonin, decreased dopamine

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the treatment options for a patient with schizophrenia who is experiencing persistent symptoms despite multiple antipsychotic medications.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted to a locked psychiatric facility after a manic episode involving running through traffic naked and tearing out his hair. Diagnosed with schizophrenia and treated initially with aripiprazole, followed by haloperidol, which caused lethargy, and then loxapine. Despite several dosage adjustments, the patient remains confused and continues to experience hallucinations.

Secondary_Symptoms: Auditory hallucinations (incessant voice screaming to run away)

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of repeated episodes of dizziness triggered by positional changes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with repeated episodes of dizziness for the last 3 months, triggered by rising from a supine position and by lying down. The episodes are sudden, usually last for less than 30 seconds, and are described as a rolling spin. There are no symptoms between episodes, and she denies headaches, vomiting, deafness, ear discharge, or ear pain. No history of known medical disorders or prolonged drug use.

Neurological_.Findings: Self-limited rotatory nystagmus observed after positional changes; rest of neurological  normal

Objective_for_Doctor: Establish the cause of mild concentric left ventricular hypertrophy in a 52-year-old man.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to establish care after not seeing a physician in over 20 years. He generally feels well but occasionally experiences shortness of breath during jogging and exercise. He smokes 2-5 cigarettes per day and uses IV heroin occasionally.

ECG.Findings: Prominent QRS voltage and left axis deviation

Echocardiogram.Findings: Mild concentric left ventricular hypertrophy, otherwise normal

ECG.Findings: Prominent QRS voltage and left axis deviation

Echocardiogram.Findings: Mild concentric left ventricular hypertrophy

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of anemia and worsening shortness of breath in a patient with chronic kidney disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 6-month history of worsening shortness of breath on exertion and fatigue. She has a medical history of type 1 diabetes mellitus, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, and chronic kidney disease. Family history includes a mother diagnosed with colon cancer at age 65.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Worsening shortness of breath on exertion

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying condition associated with bilateral club feet and other physical anomalies in a 1-month-old infant.

Patient_Actor.History: Born at term to a G1P1 mother, experienced respiratory distress at birth, and found to have bilateral club feet and other extremity contractures.

Secondary_Symptoms: Limited range of motion in arms and legs
Facial features including widely separated eyes with epicanthal folds, broad nasal bridge, low set ears, and receding chin

Physical_Exam.Findings: Limited range of motion in limbs, severe club feet, and specific facial features.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of foot weakness and sensory loss in a patient with swelling in the popliteal fossa.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of osteoarthritis of the knee and presents with weakness in his foot.

Physical_.Findings: Swelling in the popliteal fossa and weakness when attempting to invert the right foot

Correct_Diagnosis: Decreased sensation over the sole of the foot

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose a breast mass in a patient with a history of endometriosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a past medical history significant only for endometriosis. She presents with a 2-cm left breast mass identified 6 months ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: No significant increase in size since first noticed

Breast_.Findings: Palpable, round, rubbery, mobile mass approximately 2 cm in diameter

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient's symptoms of dizziness, headache, and facial swelling in the context of possible hereditary angioedema.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with dizziness and headache after a stressful event at work, along with a family history of similar symptoms of facial swelling. His father died of a stroke, and his mother suffers from frequent facial swelling.

General_.Findings: Patient appears well

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the immediate cause of sudden severe retrosternal pain and its consequences in an elderly male patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented with sudden severe crushing retrosternal pain that radiated to the left arm and was rushed to the emergency department for evaluation. He had elevated troponins and CK-MB levels.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pain radiating to the left arm

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the maternal mortality rate based on survey data from a midwestern town.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Women of childbearing age in a US midwestern town
Patient_Actor.History: A survey conducted to assess maternal mortality over the past year.

Secondary_Symptoms: Number of deaths of women of childbearing age: 7,500

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage the health of an 11-year-old boy presenting for a wellness checkup, focusing on his growth, cognitive development, and possible nutritional deficiencies.

Patient_Actor.History: First visit to the pediatrician for a wellness checkup. The child is struggling in school and has been identified as moderately mentally disabled.

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the hormonal changes affecting milk production post-delivery in a breastfeeding mother.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient started breastfeeding twenty minutes after the delivery of her newborn. Initially, the expressed milk was thick and yellowish. Three days later, her breasts swelled, and the milk became thinner and whiter.

Secondary_Symptoms: Changes in milk consistency from thick yellowish to thinner whiter

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of abdominal pain following emergent colectomy and blood transfusion.

Patient_Actor.History: Ten days after undergoing emergent colectomy for a ruptured bowel from a motor vehicle accident, the patient developed abdominal pain. She was transfused 3 units of packed red blood cells and is currently receiving total parenteral nutrition.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness to palpation in the right upper quadrant

Abdominal_.Findings: Tenderness to palpation in the right upper quadrant and hypoactive bowel sounds

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the design and findings of a clinical trial comparing salisartan with losartan for hypertension treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: Patients recruited for a trial comparing blood pressure reduction between salisartan and losartan. Baseline systolic blood pressure exclusion criteria were set at <100 mmHg.

Secondary_Symptoms: Symptomatic side effects leading to withdrawal from the study
Reported respiratory failure among patients with pulmonary hypertension

Vital_Signs.Blood_Pressure: Measured weekly for four weeks, specific values not provided

Primary_Outcome.Salisartan: Non-inferior to losartan for reduction in systolic blood pressure within 10%

Secondary_Outcome.Results: Salisartan deemed inferior for all secondary outcomes including incidence of subjective improvement in symptoms, improvement of ejection fraction, and incidence of cough

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of altered mental status and hypotension in an unconscious patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Found unconscious at the door of his house by a neighbor. Lives alone; no further history available.

Secondary_Symptoms: Intubated due to low Glasgow Coma Scale score (7)

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of frequent episodes of unresponsiveness in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 2-week history of frequent episodes of unresponsiveness characterized by staring blankly, rhythmic head nodding, and lack of response to verbal stimulation. Episodes are precipitated by hyperventilation.

Secondary_Symptoms: Immediate regaining of consciousness after episodes

Correct_Diagnosis: Blockade of thalamic T-type calcium channels

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage urinary symptoms and assess for possible abdominal aortic aneurysm.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine health maintenance  with a history of hypertension and hypercholesterolemia. He has experienced problems initiating urination and incomplete bladder emptying over the past year. He has a significant smoking history of one pack of cigarettes daily for the past 40 years. Current medications include lisinopril, atorvastatin, and daily aspirin.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Problems initiating urination and sensation of incomplete bladder emptying
Secondary_Symptoms: Pulsatile abdominal mass at the level of the umbilicus
Symmetrically enlarged, smooth, firm, nontender prostate

Abdominal_.Findings: Pulsatile abdominal mass at the level of the umbilicus and bruit on auscultation

Rectal_.Findings: Symmetrically enlarged, smooth, firm, nontender prostate with rubbery texture

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose a patient presenting with acute psychotic symptoms and anxiety.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department after being found running naked and screaming in a park. He has a history of psychotic behavior and severe depression for several years.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Psychotic behavior with delusions of persecution
Secondary_Symptoms: Refusal to eat due to fear of poisoning

Physical_Exam.Findings: Gaunt and anxious appearance; heart has a regular rate and rhythm; lungs clear to auscultation bilaterally.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and determine the histopathologic findings associated with thyroid swelling in a patient with abnormal thyroid function tests.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with thyroid swelling. She has been healthy until now and follows healthcare precautions, except for missing a flu shot this year.

Thyroid_.Findings: Diffusely enlarged and tender thyroid gland

Correct_Diagnosis: Mixed cellular infiltration with multinuclear giant cells

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the auscultation site for a potential heart murmur in a patient with a history suggestive of rheumatic fever.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports a history of recurrent sore throats and fever as a child, followed by swollen and aching hip and knee joints, which returned seasonally without treatment. She experiences shortness of breath and palpitations that are transient.

Secondary_Symptoms: History of joint swelling and pain

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's readiness for lifestyle changes regarding alcohol consumption and weight loss.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine , feeling tired and having aches. He has gained some weight since the last appointment. Past medical history includes hypertension and hyperlipidemia, managed with hydrochlorothiazide and atorvastatin. Family history is significant for alcoholic cirrhosis in his father. He consumes several beers nightly and multiple glasses of wine on weekends.

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the mechanisms of viral evolution and reassortment in influenza viruses.

Patient_Actor.History: A scientist is studying two strains of the influenza A virus, H7N1 from humans and H3N8 from horses. He coinfects chicken cells with both strains.

Secondary_Symptoms: Isolation of a new strain from chicken cells
New strain (H7N8) can infect human cells

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the behavioral and emotional health of a 15-year-old girl during an annual well-child .

Patient_Actor.History: Brought in for an annual well-child ; mother reports poor diet, excessive texting, smoking, recent ear piercing with unsterilized safety pins, and indifference to school authorities.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Indifference to authority and poor grooming

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify and manage the treatment for a patient presenting with bradycardia and hypotension due to beta-blocker overdose.
