Patient_Actor.History: The patient was found by emergency medical services with an empty bottle of propranolol, which was taken from her grandmother.

Secondary_Symptoms: Persistent symptoms despite IV fluids and oxygen

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of sharp, central chest pain with positional variation and associated pericardial friction rub.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a several-day history of sharp, central chest pain that is constant and unrelated to exertion. The pain worsens when lying down and improves when sitting forward. He has a smoking history of 10-15 cigarettes daily for the past 7 years.

Auscultation.Findings: Scratching sound at end-expiration with the patient leaning forward

Test_Results.ECG: Findings consistent with pericarditis (not specified in detail)

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of fever, abdominal pain, and diarrhea following recent travel to Mexico.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-day history of fever, crampy abdominal pain, and blood-tinged diarrhea after returning from a trip to Mexico.

Abdominal_.Findings: Diffuse tenderness to palpation; hyperactive bowel sounds

Stool_Culture.Findings: Non-lactose fermenting, oxidase-negative, gram-negative rods that do not produce hydrogen sulfide on triple sugar iron agar

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the condition associated with elevated activity of phosphoribosyl pyrophosphate synthetase in a study subject.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Human subjects from various demographic groups
Patient_Actor.History: An investigator is studying enzyme activity levels in different demographic groups, with a focus on one subject showing elevated phosphoribosyl pyrophosphate synthetase activity.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage acute respiratory distress in an asthmatic patient with fever and cough.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with shortness of breath and fever for the last 2 days, accompanied by a cough. He has a history of asthma and uses inhaled albuterol as needed.

Correct_Diagnosis: Inhibition of vagally-mediated contraction of bronchial smooth muscles

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the etiology of pruritic vesicular lesions in a 9-year-old boy with a history of acute lymphoblastic leukemia.

Patient_Actor.History: History of acute lymphoblastic leukemia, receiving chemotherapy (methotrexate, cytarabine, and cyclophosphamide) for 1 month, last treatment 2 days ago.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pruritic vesicles on the left side of the torso
Secondary_Symptoms: Localized to left C7 skin dermatome

Skin_.Findings: Painful vesicles localized to the left C7 dermatome

Correct_Diagnosis: Reactivation of VZV due to immunodeficiency caused by chemotherapy

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of severe epigastric pain, nausea, and vomiting in a patient with a history of alcohol use disorder.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-day history of severe epigastric pain radiating to the back, along with nausea and vomiting. He has a history of alcohol use disorder.

Abdominal_.Findings: Diffuse abdominal tenderness and distention

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of pruritic vesicles on the right side of the torso, likely indicating herpes zoster.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with pruritic vesicles that appeared 2 days ago after experiencing a burning sensation in the affected area one day prior.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pruritic vesicles on the right side of the torso
Secondary_Symptoms: Burning sensation in the affected area
Localized to the right T10 skin dermatome

Skin_.Findings: Painful vesicles localized to the right T10 skin dermatome

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of mucoid vaginal secretion and cervicitis in a sexually active young woman.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 5-day history of mucoid secretion noticed on her underwear upon waking. She denies experiencing dysuria and reports unprotected sexual intercourse with both a male and a female classmate two weeks prior.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pain with mobilization of the cervix

Pelvic_.Findings: Pain with cervix mobilization and clear mucoid secretion from the urethra

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate course of action regarding resuscitation in a patient with an advance directive.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented to the emergency department after an episode of chest pain and loss of consciousness. He is currently undergoing chemotherapy for Hodgkin’s lymphoma.

Secondary_Symptoms: Critical condition with rapidly deteriorating vital signs

Correct_Diagnosis: Respect the patient’s advance directive orders

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of a pruritic rash following protected sexual intercourse and manage appropriately.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department due to a pruritic rash on his penis that developed after protected sexual intercourse. He has a history of an itchy rash around his mouth after blowing up balloons at a birthday party. Five days prior, he visited a friend with intense pruritus in multiple areas.

Secondary_Symptoms: History of itchy rash around the mouth

Dermatological_.Findings: Multiple well-circumscribed, raised, erythematous plaques with mild excoriations extending from the base to the glans of the penis.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage acute exacerbation of asthma in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought in for recurrent episodes of shortness of breath and nonproductive cough over the past 3 months, occurring two times per week and resolving with rest. Experiences nocturnal shortness of breath once a month.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Acute onset of dyspnea and wheezing
Secondary_Symptoms: Recurrent episodes of shortness of breath

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the psychiatric symptoms and assess for potential thyroid dysfunction due to medication.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient has a history of bipolar I disorder and presents for a follow-up visit. He reports feeling fatigued and constipated for the past 2 months, feels cold, and has gained weight despite unchanged diet.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue, shortness of breath, and neurological symptoms in a patient with signs of anemia and vitamin B12 deficiency.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a gradual onset of fatigue over the last 4 months, shortness of breath, and difficulty concentrating. He has a 20-year history of smoking one pack of cigarettes daily and does not consume alcohol. Friends have noted that he appears pale.

Secondary_Symptoms: Reduced sensation to light touch and pinprick in the toes bilaterally

Neurological_.Findings: Reduced sensation to light touch and pinprick in the toes bilaterally

Urine_Test.Findings: Unchanged urine vitamin B12 levels after oral and intramuscular doses; increased urine vitamin B12 levels after addition of oral intrinsic factor

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of dysphagia in a patient with a history of HIV and low CD4+ count.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of HIV infection diagnosed five years ago and is on an antiretroviral regimen including emtricitabine, rilpivirine, and tenofovir. He presents with difficulties swallowing food, experiencing pain when swallowing medications or drinking water.

Secondary_Symptoms: No notable signs of oral thrush or lymphadenopathy

Oropharynx_.Findings: Clear oropharynx, no lymphadenopathy, normal cardiac and pulmonary exam

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of bilateral nipple discharge and visual field defects in a middle-aged woman.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents after a minor car accident. She has concerns about whitish discharge from both nipples and has missed her periods for the last 3 months, attributing this to menopause. She denies any nausea, vomiting, or recent weight gain and is not currently taking any medications.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of behavioral changes in a 16-year-old male patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is accompanied by his mother who reports worsening grades, cutting classes, weight gain, and frequent bloodshot eyes. The patient appears withdrawn and displays anger when discussing social history. He denies any history of abuse or sexual activity.

Secondary_Symptoms: Anger when probed about social history

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of hemoptysis in a patient with a chronic cough and shortness of breath.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: 68-year-old overweight male with a 20-pack-year smoking history
Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with multiple blood-stained tissues after coughing attacks over the last month. His cough has progressively worsened over 5 years, accompanied by worsening shortness of breath, making it difficult to ascend stairs.

Secondary_Symptoms: Oxygen saturation of 93% on room air

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage persistent bedwetting in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The child was brought for a follow-up  for persistent bedwetting. Over the past year, various methods to prevent bedwetting have been attempted without improvement. The child wets the bed 2-3 times a week and does not have daytime urinary issues.

Secondary_Symptoms: Previous attempts at management include fluid restriction, sticker rewards, and bedwetting alarms

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with increasing shortness of breath and recent travel history suggestive of respiratory infection.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient returned from a trip to China 2 weeks ago and has experienced fever, myalgias, headaches, and a dry cough for the past week, with increasingly severe shortness of breath over the last 2 days. Her past medical history is non-contributory.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of pneumonia and associated systemic symptoms in a young child.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 2-day history of cough, fever, and lethargy. He has been hospitalized twice in the past year for pneumonia. Developmentally, he can stand without support but has not yet started walking and speaks in bisyllables. He is at the 3rd percentile for height and 4th percentile for weight.

Secondary_Symptoms: Diffuse crackles over bilateral lung fields
Bright red macular spots on fundoscopy

Lung_.Findings: Diffuse crackles over bilateral lung fields

Abdominal_.Findings: Hepatosplenomegaly

Histopathology.Autopsy Findings: Spleen section showing accumulation of substances

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue, lightheadedness, and gastrointestinal symptoms in a patient with a history of hypoparathyroidism.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with fatigue, lightheadedness, dizziness upon standing, abdominal pain, and muscle pain over the past 6 months. She has experienced an unintended weight loss of 5.8 kg (12.8 lb) over the past 3 years. The patient has a history of hypoparathyroidism since her teenage years and is currently taking calcitriol and calcium carbonate.

Skin_.Findings: Tanned skin

Objective_for_Doctor: Manage the patient's erectile dysfunction and address the esophageal findings related to portal hypertension.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 6-month history of erectile dysfunction. He has a medical history of well-controlled type 2 diabetes mellitus on metformin. He consumes 5-6 beers daily and does not smoke.

Secondary_Symptoms: Palpable spleen 2 cm below left costal margin

Physical_.Findings: Bilateral pedal edema, decreased testicular volume, increased breast tissue, and palpable spleen.

Endoscopy.Findings: Dilated submucosal veins 2 mm in diameter with red spots on their surface in the distal esophagus.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's acute decompensated heart failure and adjust medication regimen accordingly.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of type 2 diabetes mellitus, hypertension, coronary artery disease, and congestive heart failure. He has been admitted to the hospital due to acute decompensated heart failure and has a long history of smoking one pack of cigarettes daily for 45 years. Current medications include lisinopril, metformin, and low-dose aspirin.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of anuria in a post-operative patient following a supracervical hysterectomy and left salpingo-oophorectomy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 15-year history of long, painful menses, only partially relieved with oral contraceptives. She denies weight loss or post-coital bleeding and has no history of smoking, alcohol or illicit drug use, or sexually transmitted diseases. She sees her gynecologist annually and takes no medications.

Correct_Diagnosis: Iatrogenic injury near the suspensory ligaments

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the causal pathogen in a patient presenting with fever, chills, and flank pain following urinary catheterization.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 2-day history of fever, chills, and flank pain. He was catheterized 5 days ago for acute urinary retention.

Physical_.Findings: Right-sided costovertebral angle tenderness

Urine_Culture.Eosin_Methylene_Blue_Agar: Purple colonies with no metallic green sheen

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the outcome of hepatitis infection in a young woman with elevated liver enzymes and positive hepatitis B surface antigen.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with a one-week history of diffuse abdominal pain. She has no significant past medical history.

Secondary_Symptoms: Numerous scars and excoriations on both arms

Abdominal_.Findings: Tender hepatomegaly

Skin_.Findings: Numerous scars and excoriations along both arms

Objective_for_Doctor: Estimate renal blood flow based on laboratory test results.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient volunteered for a research study involving renal function and underwent several laboratory tests.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of progressive dysphagia in a patient with significant risk factors.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with dysphagia that has progressively worsened over the past year, now only able to consume soup. His social history includes exposure to asbestos, multiple daily drinks of hard alcohol, and a 70 pack-year smoking history.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cognitive decline and memory issues in an elderly patient to determine the underlying cause.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has experienced increasing forgetfulness over the past 6 months, including getting lost while walking home. He has shown increased irritability and difficulty recalling recent information.

Secondary_Symptoms: Inability to recall the current month
Inability to name recently born grandson

Mental_Status_.Findings: Normal affect, oriented to person and place, but impaired recent memory.

Neurological_.Findings: Normal gait, no nystagmus

Imaging.MRI: Findings consistent with atrophy of the cortex

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue and neurological symptoms in a patient with occupational exposure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with generalized fatigue and weakness of the left hand for 4 weeks, alongside multiple episodes of cramping abdominal pain and nausea. He works at a battery manufacturing plant.

Neurological_.Findings: Weakness when extending the left wrist against resistance; brachioradialis reflex 1+ on the left and 2+ on the right

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the necessity of prostate-specific antigen (PSA) testing in a patient with risk factors for prostate cancer.

Patient_Actor.History: Routine health maintenance ; prior unremarkable colonoscopy 5 years ago; history of poststreptococcal glomerulonephritis at age 10; father died of bladder carcinoma at age 55; works at a rubber factory.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mild symmetrical enlargement of the prostate noted on
History of smoking (1 pack daily for 25 years)
Alcohol consumption (1-2 cans of beer daily)

Digital_Rectal_.Findings: Mild symmetrical enlargement of the prostate with no masses

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the neonatal condition and calculate the APGAR score following delivery with shoulder dystocia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient followed her primary care physician's recommendations throughout her pregnancy without complications. She presented in labor and experienced shoulder dystocia during delivery.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pale appearance of the baby with flexed arms and legs

Neonatal_Assessment.Findings: Pale appearance, arms and legs flexed, minimal activity when stimulated

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of confusion, weakness, and vomiting in an elderly patient with a complex medication regimen.

Patient_Actor.History: Presented to the emergency department due to increasing confusion, weakness, and vomiting for 1 day. The patient experienced 5 episodes of vomiting and blurry vision, stating 'everything appears in different colors.' Wife reports recent adjustment of drug regimen due to worsening tibial edema 1 week ago. Patient has a history of congestive heart failure, atrial fibrillation, hypothyroidism, and osteoarthritis.

Secondary_Symptoms: Inability to recall wife's name or their address

Neurological_.Findings: Confused and oriented only to person, no focal findings

Abdominal_.Findings: Soft abdomen with tenderness to palpation of both lower quadrants, no guarding or rebound

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and determine the cause of the patient's symptoms, including headaches, fatigue, dry cough, and bronchospasm, in the context of her diabetes and hypertension.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of type 2 diabetes mellitus and was diagnosed with moderate nonproliferative diabetic retinopathy last month. She presents with headaches, fatigue, dry cough, and frequent bronchospasm.

Physical__Findings.Findings: Diffuse wheezing and jugular venous distention, 2+ pitting pretibial edema

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage potential cyanide poisoning after smoke inhalation from a house fire.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department 20 minutes after being rescued from a house fire. Reports headache, metallic taste, abdominal pain, and nausea. Appears confused and agitated.

Secondary_Symptoms: Bright red color of the skin

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the effects of eplerenone on mortality and morbidity in patients with acute myocardial infarction and left ventricular dysfunction.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Patients with acute myocardial infarction and left ventricular dysfunction
Patient_Actor.History: Patients were enrolled in a double-blind, placebo-controlled study evaluating the effect of eplerenone versus placebo in addition to optimal medical therapy.

Correct_Diagnosis: Eplerenone, when added to optimal medical therapy, decreases all cause mortality in patients with left ventricular dysfunction following myocardial infarction.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the statistical significance of nausea symptoms between treatment and control groups in a clinical trial.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Participants in a randomized controlled trial for a novel alkylating agent and radiotherapy.
Patient_Actor.History: Participants included both treatment and control groups who reported nausea symptoms after taking the medication.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mild nausea (20% in treatment group, 35% in control group)
Moderate nausea (30% in treatment group, 35% in control group)
Severe nausea (50% in treatment group, 30% in control group)

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the risk factors and complications associated with proteinuria and hypertension in a pregnant patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is in her 28th week of pregnancy and presents with symptoms of pitting edema around the ankles.

Vital_Signs.Blood_Pressure: Elevated systolic blood pressure (exact value not provided)

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of persistent diarrhea and recurrent infections in a 3-month-old boy suspected of having an immunodeficiency.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with persistent diarrhea, oral candidiasis, and respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) pneumonia. He is very lean, with weight in the 10th percentile. Blood pressure is 105/64 mm Hg, and heart rate is 84/min. HIV tests are negative by PCR.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient's condition following an ischemic stroke and identify related embryologic abnormalities.

Patient_Actor.History: Two weeks ago, the patient was diagnosed with an ischemic stroke of the right middle cerebral artery and treated with thrombolytics. He currently has no residual symptoms.

Secondary_Symptoms: Transient low-volume right-to-left shunt observed during echocardiography

Cardiovascular_.Findings: No abnormalities detected

Echocardiography.Findings: Reproducible, transient, low-volume, right-to-left shunt through the atrial septum during coughing

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of sudden onset headache with associated visual disturbances and elevated blood pressure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented to the emergency department 4 hours after the sudden onset of a diffuse, dull, throbbing headache. She has a history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Medications include hydrochlorothiazide, lisinopril, atorvastatin, and metformin. She has a significant smoking history of 1 pack of cigarettes daily for the past 30 years and consumes 1–2 glasses of wine per day.

Fundoscopic_.Findings: Bilateral blurring of the optic disc margins

Neurological_.Findings: No other abnormalities noted

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying cause of recurrent palpitations and chest pressure in a patient with a history of alcohol consumption.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 6-month history of recurrent palpitations and chest pressure. He reports shortness of breath when walking several blocks or going upstairs. There is no significant personal or family history of serious illness, and he does not smoke. He has a 30-year history of consuming 7-10 beers daily.

Secondary_Symptoms: Jugular venous pulsations 9 cm above the sternal angle

Cardiac_.Findings: S3 gallop and displaced point of maximum impulse

Lung_.Findings: Crackles heard at both lung bases

Objective_for_Doctor: Advise a pregnant patient on the management of her levothyroxine medication for hypothyroidism.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is pregnant and currently taking levothyroxine for hypothyroidism. She has no other medications.

Correct_Diagnosis: Her medication dose should be increased by 30%

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the potential complications following a vasectomy procedure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient underwent elective vasectomy for permanent contraception under local anesthesia without intra-operative complications. He was discharged home with ibuprofen for post-operative pain management.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the likely infectious cause of fever, cough, and jaundice in a patient recently returned from Hawaii.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with high fever, cough, and malaise following a vacation to Hawaii where he participated in waterskiing. He developed intermittent abdominal pain three days before presentation, accompanied by flu-like symptoms, itchiness in his eyes, and photosensitivity.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Conjunctivitis and mild jaundice

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a child with symptoms suggestive of attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

Patient_Actor.History: The boy has experienced poor performance in school for the last year, characterized by difficulty sitting still, not following instructions, and blurting out answers.

Secondary_Symptoms: Difficulty listening to instructions at hockey practice

Physical_.Findings: No abnormalities noted

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of light-headedness and weight loss in a patient with a history of obesity and diabetes mellitus.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient experienced light-headedness and fell while using the bathroom. She has a past medical history of obesity and diabetes mellitus, and she presented to the emergency department one week ago with a similar complaint. She reports fatigue, constipation, an odd sensation in her chest, decreased appetite, and a desire to drink, leading to a 10-pound weight loss.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Cardiopulmonary exam within normal limits, stable gait, and abdominal distension with an obese abdomen. Strength is 5/5 in upper and lower extremities.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the genetic basis for developmental delay and intellectual disability in a 2-year-old male with obesity and hypogonadism.

Patient_Actor.History: Referred to a geneticist for developmental delay and intellectual disability. He was hypotonic at birth, and parents are concerned about his tendency to eat non-food items such as erasers and chalk.

General_.Findings: Severe obesity and signs of hypogonadism

Genetic_Analysis.Findings: One mutated allele and one normal allele at the gene of interest

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the biochemical fate of C-peptide in insulin secretion.

Patient_Actor.History: N/A

Correct_Diagnosis: C-peptide is packaged with insulin in secretory vesicles

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of confusion and disorientation in a postoperative patient and identify a potential reversal agent for the administered drug.

Patient_Actor.History: Hospitalized for overnight monitoring after elective surgery. Initially recovering well in the post-anesthesia care unit but became delirious and agitated overnight.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the potential cause of a false positive urine drug test in a patient on a ketogenic diet.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents confused about failing a work-required urine drug test. She has no significant past medical history and takes no medications. She denies smoking and using alcohol or recreational drugs. Recently, she has been on a ketogenic diet and consuming poppy seed bagels as her only source of carbohydrates.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Confusion about urine drug test results

Physical_.Findings: Within normal limits

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a pediatric patient with lower-extremity edema and recent respiratory symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The child presents with lower-extremity edema for the past 4 days, following a recent illness characterized by cough and fever treated with acetaminophen three weeks prior. His medical history is unremarkable, and he was born after an uneventful term pregnancy. Vaccinations are up to date.

Physical_.Findings: Ocular puffiness and lower-extremity edema; chest auscultation clear; no abdominal abnormalities.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the weight loss in a 4-day-old male newborn and determine appropriate management.

Patient_Actor.History: Born at 40 weeks' gestation, initially weighed 2980g (6-lb 9-oz), now weighs 2830g (6-lb 4-oz). Pregnancy was uncomplicated. Passed stool and urine 8 and 10 hours after delivery. Exclusively breastfed since birth, feeding 11-12 times daily, with mother changing 5-6 heavy diapers daily.

Secondary_Symptoms: Capillary refill time less than 2 seconds

General_.Findings: Open and firm anterior fontanelle, moist mucous membranes, capillary refill time less than 2 seconds

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the hormonal changes associated with amenorrhea in a middle-aged female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a primary complaint of amenorrhea for the past 6 months. She also reports dyspareunia, recurrent headaches, and infrequent episodes of night sweats.

Correct_Diagnosis: Decreased serum estradiol and increased serum LH

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying cause of a testicular mass in a well child with signs of potential hormonal imbalance.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is healthy, active in school and sports, and has a supportive family. No current concerns from parents.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tall stature and muscular build (99th percentile for weight and height)
Obesity with a non-tender, non-distended abdomen

General_Exam.Findings: Tall, muscular young boy; cardiopulmonary exam normal; neurological exam grossly non-focal; musculoskeletal exam normal range of motion and 5/5 strength.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the psychiatric condition of a patient presenting with depressive symptoms and subsequent manic behavior.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with feelings of sadness for the past 3 weeks following job loss 1 month ago. She reports insomnia, crying episodes, poor appetite, and weight loss. Friends report a sudden change to euphoria and bizarre behavior after starting a new medication.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Feelings of sadness and depressive symptoms
Secondary_Symptoms: Bizarre behavior (e.g., booking a plane ticket impulsively)

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of persistent heartburn and ulcers in the duodenum.

Patient_Actor.History: Complains of heartburn, epigastric pain, and diarrhea. Past medical history significant for heartburn unresponsive to omeprazole. Denies alcohol intake and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug use.

Secondary_Symptoms: Two ulcers in the proximal duodenum
One ulcer in the distal third of the duodenum

Endoscopy.Findings: Two ulcers in the proximal duodenum and one in the distal third of the duodenum.

Correct_Diagnosis: Parietal cell hypertrophy is likely present

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of right wrist pain and swelling following a fall on an outstretched hand.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented to the emergency department with right wrist pain and swelling that started 2 hours after falling on an outstretched hand while playing softball. He has a history of eczema and type 1 diabetes mellitus. His current medications include insulin and topical clobetasol.

Secondary_Symptoms: Limited range of motion due to pain
Decreased muscle strength in the right hand

Musculoskeletal_.Findings: Swollen and tender right wrist; tenderness to palpation in the area between the tendons of the abductor pollicis longus, extensor pollicis brevis, and extensor pollicis longus muscle. Active opposition of the thumb is possible.

Objective_for_Doctor: Manage the patient's heart failure while addressing concerns about medication side effects and patient dissatisfaction with urologist care.

Patient_Actor.History: Ongoing management of mild heart failure. The patient reports no changes in cardiac function and tolerating lisinopril without major side effects. He has been experiencing dizziness after starting prazosin for benign prostatic hyperplasia and is unhappy with his urologist's care.

Secondary_Symptoms: Consideration of a lawsuit against the urologist

Correct_Diagnosis: Encourage the patient to speak with his urologist directly

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with suspected infection and possible osteomyelitis based on presenting symptoms and history.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening weakness and fatigue over the past day. He has a past medical history of IV drug abuse and alcoholism, and he currently smells of alcohol.

Secondary_Symptoms: Focal tenderness over the lumbar spine

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the psychological condition of dizygotic twins presenting with shared delusional beliefs.

Patient_Actor.History: Twins present with concerns about being poisoned through cafeteria food, which they have reported previously without corroboration from others. They have no known medical conditions and no history of substance abuse.

Secondary_Symptoms: Reported concerns not supported by peers or staff

Correct_Diagnosis: Can affect two or more closely related individuals.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the etiology of diarrhea in a 4-year-old boy with recent fever and vomiting.

Patient_Actor.History: Presented with diarrhea following a fever. The child has had multiple episodes of non-bloody diarrhea and reports feelings of fatigue. He is not up to date on vaccinations and takes various herbal supplements.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage acute hyperglycemia and potential diabetic ketoacidosis in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with acute onset of confusion, malaise, diffuse abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting. He denies ingestion of suspicious foods and has experienced increased liquid consumption and urinary frequency over the past 6 months.

Neurological_.Findings: Somnolent, 1+ deep tendon reflexes in all extremities.

Abdominal_.Findings: Soft abdomen, no rebound tenderness on palpation.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the fetal condition based on elevated maternal serum and amniotic fluid markers during the first prenatal visit.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is at 18 weeks’ gestation and presents for her first prenatal visit. She works as a paralegal and lives with her husband. The pregnancy was unexpected, and she did not take any prenatal medications or supplements.

Secondary_Symptoms: Elevated α-fetoprotein and acetylcholinesterase in amniotic fluid

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of generalized fatigue and dark urine in a pediatric patient with a recent skin infection.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the physician with generalized fatigue and dark urine for 1 week. She was treated with topical mupirocin for a skin infection four weeks ago. Notably, her 5-year-old brother has steroid-resistant nephrotic syndrome.

Physical__Findings.Findings: Periorbital and 1+ pretibial edema bilaterally; remainder of  normal

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the genetic cause of muscle weakness and developmental delay in a 9-year-old boy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient developed normally until age 3, after which he began to become tired more easily and experienced frequent falls. He has progressively had trouble walking and uses the Gower maneuver to stand up. Despite his muscle weakness, his neurologic development is normal for his age.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Muscle weakness leading to inability to walk without leg braces

Musculoskeletal_.Findings: Calves appeared enlarged

Genetic_Test.Findings: Mutation leading to a string of incorrect amino acids

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of progressively worsening vision and headaches in an elderly patient with diabetes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has experienced gradually worsening blurry vision in both eyes for the past 5 months and intermittent headaches for the last 2 months. Her medical history includes type 2 diabetes mellitus, osteoarthritis, second-degree heart block, and presbyopia. Current medications are metformin, lisinopril, and ibuprofen.

Eye_.Findings: Bilateral equal and reactive pupils, best-corrected visual acuity 20/40 in each eye, bilateral narrowing of the outer rim of the optic nerve head, cupping of the optic disk.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of skin changes and menstrual irregularities in a young female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports darkening of the skin around her neck over the past 2 months, coinciding with wearing a thrift shop chain. She has a history of peptic ulcer disease and experiences irregular menstrual cycles lasting 9 days with heavy flow, occurring every 35 to 60 days. Menarche began at age 14, and her last menstrual period was 3 weeks ago. She is sexually active and not using contraception. The only medication she takes is cimetidine.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Darkening of the skin around the neck
Secondary_Symptoms: Velvety, hyperpigmented plaques in the axillae and inframammary fold

Skin_.Findings: Velvety, hyperpigmented plaques in the axillae, inframammary fold, and around the neck

Test_Results.N/A: Further evaluation of the patient is suggested to check for polycystic ovaries.

Correct_Diagnosis: Polycystic ovaries on ultrasonography of the pelvis

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of weight loss, tremor, and nervousness in a young female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Presenting for a routine check-up, the patient reports feeling nervous and having developed a slight tremor. She has lost 15 pounds in the past 3 months despite an increased appetite.

Objective_for_Doctor: Manage pain effectively in a patient with metastatic ovarian cancer in palliative care.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient has metastatic ovarian cancer and has recently transitioned to palliative care after failing to respond to multiple chemotherapy regimens over 2 years. She is currently in hospice care.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Severe pain rated 8 to 9 on a 10-point scale
Secondary_Symptoms: Concerns about morphine dosage and breathing

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of fever, lethargy, and anemia in a patient with sickle cell disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with fever and lethargy for the past 2 days, with occasional palpitations and shortness of breath. He has a history of asthma and sickle cell disease. Current medications include inhaled albuterol, hydroxyurea, and folic acid.

Cardiac_.Findings: Midsystolic ejection murmur

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of neurological symptoms following shellfish consumption.

Patient_Actor.History: Presented to the emergency department with sudden onset of headache, sensation of floating, and weakness in arms and legs after eating shellfish 2 hours prior. They experienced tingling of the lips and mouth within 15 minutes of ingestion, along with mild nausea and abdominal discomfort.

Neurological_.Findings: Decreased strength in all extremities bilaterally and hyporeflexia

Laboratory_Evaluation.Findings: Presence of a specific toxin in shellfish confirming diagnosis of paralysis

Correct_Diagnosis: Blockade of voltage-gated fast sodium channels

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the etiology of discolored skin, joint pain, and abdominal fullness in a patient with a recent history of polar bear liver consumption.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with discolored, itchy skin, joint pain, and a feeling of abdominal fullness for the past week. Her medical history includes anxiety and depression, with occasional headaches and dizziness. She recently returned from an expedition to Alaska, where she and her group ate polar bear liver.

Skin_.Findings: Dry skin with evidence of excoriation

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and identify the underlying cause of a systemic condition with respiratory and renal symptoms in a young female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 4-day history of nonproductive cough and sharp chest pain, which worsens with deep breathing. She also reports two episodes of hematuria and has experienced intermittent pain, stiffness, and swelling in her fingers and left knee over the past 6 months. Additionally, she has a history of two miscarriages at ages 22 and 24. Her only current medication is minocycline for acne vulgaris.

Secondary_Symptoms: Intermittent pain, stiffness, and swelling in fingers and left knee
Mild tenderness over metacarpophalangeal joints bilaterally

Physical_.Findings: Erythematous rash on face, mild tenderness over metacarpophalangeal joints bilaterally without warmth or erythema

Correct_Diagnosis: Low serum levels of C3 and C4

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of right flank and back pain following elective cardiac catheterization.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient underwent elective cardiac catheterization 1.5 hours prior, where 2 stents were placed for 80% stenosis in the left anterior descending artery. She has a medical history of hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Prior medications included enalapril, simvastatin, and metformin, and she received intravenous unfractionated heparin before the procedure.

Abdominal_.Findings: Tender lower abdomen; no guarding or rigidity; right suprainguinal fullness and tenderness; no bleeding or discharge from the femoral access site.

Cardiac_.Findings: No murmurs, rubs, or gallops; femoral and pedal pulses palpable bilaterally.

Correct_Diagnosis: CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying cause of muscle pain and stiffness in a patient with a history of diabetes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with complaints of pain, stating he feels stiff in the morning with general discomfort and muscle pain. He has a past medical history of diabetes and is currently not taking any medications.

Muscular_.Findings: Mild tenderness of musculature diffusely, 2+ reflexes, and 5/5 strength in upper and lower extremities.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate swallowing difficulties and determine the appropriate management following a stroke.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 4-kg weight loss over the last month and an inability to eat more than one bite without coughing or regurgitating food, particularly with liquids. One month prior, he had a stroke in the right middle cerebral artery. His medical history includes hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and hyperlipidemia. Current medications are aspirin, amlodipine, metformin, and simvastatin.

Secondary_Symptoms: Weight loss (4 kg over the last month)

Neurological_.Findings: Facial drooping on the left and decreased strength in the left upper and lower extremities.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue, pain, and stiffness in the hands of a middle-aged woman with a history of diabetes.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with fatigue and progressive pain and stiffness in her hands for 3 months. She has a history of playing tennis but stopped 1 month ago due to difficulties holding the racket and increased sensitivity to sunlight. Last menstrual period was 1 year ago. She has diabetes mellitus controlled with insulin and does not smoke or drink alcohol.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Fatigue and progressive pain and stiffness in hands
Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness in the second and third metacarpophalangeal joints
Limited range of motion in hands

Musculoskeletal_.Findings: Tenderness in the second and third metacarpophalangeal joints, limited range of motion

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the behavioral symptoms and underlying condition of a child presenting with tics.

Patient_Actor.History: The child has been experiencing repetitive, involuntary blinking, shrugging, and grunting for the past year. Symptoms improve with physical activity but worsen with tiredness, boredom, and stress. He feels embarrassed by his symptoms, which have affected his school performance.

Mental_Status_.Findings: Intact higher mental functioning and thought processes

Neurological_.Findings: Excessive blinking, grunting, and jerking of the shoulders and neck occurring at rest

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of rectal bleeding and anemia in an 18-month-old boy.

Patient_Actor.History: The child has been passing large amounts of dark red blood from his rectum for 2 days, with several episodes of dark stools over the past 3 weeks. Parents report increased sleepiness and paleness over the past 24 hours. His appetite is normal and he has not vomited. Growth parameters are normal (50th percentile for height and weight).

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Passing dark red blood from rectum

General_.Findings: Pale conjunctivae; abdomen is soft and nontender

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the causal organism of a painful genital ulcer with associated lymphadenopathy in a young male patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a painful ulcer on the penis that has been present for 12 days. He recently returned from a study abroad trip to India 3 months ago. He is sexually active with one female partner and uses condoms inconsistently.

Secondary_Symptoms: Draining yellow purulent material from the ulcer

Genital_.Findings: 2-cm ulcer with a necrotic base proximal to the glans of the penis

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the involved organ in a suspected retroperitoneal organ infection based on clinical presentation and laboratory findings.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with high-grade fever and abdominal pain for the past 2 days, accompanied by malaise and vomiting several times since the previous night. Past medical history is benign.

Physical__Findings.Findings: Severe costovertebral angle tenderness

Correct_Diagnosis: It is composed of tubules and parenchyma.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of worsening fatigue and anemia in a middle-aged woman with a history of alcohol use and malnutrition.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been experiencing fatigue for several months, worsening over the past few weeks. Past medical history includes hypertension. She drinks approximately 1 bottle of wine daily and consumes whisky or vodka every morning. She was recently terminated from her job.

General_.Findings: Malnourished appearance, anxious demeanor, pale conjunctiva, glossitis

Cardiovascular_.Findings: Regular rate and rhythm

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a 14-year-old boy presenting with abdominal swelling and vomiting.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been experiencing abdominal swelling and vomiting over the past 24 hours, with generalized abdominal pain. He has no history of serious illnesses and takes no medications.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mild generalized tenderness without guarding or rebound

Abdominal_.Findings: Diffuse swelling with active bowel sounds and mild generalized tenderness

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the segment of the respiratory tract responsible for the symptoms in a patient diagnosed with acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of severe pancreatitis and presents with new onset difficulty breathing.

Secondary_Symptoms: Oxygen saturation of 85% on room air
Rales heard at the base of each lung

General_.Findings: Cachectic male in severe respiratory distress

Lung_.Findings: Rales heard at the base of each lung

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's neurological status and identify the effects of acute alcohol intoxication.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department after being found in a park with confusion and slurred speech. He has a minor cut on the back of his head.

Secondary_Symptoms: Minor cut on the back of the head

Test_Results.Toxicology_Screening: Blood and urine drawn for screening

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the mechanism of hypotension following administration of sublingual nitroglycerin in a patient with chest pain.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented one hour after developing shortness of breath and 'squeezing' chest pain while mowing the lawn. He has a history of asthma, hypertension, and erectile dysfunction, and is currently taking salmeterol, amlodipine, lisinopril, and vardenafil.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Chest pain and shortness of breath

Vital_Signs.Blood_Pressure: 122/70 mm Hg initially, 78/40 mm Hg after nitroglycerin

ECG.Findings: Sinus tachycardia

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a patient with a gunshot wound to the thigh and evaluate for possible vascular injury.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient sustained a gunshot wound to the right thigh 35 minutes prior to arrival. He has a medical history of type 1 diabetes mellitus.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Gunshot wound to the right thigh
Secondary_Symptoms: Diminished pedal pulse on the right side

Wound_.Findings: Entrance wound on the anteromedial surface of the right thigh 2 cm below the inguinal ligament; no exit wound, no bruit or thrill.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cause of lethargy and confusion in an elderly male with a history of poorly controlled diabetes and hypertension.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was found lethargic and confused, unable to recall how he arrived at the hospital. He has not been routinely seeing a physician and has not been taking his medications recently.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the need for nephrology consultation based on urinary retention and renal function assessment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to the Emergency Department with 3 hours of intense suprapubic pain and inability to urinate for the past day or two. His medical history includes benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) currently treated with prazosin and tadalafil.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Suprapubic tenderness

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the type of bias affecting Study X and suggest a study design that minimizes this bias.

Patient_Actor.History: Study X retrospectively reviewed patients' reported coffee consumption and its relationship with lung cancer.

Secondary_Symptoms: Increased risk of developing lung cancer associated with coffee consumption
Association of increased coffee consumption with smoking (as shown by Study Y)

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of confusion and lethargy in an elderly patient with a urinary catheter.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department from her nursing home due to increasing confusion and lethargy over the past 12 hours. She has a history of Alzheimer's disease, hypertension, and nephrolithiasis. She suffers from chronic urinary incontinence and has an indwelling urinary catheter. Current medications include galantamine, memantine, and ramipril.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mild tenderness to palpation of the lower abdomen

Abdominal_.Findings: Mild tenderness to palpation of the lower abdomen

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of abdominal pain and constipation in a pediatric patient with signs of anemia.

Patient_Actor.History: The child's mother reports abdominal pain and constipation, with a reduction in appetite and no bowel movement in 2 days. The family has recently moved into a house built in the 1940s and started renovations. The child was born via spontaneous vaginal delivery at 39 weeks gestation, is up to date on vaccinations, and meets developmental milestones.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Moderate conjunctival pallor

Blood_Tests.Peripheral_Blood_Smear: Red blood cells with basophilic stippling

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a patient with syncope and a history of myocardial infarction who has regained consciousness after cardioversion.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient lost consciousness suddenly while walking to the grocery store after experiencing fluttering in his chest, lightheadedness, and profuse sweating. His medical history includes a prior anterior wall myocardial infarction 2 years ago with severe left ventricular systolic dysfunction.

ECG.Findings: Cardiac rhythm prior to cardioversion (not shown in the text)

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of acute vision loss in the right eye and assess the underlying neurological implications.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with sudden vision loss in the right eye, which she noticed that morning. Her medical history includes hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, and type II diabetes mellitus. Current medications include lisinopril, lovastatin, and metformin. She has a significant smoking history (1 pack/day for 25 years) and is a social drinker.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Vision loss in the right eye
Secondary_Symptoms: Bilateral pupillary dilation in response to light
Normal appearance of lids and lashes

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the physical  findings associated with a gain of function mutation in the FGFR3 gene in a child with short stature.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has had short stature since birth and has undergone genetic testing, revealing a gain of function mutation in the FGFR3 gene. He has met all developmental milestones, is at the 10th percentile for height, and 90th percentile for weight.

General_.Findings: Frontal bossing

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage the symptoms of a 2-year-old boy with developmental delays and potential metabolic disorder.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought in for evaluation of a tender red big toe. Recent biting of fingers and muscle spasms noted by mother. Diapers contain a substance shown in a photograph (likely indicating a metabolic issue).

General_.Findings: Significant developmental delay, tender red big toe

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of diarrhea and dehydration in a patient returning from a foreign country.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been experiencing 3 consecutive days of diarrhea, fatigue, and weakness. He recently returned from a volunteer mission in Guatemala, where he was asymptomatic. His personal medical history is unremarkable.

Secondary_Symptoms: Soft and mucoid stool with no blood stains

Physical_Exam.Findings: Sunken eyes and dry mucosa

Correct_Diagnosis: High urine osmolality, low FeNa+, low urine Na+

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fever and malaise in a patient recently diagnosed with Graves disease and on methimazole.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with fever and malaise. She has felt fatigued and weak for the past 2 days, with chills, and had a temperature of 40.8°C (104.2°F) last night. Notably, she has had a sore throat since the morning. Recently diagnosed with Graves disease and started on methimazole.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the exacerbation of heart failure in a patient with a history of exertional shortness of breath and cardiac murmur.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-month history of exertional shortness of breath and fatigue, with episodes of waking up at night coughing and gasping for air.

Cardiac_.Findings: Grade 3/6 holosystolic murmur best heard at the apex

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the implications of adjusting the ELISA absorbance cutoff value for diagnosing Trypanosoma cruzi infection.

Patient_Actor.History: A group of investigators is studying individuals infected with the parasite and assessing the diagnostic threshold for ELISA testing.

Immunological_Test.Findings: ELISA absorbance cutoff value adjusted downward by 15%

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the most likely medication that directly inhibits gastric acid secretion in a patient presenting with burning epigastric pain and regurgitation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-month history of burning epigastric pain, dry cough, and occasional regurgitation. Symptoms are aggravated by eating and lying down.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pain aggravated by eating and lying down

Abdominal_.Findings: Soft, non-tender abdomen

Endoscopy.Findings: Hyperemia in the distal third of the esophagus

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the management plan for a patient with a low-grade squamous epithelial lesion (LSIL) on Pap smear during a routine health maintenance .

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine health maintenance . She feels well, has regular menses every 28 days lasting 3-5 days, occasionally accompanied by pain. Three years ago, diagnosed with chlamydial cervicitis and treated with doxycycline. She has been sexually active with multiple partners since age 18, uses condoms for contraception, drinks 2-3 beers on weekends, and smokes half a pack of cigarettes daily.

Pelvic_.Findings: No abnormalities noted during complete pelvic exam.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of jaundice and abdominal pain in a patient with a history of biliary obstruction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with mild abdominal pain, yellowish discoloration of eyes, and itching for a year. He has lost 2.4 kg (5.3 lb) in the past month. Urine is dark and stool is clay-colored. No history of hematemesis, melena, or fever. Recent travel to Europe 6 months ago. Previous coronary angiography 2 years ago showed 75% blockage in the left anterior descending artery.

Abdominal_.Findings: Palpable, non-tender mass in the right upper abdomen

Abdominal CT.Findings: Multifocal short segmental stricture of the bile duct outside the liver, mild dilation along with hypertrophy of the caudate lobe, and atrophy of the left lateral and right posterior segments.

Biopsy.Findings: Periductal fibrosis with atypical bile duct cells in a desmoplastic stroma.

Correct_Diagnosis: Idiopathic inflammatory scarring of the bile duct

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of worsening heartburn, abdominal pain, and diarrhea in a patient with a history of duodenal ulcer.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening heartburn and abdominal pain for the past 4 months, alongside multiple episodes of greasy diarrhea. She was diagnosed with a duodenal ulcer 6 months ago. Her family history includes a mother who died of complications from uncontrolled hypoglycemia and had primary hyperparathyroidism. The patient does not consume alcohol or smoke.

Abdominal_.Findings: Tenderness in the epigastric region

Endoscopy.Findings: Friable ulcer in the distal duodenum

Correct_Diagnosis: Parietal cell hyperplasia in the stomach

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose a neck mass in a young male patient with a family history of thyroid disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient noticed a mass on his neck a few weeks ago while showering. The mass has not increased in size, and he denies any pain or difficulty in swallowing. Past medical history is unremarkable. Family history includes a father who had his thyroid removed at around the same age but the reason is unknown.

Physical_.Findings: Cachectic appearance with a palpable 4 cm x 4 cm nodule on the left lobe of the thyroid

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the nutritional deficiency causing ocular and skin symptoms in a patient with a history of alcoholism.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with dry, irritated eyes and a red bumpy rash on his arms that worsened over the last week. He has a history of alcoholism.

Secondary_Symptoms: Bilateral cornea and conjunctiva dry and thickened
Erythematous rash with small, white raised lesions on arms

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a patient diagnosed with seminoma and lymph node involvement after left radical orchiectomy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with dull pain in the scrotum and lower back pain over the last 3 months. He has a history of an uncomplicated appendectomy at age 22 and no significant past medical history. He smokes 2-3 cigarettes on weekends and drinks alcohol occasionally. He is sexually active with his wife.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Dull pain in the scrotum and lower back
Secondary_Symptoms: Firm, small, painless nodule on the left testicle

Scrotal_.Findings: Firm, small, painless nodule on the left testicle

PET_CT_Scan.Findings: Supraclavicular and para-aortic lymph node involvement

Histopathology.Findings: Uniform tumor cells with abundant clear cytoplasm and distinct cell borders, consistent with seminoma

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a patient with recurrent headaches and nausea to determine the most likely diagnosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports a 3-month history of recurrent headaches and nausea. Headaches occur a few times a month, alternating between the right and left sides. Exacerbating factors include loud sounds and bright light. She is currently in graduate school and experiencing significant stress. She does not smoke or consume alcohol, but drinks 2–3 cups of coffee daily. Her only medication is an oral contraceptive.

General_.Findings: No abnormalities; visual acuity is 20/20.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of dizziness and lightheadedness following recent percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).

Patient_Actor.History: Presented with crushing chest pain for 4 hours while shoveling snow, rated 7/10, radiating to left arm. Underwent PCI after ST-segment elevation in leads V2-4. Five days later, returned with dizziness, lightheadedness, and palpitations.

Pulmonary_Artery_Catheter.Findings: Increase in oxygen concentration at the pulmonary artery

Correct_Diagnosis: Harsh, loud, holosystolic murmur at the lower left sternal border

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cardiac process indicated by the presence of an additional heart sound preceding S1 in a patient with a history of myocardial infarction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine checkup and has a notable medical history of a previous myocardial infarction. He has not seen a doctor in many years and has no current complaints.

Cardiac_.Findings: Additional sound immediately preceding S1 when auscultating over the cardiac apex.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the causal pathogen of otitis media in a pediatric patient with ear pain and fever.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the physician with a 3-day history of fever and left ear pain.

Ear_.Findings: Bulging tympanic membrane with green discharge

Culture.Growth: Isolated organism grows on chocolate agar

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the mechanism of action of the drug causing lip swelling in a patient with multiple comorbidities.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of mild asthma, type II diabetes, hypertension, and hyperlipidemia. There have been no changes to her medications within the past two years.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Significant erythema around and swelling of the lips. The remainder of the exam is unremarkable.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate pharmacological management for a 2-year-old boy with acute otitis media.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the office with a recent onset of fever and ear pain. He has been tugging on his ear and complaining of pain for 3 days. His mother reports a temperature of 37.8°C (100.0°F) this morning and decreased appetite.

ENT_.Findings: Erythema and decreased mobility of the right tympanic membrane

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of worsening abdominal pain, hypercalcemia, and abnormal PTH levels, considering the patient's family history of thyroid cancer.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening abdominal pain over several months, recent feelings of sadness, and lack of motivation at work as a computer programmer. He has a history of multiple kidney stones and a family history of thyroid cancer in his father and uncle, both of whom underwent thyroidectomy before age 30.

Abdominal_.Findings: Diffuse tenderness over the abdomen, obesity

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of the patient's foul-smelling, greasy diarrhea and associated symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with 2 months of foul-smelling, greasy diarrhea, increased fatigue, and associated bloating and flatus. Denies recent abdominal pain, nausea, melena, hematochezia, or vomiting. No recent travel history and states her home has city water.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of respiratory symptoms and pharyngeal findings in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has clear nasal discharge and cough for the past 2 weeks, along with pain during swallowing and headaches with mild fever. The nasal discharge became purulent 5 days ago, and he has no relevant medical history.

Nasal_.Findings: Nostrils with copious amounts of pus

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with hematuria and a suspected diagnosis of muscle-invasive transitional cell carcinoma.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with gross blood in urine without associated pain. He has a significant smoking history of 1.5 packs per day for 45 years.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage postoperative complications following open proctocolectomy for ulcerative colitis.

Surgical_Site.Findings: 20 cm vertical midline incision and ileostomy in the right lower quadrant; no fluid drainage from surgical wounds.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's presentation and psychological response to a diagnosis of metastatic colon cancer.

General_.Findings: Very thin and appears pale

CT_Scan.Findings: Mass in the colon with multiple metastatic lesions scattered throughout the abdomen

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the impact of changing the cut-off level on the sensitivity and specificity of a drug screening test.

Patient_Actor.History: Development of a home drug screening test kit with an initial cut-off level set at 4 mg/uL.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the ongoing management and implications of cirrhosis in a patient with gout and evaluate renal function.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was diagnosed with cirrhosis of the liver 1 year ago and is receiving symptomatic treatment with complete abstinence from alcohol. Abdominal_.Findings: Mild ascites with no palpable abdominal organs

Objective_for_Doctor: Educate the patient about techniques used to evaluate the degree of kidney failure progression, particularly focusing on the estimation of glomerular filtration rate (GFR).

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has chronic kidney failure secondary to diabetes and is seeking information about the progression of her condition.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the developmental milestones of a 4-month-old infant during a well-child .

Patient_Actor.History: Born at 39 weeks gestation via spontaneous vaginal delivery and is exclusively breastfed. He weighed 3,400 g (7 lb 8 oz) at birth.

General_.Findings: The remainder of the physical  is normal.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of fever, malaise, weight loss, and skin rash in a 62-year-old man.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 1-month history of fever, malaise, and skin rash, along with a weight loss of 5 kg (11 lbs). He does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.

Secondary_Symptoms: Skin rash (nontender, erythematous macules on palms and soles)

Skin_.Findings: Nontender, erythematous macules on palms and soles

Patient_Actor.Demographics: 34-year-old female, gravida 1, para 0, at 18 weeks' gestation
Patient_Actor.History: The patient is attending a prenatal visit and expresses concern over the possibility of her child inheriting a genetic disorder characterized by gait ataxia, kyphoscoliosis, and arrhythmia. There is no personal or family history of this disorder.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage anaphylaxis in a pediatric patient following amoxicillin ingestion.

Patient_Actor.History: Previously healthy, she was brought to the emergency department after difficulty breathing and vomiting that started 1 hour after taking an amoxicillin tablet.

Secondary_Symptoms: Raised, erythematous plaques on trunk and extremities

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage potential alkali ingestion in a pediatric patient.

General_.Findings: Apparently healthy girl with behavioral concerns

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cause of fatigue, weakness, and neurological symptoms in a patient with a strict vegan diet.

Lower extremity sensory and motor deficits

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of stroke in a patient with a history of myocardial infarction and ventricular aneurysm.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of weakness and fatigue in a patient following a juice-only diet, with abnormal potassium levels.

ECG.Findings: Significantly peaked T-waves

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate developmental milestones and identify possible genetic or metabolic disorders in a 4-year-old boy.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought for a well-child . Started walking at 20 months, can use a cup but not silverware, speaks in 2-word sentences, builds a tower of 4 blocks, scribbles but cannot draw a circle. Height above the 99th percentile, weight at the 15th percentile.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate treatment for urinary retention following hip surgery in an elderly patient.

Secondary_Symptoms: Increased bladder size and volume on ultrasound

Ultrasound.Findings: Increased bladder size and volume

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's neurological symptoms and determine the appropriate treatment for multiple sclerosis.

Secondary_Symptoms: Numbness and weakness of the left leg

MRI.Findings: Several new enhancing lesions in the periventricular white matter and the brainstem

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate course of action regarding the patient's life support based on legal and ethical guidelines.

Correct_Diagnosis: Act according to the patient’s living will

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the appropriate prenatal screening tests for a pregnant patient with a history of type 1 diabetes mellitus.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a prenatal visit with a positive pregnancy test 1 week ago, estimated gestational age of 16 weeks, and a medical history of type 1 diabetes mellitus requiring insulin for glucose control.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cardiovascular health of a 16-year-old boy and assess the significance of the detected murmur.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine health maintenance  with no history of serious illness and feels well. He is at the 60th percentile for height and weight.

Secondary_Symptoms: Grade 3/6 ejection systolic murmur along the lower left sternal border
Murmur decreases in intensity on rapid squatting
Murmur increases in intensity with Valsalva maneuver

Cardiac_.Findings: Grade 3/6 ejection systolic murmur heard along the lower left sternal border

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the causal pathogen of scrotal pain and urinary symptoms in a sexually active male patient.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient's urinary symptoms and identify an appropriate treatment option considering his medical history.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Increased urinary frequency and difficulty with urination

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of irregular menstrual cycles and excessive hair growth in a young female patient.

Gray-brown skin discoloration on posterior neck

Ultrasound.Findings: Multiple peripheral cysts in both ovaries

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of severe facial pain and headache in a young male patient.

Limited range of motion due to pain

Imaging.X-ray Findings: Supracondylar fracture of the humerus with anterior displacement of the proximal fragment

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine appropriate health maintenance recommendations for a patient with chronic lymphocytic leukemia and other comorbidities.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is a retired teacher living in a retirement community. A colonoscopy 8 years ago was normal, and a digital  along with a prostate specific antigen level was normal 8 months ago. He has never smoked or consumed alcohol.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying causes of erectile dysfunction and lower limb symptoms in a patient with significant cardiovascular risk factors.

His father's medical history includes coronary artery disease, and his mother died of a ruptured intracranial aneurysm at 53 years old. He has a 35-year history of smoking one pack of cigarettes daily. He has tried sildenafil without improvement. His only other medication is ibuprofen for back pain.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the first cardiac finding in patients with gene product mutations affecting hormone levels and leading to cardiovascular disease symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: Patients present with symptoms associated with hormone dysregulation, including darkening of the skin, cold intolerance, excessive urination, and weight loss. They may also exhibit signs of cardiovascular disease.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of bleeding gums and fatigue in a homeless patient with poor dental hygiene.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of left groin and buttock pain in a pediatric patient with a history of recurrent pain episodes.

No swelling, warmth, or erythema noted

Objective_for_Doctor: Establish the diagnosis of chronic venous insufficiency in a patient with a history of deep vein thrombosis.

Dilated varicose veins in the right leg

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying cause of tremors and anxiety symptoms in a professional violinist.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of apnea episodes in a patient with a history of sleep apnea and acute respiratory distress.

Low oxygen saturation (SpO2 73% on room air)

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of syncope in a patient with a history of palpitations and lightheadedness.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of acute liver failure in a pregnant patient with a recent travel history.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and identify the cause of persistent bleeding following dental extraction in a pediatric patient.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the appropriateness of antibiotic therapy for a pregnant patient with complicated appendicitis.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of bilious vomiting in a newborn after delivery.
