Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the mechanism of the patient's allergic reaction following copperhead snake bite antivenom treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was bitten by a copperhead snake and treated with sheep hyperimmune Fab antivenom. Six days later, he developed an itchy abdominal rash. His medical history includes gout, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, diabetes mellitus type II, and multiple basal cell carcinomas. He smokes 1 pack of cigarettes and drinks a 6-pack of beer daily.

Physical_.Findings: Clear breath sounds bilaterally, normal heart sounds, pruritic abdominal serpiginous macular rash involving back, upper trunk, and extremities.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of acute kidney injury and systemic symptoms following intravenous acyclovir treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was treated with intravenous acyclovir and developed progressively worse fatigue, headache, and colicky pain in the right flank three days later.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Colicky pain in the right flank

Physical__Findings.Findings: No new lesions noted

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of progressive fatigue and worsening shortness of breath in a 16-year-old boy with possible congenital heart disease.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: 16-year-old male, recently immigrated from rural South Korea
Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 6-month history of progressive fatigue and worsening shortness of breath on exertion. Parents note that he has always been more easily fatigued than his peers.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Progressive fatigue and shortness of breath on exertion
Secondary_Symptoms: Mild bluish discoloration of distal toes
Bulbous enlargement of the distal toes

Echocardiography.Findings: Persistent blood flow between the pulmonary artery and descending aorta

Correct_Diagnosis: Persistent blood flow between the pulmonary artery and descending aorta

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of sudden onset chest pain and breathlessness in a patient with recent hip replacement surgery.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presented after sudden onset of chest pain and breathlessness 2 hours ago. She had a total hip replacement 20 days ago and has a history of hypertension managed with a calcium channel blocker. She is a long-term smoker, using 1 pack of cigarettes daily since adolescence.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness over the right lower lung
Dullness to percussion over the right lower lung

Chest_.Findings: Tenderness over the right lower lung with dullness to percussion

Chest_CT_Scan.Findings: Focal, wedged-shaped, pleura-based triangular area of hemorrhage in the right lower lobe of the lung

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the management of asthma in a pediatric patient and recommend appropriate preventive measures for inhaled corticosteroid therapy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was diagnosed with asthma one year ago and has been using an albuterol inhaler as needed. He has experienced shortness of breath on exertion and a dry cough 3-4 times per week over the past month.

Secondary_Symptoms: Expiratory wheezing in all lung fields

Pulmonary_.Findings: Expiratory wheezing in all lung fields

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of increased vaginal discharge and dysuria in a young woman with multiple recent sexual partners.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to urgent care with increased vaginal discharge and dysuria. She reports having multiple recent sexual partners and uses oral contraceptive pills, with no missed doses.

Secondary_Symptoms: Multiple punctate, red petechiae on cervix
Motile flagellated organisms on wet mount

Pelvic_.Findings: Multiple punctate, red petechiae on cervix

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of acute liver failure and altered mental status in a 2-year-old following a seizure.

Patient_Actor.History: Presented after a generalized tonic-clonic seizure lasting one minute, with a recent upper respiratory tract infection for the past 2 days. No previous history of convulsions.

General_.Findings: Sleepy and ill-appearing child, with unremarkable cardiovascular, respiratory, and abdominal s.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of severe right arm pain and functional impairment in a patient with a recent history of poor sleep and work-related exhaustion.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-day history of severe pain and inability to move his right arm, which began after sleeping on his side. He works as a waiter and feels exhausted from working several night shifts. He has been unable to work since the onset of pain and is dependent on his wife for support.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Severe pain and inability to move the right arm
Secondary_Symptoms: Dependence on wife for daily activities
1/5 muscle strength in the right arm
No sensation to light touch over the right arm and forearm

Musculoskeletal_.Findings: 1/5 muscle strength in the right arm; normal reflexes

Sensory_.Findings: No sensation to light touch over the entire right arm and forearm; rapid withdrawal of the right arm with pin prick test

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a newborn for the cause of abdominal distention and bilious vomiting.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Female newborn, delivered at 38 weeks' gestation.
Patient_Actor.History: The infant presents with abdominal distention and bilious vomiting 24 hours after an uncomplicated delivery.

Abdominal_.Findings: Distended abdomen

Imaging.X-ray: Findings not specified, but suggestive of obstruction

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the risk of distant recurrence of breast cancer based on tumor grade in patients who are disease-free following adjuvant radiotherapy.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Women with estrogen receptor-positive breast cancer
Patient_Actor.History: A group of 10,000 women who were disease-free after adjuvant radiotherapy and followed for 15 years.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of anemia and jaundice in a young child with a recent history of gastrointestinal symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought in for evaluation of pallor and increasing lethargy for 3 days, following resolved symptoms of abdominal pain, vomiting, and bloody diarrhea experienced 6 days ago. The family returned from a road trip to Mexico 4 weeks ago.

General_.Findings: Pale conjunctivae and scleral icterus. Abdomen is soft, nontender, and nondistended.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of worsening fatigue, dyspnea, and changes in fingernail appearance in a previously unmonitored patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening fatigue and dyspnea over several months. She has not seen a physician in 10 years and is concerned about the appearance of her fingernails.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a patient with a high-grade squamous epithelial lesion identified on Pap smear and determine the appropriate next step in management.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine health maintenance . She has a history of gonorrhea treated at age 20. Menstrual cycles are regular, occurring every 30 days, lasting for 5 days with normal flow. She smokes one pack of cigarettes daily and consumes one glass of wine daily. The only medication she takes is an oral contraceptive.

Secondary_Symptoms: No abnormalities during physical and pelvic
High-grade squamous epithelial lesion on Pap smear

Pelvic_.Findings: No abnormalities noted

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the volume of distribution of amiodarone after intravenous administration in a patient with atrial fibrillation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of myocardial infarction and is admitted for treatment of atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular response.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular response

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the mechanism of action of the antibiotic prescribed for a patient presenting with persistent fever and lymphadenopathy after rabbit hunting.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a fever lasting for 3 days, initially low but reaching 38.9°C (102.0°F) over the past 2 days. He has noticed bumps on his neck and has a recent history of rabbit hunting.

Correct_Diagnosis: It binds to the 30S subunit and prevents the formation of the initiation complex

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the predisposing cause of severe abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, and respiratory symptoms in a child with a history of recurrent nephrotic syndrome.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient developed severe abdominal pain with nausea and vomiting after attending summer camp for three days. He has a significant past medical history of recurrent nephrotic syndrome controlled by prolonged corticosteroid therapy.

Lung_.Findings: Rhonchi and focal wheezing bilaterally

Correct_Diagnosis: Iatrogenic suppression of a trophic effect on the adrenal glands

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of vaginal bleeding in a 5-day-old newborn.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought in by parents for new-onset vaginal bleeding. The newborn was born at 39 weeks to a G1P1 mother with well-controlled type 1 diabetes. The pregnancy and vaginal delivery were unremarkable, with Apgar scores of 8/9. The mother is breast-feeding and reports that the patient is feeding well.

Findings: Evidence of blood in the vaginal opening

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of fatigue and dizziness in a patient with laboratory abnormalities during a routine health maintenance .

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for routine health maintenance and reports fatigue and dizziness over the past week. He has back pain for which he takes ibuprofen. Digital rectal  shows no abnormalities.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the causative agent of conjunctivitis with corneal involvement in a contact lens wearer.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-day history of conjunctivitis, sensitivity to bright light, and decreased visual acuity. She denies any history of ocular trauma and is a contact lens user who maintains proper hygiene.

Ocular_.Findings: Fluorescein staining shows corneal dendritic branching ulcer with terminal bulbs that stained with rose bengal.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of persistent epistaxis in a 9-year-old boy with a history of nosebleeds and a family history of bleeding tendencies.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a sudden onset of persistent epistaxis lasting over 20 minutes despite pressure application. He has a history of nosebleeds since toddlerhood, which typically resolved quickly. He is otherwise healthy and has met all developmental milestones.

Secondary_Symptoms: Family history of excessive bleeding tendencies (grandfather and uncle)

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient's leg pain and determine the underlying cause, possibly related to peripheral artery disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient works as a mailman and has experienced burning and tingling pain in his legs when walking for the past month. He has a history of obesity, diabetes, stable angina, and constipation. He currently takes insulin and metformin and has a 22-pack-year smoking history with a daily alcohol intake of 2-3 beverages.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Burning and tingling pain in the legs when walking

General_.Findings: Stout man with ruddy complexion, stable gait, and 5/5 strength in upper and lower extremities

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of visual disturbances in a patient with a history of rheumatoid arthritis and current chloroquine use.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 6-month history of black spots in her vision and difficulty driving at night for the past 4 months. She has rheumatoid arthritis, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and depression. Family history includes maternal glaucoma. She consumes homemade moonshine daily and is currently taking metformin, citalopram, and chloroquine.

Secondary_Symptoms: Difficulty adapting to changes in lighting
Swan neck deformities of both hands

Ocular_.Findings: 20/20 vision in both eyes, bilateral bull's eye macular lesions, normal anterior segment on slit lamp

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the psychological status of a patient presenting with emotional distress following job loss.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought in by her daughter after she has been intermittently crying for 6 hours and expressing feelings of sadness following her recent job loss of 20 years. She has a history of asthma managed with an over-the-counter inhaler and has recently started oral isotretinoin for acne. She reduced her smoking from a pack a day to 2 cigarettes daily over the past year.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mild increase in blood pressure (140/80 mm Hg)

Mental_Status_.Findings: Oriented to person, place, and time, maintains eye contact, follows instructions, denies suicidal ideation.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the most effective intervention to prevent pressure ulcers in a bedbound patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is bedbound and presents with a shallow open ulcer over the sacrum and non-blanching redness on the lateral malleoli.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess developmental milestones and identify expected skills in a healthy infant.

Patient_Actor.History: Born at term and has been healthy since. He is beginning to crawl but cannot yet walk or run. He feeds himself small foods and can bang 2 cubes together.

Secondary_Symptoms: Beginning to use a pincer grasp
At the 40th percentile for height and weight

Physical_.Findings: No abnormalities noted.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying causes of growth retardation and associated physical findings in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the physician due to concerns about growth retardation. The patient has always been short for her age and is currently at the 5th percentile for height and 25th percentile for weight.

Secondary_Symptoms: Increased skin folds along the neck

Physical_.Findings: Low-set posterior hairline, increased skin folds along the side of the neck, high-arched palate, widely spaced nipples, shortened fourth metacarpal bones bilaterally

Objective_for_Doctor: Provide guidance on the safety of levothyroxine use during pregnancy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is pregnant and has a history of hypothyroidism for which she takes levothyroxine daily. She is concerned about the safety of her medication during pregnancy.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Anxiety regarding medication safety during pregnancy

Physical_Exam.Findings: Consistent with estimated 11-week gestation

Correct_Diagnosis: Well-controlled studies have failed to demonstrate a risk to the fetus in the first trimester of pregnancy, and there is no evidence of risk in later trimesters.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of tremor and gastrointestinal symptoms in a patient with a history of breast cancer undergoing chemotherapy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of breast cancer and is currently on chemotherapy. She developed a hand tremor approximately six months ago, prior to starting chemotherapy. She has experienced significant nausea and diarrhea since the start of her treatment. Past medical history includes diabetes and hypertension managed with metformin and lisinopril.

Secondary_Symptoms: Increased muscle tone in upper extremities

Neurological_.Findings: Tremor in left hand, increased muscle tone in upper extremities, gait difficulties

Correct_Diagnosis: Metoclopramide is contraindicated in the management of this patient’s nausea and diarrhea.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the nerve deficit causing foot drop and abnormal gait in a patient with poorly-controlled diabetes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a long-standing history of poorly-controlled diabetes and presents with 3 weeks of abnormal walking.

Secondary_Symptoms: Dragging the toes of the right foot while walking
Decreased sensation in the first dorsal web space

Neurological_.Findings: Right foot drop and decreased sensation in the first dorsal web space

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of fever and abdominal pain in a diabetic patient with a hepatic abscess.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of type 2 diabetes mellitus and presents with a 4-day history of fever, chills, nausea, and abdominal pain. He does not use illicit drugs.

Abdominal_.Findings: Right upper quadrant tenderness

Ultrasonography.Findings: 6-cm solitary, fluid-filled cavity in the right hepatic lobe

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient's readiness to change harmful alcohol consumption behavior following acute pancreatitis.

Patient_Actor.History: One week after being discharged from the hospital for acute pancreatitis and alcohol withdrawal. The patient has a history of drinking 8 to 10 beers daily. This is the second episode of severe belly pain due to his pancreas in one year.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of sudden vision loss and identify the appropriate immediate treatment for methanol poisoning.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to the emergency room with a rapid deterioration of vision over the past several hours, following consumption of homemade liquor believed to be pure due to its yellow flame when burned.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of progressive fatigue and headache in a patient with advanced HIV infection.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 4-week history of progressively worsening fatigue and headache, and is known to have HIV infection with a significantly low CD4+ lymphocyte count.

Mental_Status.Findings: Somnolent and oriented only to person

Microbiological_Test.Findings: India ink stain of CSF shows characteristic features of cryptococcal infection

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of respiratory symptoms and fever in a patient with a history of intravenous drug use.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with 2 weeks of low-grade fever, malaise, night sweats, orthopnea, and shortness of breath. He has a long-standing history of intravenous drug use and has been hospitalized multiple times in the psychiatry ward. Past medical history is unremarkable.

Cardiac_Auscultation.Findings: S3 gallop and a 3/6 holosystolic murmur heard best along the right sternal border

Lung_.Findings: Fine rattles present over the lung bases bilaterally

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of muscle weakness and fatigue in a patient presenting with myalgias and drooping eyelids, and determine if a thymoma is present.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening myalgias, early fatigue, muscle weakness, and drooping eyelids. His medical history includes gout, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, diabetes mellitus type II, and a pilocytic astrocytoma as a teenager. He has a history of alcohol consumption (6-pack of beer per day) and past cocaine use but currently denies illicit drug use.

Lung_Auscultation.Findings: Minimal bibasilar rales, otherwise clear lungs

Cardiac_.Findings: Grade 2/6 holosystolic murmur

Abdominal_.Findings: Benign abdominal findings

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage the appropriateness of medication therapy for a patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for follow-up after being diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus 3 months ago. He has been on metformin therapy since the diagnosis.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying psychological condition contributing to chronic abdominal pain without identifiable medical causes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports having had undiagnosed abdominal pain for the past 3.5 years. She has undergone two endoscopies, a colonoscopy, and an exploratory laparoscopy with no results. She is concerned about her family history of colon cancer.

Secondary_Symptoms: Inability to work or maintain a social life due to worry about her condition

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage the cause of severe left knee swelling and pain in a patient with a history of depression and recent suicide attempt.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of depression diagnosed 5 years ago and is currently taking fluoxetine. He has had 6 suicide attempts over the past 4 years. Recently, he attempted suicide by jumping from a second-story window, leading to minor injuries and hospitalization in a psychiatric unit.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Severe left knee swelling and pain
Secondary_Symptoms: Erythema and edema of the knee
Warmth to the touch of the knee

Knee_.Findings: Erythematous and edematous left knee, warm to the touch

Cultures.Pending: Mucosal, blood and synovial fluid cultures

Correct_Diagnosis: Administer intravenous antibiotics and repeat arthrocentesis

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a post-lung transplant patient with fever and pulmonary nodules for possible fungal infection.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient underwent a bilateral lung transplant 11 months ago and was placed on immunosuppressive treatment. He stopped taking prophylactic voriconazole for unknown reasons.

Biopsy.Findings: Negative for acute organ rejection, adenovirus, cytomegalovirus, and acid-fast bacilli.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of progressive shortness of breath and cough in a patient with a history of lymphoma and significant smoking history.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a persistent cough and progressively worsening shortness of breath for several weeks. Initially, he only experienced breathlessness during exercise, but now he has difficulty while at rest. His past medical history includes lymphoma, treated with chemotherapy, which is now in remission. He takes a daily baby aspirin and a multivitamin. He has a significant smoking history of at least half a pack of cigarettes daily for the past 30 years.

Cardiopulmonary_.Findings: Diffuse crackles auscultated over all lung fields during inspiration

Correct_Diagnosis: Cystic airspaces in the lung interstitium on CT scan

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of gastrointestinal symptoms and pruritic skin rash in a teenage girl.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with belly pain and a pruritic skin rash on her shoulders for the last 6 months. She reports feeling bloated after meals and has experienced multiple loose bowel movements per day over the past 3 months. She appears thin and is at the 20th percentile for height and 8th percentile for weight.

Secondary_Symptoms: Inflammation of the corners of the mouth

Abdominal_.Findings: Soft abdomen with diffuse tenderness to palpation, no guarding or rebound

Test_Results.N/A: Further evaluation is needed to confirm diagnosis.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the psychological state of the patient and identify potential neurotransmitter abnormalities associated with grief and depression.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents 6 months after the death of her husband in a car accident. She expresses inconsolable crying and feelings of guilt regarding past arguments with him.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Inconsolable crying and lack of enjoyment in previously enjoyed activities
Secondary_Symptoms: Lack of energy and concentration at work

Physical_.Findings: Normal

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the side effects of mannitol in a patient with a history of congestive heart failure after a traumatic brain injury.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of congestive heart failure and presents to a trauma center following a motor vehicle accident.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate potential causes of macrocytic anemia and assess for associated autoimmune conditions.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a regular check-up. She reports a healthy diet with a balance of meat and vegetables, and a glass of wine each night with dinner.

General_.Findings: Pallor observed during

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose and manage a patient presenting with symptoms suggestive of bipolar disorder.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with complaints of episodic late-night agitations and insomnia for months, affecting her work performance. Her husband reports recent impulsive behaviors including a shopping spree, raising concerns about possible substance use.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the risk of chromosomal abnormalities in a pregnant patient based on quad screening and ultrasound findings.

Patient_Actor.History: This is her first prenatal appointment, and she has known about her pregnancy for several weeks.

Secondary_Symptoms: Quad screening results indicating abnormal levels of AFP, hCG, estriol, and inhibin

Ultrasound.Findings: Increased nuchal translucency

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and determine the underlying cause of the patient's symptoms of fatigue, decreased sexual desire, and erectile dysfunction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-month history of fatigue, decreased sexual desire, and difficulty achieving an erection. He has a past medical history of traumatic brain injury from a motor vehicle accident 4 months ago, but neuroimaging studies showed no abnormalities.

Physical_.Findings: Bilateral gynecomastia and thin white nipple discharge

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose and manage hyperthyroidism in a patient presenting with palpitations and ocular symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been experiencing palpitations, anxiety, sweating, and unintentional weight loss for the past 2 months. She also reports a racing heart.

Ocular_.Findings: Exophthalmos

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the infant for potential metabolic disorders causing developmental delays and characteristic symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The infant presents for a routine check-up.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of fever, fatigue, and sore throat in a sexually active adolescent girl.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has experienced fever, fatigue, and sore throat for 8 days, with a diffuse rash starting yesterday. She took amoxicillin three days ago and is sexually active with inconsistent condom use.

Secondary_Symptoms: Morbilliform rash over trunk and extremities
Tonsillar enlargement with erythema and exudates

Oropharyngeal_.Findings: Tonsillar enlargement with erythema and exudates

Abdominal_.Findings: Mild splenomegaly

Skin_.Findings: Morbilliform rash over trunk and extremities

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the mechanism of action of neomycin and its effect on bacterial protein synthesis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient scraped his knee after falling from his bike and applied topical neomycin.

Secondary_Symptoms: Interest in antibiotic mechanism of action

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of tremors and neurological symptoms in a young man with possible Wilson's disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with progressively worsening tremor in hands and multiple falls over the past 3 months. He reports decreased concentration and loss of interest in normal activities. No significant medical history and takes no medications. He consumes two alcoholic beverages daily and does not use illicit drugs.

Secondary_Symptoms: Loss of interest in normal activities

Neurological_.Findings: Mild jaundice, flapping tremor, broad-based gait

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the factors contributing to a fatal drug interaction in a resident's patient care.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient died due to a fatal drug interaction. The treating resident was on duty for 27 continuous hours and had been working a maximum of 76 hours per week with only 1 day off per week.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Fatal drug interaction leading to patient death
Secondary_Symptoms: Excessive work hours and minimal rest

Correct_Diagnosis: The duty hour during which this resident received the patient

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage symptoms of peripheral artery disease in a patient with risk factors including diabetes and smoking history.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 3-month history of right lower extremity pain and burning while walking, which subsides with rest. She has a 30-year history of smoking one pack of cigarettes daily. Current medications include metformin, atorvastatin, and aspirin.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Right lower extremity pain and burning while walking
Secondary_Symptoms: Lack of hair over the right foot
Decreased skin temperature over the right foot

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the developmental and physical abnormalities in a 6-week-old infant with feeding difficulties and failure to thrive.

Patient_Actor.History: The infant has had difficulty feeding, frequent regurgitation of milk, and concerns about inadequate weight gain. The mother's description of the crying resembles a squeaky door.

Secondary_Symptoms: Physical features suggestive of developmental anomalies

Findings: 3/6 pansystolic murmur along the left lower sternal border

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of fainting spells following recent coronary artery intervention.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented with acute chest pain radiating to the left arm. He has a history of hypertension, diabetes mellitus, erectile dysfunction, benign prostate hyperplasia, and panic disorder. Medications include aspirin, lisinopril, metformin, sildenafil, prazosin, and citalopram. He underwent catheterization for a complete blockage of the left circumflex artery, receiving a stent and later discharged with clopidogrel and isosorbide mononitrate.

Secondary_Symptoms: Acute substernal chest pain radiating to the left arm

Physical_.Findings: Unremarkable

Electrocardiogram.Findings: Lateral Q waves without ST or T wave abnormalities

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage respiratory distress in a premature newborn while addressing patent ductus arteriosus.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Newborn male, delivered by emergency Cesarean section at 28 weeks gestation
Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a birth weight of 1.2 kg (2.5 lb) and developed rapid breathing 4 hours after birth.

Chest_Radiograph.Findings: Bilateral diffuse reticulogranular opacities and poor lung expansion

Echocardiography.Findings: Patent ductus arteriosus with left-to-right shunt and signs of fluid overload

Correct_Diagnosis: Decreased blood flow in the vasa vasorum of the ductus arteriosus

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of leg cramps and heaviness in a patient with risk factors for vascular disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for an annual check-up, reporting occasional leg cramps and heaviness in the legs after prolonged standing. His medical history includes hypertension controlled by metoprolol and lisinopril. He is a long-term smoker (half a pack daily for 30 years) and does not consume alcohol. Family history includes myocardial infarction in his father at age 55.

Secondary_Symptoms: Heaviness in legs after standing for long hours
Tortuous veins in lower limbs, more pronounced on left leg

Lower_Limb_.Findings: Tortuous veins over lower limbs, no skin changes, peripheral pulses 2+ in all extremities, strength 5/5 bilaterally, intact sensation, no pain on dorsiflexion.

Correct_Diagnosis: Valvular incompetence of lower limb veins and increased venous pressure

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the behavioral concerns of a child and assess for possible attention-related disorders.

Patient_Actor.History: The mother reports concerns about her son's behavior as noted by his teacher. He has been having difficulties with assignments and frequently forgets them. This behavior has been ongoing for about 8 months, with recent worsening prompting the teacher's intervention.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Difficulty sitting still and completing assignments

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a primigravid woman presenting with vaginal bleeding in early pregnancy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with vaginal bleeding and mild suprapubic pain 1 hour ago. The bleeding has subsided, and she now has mild brown spotting. She has been taking folic acid and a multivitamin. She has a 10-year history of smoking one pack of cigarettes daily and occasional alcohol use, which she ceased 6 weeks ago.

Pelvic_.Findings: Closed cervical os; uterus consistent in size with an 8-week gestation

Ultrasonography.Findings: Intrauterine pregnancy with normal fetal cardiac activity

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's mental health and suitability for prescribing a partial nicotine agonist for smoking cessation.

Patient_Actor.History: Presenting for a checkup with complaints of anxiety and persistent mood issues. Comorbidities include chronic gastritis treated with Helicobacter pylori eradication therapy and chronic pyelonephritis with stage 1 chronic kidney disease. Family history includes a grandfather who passed away from metastatic lung cancer. The patient has an 8-year history of smoking and is concerned about the health consequences. He has attempted to quit smoking multiple times using nicotine patches but has been unsuccessful due to unpleasant withdrawal symptoms and increased anxiety.

Secondary_Symptoms: Increased tobacco use over the past 12 months
Concerns about health due to smoking

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with suspected infective endocarditis and associated complications.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 6-day history of fever, chills, generalized weakness, chest pain, and night sweats. He has a bicuspid aortic valve and a history of recurrent migraine attacks. He has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 5 years and has a history of intravenous drug use, but has not used illicit drugs in the last two months. Current medications include propranolol and a multivitamin.

Cardiac_.Findings: Grade 3/6 high-pitched, early diastolic, decrescendo murmur best heard along the left sternal border; S3 gallop; diffuse crackles heard in lungs

Correct_Diagnosis: Mechanical valve replacement of the aortic valve

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the mechanism contributing to the gastrointestinal symptoms in a patient with a history of Crohn disease and recent ileocecal resection.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has Crohn disease and presents with a 4-week history of nausea, bloating, and epigastric pain after meals, radiating to the right shoulder. She underwent ileocecal resection for an acute intestinal obstruction four months ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: Radiating pain to the right shoulder

Ultrasound.Findings: Multiple echogenic foci with acoustic shadows in the gallbladder

Correct_Diagnosis: Decreased biliary concentration of bile acids

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of postpartum bleeding and abdominal pain in a patient following spontaneous delivery.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient delivered a male newborn at 39 weeks' gestation. She was admitted 5 hours prior due to spontaneous rupture of membranes. During labor, she experienced inadequate contractions, which resolved with IV oxytocin. The placenta was extracted manually after multiple attempts of controlled cord traction and fundal pressure. No significant past medical history except for occasional nosebleeds.

Secondary_Symptoms: Brisk vaginal bleeding from a round mass protruding from the vagina

Abdominal_.Findings: Fundus not palpable on abdominal exam

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of sudden onset severe abdominal pain in a patient with significant vital sign abnormalities.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a sudden onset of severe, generalized abdominal pain rated 9 out of 10 in intensity. She has a history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and chronic lower back pain. Menstrual cycles are regular with moderate flow, last 4 days, and her last menstrual period was 2 weeks ago. She is sexually active with one male partner and uses condoms inconsistently. She has a long history of smoking (one pack daily for 15 years) and consumes 2-3 beers on weekends. Current medications include ranitidine, hydrochlorothiazide, atorvastatin, and ibuprofen.

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the mechanisms of platelet function in hemostasis and the role of alpha-granules in platelet adhesion.

Application of granules to inactive platelets

Test_Results.Findings: Binding of granules to GpIb receptors induces a conformational change in platelets.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of an itchy rash and provide preventive advice based on the patient's history of atopic dermatitis.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of persistent fever and rash in a 5-year-old girl.

Significant swelling of distal upper and lower extremities bilaterally
Generalized edema with non-palpable cervical lymphadenopathy

Overall_.Findings: Agitated and ill-appearing, significant swelling of extremities, hyperemic pharynx, generalized edema

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the patient's persistent anxiety and paranoid thoughts following a traumatic event.

Mental_Status_Exam.Findings: Alert and oriented, full range of affect, organized thought processes and speech, normal memory and attention, denies hallucinations.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of blurry vision, headaches, and facial pain in a patient with a history of type 1 diabetes mellitus.

She was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes mellitus at 13 years of age, is a non-smoker, and drinks beer occasionally.

Secondary_Symptoms: Black necrotic eschar lateral to the right nasal ala
Weight loss (2.7 kg / 6 lb since last visit)

Physical_.Findings: Normal  except for a black necrotic eschar lateral to the right nasal ala.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of symptoms related to potential hypersecretion from a sellar mass.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-month history of headache, palpitations, diarrhea, and weight loss. She is not taking any medications.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage exercise-induced asthma in a patient who experiences symptoms during volleyball practice.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a wellness checkup. She reports being well overall but unable to engage in exercise due to asthma symptoms that occur once a week during volleyball practice.

Correct_Diagnosis: Recommend she use her albuterol inhaler prior to exercise

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with a head injury and neurological deficits following a traumatic event.

Poor response of pupils to light
Decreased power in left upper and lower limbs

CT_Scan.Findings: Details not provided in the scenario

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the ultrasound findings in a pregnant patient and assess for potential risks of chromosomal abnormalities.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents for a prenatal visit at 12 weeks gestation. She has a history of stopping alcohol consumption at 10 weeks gestation due to pregnancy and does not smoke cigarettes.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the etiology of a severe blistering skin condition with systemic symptoms and respiratory distress.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of palpitations, anxiety, and weight loss in a previously healthy female patient.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue, itchiness, and jaundice in a patient suspected of having liver disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with fatigue and itchiness for the past 2 months, worsening over the last month. Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of back pain in a 14-year-old boy, considering potential musculoskeletal disorders.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a patient with suspected meningitis following a seizure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to the emergency room after a seizure. He had an upper respiratory infection complicated by sinusitis two weeks ago. His past medical history includes hypertension, for which he takes hydrochlorothiazide.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cause of microscopic hematuria in a patient with a history of hypertension and smoking.
