Neurological_.Findings: Decreased pinch strength in the right hand and decreased sensation over the little finger and medial aspect of the right hand

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the psychiatric condition of a young man exhibiting signs of anxiety and psychosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient dropped out of graduate school and moved back home 8 months ago. His mother is concerned about his health and behavior.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Anxiety and preoccupation with thoughts of school and getting a job
Secondary_Symptoms: Odd behavior (wearing winter jacket in summer)
Auditory hallucinations (hears voices he cannot understand)
Paranoia (describes a plot to have him killed with poison seeping from the walls)

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of acute neurological symptoms and signs suggestive of increased intracranial pressure in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department 30 minutes after found screaming and clutching his head. He has had nausea and vomiting for 1 week, fever and left-sided headaches for 2 weeks, and increasing tooth pain for 3 weeks. No history of ear or sinus infections.

Neurological_.Findings: Confused, only oriented to person, pupils react sluggishly to light, fundoscopic  shows bilateral papilledema, extraocular movements normal, flexion of the neck causes hip flexion.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of developmental delays and malnutrition in a 5-year-old child from an immigrant family.

Patient_Actor.History: The child is brought in for a wellness visit. He appears indifferent, does not make eye contact, and keeps to himself.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Indifference and lack of eye contact
Secondary_Symptoms: Height and weight below the 5th percentile
Multiple zones of hyper- and hypopigmentation

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of excessive urination and initiate appropriate management.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with excessive urination, reporting urinating 10 times a day and multiple times at night. Symptoms worsened after increasing fluid intake upon advice from a physical trainer. He has a history of migraines and bipolar I disorder, and is taking metoprolol, lithium, and naproxen as needed.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of right upper quadrant pain and assess for potential liver pathology.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with dull right upper quadrant pain worsening over several weeks. Past medical history includes endometriosis managed with oral contraceptives and follicular thyroid cancer with total thyroidectomy. She consumes a six-pack of beer most nights and has a 20 pack-year smoking history. Recently visited cousins in Mexico with dogs.

Abdominal_.Findings: Soft and non-distended abdomen with tenderness in the right upper quadrant and palpable hepatomegaly

RUQ Ultrasound.Findings: Solitary, well-demarcated, heterogeneous 6 cm mass in the right lobe of the liver

CT Scan.Findings: Peripheral enhancement during the early phase with centripetal flow during the portal venous phase

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the pathophysiological changes occurring in a patient with acute myocardial infarction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a sudden onset of 'vice-like' chest pain associated with diaphoresis and pain radiating to the left shoulder. He has ST elevations on EKG and elevated cardiac enzymes.

Correct_Diagnosis: Decreased cardiac output; increased systemic vascular resistance

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of primary amenorrhea in a 17-year-old female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Presented with concerns of primary amenorrhea. Denies any symptoms and appears unconcerned. Review of systems is negative.

General_.Findings: Age-appropriate development of secondary sexual characteristics; no significant abnormalities on heart, lung, or abdominal .

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and initiate management for a patient with hypertension and complications from diabetes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with fatigue, weight gain of 5.5 kg (12.1 lb), and intermittent nausea over the past 4 months. She has had type 2 diabetes mellitus for 27 years, complicated by diabetic neuropathy.

Fundoscopic_.Findings: Bilateral micro-aneurysms and cotton wool patches

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the statistical significance of intelligence quotient scores in relation to crime rates.

Patient_Actor.History: Students were assessed for intelligence quotient and their criminal and disciplinary records were reviewed.

Correct_Diagnosis: 97.5% of students scored lower than him

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cardiovascular status of a 14-year-old male with exercise-induced shortness of breath and cyanosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with complaints of shortness of breath and easy fatigability during prolonged exercise. He reports a bluish-gray discoloration of his lower legs and feet during exercise. He has not seen a doctor since elementary school.

Secondary_Symptoms: Bluish-gray discoloration of lower legs and feet

Correct_Diagnosis: Continuous, machine-like murmur at the left infraclavicular area

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of severe diarrhea and electrolyte imbalances in a patient with an intra-abdominal mass.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 1-week history of severe diarrhea characterized by watery stools every 2-3 hours. There is no presence of blood in the stools.

CT_Scan.Findings: Small intra-abdominal mass

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of shortness of breath, chest pain, and cough in a patient with a history of cardiovascular and respiratory conditions.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with shortness of breath, chest pain, and cough for 2 days. Relevant medical history includes congestive heart failure, hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and hyperlipidemia. He has a significant smoking history of half a pack of cigarettes daily for 25 years. Current medications include metoprolol, lisinopril, spironolactone, metformin, and simvastatin.

Secondary_Symptoms: Chest pain exacerbated by deep inspiration

Findings: Dullness to percussion in right lower lung field
Increased tactile fremitus in right lower lung field
Bronchial breath sounds over right lower lung field
Whispered pectoriloquy over right lower lung field

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the vascular anatomy relevant to sleeve gastrectomy and identify the artery that will need to be ligated during the procedure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for weight loss surgery after unsuccessful attempts with multiple dietary and exercise regimens.

Secondary_Symptoms: Weight loss attempts with dietary changes

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the impact of stress on hormonal regulation and metabolic enzyme activity following a head injury.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department after slipping on ice and hitting her head on the pavement. She retained consciousness and was brought to the ER within an hour of the incident.

Secondary_Symptoms: Potential signs of stress response due to the incident

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of fever, sore throat, nausea, vomiting, and bloody diarrhea in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-day history of high fever, sore throat, nausea, vomiting, and bloody diarrhea. Symptoms began approximately 3 weeks after the family got a new dog. Several other children at the patient's preschool have been sick with similar symptoms.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of penile discharge and determine appropriate treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a complaint of yellowish watery penile discharge for one week. He experiences painful urination in the mornings and persistent genital pain throughout the day. He denies fever, body aches, or joint pains. No significant past medical history or current medications. He has regular intercourse without always using condoms.

Secondary_Symptoms: Lingering pain in the genital region

Physical_.Findings: Unremarkable

Microbiological_Test.Findings: Penile discharge collected and sent for analysis

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of sore throat and associated systemic symptoms in a 16-year-old male.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with a sore throat, preceded by several days of malaise and fatigue. He has a history of seasonal allergies and asthma and is a high school student on the wrestling team. Current medications include cetirizine and albuterol.

Physical_.Findings: Splenomegaly and posterior cervical lymphadenopathy

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the origin of a pulmonary thrombus in a patient with recent travel history and risk factors for thromboembolism.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department by her husband due to chest pain and a cough productive of blood-tinged sputum that started 1 hour ago. She returned from a trip to China two days prior and has a history of smoking 1 pack of cigarettes daily for 35 years. Her only home medication is oral hormone replacement therapy for postmenopausal hot flashes.

Physical_.Findings: Distended neck veins

ECG.Findings: Sinus tachycardia, right bundle branch block, T-wave inversion in leads V5-V6

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying mechanism of renal failure in a patient presenting with generalized fatigue and malaise.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has generalized fatigue and malaise for 3 months. Four months ago, she was treated for a urinary tract infection with trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole. Medical history includes hypertension, asthma, chronic lower back pain, and chronic headaches. Current medications are hydrochlorothiazide, an albuterol inhaler, naproxen, and an aspirin-caffeine combination.

Physical__Findings.Findings: Conjunctival pallor

Ultrasound.Findings: Shrunken kidneys with irregular contours and papillary calcifications

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a patient with symptoms of depression and evaluate treatment response.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 1-month history of depressed mood, difficulty sleeping, feelings of worthlessness, decreased interest in his hobby, and difficulty performing at work. No significant past medical history or substance use is noted.

Secondary_Symptoms: 7% unintentional weight gain over the past month

Physical_.Findings: Unremarkable

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with excessive daytime sleepiness, potential narcolepsy symptoms, and obesity.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient complains of feeling sleepy all the time with an uncontrollable urge to take multiple naps during the day. She experiences hypnagogic hallucinations (seeing strange shadows) before falling asleep and has sleep paralysis (feeling 'stuck' after waking). No significant past medical history or current medications. Denies smoking, alcohol, or recreational drug use. Family history of obesity and hypertension.

Physical_.Findings: Unremarkable

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of chronic pelvic pain and vaginal discharge in a sexually active young woman.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with chronic pelvic pain, especially during sexual intercourse, and new onset yellowish vaginal discharge. She has no significant past medical history and does not take contraceptive pills due to a copper intrauterine device. She smokes 2-3 cigarettes daily and drinks beer on weekends. She admits to being sexually active with over 10 partners since the age of 14.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Chronic pelvic pain during sexual intercourse

Bimanual_.Findings: Tender adnexa and uterus with cervical motion tenderness

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the complications of type 1 diabetes mellitus, particularly focusing on neuropathy and potential autonomic dysfunction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has type 1 diabetes mellitus with a 10-month history of nighttime tingling in his feet and two recent falls. He underwent retinal laser photocoagulation three years ago. Current medications include insulin and lisinopril, but he admits to non-adherence with his insulin regimen. He does not smoke or drink alcohol.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Tingling of the feet at night
Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased sense of vibration and proprioception in toes and ankles

Neurological_.Findings: Decreased sense of vibration and proprioception in toes and ankles bilaterally

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of nausea and weakness in a sexually active female patient presenting with right costovertebral angle tenderness.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 1-day history of nausea and weakness. She is sexually active with 2 male partners, uses oral contraceptives, and uses condoms inconsistently. Her last menstrual period was 4 days ago.

Pelvic_.Findings: Normal

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the developmental concerns and identify the underlying cause of delayed menstruation and virilization in a prepubescent girl.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient developed normally throughout childhood but has not yet menstruated and has noticed a deepening of her voice. She has no other health issues.

Pelvic_.Findings: Blind vagina with slight clitoromegaly and two palpable testes

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying pathological process following a thrombotic stroke.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department 30 minutes after the onset of right-sided weakness and impaired speech. Diagnosed with thrombotic stroke and treated with alteplase. Neurologic  four weeks later shows residual right hemiparesis.

Neurological_.Findings: Residual right hemiparesis

CT_Scan.Findings: Hypoattenuation in the territory of the left middle cerebral artery

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the possibility of child abuse in a young patient with a head injury and inconsistent history.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the office with a large head contusion and altered mental status. Initial story of injury from a pot falling, later changed to tripping over a football. Father mentions a fall down the stairs.

Secondary_Symptoms: Cracks in the suture lines of the skull

Neurological_.Findings: Altered mental status, signs of head trauma

Skull_.Findings: Cracks in suture lines, flattened bone appearance

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of severe headache and associated symptoms following recent sinus infection.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a severe headache that has progressively worsened over the last 24 hours, primarily located in the left forehead and eye. The headaches have woken him from sleep and are not relieved by over-the-counter medications. He is recovering from a sinus infection that started 1 week ago. His medical history includes type 1 diabetes and a 10 pack-year smoking history.

Secondary_Symptoms: Waking from sleep due to headache

Imaging.Findings: Thrombosis of a sinus above the sella turcica

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the most appropriate clinical trial subtype for evaluating the efficacy of a new over-the-counter medication for upper respiratory infections.

Patient_Actor.History: The doctor is interested in developing a new treatment for symptomatic relief of viral upper respiratory infections and plans to compare outcomes between treated and untreated groups.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a patient with intermittent palpitations and anxiety.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with several episodes of palpitations lasting 5-10 seconds, which began a couple of days ago. She has been staying up late for her final s and denies alcohol or illicit drug use.

Secondary_Symptoms: Feeling of heart 'spinning out of control'

General_.Findings: No abnormalities noted

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a patient with abdominal pain and positive hCG without visible intrauterine pregnancy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening abdominal pain that started last night. She reports being otherwise healthy, does not use drugs, and has never had sexual intercourse.

Transvaginal_Ultrasound.Findings: No gestational sac within the uterus

Correct_Diagnosis: Ultrasound and serum hCG in 48 hours

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of dysphagia, hoarseness, and muscle weakness in a middle-aged male patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-month history of hoarseness and drooling. Initially had difficulty swallowing solid food, now struggles even with soft foods like oatmeal. He has also experienced weakness in both arms and an 8.2 kg (18 lb) weight loss.

Secondary_Symptoms: 3+ deep tendon reflexes in all extremities

Findings: Diffuse muscle atrophy in all extremities
Intact sensation to pinprick, light touch, and vibration

Correct_Diagnosis: Destruction of upper and lower motor neurons

Objective_for_Doctor: Prescribe a prophylactic agent to minimize retention of radioactive substances in the body following a radioactive waste leak.

Patient_Actor.History: A semi-truck carrying radioactive waste toppled over due to a blown tire, causing a small leak into a nearby river.

Secondary_Symptoms: Community concerns about health hazards from radioactive exposure

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of lower extremity edema, shortness of breath, and fatigue in a patient with a history of sickle cell disease and HIV infection.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-week history of lower extremity edema, shortness of breath, fatigue, and weight gain. Her past medical history includes sickle cell disease and HIV infection, for which she is currently on combination therapy.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Periorbital and lower extremity edema

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management strategy for a patient with traumatic brain injury and signs of increased intracranial pressure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was involved in a motorbike accident, hitting his head on a pole without wearing a helmet. Initially responsive but later became less responsive, only opening his eyes to painful stimuli.

Secondary_Symptoms: Laceration and bruising on the left side of the head
Anisocoria (left pupil 3 mm more dilated than the right)
Sluggish reaction of both pupils to light
Increased tone and hyperreflexia in right upper and lower extremities

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of palpitations in a patient with pneumonia and determine the next appropriate management step.

Patient_Actor.History: Two days after being admitted for pneumonia, the patient experiences repeated episodes of palpitations and nausea. He does not feel lightheaded and has no chest pain. He appears mildly distressed.

Physical__Findings.Findings: No abnormalities noted

ECG.Findings: ECG taken during an episode of palpitations (specific findings not provided)

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and determine the appropriate treatment for a patient presenting with intrusive thoughts and compulsive behaviors suggestive of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is a college student admitted to an inpatient psychiatric unit due to thoughts about killing his girlfriend. He experiences overwhelming thoughts and auditory hallucinations urging him to harm her, which he finds distressing. He has no personal history of violence but has a family history of psychotic disorders. Previous treatments with haloperidol and fluoxetine were not effective.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Intrusive thoughts about killing his girlfriend
Secondary_Symptoms: Anxiety and guilt after experiencing intrusive thoughts
Compulsion to share thoughts with girlfriend for temporary relief
Worries about girlfriend's safety and repetitive prayers as a coping mechanism

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of lower abdominal pain and kidney dysfunction in a patient following allogeneic kidney transplantation.

Patient_Actor.History: Two hours after undergoing allogeneic kidney transplantation for polycystic kidney disease, the patient developed lower abdominal pain.  reveals tenderness in the area where the donor kidney was placed.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness to palpation in the donor kidney area
Diffuse tissue edema noted on ultrasound

Ultrasound.Findings: Diffuse tissue edema of the donor kidney

Correct_Diagnosis: Preformed antibodies against class I HLA molecules

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of chronic diarrhea and abdominal pain in a young female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with several months of diarrhea, crampy abdominal pain, and has made dietary modifications without improvement. She reports many watery, non-bloody bowel movements per day and fatigue. She has not traveled outside of the country recently and has lost 10 pounds since her last visit.

Skin_.Findings: Skin tags and anal fissure

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cardiac function and determine the cause of fatigue, shortness of breath, and swelling in an elderly patient with a history of myocardial infarction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a week of fatigue, headache, and bilateral ankle swelling. She reports increased shortness of breath while walking and at night, requiring her to sleep in a recliner. Past medical history includes hypertension and a myocardial infarction three years ago with a stent placement. Current medications include hydrochlorothiazide, aspirin, and clopidogrel.

Cardiac_.Findings: 3/6 holosystolic ejection murmur over the right sternal border

Peripheral_.Findings: Bilateral pitting edema in lower extremities and marked elevation of neck veins

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the psychological impact of recent personal trauma on the patient's emotional and cognitive functioning.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents for a routine health maintenance . Recently learned about his wife's affair, which led to her leaving him for another partner. Currently caring for two children after reducing work hours and giving up tennis.

Secondary_Symptoms: Feelings of loss related to wife leaving
Change in lifestyle due to increased responsibility
Engagement in intellectual pursuits to cope with emotions

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the pathogen responsible for the neonate's chorioretinitis and brain calcifications, and determine the additional microorganism that can be prevented by the same drug.

Patient_Actor.History: Born full-term with chorioretinitis and swelling and calcifications in the brain due to an in utero infection.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of episodic abdominal pain and bleeding tendencies in a previously healthy child, considering family history of autoimmune disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The boy has a 3-month history of episodic abdominal pain, increased tiredness, and has been experiencing bulky stools for the past 2 months. His family history includes a maternal aunt with systemic lupus erythematosus.

Secondary_Symptoms: Bulky stools that are difficult to flush
Scattered ecchymoses across bilateral knees, left forearm, and upper back

Abdominal_.Findings: Mildly distended abdomen; hyperactive bowel sounds

Skin_.Findings: Scattered ecchymoses across bilateral knees, left forearm, and upper back

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the part of the respiratory system from which a biopsy sample showing simple cuboidal cells and smooth muscle was obtained.

Patient_Actor.History: The investigator is conducting a study on histological changes in the respiratory tree of a chronic smoker. Multiple biopsy samples were taken from the respiratory system.

Secondary_Symptoms: Histological changes due to chronic smoking

Histopathology.Findings: Simple cuboidal cells with a surrounding layer of smooth muscle; chondrocytes and goblet cells are absent

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of frequent episodes of blanking out in a pediatric patient and determine appropriate treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with frequent episodes of blanking out or daydreaming that last for less than 10 seconds. He is unaware of his surroundings during these episodes and does not respond to questions or his name, but resumes his previous activity afterward.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of pneumonia in an elderly patient presenting with fever and cough.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient was brought to the emergency department with fever and a cough producing yellow-green sputum. He resides in an assisted living facility.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Fever and cough with yellow-green sputum
Secondary_Symptoms: Diffuse crackles over the right lung fields
Consolidation in the right lower lobe on chest x-ray

Lung_.Findings: Diffuse crackles over the right lung fields

Chest_X-Ray.Findings: Consolidation in the right lower lobe

Sputum_Culture.Findings: Organism that produces blue-green pigments and smells of sweet grapes

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of acute chest pain and identify elevated biochemical markers following a potential myocardial infarction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient arrived at the emergency department due to intense central chest pain lasting for 30 minutes. She has a history of atrial fibrillation and type 2 diabetes mellitus.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Intense central chest pain radiating down the left arm

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of fatigue, muscle cramps, and neurological symptoms in a patient with a history of osteoarthritis and hypertension.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports 6 weeks of fatigue and muscle cramps, with episodes of tingling around the mouth and in the fingers and toes. He has a history of osteoarthritis of the knees and hypertension. Current medications include ibuprofen and ramipril, and he has a significant smoking history of one pack daily for 35 years.

Secondary_Symptoms: Facial muscle twitching upon tapping over the facial nerve area

Vital_Signs.ECG_Findings: Sinus rhythm with a prolonged QT interval

ECG.Findings: Sinus rhythm with prolonged QT interval

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of an itchy rash in a 4-week-old infant and provide appropriate advice regarding skin care.

Patient_Actor.History: The mother reports a new, itchy rash on the infant's body. The infant has no significant past medical history and has an older sister who experienced similar symptoms at the same age. The mother has been bathing the infant at least twice a day.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tiny vesicles and scaling on lower back and abdomen

Skin_.Findings: Confluent erythematous patches and plaques with tiny vesicles and scaling over lower back and abdomen

Correct_Diagnosis: Hot baths that are too long, or too frequent, can dry out the skin.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a patient with urinary leakage and assess for pelvic organ prolapse.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 2-year history of urinary leakage upon exertion, coughing, and laughing, limited to daytime. She denies urgency, nocturia, or painful urination and reports no menstrual cycle disturbances. Her medical history includes a 12 pack-year smoking history, chronic bronchitis for 3 years, and arterial hypertension for 3 years. Current medications include fosinopril, metoprolol, and atorvastatin.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying condition associated with acute tearing chest pain and subsequent death.

Patient_Actor.History: Presented to the emergency department with acute tearing chest pain radiating to the back. Despite appropriate therapy, the patient died.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Acute tearing chest pain radiating to the back

Autopsy_Findings.Description: Increase in mucoid extracellular matrix and loss of smooth muscle cell nuclei in the media of large arteries.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of anemia in a patient with recent symptoms of fatigue and lightheadedness, particularly in the context of heavy menstrual bleeding.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports several weeks of fatigue and lightheadedness, expressing concern about episodes while driving. She has not lost consciousness and denies vertigo or dizziness. She has a history of jogging 3 times a week but has become winded more easily recently. Additionally, she was diagnosed with fibroids, leading to heavier and longer menstrual bleeding over the past several months.

Secondary_Symptoms: Winded more easily during physical activity

Correct_Diagnosis: Microcytic anemia, increased TIBC, decreased ferritin

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the patient presenting with severely elevated blood pressure and assess for potential hypertensive emergency.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was sent to the emergency department for hypertension found during a general health maintenance appointment. He is currently asymptomatic and feels well. No other medical problems were reported, and prior lab results were within normal limits.

Secondary_Symptoms: No reported symptoms related to hypertension

Physical_Exam.Findings: Unremarkable

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the defense mechanism exhibited by the patient in response to behavioral changes after being passed up for a promotion.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was encouraged by his wife to see a psychiatrist 6 months ago due to behavioral changes following a workplace promotion he did not receive. He has been undergoing therapy for several months.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Adoption of behaviors and traits of a coworker who received a promotion
Secondary_Symptoms: Buying clothes similar to the coworker's
Changing hairstyle to resemble the coworker's
Using phrases similar to those used by the coworker
Purchasing a new car identical to the coworker's make and model

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of fever, skin rash, and flank pain in a patient currently on antibiotics, and manage the suspected drug reaction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient returns to her primary care provider with complaints of fever, skin rash, and flank pain. She was diagnosed with pharyngitis 2 weeks ago and prescribed phenoxymethylpenicillin for 10 days, currently on day 6 of treatment. Past medical history includes type 2 diabetes mellitus, essential hypertension, and gastroesophageal reflux disease. Medications include metformin, captopril, hydrochlorothiazide, pantoprazole, and a daily multivitamin.

Secondary_Symptoms: Skin rash (sparse maculopapular rash over upper trunk)

Skin_.Findings: Sparse maculopapular rash over upper trunk

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of lower abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding in a 15-week pregnant patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is 15 weeks pregnant based on a first-trimester ultrasound. She had spotting early in the pregnancy but has had no other problems.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Lower abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding
Secondary_Symptoms: Tachycardia (heart rate of 120 beats per minute)
Small amount of blood pooling in the vagina

Abdominal_.Findings: No abdominal tenderness elicited. Cervical os is closed with no fetal tissue seen.

Ultrasound.Findings: Viable fetus with a normal heart rate noted.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the structure most abundant in the protein secreted by cells responsible for wound contraction during the healing process.

Patient_Actor.History: An investigator studies wound healing by secondary intention. A biopsy is performed 1 day and 5 days post-surgery.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage the cause of bleeding in a patient with a history of substance abuse and liver disease.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department by police after being found obtunded at a homeless shelter. The patient has a history of alcohol abuse, IV drug use, schizophrenia, hepatitis C, and anxiety. He is non-compliant with most medications except for clonazepam.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Obtunded state and bleeding from IV sites
Secondary_Symptoms: Distended abdomen positive for fluid wave

Physical_Exam.Findings: Covered in bruises, nose bleeding, and distended abdomen with a positive fluid wave.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the need for screening tests in a pregnant woman with a history of significant birth weights and current medical conditions.

Patient_Actor.History: Recently diagnosed pregnancy at 5 weeks gestational age. Previous obstetric history includes 2 vaginal deliveries and 1 medical abortion. Previous birth weights were 4100 g and 4560 g. Medical history includes gastroesophageal reflux disease, treated with pantoprazole.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the mental state of a patient presenting with unusual beliefs about healing and assess for any underlying psychiatric conditions.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient initially sought medical advice after attempting to heal her symptoms of fever, cough, and cold using her believed special powers, which she later attributed to her husband. Following separation from her husband, she no longer believes in those powers.

Secondary_Symptoms: Initial belief in special healing powers
Denial of hallucinations, mood disturbances, and socio-occupational impairment

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the viral group that contains the enzyme necessary to convert mRNA to cDNA.

Patient_Actor.History: N/A

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the condition of a pregnant patient following abdominal trauma and identify changes that may occur as her condition progresses.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted to the hospital at 35 weeks gestation after being hit in the abdomen. Complains of severe dizziness, abdominal pain, and uterine contractions.

Secondary_Symptoms: Ecchymosis on the left side of the abdomen

Abdominal_.Findings: Tender uterus, strong uterine contractions palpable, fundus between xiphoid process and umbilicus

Cervical_.Findings: No vaginal or cervical lesions, no visible bleeding, cervix is long and closed

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the organism responsible for the patient's symptoms following a recent missionary trip to Brazil.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with fevers, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and skin rash for 2 days after returning from a missionary trip to Brazil.

Skin_.Findings: Rash on the legs

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cause of fever and altered mental status in a patient with a history of pancreatitis and alcohol abuse.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was found incoherent at home by his wife. He has a history of pancreatitis and alcohol abuse and is currently in a rehabilitation program.

Abdominal_.Findings: Diffusely distended and tender abdomen

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient's metabolic status and determine resolution criteria for diabetic ketoacidosis.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient has type 1 diabetes mellitus for 2 years and ran out of insulin 2 days ago. He presents with abdominal pain, excessive urination, and drowsiness since the day before.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the underlying cause of joint pain, decreased range of motion, and characteristic physical findings in the patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening pain in his lower back, knees, and shoulders over the past few years. He has progressively lost flexibility, previously able to touch his fingers to his toes while standing, but now has difficulty touching his shins. He has notable dark brown stains around the armpits of his shirt.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Worsening pain in lower back, knees, and shoulders
Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased range of motion in affected joints

Findings: Decreased range of motion in affected joints

Imaging.X-ray Findings: Calcification of multiple lumbar intervertebral discs

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and identify the neurological symptoms in a pregnant patient presenting with hand pain and sensory changes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has experienced tingling pain in the thumb, index finger, and middle finger of her right hand for the past 6 weeks.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Tingling pain in the right hand
Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased sensation to pinprick touch on the thumb, index finger, middle finger, and lateral half of the ring finger of the right hand
Pain reproduced when the dorsal side of each hand is pressed against each other

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of recurrent severe headaches and provide acute relief.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports a severe headache lasting for 1 hour, with 3-4 episodes of severe pain over the left forehead each day for the past week. He has a history of similar symptoms 4 months ago but did not seek treatment. He considers his job stressful and has no significant past medical history. He smokes one pack of cigarettes daily for 7 years.

Neurological_.Findings: Conjunctival injection and tearing of the left eye; remainder of the  unremarkable.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the cause of right wrist pain in a patient with a history of rheumatoid arthritis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 4-month history of gradually worsening wrist pain localized to the radial side of the right wrist. Her medical history includes rheumatoid arthritis and von Willebrand disease. She is active in her local badminton league and does not smoke, consuming alcohol socially.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mild tenderness to palpation in thenar snuffbox
Nodules on proximal interphalangeal joints of both hands
Pain with ulnar deviation of the hand

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a pregnant patient presenting with severe headache, hypertension, proteinuria, and seizure.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted to the hospital at 36 weeks gestation with severe frontal headache. Initial assessment revealed hypertension.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pitting edema of the lower extremity

Physical_.Findings: Pitting edema of the lower extremity

Objective_for_Doctor: Compare the methodologies and biases of two studies on dietary salt restriction and atrial fibrillation.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Elderly nursing home patients and outpatients without atrial fibrillation
Patient_Actor.History: Study A involved nursing home patients randomly assigned to low-salt or control diets, while Study B estimated dietary sodium intake among elderly outpatients using 24-hour dietary recall.

Secondary_Symptoms: Atrial fibrillation status reevaluated after one year

Correct_Diagnosis: Study A allows for better control of confounding variables

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of ecchymoses and altered mental status in a patient with fever and respiratory symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department with fever, chills, and altered mental status for 3 days. He has a history of type 2 diabetes, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, peripheral neuropathic pain, and deep vein thromboses. Current medications include insulin, lisinopril, atorvastatin, warfarin, and carbamazepine.

Secondary_Symptoms: Crackles heard at the right lung base

Physical_.Findings: Ecchymoses on both lower extremities; crackles at the right lung base

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of recurrent infections and poor wound healing in a patient with a recent history of cholecystectomy.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted 2 weeks after uncomplicated cholecystectomy for pain, itching, and erythema at the incision site. Previous lab results showed hemoglobin A1c of 6.5% and wound cultures revealed mixed enteric bacteria. Treated with antibiotics and discharged after resolution of symptoms. Re-admitted a week later with identical signs and symptoms.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pain, itching, and erythema at the incision site

Wound_.Findings: Erythema and potential signs of infection at the incision site

Correct_Diagnosis: Self-inflicted wound contamination with fecal matter

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the likely laboratory findings in a patient with a genetic condition affecting hemoglobin production.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a known genetic condition characterized by a substitution mutation in the beta globin gene, leading to regular blood transfusions.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage the symptoms of restless legs syndrome in a patient with microcytic anemia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been experiencing discomfort in her legs for the past 6 months, described as an unpleasant, creeping and crawling feeling, particularly at night when lying in bed. She feels an irresistible urge to move her legs to alleviate the discomfort. The patient is recently divorced and lives alone, denying any changes in appetite, weight loss, low mood, or suicidal thoughts.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Difficulty sleeping due to discomfort in her legs
Secondary_Symptoms: Unpleasant creeping and crawling sensation in legs

General_.Findings: Mild pallor

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess for potential signs of sexual abuse in a three-year-old girl presenting for a well-child visit.

Patient_Actor.History: The child presents for a well-child visit. Mother reports normal growth and development but expresses concern about new behaviors possibly indicating abuse by the child's stepfather.

Physical_.Findings: Within normal limits with no visual signs of abuse

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of elevated blood pressure in an otherwise healthy elderly patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a follow-up visit regarding elevated blood pressure, which was noted to be 160/80 mmHg three weeks ago. Home blood pressure measurements taken at days 5, 10, and 15 showed readings of 165/75 mmHg, 162/82 mmHg, and 170/80 mmHg, respectively. He had a cold treated with over-the-counter medication 4 weeks ago.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of the patient's bleeding symptoms and knee injury.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department after falling in gym class and was unable to stand due to knee pain and swelling. He reports a history of hard-to-control nosebleeds and prolonged bleeding after minor cuts.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and determine the appropriate pharmacotherapy for a patient with cognitive decline and memory impairment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has experienced worsening forgetfulness and disorientation over the past 2 years, needing reminders for her grandchildren's names and frequently forgetting her current address. She lives with her son.

Secondary_Symptoms: Oriented to self and place but not to time

Mental_Status_.Findings: Mild memory impairment; oriented to self and place but not to time

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the nature of the hip condition in a 2-day-old female infant based on physical  findings.

Patient_Actor.History: Underwent a newborn  by her pediatrician.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Increased translation of the left lower extremity compared to the contralateral side
Secondary_Symptoms: Dislocation of the left hip confirmed by ultrasound

Findings: Increased translation of the left lower extremity
Audible 'clunk' over the left hip during maneuvers

Ultrasound.Findings: Decreased concavity of the left acetabulum; confirmed dislocation of the left hip

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate potential child abuse in a pediatric patient with unexplained fractures.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the pediatrician due to swelling and tenderness of the left upper arm after falling while running in the garden 2 days ago. The mother was away on a business trip during that time, and the father and older brother were caring for him. The boy has no previous history of trauma.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Swelling and tenderness of the left upper arm
Secondary_Symptoms: Swelling and bruising of the medial left upper arm

Physical_Exam.Findings: Swelling and bruising of the medial left upper arm; tenderness along the left 8th rib

Imaging.X-ray Findings: Nondisplaced spiral fracture of the left proximal humeral shaft; fracture with callus formation of the left 8th rib

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of lightheadedness, weakness, and abdominal pain in a patient with a history of pulmonary sarcoidosis on prednisone therapy.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presented with lightheadedness, weakness, and abdominal pain for 6 hours. She has experienced severe nausea, vomiting, and watery diarrhea over the past 3 days. She was diagnosed with pulmonary sarcoidosis 2 years ago and is currently taking prednisone.

Secondary_Symptoms: Fingertip blood glucose concentration of 48 mg/dL

Physical_.Findings: Round face with prominent preauricular fat pads

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage the patient's symptoms of nocturnal restlessness and determine the underlying cause.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with trouble sleeping characterized by an urge to get up and walk around at night, disturbing her husband. She reports a feeling of uneasiness and a need to move, which is relieved by walking. No symptoms during the day. She works as a mail carrier and is nearing retirement. Medical history includes anxiety, depression, irritable bowel syndrome, and dysmenorrhea. No current medications.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Nocturnal restlessness and urge to walk
Secondary_Symptoms: Irritation of husband due to nighttime activity

Neurological_.Findings: 5/5 strength in upper and lower extremities, 2+ reflexes, stable gait pattern, normal sensation

Abdominal_.Findings: Within normal limits

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the effects of carbon tetrachloride exposure in a pediatric patient presenting with malaise, dizziness, and sleepiness.

Patient_Actor.History: The child was brought to the emergency room after being found in the back room of his mother's dry cleaning shop with an open canister of carbon tetrachloride. He has a history of spastic hemiplegic cerebral palsy and is otherwise healthy with no current medications.

Neurological_.Findings: Tired and drowsy appearance; able to answer questions; increased tone in left upper and lower extremities.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the laboratory findings associated with acute shock in an unconscious patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought into the emergency department unconscious with no signs of blood loss.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of unintentional weight loss and thyroid enlargement in a 65-year-old woman.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine checkup and reports an unintentional weight loss of 4.5 kg (9.9 lb) over the past month, with no other complaints.

Neck_.Findings: Markedly enlarged thyroid with no lymphadenopathy or bruit

Nuclear_Scintigraphy.Findings: Patchy uptake with multiple hot and cold areas

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with severe abdominal pain and signs of possible rupture of an abdominal aortic aneurysm.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient has a significant history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, intermittent claudication, and a 60 pack-year smoking history. He has a previously diagnosed stable abdominal aortic aneurysm monitored by ultrasound screening.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Severe tearing abdominal pain radiating to the back

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue and daytime sleepiness in a patient with a history of heart failure and atrial fibrillation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been experiencing fatigue for 6 months, waking up tired every morning, and feeling sleepy during the day. His wife reports that he snores at night. His medical history includes heart failure and atrial fibrillation, and his medications include aspirin, atorvastatin, lisinopril, metoprolol, and warfarin. He consumes 1-2 glasses of wine daily and does not smoke.

Cardiac_.Findings: Irregularly irregular rhythm, no murmurs

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the causal organism of a nonpruritic rash with nodular and ulcerative progression in a gardener.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-week history of a nonpruritic rash on his right forearm that began as pustules and progressed to nodules and ulcers. He works as a gardener.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying cause of recurrent long bone fractures and arm pain in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought in due to arm pain following a fall that occurred 5 hours ago. He has a history of 4 previous visits for extremity pain after falls, all diagnosed as long bone fractures. He is at the 10th percentile for height and 25th percentile for weight.

Secondary_Symptoms: Two small ecchymotic regions on the left arm

Physical_.Findings: Right forearm is diffusely erythematous; tenderness noted on palpation.

Imaging.X-ray Findings: Transverse mid-ulnar fracture with diffusely decreased bone density.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the clinical features associated with high concentrations of antibodies against neutrophil proteinase 3.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is studied for immunologic response to Staphylococcus aureus toxin, with antibodies isolated against neutrophil proteinase 3 after 14 days.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue and anemia in a premenopausal woman with heavy menstrual bleeding.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with increasing fatigue over the past few months, especially since her menstrual periods have become heavier. She has no significant past medical history except for occasional flu. She experiences severe cramps during menstruation.

General_.Findings: Conjunctival pallor

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of recurrent bedwetting and polyuria in a child with intellectual disability.

Patient_Actor.History: The child has recurrent bedwetting and excessive fluid intake, often wetting himself during the day and at night. The mother reports unsuccessful attempts with bedwetting alarms. Past medical history includes moderate growth retardation.

Secondary_Symptoms: Difficulty reaching the bathroom in time

Correct_Diagnosis: Defect of Na+/K+/2Cl- cotransporter at the thick ascending loop of Henle

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of vomiting in a 3-week-old newborn and initiate appropriate management.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department with 4 episodes of yellowish-green vomiting. Generally healthy with normal daily stools and no significant family history.

Abdominal_.Findings: Soft, mildly distended abdomen with no masses or organomegaly

X-Ray.Findings: No gas distal to the duodenum

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of lateral elbow pain in a recreational badminton player.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-week history of progressively worsening pain on the outer side of her left elbow. She does not recall any trauma to the area and plays badminton recreationally.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pain on the outer side of the left elbow
Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness over the lateral surface of the left distal humerus
Pain reproduced by supinating the forearm against resistance

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the regulation of the cell cycle in relation to cancer treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: Recently diagnosed with a rare form of cancer; referred to an oncologist for treatment.

Cytogenetic_Studies.Findings: Tumor is responsive to vinblastine, which acts on the M phase of the cell cycle.

Correct_Diagnosis: Cyclin-dependent activation of CDK1 (CDC2) takes place upon the entry of a cell into M phase of the cell cycle.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cardiovascular health of a 12-year-old boy and evaluate potential complications related to his cardiac condition.

Patient_Actor.History: Immigrated to the US at age 9. History of measles at age 4 and high fever following sore throat at age 7. Received all appropriate vaccinations upon arrival in the US. No current medications.

General_.Findings: Healthy boy in no apparent distress. Breath sounds are equal bilaterally with good aeration.

Cardiac_.Findings: Fixed splitting of the second heart sound noted on auscultation.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of progressive breathlessness and dry cough in a patient with a history of cardiac arrhythmia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has experienced breathlessness for several months, which has progressively worsened, accompanied by a recent onset of a dry cough. His past medical history includes treatment for a cardiac arrhythmia with an anti-arrhythmic medication. He is a non-smoker and a social drinker.

Chest_X-ray.Findings: Peripheral reticular opacities with a coarse reticular pattern

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine which pediatric condition is associated with increased morbidity when exposed to high temperatures.

Patient_Actor.History: The child has a chronic condition that may complicate their ability to regulate body temperature during hot weather.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Increased morbidity during hot summer days

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the increased processes in bone metabolism in older women compared to younger women.

Patient_Actor.History: The investigator is studying bone metabolism and comparing serum studies and bone biopsy findings between two cohorts: women aged 25-35 and women aged 55-65.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the urinary symptoms and determine the appropriate pharmacotherapy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports frequent urination, especially at night, and difficulty initiating urination. Symptoms have slightly improved since starting terazosin 2 months ago. He has a history of stable angina and is taking nitroglycerin, metoprolol, and aspirin.

Rectal_.Findings: Prostate size equivalent to three finger pads, no fluctuance or tenderness

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the likely additional condition in a patient with rheumatoid arthritis who was recently hospitalized.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of rheumatoid arthritis and was discharged from the hospital one week ago. During her hospital stay, she received acetaminophen and erythropoietin.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a patient with abdominal stab wound.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presented to the emergency department after being stabbed in the abdomen during an altercation at a local bar.

Abdominal_.Findings: Knife in the abdomen at the site of stab

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the sensory modalities affected by an intracerebral hemorrhage in a patient presenting with altered mental status.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient collapsed on the street and was brought to the emergency department. Upon arrival, he was obtunded.

CT_Scan.Findings: Intracerebral hemorrhage involving bilateral thalamic nuclei and the third ventricle

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a 2-week-old infant with vaginal discharge and bruising.

Patient_Actor.History: The infant has a 1-week history of vaginal discharge that was initially clear but is now blood-tinged. The father reports bruises on the infant's back and buttocks. The infant spends most of her time in daycare or with her aunt. She was born at term following a pregnancy complicated by maternal gonococcal infection treated with antibiotics.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mild acne across cheeks and forehead
Erythema and swelling of the vulva and vagina

General_.Findings: Mild acne on cheeks and forehead, firm breast buds present.

Genitourinary_.Findings: Erythema and swelling of the vulva and vagina with blood-stained white discharge.

Skin_.Findings: Multiple large flat gray-blue patches on back and buttocks.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient for potential complications related to neurofibromatosis, particularly optic glioma.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a seizure disorder treated with valproic acid and has been experiencing difficulties in schoolwork for the past 4 years. He was able to walk independently at 3 years and use a fork and spoon at 4 years.

Secondary_Symptoms: Multiple freckles in axillary and groin skin folds
14 hyperpigmented macules on back and chest
Multiple soft, painless nodules on extremities and trunk

Dermatological_.Findings: Multiple freckles in axillary and groin skin folds, 14 hyperpigmented macules over the back and chest, multiple soft, painless nodules over the extremities and trunk.

Musculoskeletal_.Findings: Scoliosis

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of increasing shortness of breath and fatigue, and assess for vitamin B12 deficiency.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with increasing shortness of breath on exertion for the past few months, associated with fatigue and balance issues. She denies swelling of her feet and difficulty breathing at night or while lying down.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Increasing shortness of breath on exertion

Physical_.Findings: Conjunctival pallor

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the risk of malignancy in a patient with a history of occupational exposure and respiratory symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with progressively worsening breathlessness for the last 2 months. His medical history includes hypertension treated with lisinopril-hydrochlorothiazide and gastroesophageal reflux disease treated with pantoprazole. He has a 30-pack-year smoking history and consumes alcohol on weekends. He works mainly with insulation and drywall placement and admits to not regularly using a mask or protective devices.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's mental state and determine the appropriate long-term management for symptoms of mania.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department by friends, who report she has been acting strangely for the past week, including not showing up for work and exhibiting rapid and incoherent speech. Friends describe her as extremely excited, having purchased a new car she cannot afford, and calling them at odd hours to discuss future plans.

Correct_Diagnosis: Inhibition of inositol monophosphatase and inositol polyphosphate 1-phosphatase

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of vaginal pruritus and pain, and recommend appropriate treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with intense vaginal pruritus and pain for the past week, worse when urinating. Last menstrual period was 4 weeks ago. She is sexually active with a single partner and uses condoms infrequently. Denies recent fevers, chills, abdominal or flank pain, or menstrual irregularities. Past medical history includes systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), managed medically.

Secondary_Symptoms: Thick, white, cottage cheese-like vaginal discharge

Vaginal_.Findings: Small amount of discharge from the vagina, severe inflammation and scarring

Microscopic_.Findings: Pseudohyphae seen on KOH mount of vaginal discharge

Correct_Diagnosis: Oral fluconazole for the patient alone

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of sore throat and difficulty swallowing in a patient presenting with fever and unilateral tonsillar lesion.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with sore throat, difficulty swallowing, and difficulty opening his mouth for the past 5 days. He has a history of similar symptoms previously treated with antibiotics. He is up to date on his immunizations.

Oropharyngeal_.Findings: Erythematous pharynx with a large, unilateral lesion superior to the left tonsil;  limited by pain

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the appropriateness of low-dose aspirin therapy for cardiovascular risk reduction in a healthy patient with elevated cholesterol.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a well-patient visit with no symptoms. He has a past medical history of asthma, chronic sinusitis, and nasal polyps. He occasionally takes diphenhydramine for allergies.

Correct_Diagnosis: Have you had a reaction to aspirin in the past?

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the signs and symptoms of a suspected case of neonatal meningitis and determine the appropriate procedure for diagnosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The neonate was brought to the emergency department with high-grade fever, inability to feed, and lethargy. He had been active and feeding regularly until 2 days prior when he experienced vomiting and diarrhea.

Neurological_.Findings: Floppy and unresponsive, difficult to rouse

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of abdominal pain and bloody stools in a patient post-abdominal aortic aneurysm repair.

Patient_Actor.History: Five days after open abdominal aortic aneurysm repair, the patient has developed crampy abdominal pain and two episodes of loose, bloody stools. The surgery was complicated by severe blood loss requiring vasopressors and multiple transfusions. Perioperative antibiotics included cefazolin.

Secondary_Symptoms: Distended abdomen with absent bowel sounds

Abdominal_.Findings: Distended abdomen with absent bowel sounds and exquisite tenderness to palpation in all quadrants

Lung_.Findings: Clear to auscultation

Cardiac_.Findings: S4 gallop

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the best preventive medication for a patient with recurrent chest pain episodes following a migraine.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented to the emergency room 30 minutes after sudden onset of chest pain radiating to the left shoulder while lying in bed due to a migraine headache. She has a history of similar episodes of chest pain that usually resolve after a couple of minutes. She has a smoking history of one pack of cigarettes daily for 20 years and is currently taking sumatriptan.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Chest pain radiating to the left shoulder

ECG.Findings: ST-segment elevations in the anterior leads initially, but no abnormalities 30 minutes later.

Serum_Troponins.Results: Negative on two successive blood draws

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of shortness of breath and fatigue in a postpartum patient with abnormal cardiac findings.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted to the hospital 2 weeks after delivery of a full-term female newborn. No history of major medical illness.

Secondary_Symptoms: Grade 2/6 holosystolic murmur best heard at the apex

Cardiac_.Findings: S3 gallop and a grade 2/6 holosystolic murmur best heard at the apex

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with newly diagnosed hypertension and suspected renal artery stenosis.

Patient_Actor.History: Routine health maintenance  with no current complaints or history of serious illness and no medications.

Secondary_Symptoms: High blood pressure confirmed (185/110 mm Hg)
Bruits in both upper quadrants near the midline

Abdominal_Auscultation.Findings: Bruits in both upper quadrants near the midline

General_.Findings: Unremarkable

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with acute chest pain suggesting possible myocardial infarction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to the emergency department after experiencing chest pain for the last hour, rated as 8/10, dull in character, associated with sweating and shortness of breath. He has a history of diabetes and hypercholesterolemia. His current medications include amlodipine, aspirin, atorvastatin, insulin, and esomeprazole. He has a significant smoking history of 2 packs per day for the past 25 years.

ECG.Findings: ECG findings suggestive of myocardial ischemia (specific findings not provided).

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the specific risk factor contributing to the patient's liver condition characterized by jaundice, elevated alpha-fetoprotein, and prolonged prothrombin time.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 4-month history of fatigue and weight loss. Physical  reveals jaundice, and the liver is palpated 3 cm below the right costal margin.

Liver_.Findings: Liver palpable 3 cm below the right costal margin

Genetic_Analysis.Findings: G:C to T:A transversion in codon 249 of the TP53 gene

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying mechanism of vaginal bleeding and assess the patient's hemodynamic status.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Pregnant female, 5 weeks post initial assessment
Patient_Actor.History: The patient declined the use of oxytocin or any further testing and decided to await spontaneous delivery. She presents to the ED with vaginal bleeding for 1 hour.

Pelvic_.Findings: Active vaginal bleeding

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of increased exertional dyspnea and dizziness in an elderly male patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of hypertension and has been taking lisinopril. He has a significant smoking history of one pack of cigarettes daily for the past 50 years. Symptoms of increased exertional dyspnea and dizziness have developed over the past 8 weeks.

Cardiac_.Findings: Weak peripheral pulses

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of hematochezia and recommend interventions to prevent future complications.

Patient_Actor.History: Presenting with a large amount of blood in his recent bowel movement. He has a past medical history of diabetes and obesity. He reports no pain and otherwise feels well.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Large amount of blood in stool

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of panic attack symptoms in a patient with a history of anxiety.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of anxiety and presents with a panic attack.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of altered mental status and metabolic acidosis in a patient following a suicide attempt.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department after swallowing a bottle of pain medication in a suicide attempt. Recently had a fight with her boyfriend and was acting very depressed. Claims to not remember what she had taken.

Abdominal_.Findings: Mild abdominal tenderness

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of recurrent hand pain and numbness, particularly at night.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with episodes of pain in her right hand, which worsens at night and interrupts her sleep. She reports alleviating the pain by using warm water or shaking her hand. She also experiences numbness in the affected hand, with driving and extending her right arm exacerbating the symptoms. There is no history of trauma or associated weakness. Her medical history includes hypothyroidism treated with levothyroxine. She works as a secretary.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pain in the right hand at night
Secondary_Symptoms: Pain and paresthesia affecting the first 3 digits of the right hand when wrist is hyperflexed

Physical_Exam.Findings: Pain and paresthesia affecting the first 3 digits of the right hand upon wrist hyperflexion

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient's sleep difficulties and determine the most appropriate short-term pharmacotherapy for insomnia in the context of social anxiety disorder.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has experienced poor sleep for the past 8 months, gradually sleeping less due to difficulty initiating sleep at night. She averages 4-5 hours of sleep each night and feels tired throughout the day. Recently diagnosed with social anxiety disorder, she attends weekly psychotherapy sessions.

Mental_Status_.Findings: Anxious mood

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a pruritic rash in a previously healthy adolescent patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a pruritic rash on the chest that has progressively enlarged over the past 10 days. He is sexually active with two female partners and uses condoms inconsistently. He works part-time as a lifeguard. No family history of serious illness. Non-smoker, consumes 5-6 beers on weekends.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of syncope and cardiovascular symptoms in a patient with a history of diabetes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department after passing out for 5 seconds after dinner. He experienced lightheadedness and palpitations prior to the event. He reports recent fatigue and shortness of breath. His medical history includes well-controlled diabetes on metformin.

Correct_Diagnosis: Decreased rate of phase 0 depolarization and increased action potential duration

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of a persistent nonproductive cough and headache with associated radiographic findings.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a persistent nonproductive cough and headache that has gradually developed over the past week.

Secondary_Symptoms: Bilateral diffuse interstitial infiltrates on chest radiograph

Laboratory_Evaluation.Findings: Clumping of red blood cells after the patient’s blood is drawn and transferred into a chilled EDTA-containing vial

Correct_Diagnosis: Clumping of red blood cells after the patient’s blood is drawn and transferred into a chilled EDTA-containing vial

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of bradycardia and altered mental status in a patient with a history of substance abuse.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought into the emergency department by emergency medical services after being found down in his apartment. Last seen 24 hours earlier by his mother. History of substance abuse.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Disorientation and inability to answer questions

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the mechanism of action of intravenous zidovudine in the context of an HIV-positive pregnant patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is at 38 weeks' gestation and is in active labor. She has a history of HIV infection but has not been on antiretroviral therapy. Previous viral load is unknown.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the implications of an INR of 5 in a patient with a history of COPD and atrial fibrillation, and address the management of potential warfarin overdose.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient has a history of COPD and atrial fibrillation. She is on warfarin for anticoagulation and was admitted for management of a COPD exacerbation.

Correct_Diagnosis: Tell the patient that a mistake was made and explain why it happened

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify signs of child neglect and assess the child's well-being after being struck by a car.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department after being struck by a car. The boy is intellectually disabled and has a history of being left unattended at home frequently. He has not been seen by a physician in several years and has missed several vaccines.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of gastrointestinal symptoms following exposure to untreated water.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents after several days of flatulence and greasy, foul-smelling diarrhea, which started after a camping trip where he collected water from a stream without treatment.

Physical_.Findings: Dry mucous membranes

Stool_Analysis.Findings: Motile protozoa observed on microscopy, negative for ova, no blood cells, and pus cells

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate party to contact for organ donation consent after the patient has expired from injuries sustained in a motor vehicle accident.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was otherwise healthy and was brought into the emergency department after being struck by a motor vehicle. She experienced heavy bleeding and eventually expired due to her injuries. There is no past medical history and no medications were being taken.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage the patient's symptoms of excessive hunger, polyuria, and thirst in the context of chronic health issues.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a medical history significant for obesity, hypothyroidism, and chronic venous insufficiency. Her current medications include thyroxine and a multivitamin. In a previous visit, she reported being hungry all the time, urinating multiple times a day, and having persistent thirst.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mild pitting edema of bilateral lower extremities

Physical_.Findings: Clear lungs, regular heart sounds, no abdominal tenderness, and mild pitting edema of the bilateral lower extremities.

Correct_Diagnosis: No further renal tests are required
