Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate treatment for a patient presenting with hematochezia and a history of ulcerative colitis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented to the emergency department with blood in his stool after returning from a camping trip where he consumed meats cooked over a fire pit and drank water from local streams. His medical history includes obesity, diabetes, constipation, irritable bowel syndrome, and ulcerative colitis in remission. He has a significant smoking history of 70 pack-years and a family history of breast cancer in his mother and prostate cancer in his father.

Abdominal_.Findings: Non-tender, non-distended abdomen with normal bowel sounds

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue, weight loss, muscle aches, and intermittent fevers with associated skin rash in a 61-year-old man.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with fatigue, weight loss, and muscle aches experienced for the past year, initially attributed to work stress. Over the last month, he developed intermittent fevers and a skin rash. He denies recent asthma, rhinitis, hematuria, or difficulty breathing. He has a distant history of cocaine abuse (not used in 30 years) and takes no medications. Family history includes pancreatic cancer in his father and inflammatory bowel disease in his sister.

Lung_.Findings: Rales heard at bilateral lung bases

Neurological_.Findings: Strength 5/5 in bilateral upper and lower extremities, normal gait

Dermatological_.Findings: Palpable purpura noted on trunk and bilateral upper and lower extremities

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the ethical implications and communication strategies regarding a cancer diagnosis in a patient whose daughter requests non-disclosure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for evaluation of weight loss and a bloody cough that began 3 weeks ago. She has a history of a major depressive episode and a suicide attempt 20 years ago but has since been stable. She lives alone and manages her daily activities independently. She has a 40-year smoking history (1 pack daily) and does not take any medications.

Secondary_Symptoms: Central solitary nodule in the right lung
Multiple metastatic lesions within the liver

Chest X-ray.Findings: Central solitary nodule in the right lung

CT Scan of Abdomen.Findings: Multiple metastatic lesions within the liver

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the primary site of metastasis in a patient with a neoplastic mass in the brain showing a BRAF mutation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with morning headaches lasting for 6 weeks. An MRI of the head shows a likely metastasis in the supratentorial region of the brain.

Imaging.MRI: Likely metastasis in the supratentorial region of the brain

Biopsy.Findings: Mutation in BRAF (glutamic acid substituted for valine at position 600)

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate imaging test for a patient with suspected renal masses and history of kidney disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 2-year history of dull, nonspecific flank pain that subsides with rest. His past medical history includes hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Family history includes a father who died of kidney disease at 51 and a mother treated for ovarian cancer.

Abdominal_.Findings: Palpable bilateral renal masses

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the hormonal changes associated with lactation in a postpartum patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a postpartum check-up 3 weeks after an uncomplicated vaginal delivery of a 38-week-old boy. She has been exclusively breastfeeding.

Hormonal_Assessment.Findings: IP3 levels significantly change during milk let-down

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of generalized edema and frothy urine in a patient with a history of diabetes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with gradual swelling of his face and frothy urine, first noticed 4 days ago. He has a past medical history of diabetes mellitus for the past 10 years and is currently on metformin with well-controlled blood sugar and HbA1c levels. He does not smoke and drinks alcohol occasionally. His laboratory results from 6 months ago were normal.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Gradual swelling of the face and limbs

Physical_.Findings: Pitting edema in lower extremities and on the face

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the pulmonary function of a patient with a chronic cough and recurrent dyspnea, likely related to a history of smoking and occupational exposure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has had chronic cough and recurrent episodes of dyspnea for the last 3 years, with multiple physician visits and three hospitalizations for severe exacerbations. He has a 17-year smoking history and a family history of allergic disorders.

Secondary_Symptoms: Temporary and partial relief from previous treatments

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue and abnormal laboratory findings in a patient with a history of diabetes, hypertension, and congestive heart failure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to the emergency department for fatigue and feeling off for the past week. He has no known sick contacts and cannot recall any preceding symptoms.

Secondary_Symptoms: Feeling off for the past week

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the most sensitive test for detecting renal impairment in a diabetic patient during a routine checkup.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 15-year history of diabetes mellitus and is presenting for a routine checkup.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose cystic fibrosis in a 2-week-old male infant and discuss treatment options for respiratory complications and potential overdose antidotes.

Patient_Actor.History: The infant was brought to the pediatrician after a positive newborn screening result for cystic fibrosis. A diagnostic sweat test showed elevated chloride levels.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Elevated chloride levels in sweat test
Secondary_Symptoms: Risk of respiratory infections due to improper mucus clearance

Genetic_Test.Findings: 3 base pair deletion in a transmembrane cAMP-activated ion channel

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of progressive shoulder pain and dark urine in a young male patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports left shoulder pain that started 3 years ago and has progressively worsened. He denies joint trauma, fever, dysuria, or morning stiffness. He notes that his urine turns black after exposure to air and has done so since childhood.

Secondary_Symptoms: Point tenderness upon palpation of right elbow, left knee, and shoulder

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of vaginal bleeding and lower abdominal pain in a pregnant woman.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 10-hour history of vaginal bleeding and lower abdominal pain. She has experienced nausea and fatigue for the past 4 weeks. Her last menstrual period was 9 weeks ago, and there is no history of medical illness.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Vaginal bleeding and lower abdominal pain

Pelvic_.Findings: Uterus consistent in size with a 9-week gestation

Transvaginal_Ultrasound.Findings: Unclear, amorphous fetal parts and a large placenta with multiple cystic spaces

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of sudden vision loss and neurological symptoms in a patient with a history of migraines.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a sudden loss of vision in her left eye and difficulty speaking. Two weeks prior, she experienced muscle aches, fever, and cough. The muscle aches are improving, but she still has a cough and reports increased fatigue. She had a similar episode of vision loss 2 years ago that was evaluated with an MRI. Her family history includes migraines, and she takes propranolol daily.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Sudden loss of vision in the left eye
Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased constriction of the left pupil on swinging light test

Neurological_.Findings: Decreased constriction of the left pupil relative to the right pupil

MRI.Findings: Enhancing lesions in the left optic nerve

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of diarrhea and abdominal pain in a patient with a recent history of antibiotic use.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with diarrhea for the past week, intense fatigue, and intermittent cramping abdominal pain. She had an episode of pneumonia last month, treated with antibiotics. Recently traveled to Florida. Her medical history includes hypertension, peptic ulcer disease, hypercholesterolemia, and osteoporosis.

Abdominal_.Findings: Lower abdominal tenderness

Correct_Diagnosis: Peptic ulcer disease treated with esomeprazole

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of the patient's movement disorder following treatment for paranoid delusions and auditory hallucinations.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of paranoid delusions and auditory hallucinations lasting for 7 months, leading to significant social and financial deterioration. He has been sporadic with follow-up appointments and was last seen for a regular depot injection. He lacks social support and has a tendency to be non-compliant with medications.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying immunological deficiency in a patient with persistent pneumonia and yeast infection.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted to the hospital with a presumed pneumonia and started on antibiotics. No improvement observed after two days.

Secondary_Symptoms: Positive blood cultures for yeast with pseudohyphae

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of the patient's vertigo and nausea following physical exertion.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented after experiencing intense nausea and vomiting following a 15-kilometer race. He felt well while resting but experienced dizziness and emesis upon rising from a hammock. He has a past medical history of migraines, usually without nausea or vomiting.

Neurological_.Findings: Cranial nerves intact, gross motor function and sensation within normal limits.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of infertility in a 28-year-old woman after 3 years of attempted conception.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been unable to conceive for 3 years despite being sexually active without contraception. She had a partial assessment 6 months ago, with normal semen analysis for her partner and normal hormonal assays for both partners. Her menstrual cycles are regular, occurring every 28 days and lasting 5 to 6 days. Her last menstrual period was 2 weeks ago. She had a single urinary tract infection 4 years ago, treated with oral antibiotics.

Secondary_Symptoms: No reported abnormalities on vaginal and rectal s

Pelvic_.Findings: Normal-sized uterus and no palpable adnexal masses

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of acute respiratory distress and cardiac dysfunction in a patient with a history of asthma.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening breathlessness that began overnight. He was diagnosed with asthma 3 years prior and uses albuterol and steroid inhalers. No prior history of cardiac disease or other respiratory diseases.

ECG.Findings: Regular sinus tachycardia with absence of strain pattern or evidence of ischemia

Echocardiography.Findings: Dilated left ventricle with an ejection fraction of 30% (normal is 55% or greater)

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with symptoms suggestive of pneumonia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 4-day history of fever, malaise, chills, and a productive cough with yellow sputum. She has a history of a urinary tract infection treated with trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole four months ago.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Right-sided chest pain exacerbated by deep inspiration

General_.Findings: Pale conjunctivae

Lung_.Findings: Crackles heard at the right lung base

Cardiac_.Findings: No abnormalities

Chest X-ray.Findings: Infiltrate at the right lung base

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess developmental delays and neurological symptoms in a 3-year-old boy.

Patient_Actor.History: The child has had multiple falls while walking and running for the past 4 months. He used to climb stairs independently but now requires assistance. He began speaking in 2-word sentences at 2 years of age.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Waddling gait and difficulty rising from a sitting position
Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased muscle strength in bilateral lower extremities

Neurological_.Findings: Waddling gait, decreased muscle strength in bilateral lower extremities, and 1+ patellar and ankle reflexes bilaterally

Objective_for_Doctor: Monitor for complications following chemotherapy in a patient with serous cystadenocarcinoma.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with bloating and fatigue over the past year. She has a mass-like lesion affecting the left ovary, diagnosed as serous cystadenocarcinoma through biopsy.

Abdominal_.Findings: Abdominal distension and ascites

Imaging.Findings: Mass-like lesion affecting the left ovary

Biopsy.Findings: Serous cystadenocarcinoma

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of a painful penile lesion in a sexually active male.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a painful lesion at the end of his penis that started as a tiny red bump and grew over several days. He has had several sexual partners in the past few months and has no history of serious illness or current medications.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Painful lesion at the end of the penis
Secondary_Symptoms: Enlarged and tender inguinal lymph nodes
Ulcerated and weeping sore with erythematous base and ragged edges

Inguinal_.Findings: Enlarged and tender lymph nodes, some fluctuant

Genital_.Findings: Ulcerated and weeping sore with an erythematous base and ragged edges on the penis

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with symptoms suggestive of giant cell arteritis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with 1 week of fever, unremitting headache, and stiffness in the hips and shoulders. She has no significant past medical history and denies any vision changes.

Secondary_Symptoms: Limited range of motion due to pain and stiffness

Neurological_.Findings: Normal neurological testing

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of fatigue and lymphadenopathy in a patient with a history of alcohol-induced pain.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-month history of fatigue, weight loss, and multiple painless swellings on his neck and axilla that become painful after consuming alcohol.

Secondary_Symptoms: Multiple painless swellings in the neck and axilla

Biopsy.Findings: Giant binucleate cells

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of low back pain and left leg weakness in a construction worker.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a two-week history of low back pain and left leg pain, which started while working as a construction worker. He reports intermittent achy pain over the lumbar spine and radiating pain into the left leg.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Low back pain and left leg pain

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the significance of a late systolic crescendo murmur in a patient with a history of rheumatic fever.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine check-up. He has a past medical history of rheumatic fever.

Cardiac_.Findings: Late systolic crescendo murmur with a mid-systolic click, best heard over the apex and loudest just before S2.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with symptoms suggestive of myasthenia gravis and assess for potential thymoma.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with blurred vision for the past 2 months, along with difficulty chewing and swallowing that worsens throughout the day and improves with rest. She has been under significant stress recently. No personal or family history of serious illness. She does not smoke and drinks a glass of wine occasionally. She takes no medications.

Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased muscle strength in lower extremities

Neurological_.Findings: Bilateral ptosis and mask-like facies, decreased muscle strength in lower extremities

Electromyography.Findings: Decremental response following repetitive nerve stimulation

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage the cause of left-sided facial swelling and pain following recent coronary intervention.

Patient_Actor.History: Three days after outpatient percutaneous coronary intervention with stent placement in the right coronary artery, the patient developed left-sided painful facial swelling. She has a history of hypertension and coronary artery disease and is on multiple medications including enalapril, metoprolol, aspirin, clopidogrel, simvastatin, and a multivitamin. She does not smoke or drink alcohol.

Secondary_Symptoms: Swelling and tenderness of the left parotid gland
Erythema with scant purulent drainage in the intraoral

Physical__Findings.Findings: Swelling and tenderness of the left parotid gland with intraoral erythema and scant purulent drainage

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient's symptoms and identify potential endocrine disorders, particularly acromegaly.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has presented with joint pain and recurrent headaches for a month. There are concerns about excessive sweating and noticeable changes in facial appearance over the past few years, including a protruding jaw and prominent forehead. The patient reports that his wedding ring no longer fits despite no significant weight gain in the last decade.

Secondary_Symptoms: Facial changes (protruding jaw, prominent forehead and brow ridge)

Correct_Diagnosis: Elevated insulin-like growth factor (IGF1) and growth hormone (GH)

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the anti-arrhythmic drug used in the treatment of atrial fibrillation based on the patient's symptoms and ECG findings.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of atrial fibrillation and recently started treatment with an anti-arrhythmic drug. He reports feeling well and has no complaints during the follow-up visit.

Secondary_Symptoms: Slight prolongation of PR and QT intervals on ECG

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a patient presenting with hypercalcemia and related symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with constipation, weakness, dry cough, weight loss, recurrent kidney stones, and mood changes. He has a significant smoking history of 30 pack-years.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of severe fatigue and jaundice in a 7-year-old boy with a recent history of gastrointestinal illness.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department with a 2-day history of severe fatigue. He has no past medical history but caught an illness circulating in his school 1 week ago, which involved several days of abdominal pain and bloody diarrhea. Family history includes several members requiring blood transfusions, and he lives in an old house.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Conjunctival pallor and mild jaundice

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and provide appropriate vaccinations for a pregnant patient during her first prenatal visit.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: 20-year-old primigravid woman, emigrated from Mexico 2 years ago
Patient_Actor.History: The patient delayed her first prenatal visit due to a preference for a 'natural birth' but sought the visit after experiencing increased fatigue. Her menstrual history includes menarche at age 12 with regular 28-day cycles lasting 3-7 days. Immunization records are unavailable.

Pelvic_.Findings: Uterus consistent in size with a 28-week gestation

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose major depressive disorder and recommend appropriate treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with consistent sadness and has experienced feelings of worthlessness, anxiety, and anhedonia for the past couple of months. He denies any past episodes of feeling overly energetic with racing thoughts and denies suicidal ideation.

Correct_Diagnosis: Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor; anorgasmia, insomnia

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's erratic behavior and paranoid beliefs to determine any underlying psychiatric condition.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought in by mother for concerning erratic behavior. Recently started a new relationship and expresses paranoia about girlfriend cheating. Previous relationship ended due to similar beliefs. No prior psychiatric history.

Secondary_Symptoms: Feeling that everyone is against him

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the injuries sustained in a motor vehicle collision and identify the most likely injured structure.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department 20 minutes after being involved in a motor vehicle collision as a restrained passenger. The patient is confused.

Secondary_Symptoms: Hand-sized hematoma on the anterior chest wall

ECG.Findings: Sinus tachycardia

Chest_.Findings: Hand-sized hematoma on anterior chest wall

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of constipation and left lower abdominal discomfort in an elderly female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with complaints of constipation and left lower abdominal discomfort, which worsens after meals. She has a past medical history of gastroesophageal reflux disease and is currently taking omeprazole. There is a positive history of chronic constipation without episodes of bloody stools.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the expected histological changes in the myocardium following an acute myocardial infarction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a lengthy history of angina and was brought to the emergency department after the acute onset of severe chest pain that started 40 minutes ago. This episode of chest pain was unresponsive to nitroglycerin. His medical history includes hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and hyperlipidemia. Current medications include lisinopril, metformin, and simvastatin.

ECG.Findings: ST-segment elevation in leads avF and V1-V3

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the implications of combining data from multiple studies in rheumatology for enhanced analysis.

Patient_Actor.History: Principal investigators from two studies and a third researcher expressed interest in pooling data for analysis.

Correct_Diagnosis: The results are more precise in comparison to individual studies

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the risk of chromosomal abnormalities in a pregnant woman with a history of pregnancy losses and current findings of cystic hygroma and fetal hydrops.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a scheduled fetal anomaly scan at 18 weeks of gestation. She has a history of spontaneous abortions at 8, 10, and 12 weeks of gestation.

Ultrasonography.Findings: Female fetus with cystic hygroma measuring 4 cm x 5 cm and fetal hydrops.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the impact of a mutation in a plasma membrane ion channel on neuronal action potentials.

Patient_Actor.History: A mutation in a plasma membrane ion channel has been identified. The scientist investigates its effects on action potential dynamics in isolated neuronal membranes.

Secondary_Symptoms: Increased inactivation rate of the mutant ion channel

Channel_Testing.Findings: The mutant ion channel allows rapid sodium entry when additional potassium is placed inside the membrane and is more rapidly inactivated compared to wildtype.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine which structure of the respiratory tree contributes the most to total airway resistance based on pulmonary function testing.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for an annual health assessment. She does not smoke or drink alcohol.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate laboratory parameter to monitor for a patient on long-term anticoagulation after aortic valve replacement.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient underwent successful mechanical prosthetic aortic valve replacement for severe aortic valve stenosis. He was started on an oral anticoagulant post-procedure and advised to avoid large amounts of dark-green, leafy vegetables.

Laboratory_Monitoring.Prothrombin Time: Regular monitoring required for anticoagulation management

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of joint pain and morning stiffness in a patient presenting with potential autoimmune symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has experienced pain in both hands and wrists for several years, accompanied by morning stiffness lasting almost an hour.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pain in both hands and wrists
Secondary_Symptoms: Morning stiffness lasting for almost an hour
Tenderness and swelling in both hands and wrists, especially over the proximal interphalangeal joints

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of a painful penile erection and assess for potential complications related to sickle cell disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency room due to a severely painful penile erection that started spontaneously while in class and has persisted for the past 5 hours.

Secondary_Symptoms: Respiratory acidosis indicators (pCO2 65 mm Hg, pH 7.25)
Presence of Howell-Jolly bodies in peripheral blood smear

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of confusion and metabolic acidosis in a 72-year-old female found unresponsive.

Patient_Actor.History: Found unresponsive in her garage with an open bottle of unmarked fluid. Medical history significant for Alzheimer disease; family reports no other comorbidities.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of failure to thrive in a 2-year-old boy with a family history of congenital kidney disorders.

Patient_Actor.History: The child is brought to the primary care physician for persistent failure to thrive and has not met normal motor developmental milestones. There is a family history of congenital kidney disorders.

Objective_for_Doctor: Manage hypertension in a newly established patient with a history of obesity and family history of diabetes and stroke.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has no significant past medical history and has not seen a physician in over 10 years. He has been a smoker for 20 years, smoking approximately half a pack daily. His family history includes diabetes in his brother and father, with his father having experienced two strokes.

Secondary_Symptoms: Recent weight loss of 1.8 kg (4 lb)

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine which patient has the best prognosis following hematuria after an outbreak of Group A Streptococcus.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Various patients with differing ages and backgrounds
Patient_Actor.History: Multiple patients present with hematuria following an outbreak of Group A Streptococcus.

Biopsy.Findings: Large, hypercellular glomeruli with neutrophil infiltration

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the changes in the duodenum related to peptic ulcer disease in a patient with unresponsive symptoms to standard therapy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a longstanding history of gastroesophageal reflux and presents for follow-up evaluation of endoscopically confirmed gastric and duodenal ulcers. Her symptoms have been unresponsive to proton pump inhibitors and histamine receptor antagonists. Results for H. pylori infection are pending.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Persistent symptoms despite treatment for peptic ulcer disease
Secondary_Symptoms: Endoscopically confirmed gastric and duodenal ulcers

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the potential adverse effects of a new medication added to the patient's existing therapy for hyperlipidemia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has hyperlipidemia and is on home medications including acetaminophen and atorvastatin. He presents for a follow-up .

Secondary_Symptoms: Elevated total cholesterol and triglyceride concentrations

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of left leg weakness in a patient with a history of hypertension and coronary artery disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented to the emergency department with weakness of the left leg for the past hour and was unable to get out of bed that morning. He has a history of hypertension and coronary artery disease. Current medications include enalapril, carvedilol, aspirin, and simvastatin.

Secondary_Symptoms: Muscle strength 2/5 in left lower extremity
Decreased sensation in left lower extremity
Extensor plantar response on the left
Difficulty in counting backwards and naming words

Neurological_.Findings: Equal pupils reactive to light, decreased muscle strength in left lower extremity, extensor plantar response on the left, decreased sensation in left lower extremity, oriented to time, place, and person with flat affect.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of petechiae and bruising in a premature newborn, considering possible coagulation disorders.

Patient_Actor.History: The newborn presents with petechiae and persistent subcutaneous bruising. No additional complications were noted during delivery.

Secondary_Symptoms: Dullness to percussion over the bases of the thorax bilaterally
Evidence of pulmonary hemorrhage on chest radiograph

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the clinical significance of a rash presented by the patient and determine the underlying cause.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 'weird rash' that appeared over his torso last week. He reports no itching, pain, or recent exposure to irritants.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Light brown-colored flat plaques on the torso

Skin_.Findings: Multiple light brown-colored flat plaques on the torso

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and determine the initial treatment for a patient with recurrent nosebleeds, splenomegaly, and signs of potential hematologic malignancy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports recurrent nosebleeds with light trauma or randomly throughout the day. He has experienced weakness, fatigue, poor appetite, and a weight loss of 10 kg (22 lbs) over the past 6 months. He does not have night sweats.

Secondary_Symptoms: Splenomegaly (spleen palpated 10 cm below left costal margin)

Physical__Findings.Findings: Spleen palpated 10 cm below left costal margin; multiple bruises noted on upper extremities.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the cause of chronic cough and dyspnea in a patient with a significant smoking history.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 9-month history of cough and progressive dyspnea, with symptoms worsening in the mornings. He has a smoking history of two packs of cigarettes daily for 30 years.

Chest_X-ray.Findings: Widened intercostal spaces and generalized hyperlucency of the pulmonary parenchyma

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate diagnostic step for genital lesions in a sexually active male with a history of diabetes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 7-day history of genital itching and burning on micturition. He has a medical history of well-controlled type 2 diabetes mellitus managed with oral metformin.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tender, atrophic white papules on the glans and prepuce

Pelvic_.Findings: Tender, atrophic white papules on the glans and prepuce with erythema of the surrounding skin; narrowed and sclerotic urinary meatus.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of hallucinations and altered mental status in a patient with a history of alcohol use.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was found in a stuporous state with a small cut on his forehead. He has a 10-year history of regular alcohol consumption and drank a pint of vodka before admission. He occasionally smokes marijuana and uses cocaine.

Secondary_Symptoms: Fine digital tremor on right hand

Neurological_Exam.Findings: Alert and oriented, no abnormalities except fine digital tremor on right hand

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of infertility in a patient with a history of a previous sexually transmitted infection.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a primary concern of infertility, having been unable to conceive for the last 16 months despite consistent attempts. She has not used contraception during this time, and her husband's semen analysis is normal. She recalls testing positive for a sexually transmitted infection approximately four years ago.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the expected histologic findings in myocardial tissue following sudden cardiac death due to coronary artery disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient had a history of myocardial infarction and underwent coronary artery bypass grafting. He had a significant smoking history of 60 pack-years and was found deceased in his apartment after not responding to family calls for 2 days.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Deceased with a history of cardiovascular disease
Secondary_Symptoms: 100% blockage of left anterior descending artery

Heart.Blockage: 100% blockage of left anterior descending artery

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the likely normal physiological parameter in a patient with traumatic brain injury and respiratory failure on mechanical ventilation.

Patient_Actor.History: Suffered a traumatic brain injury while skiing in a remote area. Upon arrival at the ER, the patient was severely hypoxemic and unresponsive to oxygen therapy and was placed on a mechanical ventilator.

Secondary_Symptoms: Late inspiratory crackles noted upon auscultation after 2 days

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify potential causes of elevated transaminases in a seemingly healthy patient during a routine health maintenance visit.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of hypertension and asthma and presents for a health maintenance visit. She reports no current complaints and feels generally healthy.

Secondary_Symptoms: Elevated transaminases noted on routine blood work

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of failure to thrive and academic difficulties in a 13-year-old boy with a history of microcytic anemia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of microcytic anemia and takes a multivitamin every morning with breakfast. He is being evaluated for failure to thrive and poor academic performance.

Hemoglobin_Electrophoresis.Findings: No adult hemoglobin (HbA), elevated hemoglobin adult type 2 (HbA2), normal fetal hemoglobin (HbF)

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify neurological signs associated with squamous cell carcinoma in the upper lobe of the right lung.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been diagnosed with squamous cell carcinoma in the upper lobe of the right lung.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Neurological signs potentially related to lung cancer

Imaging.Chest Radiograph: Findings consistent with squamous cell carcinoma in the upper lobe of the right lung (Image A)

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the underlying cause of prolonged bleeding in a pediatric patient following dental surgery.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient experienced prolonged bleeding during the removal of a tooth that did not resolve with pressure and gauze packing and required suture placement. His older brother had a similar episode a year ago, but his parents and two sisters have not had bleeding issues.

Physical_.Findings: No abnormalities noted

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the vitamin deficiency in a patient with malabsorption presenting with oral and ocular symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a known history of malabsorption and reports gradual onset of symptoms over the past 4 months after moving away for college. She has not been able to maintain her normal diet or take her vitamins regularly.

General_Appearance.Findings: Malnourished appearance with significant pallor and bilateral conjunctival injection

Correct_Diagnosis: Measurement of erythrocyte glutathione reductase activity

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of oral thrush and subsequent symptoms following pharmacotherapy initiation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-day history of pain in his mouth and throat, and difficulty swallowing. He has a history of COPD and is on theophylline and inhaled budesonide-formoterol.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pain in mouth and throat with difficulty swallowing
Secondary_Symptoms: White patches on the tongue and buccal mucosa

Oral_.Findings: White patches on the tongue and buccal mucosa that can be scraped off easily

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's hypertension and recommend lifestyle modifications to improve blood pressure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is a high school teacher who has a history of elevated blood pressure measured three months ago. She mostly eats cafeteria food and take-out, denies regular physical activity, does not smoke or use recreational drugs, and consumes 2 to 3 glasses of wine per day. She has hypercholesterolemia and is taking atorvastatin.

Correct_Diagnosis: Losing 15 kg (33 lb) of body weight

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the cause of hyperthyroid symptoms and determine the appropriate treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-month history of tremor, diarrhea, and a weight loss of 5 kg (11 lbs).

Ocular_.Findings: Protrusion of the eyeball when looking forward

Serum_Studies.Autoantibodies: Autoantibodies to the thyroid-stimulating hormone receptor

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of jaundice and abdominal pain in a patient with a significant smoking history and diabetes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with jaundice and intermittent upper abdominal pain relieved by Tylenol. He reports weight loss over the past several months. His past medical history includes type 2 diabetes mellitus and a 40-pack-year smoking history.

Ultrasound.Findings: Hypoechoic mass in the epigastric region

Correct_Diagnosis: CA 19-9 is a marker for this condition.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of blurry vision and urinary symptoms in a patient with a history of diabetes and hypertension.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented to the emergency department with blurry vision for 10 hours, urinary urgency, and discomfort while urinating for the past 4 days. Her medical history includes type 2 diabetes mellitus and arterial hypertension, and she was treated for an eye infection one year ago. She consumes 2–3 glasses of wine weekly.

Ocular_.Findings: Decreased visual acuity in both eyes, pupils equal and reactive to light, brisk corneal reflexes

Abdominal_.Findings: Abdomen soft and not distended

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of progressive left thigh pain and assess for potential malignancy.

Local_.Findings: Swelling and tenderness over the inferior aspect of the left femoral diaphysis

Biopsy.Findings: Sheets of monotonous small round blue cells with minimal cytoplasm

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of knee pain and swelling in a pediatric patient following a fall.

Patient_Actor.History: The child presented to the pediatric emergency department after falling while riding his skateboard yesterday. He has a past medical history of seasonal allergies and asthma. Current medications include loratadine, albuterol, and fluticasone.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Young boy in pain, erythematous and tender left knee, normal cardiopulmonary exam

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate cognitive decline and mood changes in an elderly patient to determine the underlying cause.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with memory difficulty for the past couple of months, including forgetting simple tasks. She has not been ill recently and seeks consultation due to her daughter's concerns. Notable mood decrease for the past 2 months since her husband's death. She remains capable of preparing her own meals and maintains a varied diet.

General_.Findings: Elderly woman; weight unchanged; cardiac, pulmonary, and dermatologic exams within normal limits.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the psychological impact of acne and assess for body dysmorphic disorder in a teenager.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 6-month history of mild acne with papules on the back and shoulders. She has developed significant distress about her appearance, leading to avoidance of social situations and activities such as swimming. She attempted a low-carb diet resulting in weight loss but no improvement in skin condition.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Mild acne with widespread scratch marks

Skin_.Findings: A few small papules and numerous widespread scratch marks over the neck, back, and buttocks.

Mental_Status_.Findings: Depressed and irritable mood, no evidence of suicidal ideation.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of recurrent bacterial infections in a 6-month-old infant.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of recurrent bacterial infections and has been hospitalized multiple times due to these infections. Currently well.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying metabolic disorder causing seizures in a 2-year-old boy with developmental delay and hypotonia.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the mechanism of action of the anti-nausea medication prescribed to a patient with severe nausea after chemotherapy.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the appropriate beta blocker treatment for a patient with chest pain and COPD.

He has a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and is currently taking ipratropium bromide.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of proteinuria in a 17-year-old boy with a recent health maintenance  showing 3+ proteinuria.

He had an upper respiratory infection one month ago that resolved spontaneously. He is an intern at a shooting range and does not typically use hearing protection.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose a chronic respiratory illness with systemic symptoms in a farmer from Ohio.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a transient ischemic attack (TIA) in a patient with a history of vascular risk factors.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient experienced a transient episode of right arm and hand weakness lasting approximately one hour while gardening. Her past medical history includes hypertension, diabetes, anxiety, and dyslipidemia. Current medications include insulin, metformin, and fluoxetine.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Transient right arm and hand weakness

Ultrasound_Duplex.Findings: Right carotid stenosis of 35% and left carotid stenosis of 50%

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose and manage diabetic ketoacidosis in a pediatric patient presenting with disorientation and hyperglycemia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient became disoriented at home after vomiting several times over the past two days. His parents noted he appeared to be recovering but then showed signs of disorientation in the morning.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with an abdominal mass and mild weight gain.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine physical exam with no specific complaints but mentions mild weight gain. Medications include aspirin, lisinopril, rovastatin, metformin, and methotrexate. Up to date with vaccinations. Normal colonoscopy two years ago and routine mammography last year. Last menstrual period was 10 years ago. Family history includes a father who died of colon cancer at 71 years and a mother with breast cancer.

Secondary_Symptoms: Firm and non-mobile right adnexal mass

Abdominal_.Findings: Mildly distended abdomen and firm, non-mobile right adnexal mass

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with signs of cardiac tamponade secondary to pericardial disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 3-month history of increasing shortness of breath, abdominal fullness, and pedal edema. He was diagnosed with pulmonary tuberculosis 4 months ago and is currently receiving therapy with isoniazid, rifampin, pyrazinamide, and ethambutol.

Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased breath sounds at lung bases
Distended abdomen with positive shifting dullness

Cardiac_.Findings: Early diastolic sound over left sternal border

Abdominal_.Findings: Distended abdomen with positive shifting dullness

Respiratory_.Findings: Decreased breath sounds at lung bases bilaterally

ECG.Findings: Low-amplitude QRS complexes

Chest_XRay.Findings: Small pleural effusions bilaterally and calcifications over left cardiac silhouette

Cardiac_Catheterization.Findings: Elevated right ventricular diastolic pressure with characteristic dip-and-plateau waveform

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the vascular cause of sudden-onset right leg weakness and urinary incontinence in an elderly patient.

Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased sensation over the right thigh
Muscle strength 2/5 in the right lower extremity
Muscle strength 4/5 in the right upper extremity

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the mechanism that helps maintain core body temperature in a patient who experienced near drowning in cold water.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department after falling into a frozen lake during ice fishing. He was in the water for less than 1 minute before being rescued.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of progressive shortness of breath and pleuritic chest pain in a construction worker with a history of asbestos exposure.

CT_Scan.Findings: Pleural scarring

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of progressive weakness and difficulty with motor functions in a young adult.

Decreased reflexes in bilateral upper and lower extremities

Correct_Diagnosis: Normal cell count, high protein, normal glucose, normal opening pressure

Objective_for_Doctor: Explain the biochemical basis and pathogenesis of cystic fibrosis to the parents of a newborn diagnosed with the condition.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of the neonatal respiratory distress and cyanosis following preterm delivery.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a 4-year-old boy with findings suggestive of Marfan syndrome and assess potential cardiac involvement.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's risk for breast cancer and recommend appropriate screening methods in light of family history and genetic predisposition.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying pathophysiology related to recurrent wheezing and dyspnea in a pediatric patient.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of decreased triiodothyronine (T3) levels in a patient recovering from pneumonia.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the best preventive treatment for a high-risk infant with respiratory distress and infection.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of acute pain and swelling in the proximal joint of the third finger, likely related to crystal-induced arthritis.

Joint_.Findings: Tender, swollen, warm, and slightly red proximal interphalangeal joint of the third finger with extreme tenderness preventing range of motion assessment.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a child with growth failure, dysmorphic features, and cognitive impairment for associated genetic syndromes.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the infectious etiology of urinary symptoms in a young male patient.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of genital itching and associated symptoms in a pediatric patient.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of intermittent squeezing chest pain and tightness in a 32-year-old male.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of decreased sexual function in a 70-year-old male with a significant medical history.

Secondary_Symptoms: History of significant bleeding following trauma

Joint_.Findings: Hot, swollen, and painful knee

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cervical cytology and identify potential conditions based on the findings from the Pap smear.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient comes for an annual pelvic  and Pap smear. She has been sexually active with multiple male partners and takes oral contraceptives. She has a 10-year history of smoking one pack of cigarettes daily.

Pelvic_.Findings: No abnormalities

Pap_Smear.Findings: Photomicrograph of cervical cells indicating abnormal cells suggestive of viral infection

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the child's behavior and communication skills to determine the underlying cause of his symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The child has shown concerning behavior over the past year, including a failure to answer when called and unprovoked episodes of crying and screaming. He can follow group activities at kindergarten but does not follow direct instructions from the teacher. He is cheerful, maintains eye contact when spoken to, and gets along well with friends and family.

Secondary_Symptoms: Regular unprovoked episodes of crying and screaming

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of irregular and heavy menstrual periods, fatigue, joint pain, and potential thyroid dysfunction in a young woman.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for evaluation of irregular and heavy periods, along with recent complaints of fatigue, joint pain, and constipation. Notable physical exam findings include thinning eyebrows and recent weight gain.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate treatment for a child with an itchy scalp rash and hair loss, possibly due to tinea capitis.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought in by mother due to an itchy rash on the right side of the scalp and progressive hair loss for 1 month. No history of serious illness. Younger sibling treated for pediculosis capitis 3 months ago. The boy has not attended school for the last week due to embarrassment from the rash.

Scalp_.Findings: Itchy rash on the right side of the scalp, progressive hair loss, and occipital lymphadenopathy

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose a potential case of gender dysphoria in a young adolescent.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the physician by his mother due to concerns about his behavior, including wearing dresses and requesting to be called Lilly. He has not made friends since starting puberty and has been bullied at school. Academic performance has declined over the past year. The mother reports a preference for female friends and toys as a child. The patient was raised by his single mother since age 8 after his father left due to financial issues.

Genitalia.Secondary_Sex_Characteristics: Scarce coarse, dark axillary and pubic hair

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the characteristics of the organism associated with the infection following oyster shucking.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with 2 days of fever and malaise. She has a painful red lesion on her left hand that developed after shucking oysters at a family reunion.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Painful red lesion on left hand
Secondary_Symptoms: Swelling and warmth of the lesion

Lesion_.Findings: Well-demarcated swollen, tender, warm, red lesion on left hand with purulent drainage

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify and manage anaphylaxis following medication administration in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency room after a fall from a horse with a history of asthma and atopic dermatitis. Current medications include an albuterol inhaler and hydrocortisone cream.

Physical__Findings.Findings: Audible wheezing, generalized urticaria, lip swelling, scattered wheezing throughout both lung fields, no conjunctival edema.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of vomiting and hematemesis in a young male patient after suspected ingestion of a harmful substance.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents after numerous episodes of vomiting for the past 48 hours, stating he thinks he 'ate something weird'. He came to the hospital due to vomiting blood.

Abdominal_.Findings: Mild epigastric tenderness

Endoscopy.Findings: Tear involving the mucosa and submucosa of the gastroesophageal junction

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of edema and shortness of breath in a pregnant patient at 32 weeks' gestation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is at 32 weeks' gestation and has experienced swollen legs, mild shortness of breath, and generalized fatigue for the past 2 weeks. Current medications include iron supplements and a multivitamin.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Swollen legs and mild shortness of breath
Secondary_Symptoms: 2+ pitting edema of the lower extremities

Cardiac_.Findings: S3 gallop

Pelvic_.Findings: Uterus consistent in size with 32 weeks' gestation

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of fever and chills following a blood transfusion in a patient with placenta previa.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented to an obstetric clinic with painless vaginal bleeding and was diagnosed with placenta praevia. She received a transfusion of 2 units of whole blood and developed fever and chills 5 hours later.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Fever and chills after blood transfusion

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of a progressive rash and respiratory symptoms in a previously healthy child.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 3-day history of a progressive rash that started on his face and now involves the entire body. He has had a cough and a runny nose for the past week. The patient is visiting from the Philippines with his family, and immunization records are not available.

Skin_.Findings: Erythematous maculopapular, blanching, and partially confluent exanthem on the entire body

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the bacterial species responsible for acquired pathogenicity through the incorporation of viral genetic information.

Patient_Actor.History: Investigator studying bacterial toxins in a nonpathogenic bacterial monoculture inoculated with specific bacteriophages cultured in a toxin-producing bacterial culture.

Secondary_Symptoms: Isolation of a new toxin from the culture
Incorporation of viral genetic information into bacterial genome

Genetic_Analysis.Findings: Bacteria incorporated gene for toxin from viral genetic information

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify and manage the cause of significant hemorrhage following a traumatic injury.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department after a motor vehicle crash. He has a laceration on the femoral artery due to shrapnel and has lost a large quantity of blood, requiring stabilization via endotracheal intubation.

Secondary_Symptoms: Signs of shock due to blood loss

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate pharmacotherapy for a patient with urinary incontinence.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports urinary leakage over the last year, characterized by involuntary loss of small amounts of urine following a sudden urge to void. She experiences difficulty reaching the bathroom in time and has begun to wake up at night to urinate. Symptoms have persisted despite 6 months of bladder training, weight loss, and reducing soda and coffee intake.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Urinary leakage after sudden urge to void
Secondary_Symptoms: Difficulty reaching the bathroom in time
Nocturia (waking up to urinate at night)

Physical_Exam.Findings: No abnormalities noted

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of respiratory symptoms and systemic illness in a patient with a recent history of fever and cough.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a fever, nausea, and nonproductive cough for 7 days, accompanied by headaches, generalized fatigue, muscle, and joint pain, and increasing shortness of breath for 2 days. She has a medical history of type 2 diabetes mellitus and osteoarthritis of the left knee. Current medications include insulin and ibuprofen. She smoked two packs of cigarettes daily for 20 years but quit 10 years ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: Multiple skin lesions with a blue livid center, pale intermediate zone, and a dark red peripheral rim

Lung_.Findings: Lungs clear to auscultation

Skin_.Findings: Multiple skin lesions with a blue livid center, pale intermediate zone, and dark red peripheral rim on upper and lower extremities

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fever and joint pain following a rattlesnake bite and administration of antivenom.

Patient_Actor.History: The child was bitten by a rattlesnake while playing in the backyard. He presented with a bleeding bite mark and significant swelling on the dorsal aspect of the right hand, was treated with fluid resuscitation and rattlesnake antivenom, and was discharged feeling better.

Physical_.Findings: Bleeding bite mark with significant swelling over the dorsal aspect of the right hand

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cause of syncope and potential injuries following a fall in an elderly patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to urgent care after a fall. The patient experienced lightheadedness and 'blacked out' while getting up to go to the bathroom. Previous similar episodes without falls or fainting. Medical history includes rheumatoid arthritis and osteoporosis. Medications include methotrexate and alendronate. Smokes 1/2 a pack of cigarettes per day.

Secondary_Symptoms: Ecchymosis on right upper extremity (3 cm, tender to palpation)

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the characteristic findings of kidney disease associated with mild high frequency hearing impairment in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was found to have mild high frequency hearing impairment during a routine auditory screening. He reports no ear pain, no recent illnesses, and has no focal neurological deficits or cardiac murmurs.

Secondary_Symptoms: 6 RBCs per high-power field in urinalysis

General_.Findings: No ear pain, no focal neurological deficits, no cardiac murmurs

Correct_Diagnosis: Basket-weave, pattern of basement membrane on electron microscopy

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying tumor associated with neurological symptoms in a patient with anti-Yo antibodies.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 1-week history of dizziness, nausea, vomiting, and repeated falls. Neurological  reveals past-pointing on a finger-nose test and a broad-based gait. Ophthalmologic  shows rhythmic leftward movement of the globes.

Secondary_Symptoms: Rhythmic leftward movement of the globes

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the potential life-threatening complications of amphetamine toxicity in an agitated patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department by police after a physical altercation. He appears disheveled and is very agitated.

Secondary_Symptoms: Healing and new ulcers in the mouth and on lips

Head_Eyes_Ears_Nose_Throat_Exam.Findings: Temporal wasting, marked tooth decay, healing and new ulcers in the mouth and on lips, dilated pupils

Skin_.Findings: Dramatic diaphoresis and excoriations over arms

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of respiratory distress and hypotension following a high-impact fall.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient was brought to the emergency department 15 minutes after falling 7 feet onto a flat-top wooden post.

Secondary_Symptoms: Absent breath sounds over the left lung
Dullness to percussion over the left chest

Chest_.Findings: Impact wound in the left fourth intercostal space at the midaxillary line, absent breath sounds over the left lung, dullness to percussion over the left chest, flat neck veins.

Cardiac_.Findings: No abnormalities

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the causative pathogen of septic arthritis in a patient with a history of knee arthroplasty.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening pain and swelling in her right knee for 3 days following a total knee arthroplasty 5 months ago. She has a medical history of hypertension and osteoarthritis. Current medications include glucosamine, amlodipine, and meloxicam.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Worsening pain and swelling in the right knee
Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness and swelling of the right knee joint
Limited range of motion due to pain

Knee_.Findings: Tender, swollen right knee joint with limited range of motion due to pain

Microbiological_Test.Findings: Synovial fluid sent for culture and antibiotic sensitivity

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of acute abdominal pain and gastrointestinal symptoms in a patient with a history of alcoholism.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with several hours of worsening abdominal discomfort radiating to the back. She has a social history notable for alcoholism.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the male partner's fertility issues and determine the appropriate management for low sperm count.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient and his wife have been trying to conceive for several years without success. They have had unprotected intercourse several times a week. He has no history of serious illness and does not take any medications. No concerns regarding libido or erections. His female partner is not on contraceptive medication and has a child from a previous marriage.

Secondary_Symptoms: Palpable varicocele on the left side
Poor motility and increased percentage of abnormal sperm

Scrotal_.Findings: Normal right side; left side shows many deep and superficial ducts or vessels that feel like a bag of worms on palpation, more apparent when bearing down.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate next step after a medication error in treating pneumonia in a patient with a penicillin allergy.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted to the hospital with productive cough and fever; diagnosed with pneumonia. History includes penicillin allergy.

Correct_Diagnosis: Switch the patient back to levofloxacin and discuss the error with the patient

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate antihypertensive medication for a patient with hypertension and asthma, considering elevated creatinine and potassium levels.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a diagnosis of hypertension and a history of asthma. Recent laboratory tests indicate slightly elevated creatinine and potassium levels.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the predisposing factor for the patient's diabetes mellitus based on presented symptoms and risk factors.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of hypertension and presents with frequent urination and increased thirst. He consumes 4 oz of alcohol daily and has a 30-year smoking history (1 pack of cigarettes daily). His height is 180 cm (5 ft 10 in) and weight is 106 kg (233 lb), resulting in a BMI of 33 kg/m2.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's smoking cessation progress and overall health maintenance following a history of myocardial infarction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a past medical history of well-controlled type 2 diabetes mellitus and was admitted for a myocardial infarction one year ago. He has a 40-pack-year smoking history but has stopped smoking for the last six months after being informed of the risks associated with smoking.

Secondary_Symptoms: Efforts to manage stress through wellness sessions and meditation

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying gastrointestinal pathology in a patient presenting with abdominal pain, weight loss, and skin lesions.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 1-year history of severe abdominal pain, bloating, and episodic diarrhea, with a significant weight loss of 10 kg (22 lbs) over the past 10 months.

Secondary_Symptoms: Multiple erythematous, tender nodules on the anterior aspect of both legs
Small draining lesion in the perianal region

Abdominal_.Findings: Mildly distended abdomen and diffuse abdominal tenderness

Dermatological_.Findings: Multiple erythematous, tender nodules on the anterior aspect of both legs

Perianal_.Findings: Small draining lesion in the perianal region

Objective_for_Doctor: Monitor ECG features during treatment of atrioventricular nodal reentrant tachycardia managed with synchronized cardioversion and verapamil.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with palpitations and anxiety. A recent outpatient ECG suggested supraventricular tachycardia, but no underlying disease was identified by her previous physician. She has no significant past medical history.

Secondary_Symptoms: No significant findings in past medical history

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cardiovascular implications of a patient with a family history of ischemic heart disease and physical findings suggestive of Marfan syndrome.

Patient_Actor.History: No personal medical history, strong family history of ischemic heart disease on father's side. Occasional alcohol use, no illicit drug use or smoking.

Cardiovascular_.Findings: Mid-systolic click over the apex

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of new neurological symptoms following left hip arthroplasty.

Patient_Actor.History: Three hours after left hip arthroplasty for chronic hip pain, the patient reports a new prickling sensation in the left anteromedial thigh and lower leg. He has a history of hyperlipidemia and coronary artery disease, with recent right-sided gluteal and thigh pain during ambulation.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Prickling sensation in left anteromedial thigh and lower leg
Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased sensation to pinprick and light touch on the left anteromedial thigh and medial lower leg
Left leg strength 3/5 on hip flexion
Left leg strength 2/5 on knee extension
Decreased patellar reflex on the left

Neurologic_.Findings: Decreased sensation and strength in the left leg, decreased patellar reflex

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying autoimmune condition causing oral lesions and skin bullae.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with oral lesions and skin  reveals flaccid bullae on the back that spread with lateral pressure.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the diagnosis of a vaginal chancre in a pregnant patient at 36 weeks gestation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for her routine 36-week OB/GYN visit with complaints of increased fatigue and ankle edema. Physical  is unremarkable except for inguinal adenopathy.

Secondary_Symptoms: Increased fatigue at the end of the day

Pelvic_.Findings: Vaginal chancre noted, which is not painful when touched.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of fever, headaches, and confusion in a patient with a history of heart transplantation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department with fever, headaches, and confusion for the past 24 hours. He has a history of heart transplantation three years ago due to congestive heart failure.

Neurological_.Findings: Oriented only to person, nuchal rigidity

Cerebrospinal_Fluid_Culture.Findings: Colonies of a gram-positive bacillus surrounded by a narrow transparent rim

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cause of hirsutism and clitoromegaly in a pregnant woman at 28 weeks' gestation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is at 28 weeks' gestation and has developed a hoarse voice and facial hair over the past 2 months. She takes iron and a multivitamin. The last fetal ultrasound at 21 weeks was unremarkable.

Pelvic_.Findings: Clitoromegaly and bilateral adnexal masses

Ultrasonography.Findings: Single live intrauterine pregnancy consistent with 28-week gestation and bilateral 6-cm solid, multinodular ovarian masses

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of a painless neck lump in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has no history of serious illness and presents with a painless lump on her neck.

Secondary_Symptoms: Firm, 2-cm swelling at the midline below the hyoid bone
Mass moves cranially when tongue is protruded

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the effects of follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) on ovarian follicle cells and identify the enzyme stimulated by FSH.

Patient_Actor.History: A researcher is studying the effects of hormones on different cells within the ovarian follicle by adding FSH to a culture of ovarian follicle cells.

Secondary_Symptoms: Measurement of enzyme activity levels in ovarian follicle cells

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the metabolic processes involved in gluconeogenesis, particularly identifying which irreversible steps occur in the mitochondria.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was asked to fast overnight for an endoscopy scheduled at 12 p.m. His last meal was dinner at 5 p.m. the previous day.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of infertility and amenorrhea in a female patient with galactorrhea.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with an inability to conceive and has been amenorrheic for several months. She reports frequent white nipple discharge and has negative urine tests for beta-HCG.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's beliefs and behavior to diagnose potential delusional disorder.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought by her mother to a psychiatrist due to concerns about her behavior. The patient believes a famous Hollywood celebrity loves her and will marry her after attending a function where he was present.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Belief that a celebrity loves her and will marry her

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of shortness of breath and fatigue in a patient with a history of hypertension and cardiovascular risk factors.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with shortness of breath and fatigue over the last few weeks. Her medical history includes hypertension diagnosed 20 years ago, for which she takes hydrochlorothiazide and losartan. Family history includes maternal stroke at age 54 and grandparents with cardiovascular disease. She has a 13 pack-year smoking history and drinks alcohol occasionally.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pitting edema in both lower extremities
Fundoscopic findings of 'copper wiring' and 'cotton wool spots'

Echocardiographic_Findings.Ejection_Fraction: 40% with increased left ventricular wall thickness

Correct_Diagnosis: Ejection fraction: 40% with increased left ventricular wall thickness

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of paroxysmal tachycardia and its resolution through neck maneuvers.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has experienced multiple episodes of heart palpitations over the past few months. Tight clothing sometimes helps stop these episodes. Upon presentation to the emergency department, she reports her heart pounding and feels nauseous.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the underlying condition associated with telangiectasias, bluish discoloration of fingertips, and chest pain in a patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with complaints of telangiectasias on both upper and lower extremities, bluish discoloration of the fingertips when exposed to cold, and burning midsternal chest pain. She is a tobacco smoker and works as a school teacher.

Secondary_Symptoms: Telangiectasias on upper and lower extremities
Bluish discoloration of fingertips when exposed to cold

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the management for a patient with syncope due to hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient experienced a sudden loss of consciousness while playing basketball. He has no past medical history, does not smoke or drink alcohol, and has a family history of sudden death in a cousin.

Secondary_Symptoms: Systolic ejection murmur audible on left lower sternal border

Cardiovascular_.Findings: Systolic ejection murmur on left lower sternal border

ECG.Findings: Left ventricular hypertrophy

Echocardiography.Findings: Asymmetric septal hypertrophy

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient with autoimmune condition for potential associated malignancies and assess treatment effectiveness.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was previously evaluated for fatigue, muscle weakness, and a scaly rash on both hands. She has recently started high dose corticosteroids for a newly diagnosed autoimmune condition and has not seen improvement in her symptoms.

Secondary_Symptoms: Muscle strength rated 2 out of 5 in upper extremities

Muscle_Strength.Findings: Muscle strength rated 2 out of 5 in upper extremities

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of increased fatigue and respiratory distress in a 2-year-old boy.

Patient_Actor.History: Parents report that the child has been getting tired easily, often panting for breath after walking short distances, and needing frequent naps. There is no recall of recent infections, and the child was born at home without prenatal care.

Cardiovascular_.Findings: Holosystolic murmur best heard at the lower left sternal border

Correct_Diagnosis: LV: normal, RV: increased, SC: normal

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of microcytic anemia in a young female patient with a point mutation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient comes for an annual health maintenance  with no particular health concerns.

Genetic_Analysis.Findings: Point mutation in intron 1 of a gene on the short arm of chromosome 11

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cognitive and motor symptoms of an elderly male with a history of transient ischemic attacks and assess for possible neurodegenerative conditions.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has exhibited increased confusion and irritability over the past three months, with a history of falling and dysmetria. Past medical history includes transient ischemic attacks, hypertension, and hyperlipidemia. Current medications include aspirin, enalapril, hydrochlorothiazide, and rosuvastatin. He has a significant smoking history of 30 pack-years and a family history of Alzheimer's disease.

Secondary_Symptoms: Twitching of the arm when startled

Neurological_.Findings: Dysmetria and ataxic gait

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of right lower quadrant pain in a 14-year-old girl and identify the significance of elevated cells in the presurgical blood count.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with sudden, severe, colicky pain in the right lower quadrant of her abdomen, associated with nausea and vomiting.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Severe pain in the right lower quadrant
Secondary_Symptoms: Severe tenderness to palpation with rebound in the right iliac region

Abdominal_.Findings: Severe tenderness to palpation with rebound in the right iliac region

Blood_Tests.Cell_Count: Increase in the number of cells having a multilobed nucleus and multiple cytoplasmic granules

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of intravenous site infection in a patient with jaundice and recent biliary surgical intervention.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with jaundice and extreme fatigue for the past 4 days, with significant weight loss of 23 kg (50 lb) over the last 3 months attributed to decreased appetite. He has a recent diagnosis of a mass in the pancreatic head and is being treated with total parenteral nutrition (TPN) after surgical decompression of the biliary tract.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Erythematous and edematous intravenous access site

CT_Scan.Findings: Mass in the pancreatic head

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of headache, cough, runny nose, and fever in a child with recent history of a urinary tract infection.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the physician with headache, cough, runny nose, and low-grade fever since waking up that morning. He has been healthy except for a urinary tract infection one week ago that resolved with trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole therapy. Both parents have a history of allergic rhinitis.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness over frontal and maxillary sinuses

Physical_Exam.Findings: Rhinorrhea and tenderness over the frontal and maxillary sinuses; cervical lymphadenopathy

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of prolonged fever and respiratory symptoms in a teenager, considering the possibility of infectious mononucleosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been experiencing fever, nonproductive cough, fatigue, lack of appetite, and sore throat for the past 2 months. Several other students at his high school have had similar symptoms.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the compound that results in the least insulin secretion from isolated pancreatic islets in a high glucose environment.

Patient_Actor.History: Pancreatic islets were isolated for an experiment to study insulin secretion inhibition.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of diffuse weakness in a patient with an anterior mediastinal mass.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with diffuse weakness for the past several months. He has a history of gastroesophageal reflux disease and is currently taking rabeprazole. He is 178 cm tall and weighs 77 kg, with a BMI of 24.3 kg/m2.

Secondary_Symptoms: Soft and nontender abdomen with no splenomegaly

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying cause of progressive heart failure symptoms in an elderly female patient with a history of cardiac illness.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with progressive shortness of breath, lower extremity swelling, and early satiety that started 4 months ago. She has a 25-year history of type 2 diabetes mellitus and 15 years of hypertension, managed with metformin and captopril. She had an anterolateral ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction 6 years ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pitting edema in both lower extremities

Cardiovascular_.Findings: Laterally displaced apical impulse with a loud 4/6 holosystolic murmur at the apex, increasing in intensity with breath-holding.

Abdominal_.Findings: Shifting dullness on percussion noted.

Edema.Findings: 2-3+ pitting edema in both lower extremities.

Echocardiography.Findings: Left ventricular ejection fraction of 40% and moderate mitral and tricuspid regurgitation.

Correct_Diagnosis: Right-ventricular dilatation with subsequent functional tricuspid valve dysfunction

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cause of altered mental status and metabolic derangement in a patient with type 1 diabetes mellitus.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has type 1 diabetes mellitus and was brought to the emergency department by her husband due to polyuria, nausea, vomiting, and altered mental status for 4 hours. She is unconscious upon arrival.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the results of screening tests and determine the next steps for a pregnant patient with a history of spontaneous abortion.

Patient_Actor.History: Currently at 15 weeks gestation with no complaints. Previous pregnancy ended in spontaneous abortion during the first trimester. Immunizations are up to date.

Physical_.Findings: Within normal limits

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the causal pathogen of respiratory illness and skin lesions in a farmer from southern Arizona.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 4-day history of productive cough, shortness of breath, and low-grade fever. He works as a farmer in southern Arizona.

Secondary_Symptoms: Multiple skin lesions with a dark blue center, pale intermediate zone, and red peripheral rim

Chest_.Findings: Diffuse crackles on the left side of the chest

Chest_X-Ray.Findings: Left basilar consolidation and left hilar lymphadenopathy

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and treat a patient with a recent animal bite and localized infection.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with swelling of the right index finger a few hours after noticing it. She has no past medical history and takes no prescription medications, occasionally takes ibuprofen, and smokes a few cigarettes daily for the last year. She has a dog and a cat at home.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Swelling of the right index finger
Secondary_Symptoms: Localized erythema and induration at the puncture wounds

Physical_.Findings: 2 clean puncture wounds with localized erythema and induration on the dorsum of the right second digit; capillary refill is 2 seconds; sensory and motor function intact bilaterally.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of tingling, difficulty breathing, and chest tightness following total thyroidectomy.
