Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a prenatal visit with a positive pregnancy test 1 week ago, estimated gestational age of 16 weeks, and a medical history of type 1 diabetes mellitus requiring insulin for glucose control.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cardiovascular health of a 16-year-old boy and assess the significance of the detected murmur.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine health maintenance  with no history of serious illness and feels well. He is at the 60th percentile for height and weight.

Secondary_Symptoms: Grade 3/6 ejection systolic murmur along the lower left sternal border
Murmur decreases in intensity on rapid squatting
Murmur increases in intensity with Valsalva maneuver

Cardiac_.Findings: Grade 3/6 ejection systolic murmur heard along the lower left sternal border

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the causal pathogen of scrotal pain and urinary symptoms in a sexually active male patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with throbbing right scrotal pain for 1 day and a burning sensation on urination for the last 4 days. He is sexually active with multiple female partners and does not use condoms.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tender, palpable swelling on the upper pole of the right testicle

Testicular_.Findings: Tender, palpable swelling on the upper pole of the right testicle; lifting the testicle relieves the pain

Urethral_Secretions.Gram_Stain: Numerous polymorphonuclear leukocytes but no organisms

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient's urinary symptoms and identify an appropriate treatment option considering his medical history.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with changes in urination over the last few months, including increased urinary frequency and difficulty with initiating and stopping urination. He denies having pain with urination. His medical history includes intolerance to an alpha blocker due to episodes of syncope.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Increased urinary frequency and difficulty with urination

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of irregular menstrual cycles and excessive hair growth in a young female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with irregular menstrual cycles that have been light with irregular breakthrough bleeding for the past three months. She reports hair loss and increased growth of facial and body hair. She had menarche at 11.

Secondary_Symptoms: Excessive hair growth on face, back, linea alba region, and hips
Gray-brown skin discoloration on posterior neck

Physical_.Findings: Excessive hair growth and gray-brown skin discoloration on posterior neck

Ultrasound.Findings: Multiple peripheral cysts in both ovaries

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of severe facial pain and headache in a young male patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a severe headache and reports sudden, severe pain over his face triggered by touch (e.g., shaving or applying lotion). He describes the pain as electric and states it is exacerbated by touch. He is currently pain-free.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pain elicited with light palpation of the face

Neurological_.Findings: Normal except for severe pain with facial palpation

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the extent of injury and potential vascular compromise following a fall resulting in elbow trauma.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department after falling onto her outstretched right arm, leading to swelling and pain in the right elbow. She has been unable to move her right elbow since the incident.

Secondary_Symptoms: Bruising and tenderness of the right elbow
Limited range of motion due to pain

Physical_.Findings: Swelling, bruising, and tenderness of the right elbow; range of motion limited by pain.

Imaging.X-ray Findings: Supracondylar fracture of the humerus with anterior displacement of the proximal fragment

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine appropriate health maintenance recommendations for a patient with chronic lymphocytic leukemia and other comorbidities.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is a retired teacher living in a retirement community. He has a history of hypercholesterolemia, hypertension, osteoarthritis of the left knee, and chronic lymphocytic leukemia diagnosed last year. A colonoscopy 8 years ago was normal, and a digital  along with a prostate specific antigen level was normal 8 months ago. He has never smoked or consumed alcohol.

Secondary_Symptoms: Grade 2/6 systolic ejection murmur along the upper right sternal border

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying causes of erectile dysfunction and lower limb symptoms in a patient with significant cardiovascular risk factors.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with increasing difficulty achieving an erection for the past 6 months, accompanied by lower back and thigh pain, and progressive lower limb weakness during longer walks. He reports pain that resolves with rest and improves when standing still. He has a history of multiple female partners and irregular condom use. His father's medical history includes coronary artery disease, and his mother died of a ruptured intracranial aneurysm at 53 years old. He has a 35-year history of smoking one pack of cigarettes daily. He has tried sildenafil without improvement. His only other medication is ibuprofen for back pain.

Secondary_Symptoms: Progressive lower limb weakness with exertion

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the first cardiac finding in patients with gene product mutations affecting hormone levels and leading to cardiovascular disease symptoms.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Individuals with mutations in a specific gene product
Patient_Actor.History: Patients present with symptoms associated with hormone dysregulation, including darkening of the skin, cold intolerance, excessive urination, and weight loss. They may also exhibit signs of cardiovascular disease.

Correct_Diagnosis: Preload: decreased, cardiac contractility: unchanged, afterload: increased

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of bleeding gums and fatigue in a homeless patient with poor dental hygiene.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with several weeks of painless bleeding gums and has not received dental or medical care for several years. He typically sleeps on the street or stays at a shelter, consuming 1-2 fast food meals per day.

Oral_.Findings: Poor dentition and significant periodontal disease with notable areas of bleeding gingiva

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of left groin and buttock pain in a pediatric patient with a history of recurrent pain episodes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 4-week history of left groin and buttock pain, worsened by activity and present at rest. He has a history of multiple episodes of abdominal, back, and chest pain that required hospitalization. His growth is below average, at the 20th percentile for height and 25th percentile for weight.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pain with passive abduction and internal rotation of the left hip
No swelling, warmth, or erythema noted

Hip_.Findings: Tenderness over the lateral aspect of the left hip

Objective_for_Doctor: Establish the diagnosis of chronic venous insufficiency in a patient with a history of deep vein thrombosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 6-month history of dull, persistent pain and swelling in the right leg, exacerbated at the end of the day and relieved by walking or elevating her feet. She has a history of acute deep vein thrombosis in the right calf two years ago, treated with anticoagulants for 6 months.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Dull, persistent pain and swelling of the right leg
Secondary_Symptoms: 2+ pitting edema of the right leg
Reddish-brown discoloration around the right ankle
Dilated varicose veins in the right leg

Physical_.Findings: 2+ pitting edema of the right leg; reddish-brown discoloration and telangiectasias around the right ankle; dilated varicose veins in the right leg.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying cause of tremors and anxiety symptoms in a professional violinist.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with an 8-month history of occasional tremor, sudden restlessness, and nausea that disrupt her work as a violinist. Symptoms worsen before concerts and appear during city walks. She has difficulty sleeping due to worry about potential burglaries. Drinks one glass of wine before performances and 2-3 glasses per week. Takes daily multivitamins.

Secondary_Symptoms: Difficulty falling asleep due to anxiety

Neurological_.Findings: Fine tremor in both hands, muscle tension, full range of affect with no other abnormalities noted.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of apnea episodes in a patient with a history of sleep apnea and acute respiratory distress.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a past medical history of sleep apnea and presented to the emergency room in severe respiratory distress, leading to intubation and eventual tracheostomy.

Secondary_Symptoms: Apnea episodes while sleeping after surgery
Low oxygen saturation (SpO2 73% on room air)

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of syncope in a patient with a history of palpitations and lightheadedness.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department after being found unconscious. Prior to losing consciousness, he experienced palpitations, lightheadedness, and shortness of breath. He takes captopril for hypertension and glyburide for type 2 diabetes mellitus.

Physical_.Findings: No abnormalities noted

ECG.Findings: Short PR interval and wide QRS complex with initial slurring

Echocardiography.Findings: Normal echocardiographic findings with normal left ventricular systolic function

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of acute liver failure in a pregnant patient with a recent travel history.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department for lethargy, nausea, and vomiting for 4 days after returning from South Asia 2 weeks ago. Immunizations are up-to-date and has never received blood products.

Secondary_Symptoms: Disorientation to person, place, and time

Physical__Findings.Findings: Jaundice and mild asterixis

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and identify the cause of persistent bleeding following dental extraction in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient underwent a tooth extraction yesterday which was complicated by persistent bleeding. No previous bleeding issues reported.

Secondary_Symptoms: Slowly oozing blood from the extraction site

Oral_.Findings: Wound consistent with extraction of the second upper right molar, slowly oozing blood with no stable clot

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying cause of gastrointestinal symptoms and oral ulcers following recent travel.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 4-week history of fatigue, crampy abdominal pain, watery diarrhea, and oral pain. He returned from a 2-week trip to the Dominican Republic 2 months ago and has a significant smoking history of one pack of cigarettes daily for 45 years.

Secondary_Symptoms: Three painful ulcers in the mouth
Mild tenderness in the right lower quadrant

Oral_.Findings: Three 1.5-cm painful ulcers in the mouth

Abdominal_.Findings: Mild tenderness to palpation in the right lower quadrant without guarding or rebound

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the appropriateness of antibiotic therapy for a pregnant patient with complicated appendicitis.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: 35-year-old pregnant female (G1P0) in her first trimester
Patient_Actor.History: Admitted for complicated appendicitis and awaiting appendectomy. The attending surgeon suggests starting moxifloxacin IV preoperatively.

Correct_Diagnosis: Wait to administer any antibiotics until you discuss your safety concerns with your attending.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of bilious vomiting in a newborn after delivery.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Male newborn, 3100 g (6-lb 13-oz), born at term
Patient_Actor.History: The newborn is 6 hours old. The pregnancy was complicated by polyhydramnios, and the mother smoked a pack of cigarettes daily during the pregnancy.

Secondary_Symptoms: Localized gas collections in the upper abdomen

Imaging.X-ray Findings: 3 distinct, localized gas collections in the upper abdomen and a gasless distal abdomen

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of joint pain and stiffness in a patient with a potential autoimmune condition.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with fatigue, symmetric pain, swelling, and stiffness in her wrists, fingers, knees, and other joints. The stiffness is particularly severe upon awakening but improves with movement throughout the day. Initial treatment with NSAIDs provided minimal symptomatic improvement.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the risk of pulmonary distress in a preterm infant of a diabetic mother and interpret amniotic fluid test results.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is at risk of delivering prematurely at 29 weeks due to her diabetes.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Risk of significant pulmonary distress in the infant
Secondary_Symptoms: Testing of amniotic fluid for lung maturity indicators

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the etiology of acute behavioral changes and confusion in a patient with a history of Alzheimer's dementia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of Alzheimer's dementia and presents with increased confusion and fever. He is unable to answer questions due to confusion and has shown aggressive behavior after learning he needs to be admitted.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Change in behavior and increased confusion

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the cause of weight loss, fatigue, night sweats, and lymphadenopathy in an elderly female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-week history of fatigue, worsening back and abdominal pain, excessive night sweats, and a 4.6-kg (10-lb) weight loss. She reports swelling of the neck for the past 3 days and has no history of smoking or alcohol use.

Lymphadenopathy.Findings: 4-cm, supraclavicular, nontender, enlarged and fixed lymph node
Lymphadenopathy.Spleen: Palpated 2 cm below the left costal margin

CT_Scan.Findings: Massively enlarged paraaortic, axillary, mediastinal, and cervical lymph nodes

Histopathology.Findings: Lymphocytes with a high proliferative index that stain positive for CD20

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the immune-mediated process responsible for chronic pain and morning stiffness in the patient's hands and wrists.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has presented with pain in both hands and wrists for several years, associated with morning stiffness lasting almost an hour.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pain in both hands and wrists
Secondary_Symptoms: Morning stiffness lasting almost an hour
Tenderness and swelling in both hands and wrists

Physical_.Findings: Tenderness and swelling in both hands and wrists

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of acute respiratory distress and hemodynamic instability following blood transfusion in a patient with severe menorrhagia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with severe menorrhagia for 3 days and reports dizziness. She has a history of hypertension controlled with lisinopril.

Secondary_Symptoms: Hypotension (blood pressure 100/60 mmHg initially, 170/90 mmHg later)

Pelvic_.Findings: Vaginal vault with dark maroon blood and clots, no active source of bleeding

Cardiac_.Findings: S3 gallop

Lung_Auscultation.Findings: Diffuse crackles over lower lung fields

ECG.Findings: No abnormalities

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the psychological impact of a traumatic event following a recent motor vehicle accident.

Patient_Actor.History: Involved in a motor vehicle accident as a front passenger where the vehicle struck 2 pedestrians. She was restrained and did not suffer significant physical injuries. Attended 1 outpatient visit and is recovering well.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Significant distress while riding in her car
Secondary_Symptoms: Inability to recall many details of the accident
Family members expressing concern about her emotional state

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying cause of short stature and associated symptoms in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The boy has always had short stature around the 35th percentile on the growth curve. Over the past year, he has dropped further on the curve despite maintaining the same diet. He has a history of low birth weight.

Secondary_Symptoms: Hyperpigmented and hypopigmented patches on the back
Prominent knobs of bone at costochondral junctions

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the respiratory status and identify potential exacerbation of asthma in a patient presenting for a pre-employment medical check-up.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of persistent asthma and regularly uses inhaled fluticasone for prophylaxis. He reports increasing asthma symptoms, including night time cough and wheezing on exertion, over the past week. Due to running out of his albuterol metered-dose inhaler, he has been taking oral albuterol 3 times a day for the last 3 days, which has improved his symptoms.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Increasing symptoms of asthma (night time cough and wheezing)
Secondary_Symptoms: Use of oral albuterol 3 times a day

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the cause of worsening back pain and hip pain in a young male patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening back pain that started 10 months ago, worsens in the morning, and improves with activity. He has a history of bilateral hip pain and difficulty bending forward during exercise for the past 3 months. The patient has celiac disease and maintains a gluten-free diet.

Musculoskeletal_.Findings: Limited range of spinal flexion; pain on flexion, abduction, and external rotation of both hips

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying psychological condition contributing to the patient's anxiety and difficulty sleeping.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with nervousness and difficulty sleeping over the past 4 weeks, stemming from concerns about her relationship and future after her boyfriend moved in with her 3 months ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: Distress over her boyfriend's habits such as not cleaning up properly
Inability to tolerate perceived flaws of her boyfriend

Mental_Status_.Findings: Cooperative but appears distressed; affect has little intensity or range.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the best study designs to evaluate the incidence and prevalence of testicular cancer based on various risk factors.

Patient_Actor.History: A population is studied for risk factors associated with testicular cancer including alcohol exposure, smoking, dietary factors, social support, and environmental exposure.

Correct_Diagnosis: 1. Prospective cohort study 2. Cross sectional study

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of acute symptoms following treatment for hypertensive crisis and the appropriate antidote for the toxin.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient with a history of long-standing hypertension presented to the emergency department due to headache, dyspnea, and blurry vision after forgetting to fill his antihypertensive medications. Initial blood pressure recorded at 230/130 mm Hg.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of dehydration and electrolyte imbalance in a young male jockey who collapsed after working out.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient collapsed after working out and feels dehydrated. He is a jockey and is trying to lose weight for an upcoming meet.

Secondary_Symptoms: Postural hypotension (blood pressure upon standing 94/65 mmHg)

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management of neuromuscular block during hip replacement surgery.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient underwent hip replacement surgery due to unresponsive pain to non-operative treatment. During surgery, he experienced fasciculations in the extremities due to an administered agent.

Secondary_Symptoms: No further symptoms after fasciculations stopped
Pain from hip condition prior to surgery

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of sudden onset right-sided weakness and assess for cerebrovascular events.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient was brought to the emergency department by his wife due to sudden onset of right-sided weakness 2 hours prior. He has a past medical history of poorly managed hypertension and diabetes. There is a family history of heart disease and diabetes.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the mechanism behind nausea and vomiting following the first infusion of chemotherapeutic agents in a patient with esophageal carcinoma.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has inoperable esophageal carcinoma and is undergoing palliative chemoradiotherapy. He experienced nausea and vomiting four hours after his first infusion of carboplatin and paclitaxel.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage the ocular symptoms following radioactive iodine ablation in a patient with hyperthyroid symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 4-month history of anxiety and weight loss, inability to tolerate heat, and intermittent heart racing over the last 2 months. She has undergone radioactive iodine ablation and is now experiencing new-onset double vision.

Neurological_.Findings: Fine tremor of outstretched hands

Ocular_.Findings: Conjunctival injections, proptosis, lid lag, and mild corneal ulcerations

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the deterioration of cardiac function in a patient with a history of heart failure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with chest tightness and lower extremity edema. He has a worsening history of heart failure over the past several years and takes medications including finasteride, lisinopril, and albuterol. He does not use oxygen at home.

Secondary_Symptoms: Lower extremity edema (2+ pitting up to thighs)

General_.Findings: Overweight man with difficulty speaking

Correct_Diagnosis: Cardiac output went down, and right atrial pressure went up

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of inability to walk in a young child and assess for potential child abuse.

Patient_Actor.History: The child was brought to the emergency department due to an inability to walk for a few days after reportedly falling onto the carpeted floor. Lives at home with her mother and 3-month-old brother. Past medical history is noncontributory.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pain upon palpation of the right thigh
Green bruise on the left arm

Physical_.Findings: Noticeable pain upon palpation of the right thigh; green bruise on the left arm

Radiographs.Findings: Femur fracture in the right lower extremity

Correct_Diagnosis: Obtain a complete skeletal survey to detect other bony injuries and report child abuse case.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the organism responsible for the patient's gastrointestinal symptoms and constitutional signs.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with recent weight loss, fever, joint pain, and frequent bouts of diarrhea. An intestinal biopsy was performed.

Biopsy.Findings: PAS-positive, non-acid fast macrophage inclusions in the lamina propria

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of easy bruising and fragile skin in a 5-year-old boy.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the physician for evaluation of easy bruising. The patient has met all developmental milestones and has normal vital signs.

Secondary_Symptoms: Velvety, fragile skin that can be stretched further than normal
Increased range of motion in joints

Physical_.Findings: Velvety, fragile skin; multiple ecchymoses; increased joint range of motion.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of failure to thrive, developmental delay, and cataracts in a 3-year-old boy with a family history of early myocardial infarction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was born at home without perinatal care and was apparently normal at birth. He later developed failure to thrive and developmental delay. He has a history of cataracts. Notably, his older brother had a myocardial infarction at the age of 18 and is lanky and tall.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Failure to thrive and developmental delay
Secondary_Symptoms: Increased level of an amino acid in urine

Urine_Analysis.Findings: Increased level of an amino acid

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of dizziness and disequilibrium in a healthy 33-year-old male.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to the emergency department with dizziness and a sustained sense of disequilibrium for the past 2 days. He is otherwise healthy, has no other medical diagnoses, and is currently taking vitamin C.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cause of severe penile pain in a patient with a history of intubation and sedation for severe pneumonia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been intubated and sedated in the ICU for severe pneumonia for 1 week. He has a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, is an ex-smoker, and is currently on broad-spectrum IV antibiotics.

Secondary_Symptoms: No ulcers or discharge from the urethral meatus

Vital_Signs.Oxygen_Saturation: On 2 L of oxygen via nasal cannula

Genital_.Findings: Uncircumcised with urinary catheter in place; retracted foreskin revealing severely edematous and erythematous glans; area is markedly tender.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the underlying causes of fatigue, weight gain, irregular menstrual cycles, and other associated symptoms in a young woman.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with fatigue and a 9-kg weight gain over the past 12 months, along with irregular menstrual cycles and difficulty sleeping. Menstrual cycles are irregular, occurring at 35- to 50-day intervals. Menarche was at age 13, and the last menstrual period was 4 weeks ago. She has a 1-year history of hypertension treated with hydrochlorothiazide. Daily alcohol intake includes one glass of wine.

Physical_.Findings: Acne on face, hirsutism, rounded and reddened face, several smaller bruises on both forearms

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the histological findings associated with chronic graft rejection in a kidney transplant patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient had a kidney transplant 3 years ago and presents with elevated creatinine levels and elevated blood pressure.

Biopsy.Findings: Histological findings consistent with chronic graft rejection

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the characteristic cutaneous finding associated with a neurocutaneous disorder in a 6-month-old infant.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency room due to abnormal jerky movements of the upper and lower limbs for the past month. Prenatal scan showed a mass in the left ventricle, leading to a diagnosis of a neurocutaneous disorder.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Abnormal jerky movements of upper and lower limbs
Secondary_Symptoms: History of a prenatal heart mass

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of shortness of breath and lower limb edema in the context of suspected right heart failure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented to the ER with sudden onset dyspnea that started a week ago, worsened with exercise, and did not improve with rest. She also has a dry, persistent cough. Notably, there is a family history of maternal hypertension.

Secondary_Symptoms: Abdominal pain in the right hypochondrium

Lung_.Findings: Diminished thoracic expansion on the right side, with rhonchi and crackles predominantly in the lower two-thirds of both lungs.

Cardiovascular_.Findings: Systolic murmur at tricuspid foci, increased with inspiration.

Abdominal_.Findings: Hepatomegaly 4 cm below the lower coastal edge, painful on palpation of the right hypochondrium, and positive hepatojugular reflux.

Extremity_.Findings: Soft, painless, pitting edema in both lower limbs up to the middle third of both legs.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of facial hyperpigmentation and recommend appropriate treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a rash on her face that has developed over the past three months, with darker cheeks causing psychological distress. She has a history of a first-trimester miscarriage 5 years ago and migraines for 15 years. Current medications include ibuprofen, rizatriptan, and oral contraceptives. Family history includes mother's thyroid disease and migraines.

Skin_.Findings: Marked confluent hyperpigmented patches over cheeks without scarring; hyperpigmented macules on forehead.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of worsening headaches and rash in a child with recurrent otitis media and cervical lymphadenopathy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been experiencing worsening headaches and a rash for 2 weeks. He has had recurrent episodes of otitis media over the past 2 months. The rash started on his abdomen and has diffusely spread.

Secondary_Symptoms: Diffuse erythematous papular rash involving the groin, abdomen, chest, and back

Rash.Findings: Diffuse erythematous papular rash involving multiple body areas

X-Ray of Skull.Findings: Well-defined lytic lesions of the left occipital bone and the mastoid bone

Biopsy.Electron Microscopy Findings: Polygonal cells with organelles shaped like tennis rackets, positive for S-100

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the rationale behind analyzing participants as randomized regardless of adherence to treatment in a clinical trial.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Participants with coronary artery disease and comorbid asthma
Patient_Actor.History: Participants were enrolled in a double-blind, randomized controlled trial evaluating the efficacy of pulmharkimab for asthma and cardiovascular disease.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a patient with atypical squamous cells of undetermined significance (ASC-US) on Pap smear.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to discuss the results of her Pap smear. Previous two Pap smears were normal. Family history includes breast cancer in grandmother and cervical carcinoma in situ in older sister.

Pap_Smear_Results.Interpretation: Atypical squamous cells of undetermined significance (ASC-US)

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of gastrointestinal symptoms and skin rash in a young female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-month history of diarrhea, flatulence, and fatigue. She experiences 3-5 episodes of loose stools daily that have an oily appearance, with worsening symptoms after eating. Additionally, she has an itchy rash on her elbows and knees.

Secondary_Symptoms: Itchy rash on elbows and knees

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cardiac health of a 2-year-old boy with a significant murmur and determine the structural consequences of untreated cardiac conditions.

Patient_Actor.History: Recently emigrated from Mexico, has not seen a physician since birth.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Holosystolic murmur heard best at the left lower sternal border
Secondary_Symptoms: Split second heart sound during deep inspiration

Cardiac_.Findings: Harsh, grade 3/6 holosystolic murmur best at the left lower sternal border; split second heart sound during deep inspiration

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue and new findings of cyanosis and clubbing in a patient with Down syndrome.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought by his mother for evaluation of fatigue. Recent  showed new findings of bluish-colored lips and digital clubbing.

Cardiovascular_.Findings: Evidence of right heart strain with high right atrial pressure

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the impact of a data entry error on statistical measures in a study on hypertension during pregnancy.

Patient_Actor.History: A data analyst is inputting systolic blood pressure values for a research study. Most values are between 130 and 145, but one value was mistakenly entered as '1400' instead of '140'.

Secondary_Symptoms: Data entry error leading to potential skewing of statistical analysis

Correct_Diagnosis: The median is now smaller than the mean

Objective_for_Doctor: Recommend appropriate preventive measures for a pediatric patient with sickle cell disease.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient diagnosed with sickle cell disease last year after an episode of dactylitis. She has been on hydroxyurea with no painful crises or acute chest episodes since starting the medication.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the causative agent of endocarditis in a patient with a history of intravenous drug use and presenting symptoms of fever and breathlessness.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with breathlessness and fever for the past few days. He has no significant past medical history and denies visiting any sick person recently. He uses marijuana frequently and illicit intravenous drugs intermittently.

Secondary_Symptoms: Early diastolic murmur over the right second intercostal space
Presence of S3 and S4 heart sounds

Cardiac_Auscultation.Findings: Early diastolic murmur over the right second intercostal space, S3 and S4 present

Skin_.Findings: Track marks on the arms and a lesion on the left ring finger

Echocardiography.Findings: Vegetation on the aortic valve and mild valve insufficiency

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying cause of pulmonary symptoms and skin nodules in a young female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with painful shin nodules, uveitis, and calcified hilar lymph nodes.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the severity of acute abdominal pain and nausea with consideration of the patient's alcohol use and laboratory results.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented to the ER with an abrupt onset of abdominal pain radiating to the back, nausea, and vomiting episodes lasting for 10 hours. He has no significant past medical history but admits to drinking alcohol every night.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Abrupt abdominal pain radiating to the back

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the cause of chest pain in a patient with risk factors for coronary artery disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with chest pain for the past 3 weeks, occurring after climbing more than 2 flights of stairs or walking for more than 10 minutes. The pain lasts for an average of 30 minutes despite rest and is associated with a history of type 2 diabetes mellitus and a significant smoking history. Family history includes a father who died from a myocardial infarction at age 52.

Physical_.Findings: Unremarkable

Correct_Diagnosis: Symptoms present for 30 minutes despite rest

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a young male patient with anxiety, weight loss, and a testicular mass to identify the underlying condition.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-week history of anxiety, diarrhea, and a 4.1-kg (9-lb) weight loss. He also reports a painless mass on his left testicle that he noticed 2 weeks ago.

Testicular_.Findings: 3-cm, firm, nontender mass on left scrotum that does not transilluminate

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of hoarseness and dysphagia in an elderly patient with a significant smoking history.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with hoarseness and dysphagia for the past 2 months, progressively worsening, with a 9 kg (20 lb) weight loss since the last visit 3 months ago. Past medical history is unremarkable.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and adjust treatment for a patient experiencing persistent depressive symptoms and medication side effects.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with difficulty sleeping and feeling low for the past 6 months. He has been married for 1 year and plans to have a child. He has been on sertraline for 3 months without improvement in depressive symptoms and reports erectile dysfunction since starting the medication.

Physical_.Findings: Unremarkable

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with sharp chest pain post-myocardial infarction, assessing for possible pericarditis.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient has sharp chest pain for the past 3 hours, worsened by deep inspiration and coughing. He underwent cardiac catheterization for an acute myocardial infarction two weeks ago. Current medications include aspirin, ticagrelor, atorvastatin, metoprolol, and lisinopril.

Cardiac_.Findings: High-pitched scratching sound best heard when sitting upright and during expiration

ECG.Findings: Diffuse ST elevations and ST depression in aVR and V1

Echocardiography.Findings: No abnormalities

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the need for prophylactic treatment in a Rh-negative pregnant woman to prevent hemolytic disease of the newborn.

Patient_Actor.History: Pregnant at 28 weeks estimated gestational age, with no prior prenatal care. Previous pregnancy delivered safely at home by an unlicensed midwife. Desires epidural anesthesia for upcoming delivery.

Secondary_Symptoms: Lack of prenatal supplements or vaccinations

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the hematological cause of fatigue and bleeding in a patient with marked pallor and thrombocytopenia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening fatigue and recurrent bleeding from the gums over the past 2 weeks. He has a notable physical  finding of marked pallor.

Secondary_Symptoms: Scattered red, nonblanching pinpoint spots on trunk and extremities

General_.Findings: Marked pallor and scattered red, nonblanching pinpoint spots

Genetic_Analysis.Findings: Leukemic cells with a balanced translocation between the long arms of chromosome 15 and 17

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the nutritional adequacy of a 5-month-old infant who is exclusively breastfed and provide appropriate dietary recommendations.

Patient_Actor.History: Born at 35 weeks gestation via vaginal delivery. No resuscitation needed at birth. Discharged from the hospital on day two of life. Exclusively breastfed since birth with good feeding habits and adequate urination.

Correct_Diagnosis: Supplement his diet with iron and vitamin D

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the cause of headache and hypertension in a pregnant patient at 28 weeks gestation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is at 28 weeks gestation and presents with a headache. Her pregnancy has been managed by a nurse practitioner.

General_.Findings: Comfortable appearing woman with a gravid uterus

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of severe headache and visual disturbances in a patient with a history of migraines.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of migraine headaches and presents with a severe, sudden-onset, throbbing headache and double vision for 1 hour. She reports having frequent headaches and has not had her period in several months.

Visual_.Findings: Decreased visual acuity and loss of peripheral vision in both eyes

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the effects of a calcium channel blocker on the cardiac conduction system in a patient with palpitations and dizziness.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 1-week history of palpitations and dizziness.

Test_Results.ECG: Not provided in the scenario; ECG findings are necessary for a complete assessment.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose and recommend appropriate pharmacotherapy for a pediatric patient presenting with conjunctivitis and respiratory symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 2-day history of redness and foreign body sensation in both eyes, accompanied by violent coughing spells and a high-pitched inspiratory sound. She has had low-grade fevers and a runny nose for the past week. Her vaccinations were only received at birth.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Redness and foreign body sensation in both eyes

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of jaundice and thrombocytopenia in a patient with a history of alcohol abuse.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with fatigue, recent weight loss of 7 pounds, and diffuse itching. He has a past medical history of alcohol abuse, obesity, asthma, and IV drug use. Current medications include metformin, atorvastatin, albuterol, and fluticasone. He admits to increased smoking and drinking due to stress.

Correct_Diagnosis: Severe migraine headaches treated with acetaminophen

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of persistent fevers and systemic symptoms in a patient with a history of congenital heart disease and evidence of endocarditis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 6-day history of persistent fevers, weakness, and occasional shortness of breath. He has a significant past medical history of congenital heart disease, though specific details are unclear. The patient has been unemployed for the last 3 years and has experienced periods of homelessness.

Secondary_Symptoms: Painful nodes on fingers and toes

Physical_Exam.Findings: Nailbed splinter hemorrhages and painful nodes on fingers and toes

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of facial edema and difficulty breathing in a patient with a recent medication history.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with edema over his face and difficulty breathing. His past medical history includes hypertension and dyslipidemia. He recently started on lisinopril and atorvastatin several weeks ago. Family history includes a father who died from stroke complications at 80 years and a mother in a nursing home.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of pruritic skin lesions and identify potential associated conditions.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with pruritic skin lesions on his elbows and knees that have persisted for 1 month. He has been using over-the-counter ointments without improvement and has not seen a healthcare provider for many years. He has no known allergies.

Secondary_Symptoms: Clustered vesicular lesions on elbows and knees

Skin_.Findings: Clustered vesicular lesions on both elbows and knees

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the conditioning process related to reflexive responses to stimuli.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has experienced a reflexive response to the sound of a flushing toilet, which causes the water in the shower to become hot. This has been ongoing for several months.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Reflexively jumping back from the water after hearing the toilet flush
Secondary_Symptoms: Increased awareness of the flushing toilet sound
Anticipation of hot water despite no immediate change in temperature

Correct_Diagnosis: White coat syndrome (patient anxiety evoked at the sight of a white lab coat)

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and determine the underlying cause of recurrent urinary tract infections and hydronephrosis in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has recurrent episodes of dysuria for the past few months, with 4 to 5 similar episodes in the last year. She has had several urinary tract infections throughout her childhood and has no other medical problems or medications.

Secondary_Symptoms: History of recurrent urinary tract infections

Physical_.Findings: Suprapubic tenderness

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's mental status and identify the nature of his perception following a recent hemicolectomy.

Patient_Actor.History: Two days after undergoing hemicolectomy for colon cancer, the patient is found agitated and confused, claiming that a burglar broke into his room. He has a history of type 2 diabetes mellitus and arterial hypertension, with current medications including insulin and hydrochlorothiazide.

Secondary_Symptoms: Misinterpretation of bathrobe as a burglar

Abdominal_.Findings: Nontender, nonerythematous midline abdominal wound

Mental_Status_.Findings: Agitated and oriented only to person

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of palpitations in a patient following laparoscopic abdominal hernia repair.

Patient_Actor.History: Two days after an uncomplicated laparoscopic abdominal hernia repair, the patient presents with palpitations. He has a history of hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and a spontaneously closed ventricular septal defect. Family history includes coronary artery disease. Prior to admission, he was on hydrochlorothiazide and metformin, and he is currently taking hydromorphone/acetaminophen for postoperative pain.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness to palpation over lower quadrants

Cardiopulmonary_.Findings: Normal S1 and S2 without murmurs, clear lung fields

Abdominal_.Findings: Abdominal incisions are clean, dry, and intact with mild tenderness to palpation over the lower quadrants

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of a severe headache with associated symptoms and assess the need for imaging.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a severe headache lasting 2 hours, rated 10/10, with a history of migraines. He denies head trauma or fever and does not take any medications. His father has chronic kidney disease.

Neurological_.Findings: Patient is awake, alert, and oriented but in severe distress. Motor strength is 5/5 in all 4 limbs, sensation is intact, and fundoscopic  is normal.

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the role of immunoglobulins in maternal-fetal immunity and identify the specific immunological event associated with the structure indicated in the study.

Patient_Actor.History: An investigator is examining immunoglobulins transmitted across the placenta from mother to fetus.

Secondary_Symptoms: Focus on immunoglobulin structure and function

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the characteristics of the injured nerve branch following severe facial trauma and surgical reconstruction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was found down in the middle of the street after exiting a local bar, where he was subsequently assaulted, leading to severe facial trauma with multiple lacerations and facial bone fractures. After surgery for facial reconstruction, he reports difficulty opening his mouth wide and chewing food, which he was able to do preoperatively.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of sudden onset hypertension in a patient with a history of coronary artery disease and transient ischemic attack.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of hypercholesterolemia, coronary artery disease, and transient ischemic attack (TIA). He previously managed his blood pressure with diet and an ACE inhibitor. Currently, he is compliant with his medications.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the systemic complaints and understand the underlying mechanism of polyarteritis nodosa in a patient with multiple comorbidities.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a history of hypertension, gout, hypercholesterolemia, diabetes mellitus type II, HIV, and hepatitis C. He is currently unemployed, smokes 2 packs of cigarettes per day, and drinks a 6-pack of beer daily. He has a past history of injection drug use with heroin, but currently denies any drug use.

Secondary_Symptoms: Diffuse palpable, pruritic eruptions over lower extremities

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the asthma management and identify potential adverse effects of treatment with inhaled corticosteroids.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was diagnosed with asthma two months ago and has been using an albuterol inhaler as needed. She experiences episodic chest tightness and cough 2-3 times per week, with the cough being worse at night. She has been otherwise healthy and takes no other medications.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mild expiratory wheezing of all lung fields

Pulmonary_.Findings: Mild expiratory wheezing of all lung fields

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the predisposing factor for the patient's symptoms of heart failure and abdominal distension.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is previously healthy and presents with fatigue and bilateral leg swelling.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pitting edema of the lower extremities
Holosystolic murmur best heard at the left lower sternal border

Cardiovascular_.Findings: Holosystolic murmur heard best at the left lower sternal border that increases in intensity with inspiration

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate vaccination for a 2-year-old boy with sickle cell disease who requires documentation for daycare enrollment.

Patient_Actor.History: The boy was born by spontaneous vaginal delivery at 39 weeks and 5 days after a normal pregnancy. He has sickle cell disease and is on penicillin prophylaxis. He has received all age-appropriate vaccinations as of his last visit at 18 months.

Secondary_Symptoms: Up-to-date vaccinations required for daycare enrollment

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the pathophysiology of Maturity Onset Diabetes of the Young (MODY) type 2 and its impact on glucose metabolism.

Patient_Actor.History: MODY type 2 is associated with a defective pancreatic enzyme leading to mild hyperglycemia, particularly exacerbated during pregnancy.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the need for adjustments in levothyroxine therapy in a patient presenting with signs of early pregnancy.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with a missed menstrual cycle and occasional morning nausea. She has a history of hypothyroidism due to Hashimoto thyroiditis, diagnosed 2 years ago, and is currently taking levothyroxine (50 mcg daily). No other medications, including birth control pills.

Gynecologic_.Findings: Cervical softening, increased mobility, and enlarged uterus. No adnexal masses.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the specific enzymatic reaction in gluconeogenesis that differs from glycolysis.

Patient_Actor.History: N/A

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of gastrointestinal bleeding and epigastric pain in a patient with tarry-black stools.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted to the hospital due to tarry-black stools and epigastric pain for 2 weeks. The pain is relieved after meals but worsens after 1-2 hours. No history of serious illness and takes no medications.

Physical_.Findings: No abnormalities

Endoscopy.Findings: Bleeding duodenal ulcer

Biopsy.Findings: Curved, flagellated gram-negative rods

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a 1-year-old boy with high-grade fever and ecchymosis for potential hematological malignancy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with high-grade fever and ecchymosis for the past 2 weeks. He has achieved all developmental milestones on time and has no significant past medical history.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying cause of muscle weakness and stiffness in a professional baseball player.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with stiffness in his hands, inability to bat effectively, feeling of power loss in swings, dragging feet while walking, and changes in voice.

Muscle_Strength.Findings: Strength is 3 out of 5 in the extensor and flexor muscle groups in both upper and lower limbs bilaterally.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify and initiate treatment for acute pesticide poisoning in a patient presenting with gastrointestinal and neurological symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented to the emergency room after experiencing malaise, nausea, and vomiting following exposure to insecticide while spraying at his farm. His past medical history includes hypertension, diabetes, hyperlipidemia, and a prior myocardial infarction. Medications include aspirin, metoprolol, metformin, lisinopril, and atorvastatin. He has a significant smoking history (40-pack-year) and consumes 3-4 shots of whiskey per day.

Secondary_Symptoms: Altered mental status (not oriented to time)

Neurological_.Findings: Alert and oriented to person and place but not to time; pupils are 2 mm bilaterally; diaphoretic and tremulous.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with acute lower back pain.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with lower back pain developed over the past week. He works in construction and cannot recall a specific injury. Denies any leg pain, weakness, changes in sensation, incontinence, or changes in bowel or urinary habits.

Physical_.Findings: No focal spine tenderness, 5/5 strength, intact sensation to light touch throughout lower extremities.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of vomiting and lethargy in a pediatric patient following flu-like symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with vomiting and one day of lethargy after a one week history of flu-like symptoms and low-grade fevers. He has experienced mild rhinorrhea and cough but has no past medical history and is not on any medications aside from over-the-counter fever reducers.

General_Observation.Findings: The patient appears lethargic and is oriented only to person; otherwise, the physical exam is benign with no additional neurologic symptoms.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the site of action of the prescribed drug for managing worsening shortness of breath and associated symptoms in a patient with a history of heart disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening shortness of breath, cough, and fatigue. His shortness of breath is worst at night, requiring him to sit on a chair to sleep. Medical history includes hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, and coronary heart disease.

Pulmonary_.Findings: Crackles and wheezes noted on auscultation

Cardiac_.Findings: S3 heart sound detected

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess potential obstetric complications in a pregnant patient with a history of bipolar disorder and hypothyroidism.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of bipolar disorder and hypothyroidism. Pregnancy and delivery of her first child were uncomplicated. She uses cocaine once a month and has a history of excessive alcohol consumption but has abstained for the past 5 years. Current medications include quetiapine, levothyroxine, folic acid, and a multivitamin.

Pelvic_.Findings: Uterus consistent in size with a 28-week gestation

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a patient with atypical squamous cells on Pap smear and positive high-risk HPV DNA test.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for cervical cancer screening with no complaints and is sexually active. There is no family history of cervical cancer or other malignancies.

Secondary_Symptoms: Atypical squamous cells present in Pap smear

Cytology.Findings: Negative for high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesions, atypical squamous cells present

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of painful menses in a young female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for painful menses, with regular menstrual cycles every 28 days lasting approximately 4 days. She has developed aching pelvic pain during the first 2 days of her menstrual period over the past 6 months. Her past medical history includes treated chlamydia from 4 years ago, and she currently takes no medications. She works as a copywriter and has a monogamous relationship with her boyfriend for the past 3 years, using condoms intermittently.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Aching pelvic pain during the first 2 days of menstrual period
Secondary_Symptoms: Moderate relief of symptoms with ibuprofen
Denies nausea, vomiting, dyschezia, dyspareunia, irregular menses, or heavier than usual menses

Pelvic_.Findings: Normal appearing vagina with no adnexal or cervical motion tenderness. Uterus is flexible and anteverted.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the potential complications of a right upper quadrant mass in a patient with a history of abdominal pain.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with intermittent abdominal pain for the past month, localized in the right upper abdomen, with no relation to food intake. She has a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia, and reports no nausea, vomiting, or weight change. She consumes 1-2 glasses of wine daily and is currently taking captopril and atorvastatin.

Secondary_Symptoms: Small, firm mass in the right upper quadrant

Abdominal_.Findings: Small, firm mass in the right upper quadrant

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of urinary symptoms in a young female patient following increased sexual activity.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents on the fourth day of her honeymoon, expressing concern that severe pain is ruining her experience. She reports the onset of severe pain with urination and increased frequency of urination, coinciding with increased sexual intercourse.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of renal injury post-renal transplantation in a patient on immunosuppressive therapy.

Patient_Actor.History: Four months ago, the patient underwent renal transplantation for end-stage renal disease. His current medications include sirolimus, tacrolimus, and prednisolone.

Physical_.Findings: No abnormalities

Biopsy.Findings: Tubular vacuolization without parenchymal changes

Objective_for_Doctor: Manage the acute hypertensive emergency in a patient presenting with severe headache and blurred vision.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a severe throbbing headache and blurred vision that developed two hours ago. He has a past medical history of hyperlipidemia and poorly controlled hypertension. Current medications include atorvastatin and lisinopril.

Secondary_Symptoms: No previous episodes of similar symptoms

Neurological_.Findings: Oriented to person, place, and time; strength 2+ bilaterally in upper and lower extremities; no bruits or murmurs

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the management plan for a patient presenting with acute cholecystitis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 10-hour history of severe nausea and abdominal pain starting 30 minutes after dinner. She has a history of type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypercholesterolemia. Current medications include metformin and atorvastatin.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Severe abdominal pain in the right upper quadrant
Secondary_Symptoms: Right upper quadrant tenderness with guarding

Abdominal_.Findings: Right upper quadrant tenderness with guarding

Ultrasound.Findings: Gall bladder wall measuring 6 mm, pericholecystic fluid, sloughing of the intraluminal membrane, and a 2 x 2-cm stone at the neck of the gallbladder. Common bile duct appears unremarkable.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate step in the management of a patient with worsening asthma symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of asthma diagnosed at age 15 and uses inhaled albuterol for symptom relief. Recently, he has experienced nocturnal coughing for 4 weeks, requiring daily use of his rescue inhaler.

Secondary_Symptoms: No fever or upper respiratory symptoms

Pulmonary_Function.PEFR: 74% of expected for age, sex, and height

Correct_Diagnosis: Add daily inhaled corticosteroids to the current regimen.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying pathogenesis of the patient's skin lesions and oral ulcerative lesion.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with multiple target-like skin lesions that appeared 4 days ago and have since extended to his torso. One week prior, he experienced pruritus and pain on the left border of his lower lip, followed by an oral ulcerative lesion.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pruritus and pain on the left border of the lower lip

Skin_.Findings: Multiple round erythematous papules with a central blister, a pale ring of edema surrounding a dark red inflammatory zone, and an erythematous halo.

Oral_.Findings: Mucosal surfaces are free of any ulcerative and exudative lesions.

Correct_Diagnosis: Interferon (IFN) gamma production by CD4+ T cells in the skin

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of generalized malaise, weight loss, abdominal pain, and gastrointestinal symptoms in an elderly male with a significant medical history.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with generalized malaise over the last month, persistent abdominal pain not relieved by ibuprofen, and unintentional weight loss of 22 pounds. He reports intermittent diarrhea after large meals. His past medical history includes alcohol use, obesity, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, IV drug use, and asthma. He attends weekly Alcoholics Anonymous meetings and has recently received his two-week chip for sobriety.

Secondary_Symptoms: Palpable liver edge 2 cm inferior to the rib cage

Abdominal_.Findings: Tenderness to palpation, liver edge palpable 2 cm inferior to the rib cage

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fever, rash, and joint symptoms following a recent snake bite treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 6-hour history of fever, itchy rash, and generalized body aches. He was treated in the emergency department for a snake bite 10 days ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased range of motion of metacarpophalangeal and wrist joints

Skin_.Findings: Multiple well-demarcated, raised, erythematous plaques over the trunk

Joint_.Findings: Tenderness to palpation and decreased range of motion of the metacarpophalangeal and wrist joints bilaterally

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine methods to acutely lower intracranial pressure following a massive cerebral infarction.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted to the neurology intensive care unit after a massive cerebral infarction. Medical history includes hypertension, ovarian cancer, and lung cancer. She has been on medications including lisinopril and aspirin. She has a smoking history of a few cigarettes daily for the last 60 years. No alcohol or drug use.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the medication causing abnormal movements in a patient with a complex medical history.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of hypertension, coronary artery disease (status post 3-vessel coronary artery bypass surgery 5 years prior), stage III chronic kidney disease, and uncontrolled diabetes complicated by diabetic retinopathy, gastroparesis, and polyneuropathy. Recently moved back to the United States after living in Thailand for 1 year.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Abnormal movements (smacking lips and slow tongue movements)
Secondary_Symptoms: Numbness and decreased proprioception of feet bilaterally

Neurological_.Findings: Numbness and decreased proprioception of feet bilaterally

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the appropriate medication for hypertension based on the patient's background and medication profile.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for an annual check-up with no significant developments over the last year and reports feeling well in general. This is the third time he has had elevated blood pressure.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of chronic pelvic pain and assess for potential endometriosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with chronic pelvic pain, worsening during menstruation and intercourse. She has a history of menorrhagia and previously used a copper IUD, which was removed a year ago. She has been on combined oral contraceptive pills for nearly a year, which improved her menorrhagia but not her pain.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness to palpation during vaginal exam

Pelvic_.Findings: Tenderness to palpation with lateral displacement of the cervix

Ultrasound.Findings: No abnormalities noted on pelvic ultrasound

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the study design examining the association between type 2 diabetes mellitus and Alzheimer's disease.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: 250 subjects diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus and 250 matched subjects without diabetes
Patient_Actor.History: Subjects are monitored regularly over their lifetime for the development of symptoms of dementia or mild cognitive impairment.

Secondary_Symptoms: Development of dementia or mild cognitive impairment (if present)

Correct_Diagnosis: It is a prospective observational study.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate course of action regarding intubation in a patient with a living will and poor prognosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to the emergency department with chest pain and shortness of breath. He has a history of multiple comorbidities and was recently hospitalized for a myocardial infarction. The patient has a documented living will.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Chest pain and shortness of breath

Correct_Diagnosis: Do not intubate the patient given his living will

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the etiology of dry mouth and related symptoms in a patient with a history of type 2 diabetes and rheumatoid arthritis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been experiencing dry mouth for the past 2 months and reports increased dental cavities. She has a medical history of type 2 diabetes and rheumatoid arthritis.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Unremarkable except for dry and erythematous sclera and bilateral joint deformities

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the defense mechanism being used by the patient in response to emotional distress.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was voted off the board of her garden club due to tardiness and incomplete work on the spring fair. Following this, upon arriving home, she became upset with her husband who was attempting to console her.

Secondary_Symptoms: Feelings of distress after being voted off the board

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of primary amenorrhea in a sexually active 13-year-old girl.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with concerns of not having her first menstrual period. She reports a mild headache and has an unremarkable medical history. She is sexually active and uses condoms inconsistently. Family history shows menarche began at age 11 for her mother and sister.

Pelvic_.Findings: Present uterus and normal vagina

Correct_Diagnosis: Obtain an MRI of the pituitary

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the area of antibody deposition in a patient presenting with pruritic blister formation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 1-week history of pruritic blister formation.

Secondary_Symptoms: Multiple 1-3 cm bullae on palms, soles, lower legs, and inguinal folds
No sloughing of the epidermis upon gentle rubbing

Skin_Biopsy.Immunofluorescence: Deposition of antibodies at the dermoepidermal junction

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying condition causing right-sided chest pain, fevers, joint pain, weight loss, and a facial rash.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with right-sided chest pain exacerbated during inspiration, intermittent fevers for the past 3 months, pain in both knee joints, and an unintended weight loss of 3 kg (6 lbs) over the past 2 months.

Secondary_Symptoms: Red rash on the face overlying the nose and cheeks

Skin_.Findings: Red rash on the face overlying the nose and cheeks

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the enzymes involved in glycogen synthesis and their functions in glycogen regulation.

Patient_Actor.History: Researchers are investigating a new mouse model of glycogen regulation using hepatocyte enzyme extracts and radiolabeled glucose.

Secondary_Symptoms: Observation of enzyme activity in glycogen synthesis

Enzyme_Investigation.Findings: First enzyme adds a radiolabeled glucose to the end of a long strand; second enzyme rearranges glycogen structure into shorter strands that are linked.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a patient presenting with acute anal pain and a palpable perianal mass.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with intense anal pain that began 2 hours prior. He has a history of chronic constipation and rectal itching. Past medical history is otherwise unremarkable and he takes no medications.

Rectal_.Findings: Palpable perianal mass; no skin tag or mucosal prolapse noted

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the effects of hydrochlorothiazide on serum electrolyte levels in a patient with hypertension.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents for a general check-up. No active medical problems reported previously. Blood pressure was 145/90 on the last visit and 150/95 at this visit.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the treatment response in a patient with schizophrenia who has previously failed multiple antipsychotic trials.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has schizophrenia and has been hospitalized 4 times in the past year. She was brought to the emergency department 6 weeks ago due to bizarre behavior, paranoid delusions, and auditory hallucinations. Following the initiation of a new medication, her symptoms have improved.

Secondary_Symptoms: Improvement of symptoms after new medication

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and determine the appropriate treatment for a patient with lower back pain and recent ocular symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with lower back pain that started over a year ago but has worsened significantly in the past few months. He reports that the pain is most severe in the mornings. He has a recent history of right eye pain and blurry vision.

Musculoskeletal_.Findings: Bilateral sacroiliitis noted on radiographs

Radiological_Studies.Findings: Bilateral sacroiliitis on spine and pelvis radiographs

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the type of hypersensitivity reaction in a patient with acute allergic symptoms following a presumed bee sting.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to an urgent care center following a presumed bee sting at a picnic. She has no significant medical history and denies any previous similar episodes. Her father has a known allergy to peanuts.

Secondary_Symptoms: Skin rash and swelling over arms and face

Physical_.Findings: Severe facial edema and inspiratory stridor

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a case of suspected lithium overdose and altered mental status.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department after being found unconscious at home. Patient has a history of bipolar disorder and chronic back pain from a motor vehicle accident. Current medications include lithium and oxycodone.

Neurological_.Findings: Drowsy but fully oriented, slurred speech, horizontal nystagmus, diffusely hyperreflexic, mild tremor

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of the patient's reluctance to speak and its impact on academic performance.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been increasingly reluctant to speak at school over the past 4 months, affecting her academic performance. She was born at 35 weeks' gestation with a pregnancy complicated by preeclampsia. Previous well-child s have been normal. Her older brother has a history of learning disability.

General_.Findings: No abnormalities noted, follows commands

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of palpitations and changes in renal function in a patient post-acute decompensated heart failure treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: Two days after emergency treatment for acute decompensated heart failure. Has a history of ischemic heart disease and congestive heart failure for the past 10 years. Current medications include intravenous furosemide and oral medications: carvedilol, aspirin, lisinopril, nitroglycerin, and morphine. No intravenous fluids administered.

Cardiac_.Findings: No change compared to the initial exam; peripheral edema has lessened.

Lung_.Findings: Lungs clear to auscultation.

ECG.Findings: No dynamic changes

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of the ventral urethral meatus in a newborn delivered via in vitro fertilization.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient underwent in vitro fertilization and delivered a boy vaginally.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Ventral urethral meatus inferior to the glans

Correct_Diagnosis: It results from failure of the genital folds to fuse

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of knee pain and stiffness in an elderly male with diabetes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 9-month history of pain and stiffness in the right knee, with stiffness lasting about 10 minutes after waking up. Pain worsens in the evening, and there is no history of trauma. His height is 175 cm (5 ft 9 in) and weight is 102 kg (225 lb), resulting in a BMI of 33 kg/m2.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pain and stiffness in the right knee
Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness in the anteromedial joint line

Knee_.Findings: Tenderness in the anteromedial joint line and crepitus during knee movement

Correct_Diagnosis: Osteophytes and narrowing of the joint-space

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of recurrent foul-smelling, fatty diarrhea in a pediatric patient with a history of severe allergies and recurrent sinusitis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of severe allergies and recurrent sinusitis, presenting with episodes of foul-smelling, fatty diarrhea. His mother reports several similar episodes over the years, with no known history of fungal or severe viral infections.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with loss of consciousness and signs suggestive of heart failure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department after loss of consciousness. He has a history of a heart condition but the specific condition is not recalled by his wife. He has been drinking alcohol for the past 30 years.

Secondary_Symptoms: Difficulty breathing (requires three pillows to sleep)
Shortness of breath on exertion (can only walk a few kilometers before needing to rest)
Occasional severe coughing spells with pinkish sputum production

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the etiology of a sudden severe headache in a patient with significant nuchal rigidity and photophobia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a medical history significant for hypertension, recurrent urinary tract infections, mitral valve prolapse, and diverticulosis. He experienced a sudden, severe headache while watching television, describing it as if 'someone shot me in the back of my head.'

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a breast mass in a young woman and determine the appropriate next steps in management.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for evaluation of a breast mass that she noticed while showering yesterday. She has no previous gynecological evaluations and reports a neck ache following a minor car accident last week. She feels otherwise well and has no personal or family history of major illness. Her last menstrual period was 3 weeks ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: Trace bruising in the breast area

Breast_.Findings: Hard, round, nontender, 2-cm mass in the inferomedial quadrant of the left breast; regional lymph nodes not palpable.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the neurological findings associated with a fall and suspected spinal injury.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient fell from a 2-story scaffolding, presenting with left lower-limb weakness and loss of sensation in the right lower limb. No previous medical history.

Secondary_Symptoms: Loss of sensation in the right lower limb
Loss of motor function in left knee extension
Left-sided loss of light touch sensation from mid-thigh and below
Right-sided loss of pin-prick sensation of the lateral leg and entire foot

Neurological_.Findings: Total loss of motor function in left knee extension; left-sided loss of light touch sensation from mid-thigh and below; right-sided loss of pin-prick sensation in the lateral leg and foot.

Correct_Diagnosis: Left-sided numbness at the level of the lesion

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the neurologic condition of a patient presenting with lower extremity symptoms and urinary incontinence.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 4-day history of lower extremity numbness, weakness, and urinary incontinence. There is no history of trauma.

Neurologic_.Findings: Stroking the lateral side of the sole of the foot elicits dorsiflexion of the big toe and fanning of the other toes (Babinski sign)

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate thyroid function in a patient with symptoms suggestive of hyperthyroidism.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with insomnia, diarrhea, anxiety, thinning hair, and diffuse muscle weakness. She has a family history of type 1 diabetes mellitus and thyroid cancer. Alcohol consumption is 1-2 glasses of wine weekly.

Thyroid_Panel.Expected_Results: Low TSH, high T4, high T3

Correct_Diagnosis: Low TSH, high T4, high T3

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the management options for a patient with symptomatic aortic stenosis and determine the best intervention for survival benefit.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a progressive shortness of breath on exertion for the last 6 months. He has a history of controlled type II diabetes mellitus.

Cardiovascular_.Findings: Systolic murmur heard best at the right upper sternal border with radiation to the carotid arteries

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the likely medication causing urinary retention and other anticholinergic side effects in a patient with major depressive disorder.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with urinary retention for the past week following the prescription of a new medication for depression. He reports increased fluid intake, ineffective in alleviating symptoms, and also mentions constipation and dry mouth. No history of smoking, alcohol consumption, or recreational drug use.

Physical_.Findings: Unremarkable

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the causative agent of illness in a young infant presenting with high-grade fever and neurological symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The infant presents with high-grade fever, poor feeding pattern, and regurgitation of milk after each feeding. The mother reports eating unprocessed foods and unpasteurized dairy during pregnancy.

Neurological_.Findings: Hypertonia and exaggerated DTRs

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cause of altered consciousness and hypotension in a patient suspected of medication overdose.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department after losing consciousness. Her husband reports she has been in a bad mood, crying frequently, and has had sleep disturbances following her mother's death earlier this year. He found her lying on the floor next to a bottle of migraine pills.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the cause of lymphadenopathy and splenomegaly in a patient with a history of variable-sized masses.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient noticed a lump in his left axilla 1 year ago, with similar masses in the neck and groin. He denies any fever, weight loss, or night sweats.

Secondary_Symptoms: Variable size of the mass over time
Nontender, rubbery mass in left axilla
Smaller mass in the right groin
Palpable spleen 3 cm below the left costal margin

Lymphatic_.Findings: Nontender, rubbery mass in the left axilla and a smaller mass in the right groin.

Abdominal_.Findings: Spleen palpable 3 cm below the left costal margin.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of generalized weakness, increased urination, and thirst in a patient with type 2 diabetes and chronic kidney disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 4-week history of generalized weakness, increased urination, and thirst. He has a medical history of type 2 diabetes mellitus and chronic kidney disease. His only medication is metformin.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of recurrent abdominal pain and discomfort in a middle-aged female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with recurrent episodes of abdominal discomfort and pain for the past month, which occurs 2-3 hours after meals, usually at midnight. She reports a moderate to severe intensity of pain and has been experiencing fatigue. Her past medical history is insignificant, and she is under stress from her job as an office secretary.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mild tenderness over the epigastric region

Physical_.Findings: Conjunctival pallor and mild tenderness over the epigastric region

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of jaundice and liver dysfunction in a young male with a history of pleurodesis.
