Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-week history of yellow discoloration of the skin, right upper abdominal pain, and fatigue. He underwent right-sided pleurodesis for recurrent spontaneous pneumothorax two years ago.

Pulmonary_.Findings: Mild bibasilar crackles and expiratory wheezing

Genetic_Analysis.Findings: Substitution of lysine for glutamic acid at position 342 of a gene located on chromosome 14

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of deterioration in a young man following a suicide attempt with significant blood loss.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department after being found unconscious in his bedroom following a suicide attempt involving wrist lacerations.

Wrist_Lacerations.Findings: Pressure applied to bilateral wrist lacerations

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate cardiac and gastrointestinal symptoms in a pregnant patient and identify abnormal findings.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is 10 weeks pregnant, with complaints of heartburn while lying flat at night and mild constipation over the past couple of weeks. She has had regular 28-day menstrual cycles since menarche at age 13. Past medical history is insignificant. Family history includes colon cancer in father at age 70, and diabetes and hypertension in mother.

Cardiovascular_.Findings: Diastolic murmur heard over the apex

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying cause of severe headaches and ocular symptoms in a patient with a recent history of rhinosinusitis.

Patient_Actor.History: Presented with severe, intractable headaches and bilateral ocular pain that began approximately 2 weeks prior to presentation. Symptoms worsened progressively, initially presenting as right-sided sharp headaches, diplopia with right lateral gaze, and fatigue. There was a recent history of rhinosinusitis infection.

Secondary_Symptoms: Ptosis, proptosis, and chemosis of both eyes

Ocular_.Findings: Ptosis, proptosis, chemosis, periorbital swelling of both eyes; hyperesthesia in bilateral ophthalmic and maxillary divisions of the trigeminal nerve; bilateral papilledema; mydriasis and eye muscle weakness in all directions

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of a painful lesion on the sole of the patient's foot.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a painful lesion on the sole of the right foot for 1 month, which has become progressively larger and more painful, affecting his ability to walk. He has no significant personal or family medical history. He was hospitalized three years ago for an ankle fracture requiring surgical intervention. Currently, he has moderate facial acne for which he is not receiving treatment. His immunizations are up-to-date.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Painful lesion on the sole of the right foot

Skin_.Findings: 1-cm lesion on the sole of the right foot; remainder of the  is unremarkable.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of diarrhea and fatigue in a patient with a history of HIV infection and possible inflammatory bowel disease.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with a 6-week history of fatigue and diarrhea containing gross blood. He has a history of IV drug abuse, non-compliant HIV infection, and osteoarthritis. Family history includes Crohn disease in his mother.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Fatigue and diarrhea with gross blood
Secondary_Symptoms: Mild right and left lower quadrant tenderness

Abdominal_.Findings: Mild right and left lower quadrant tenderness, no rebound or guarding

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the coagulation status of a preterm neonate presenting with respiratory distress and signs of bleeding.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Preterm neonate, born at 28 weeks of gestation
Patient_Actor.History: Developed respiratory distress during the 4th hour after birth and required ventilator support by the 2nd day of life. On the 5th day of life, he developed generalized purpura and a hemorrhagic aspirate from the stomach.

Correct_Diagnosis: Serum levels of fibrinogen in a preterm infant born at 32 weeks of gestation are typically normal, as compared to an adult.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage nutritional deficiencies in a child with lactose intolerance and assess the risk of complications.

Patient_Actor.History: The child has lactose intolerance and his family emigrated from Somalia 6 months ago. He is at the 30th percentile for height and 15th percentile for weight.

Secondary_Symptoms: Inflammation of the perioral and labial mucosa
Peeling and cracking of the skin at the corners of the mouth

General_.Findings: Pale conjunctivae, erythematous throat, swollen tongue, inflammation of perioral and labial mucosa, peeling and cracking of skin at corners of mouth.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of involuntary weight loss, recurrent abdominal pain, and hematochezia in a patient with a history of polycystic ovarian syndrome and a family history of colon cancer.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with involuntary weight loss and recurrent abdominal pain, with episodes of blood in her stool. She has a medical history significant for polycystic ovarian syndrome and a family history of paternal colon cancer.

Objective_for_Doctor: Provide contraceptive counseling and recommend a suitable non-hormonal contraceptive method.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient recently became sexually active and is concerned about potential pregnancy after a condom broke during intercourse 10 days ago. She has a medical history of deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism. A urine pregnancy test is negative.

Secondary_Symptoms: History of deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the acid-base disorder in a patient with altered mental status and a history of major depressive disorder.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a long history of major depressive disorder and has been experiencing a severe depressive episode over the past several weeks. She was found unconscious and brought to the emergency room.

Correct_Diagnosis: Mixed respiratory alkalosis and anion gap metabolic acidosis

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying cause of chronic diarrhea and weight loss in a young female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a longstanding history of diarrhea, reporting foul-smelling, loose stools and a 35 lb weight loss over the past 3 years. She developed an 'itchy, bumpy' rash on her elbows and forearms two months ago, which has since resolved. The patient denies recent camping trips or travel outside of the country.

General_.Findings: Patient appears thin; conjunctiva and skin are pale; abdomen is mildly distended.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient's experience of shortness of breath at high altitude and assess for any underlying conditions.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented for a routine checkup, reporting good health but experiencing shortness of breath during a recent hiking and skiing trip to Colorado. This was her first high-altitude experience, and symptoms lasted for three days before resolving. She has a history of childhood asthma, but this episode felt different.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Shortness of breath while at high altitude
Secondary_Symptoms: Concern about symptoms during the trip
Resolution of symptoms after three days

Correct_Diagnosis: Increase in concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide in blood

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate treatment for a patient with manic and hypomanic episodes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of multiple manic and hypomanic episodes that started last year and have progressively worsened. She expresses anxiety about how her condition will impact her school and social life.

Secondary_Symptoms: Anxiety about treatment and social impacts

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cause of right foot weakness and sensory loss following vaginal delivery.

Patient_Actor.History: Eighteen hours after the vaginal delivery of a 2788-g (6-lb 2-oz) newborn, the patient experienced weakness and numbness in her right foot. The delivery was complicated by prolonged labor and epidural analgesia.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Weakness and numbness of the right foot
Secondary_Symptoms: Inability to walk without dragging and shuffling the foot
Decreased sensation over the dorsum of the right foot and anterolateral aspect of the right lower extremity below the knee

Neurological_.Findings: Weakness of right foot dorsiflexion and right ankle eversion; deep tendon reflexes are 2+ bilaterally

Correct_Diagnosis: Compression of the common peroneal nerve

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the mechanism of action of methotrexate in a patient presenting with symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis and subsequent megaloblastic anemia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient first presented with morning stiffness, symmetrical arthralgia in her wrist joints, and fatigue. She was diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis and started on methotrexate therapy. She returns for follow-up 2 months later with megaloblastic anemia.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Morning stiffness and symmetrical arthralgia in wrist joints
Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness to palpation of both wrists

Joint_.Findings: Tenderness to palpation of both wrists with full range of motion

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of altered liver function and thrombocytopenia in the patient based on laboratory findings.

Patient_Actor.History: Laboratory studies show hematocrit of 32%, leukocyte count of 9,400/mm3, and platelet count of 96,000/mm3. The patient has elevated liver enzymes with aspartate aminotransferase at 94 U/L and alanine aminotransferase at 92 U/L.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the arterial blood gas values indicating the patient's respiratory status following a pelvic fracture repair.

Patient_Actor.History: Hospitalized after a pelvic fracture and underwent surgical repair without complications. Four days post-surgery, the patient developed acute dyspnea and chest pain.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a breast mass in a postmenopausal woman with a family history of breast cancer.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents 10 days after noticing a mass in her left breast. She has a family history of breast cancer (sister diagnosed at 61 years). Menopause occurred 6 months ago. She has a significant smoking history (2 packs daily for 30 years) and took oral contraceptives for 20 years. Current medications include hormone replacement therapy and a calcium supplement.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Palpable mass in the left breast
Secondary_Symptoms: Tethering of the skin over the lump

Breast_.Findings: 2.5-cm palpable, hard, nontender mass in upper outer quadrant of left breast; no abnormalities in right breast and axillae.

Mammography.Findings: Irregular mass with microcalcifications and oil cysts.

Biopsy.Findings: Foam cells and multinucleated giant cells.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the psychological condition of a young adult presenting with symptoms of depression and fatigue.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been experiencing depressed mood and fatigue for the past 5 weeks, finding it difficult to attend college classes and get out of bed. He has a history of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder treated with methylphenidate, which he stopped 4 years ago. He has been smoking two packs of cigarettes daily for 8 years and feels guilty about his inability to quit despite multiple attempts.

Secondary_Symptoms: Increased appetite and weight gain (3 kg) after recent smoking cessation

Mental_Status_.Findings: Psychomotor retardation and restricted affect; no evidence of suicidal ideation

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of vomiting and abdominal pain in a 7-month-old boy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with three episodes of vomiting and severe abdominal pain for the past two hours. The most recent vomit is bilious, and he had one bloody stool with mucus. The mother reports that one stool at home appeared 'jelly-like.'

Secondary_Symptoms: Palpable mass in right lower quadrant

Abdominal_.Findings: Palpable mass in the right lower quadrant

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the risk factors for developing diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL) in an HIV-positive patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Diagnosed with HIV four years ago and started on cART therapy. Difficulty adhering to the medication regimen. Unemployed for the past couple of years and relies on unemployment benefits. His father died of lymphoma at age 60.

Secondary_Symptoms: Concerns about risk of developing DLBCL

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient's postoperative complications following total pancreatectomy and determine the appropriate management.

Patient_Actor.History: Twelve days post total pancreatectomy for chronic pancreatitis. Complicated by persistent hypotension requiring IV fluids and decreased tolerance to food. Medical history includes type 1 diabetes mellitus and glaucoma. Significant smoking and alcohol history.

Abdominal_.Findings: Soft and mildly tender abdomen; 12-cm vertical wound with 25 mL of viscous, dark green substance draining; nonerythematous wound edges; no pus present.

Correct_Diagnosis: Total parenteral nutrition and ostomy pouch

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the underlying cause of anemia and associated symptoms in a female patient with a history of menorrhagia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with weakness, shortness of breath, and lightheadedness that have gradually worsened over the past 4 months. She has a significant history of menorrhagia secondary to uterine fibroids.

Physical_.Findings: Unremarkable

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the immediate life-saving intervention for a trauma patient with compromised airway and signs of shock.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department following a motor vehicle accident. The patient has multiple wounds, a large laceration on the forehead, and a fracture of the nasal bridge. He is minimally responsive and has a history of coughing and spitting blood.

Abdominal_.Findings: Distended and tender abdomen

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of flu-like symptoms and chest pain in a young child.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the clinic with flu-like symptoms and chest pain lasting for 3 days. The mother noted that he felt warm to the touch and developed chest and muscle pain within the past week. All pediatric vaccinations were administered on schedule.

Biopsy.Findings: Heart biopsy demonstrates characteristic features consistent with viral infection.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with suspected cellulitis of the right leg.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-day history of redness, swelling, and pain in the right leg. He has fever, chills, and nausea, and has noted liquid oozing from the affected area. His medical history includes hypertension and gastroesophageal reflux disease, and he was hospitalized three months ago for a hip fracture.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Redness, swelling, and pain of the right leg
Secondary_Symptoms: Tender, enlarged lymph nodes in the right groin

Leg_.Findings: Large area of erythema with poorly-demarcated borders, nonfluctuant, warm, tender to touch, with purulent drainage.

Lymph_Node_.Findings: Enlarged, tender lymph nodes in the right groin.

Ankle_.Findings: Mild edema of the ankles bilaterally.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the patient's fear of public speaking and associated symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has always had a fear of public speaking. Two weeks ago, he experienced significant anxiety before a presentation, leading to physical symptoms and embarrassment. Similar episodes occurred in high school. He has a normal social life and enjoys his classes and part-time job.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's laboratory results and initiate appropriate management for dyslipidemia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with abnormal lab results after participating in a company health initiative. She has a medical history of obesity, hypertension, and obstructive sleep apnea. She is currently on hydrochlorothiazide and uses a CPAP machine at night.

Secondary_Symptoms: None reported; the visit is primarily for lab result evaluation

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of anemia in a 16-month-old girl presenting with specific symptoms and laboratory findings.

Patient_Actor.History: Routine ; mother reports cravings for ice and episodes of gasping for breath while walking or playing. Family history is unremarkable.

Secondary_Symptoms: Gasping for breath while walking or playing

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of hypotension and altered mental status in a patient following a motor vehicle crash.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought in by EMS after being an unrestrained driver in a motor vehicle crash. Upon arrival, the patient is disoriented and unable to follow commands.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Midline trachea, prominent jugular venous distention, distant heart sounds on cardiac auscultation, large ecchymosis over the sternum

Correct_Diagnosis: Impaired left ventricular filling resulting in decreased left ventricular stroke volume

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the effectiveness of a newly prescribed antihypertensive medication in a patient with primary hypertension.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has primary hypertension and was prescribed a new antihypertensive medication after a family physician attended a continuing education course discussing its benefits.

Vital_Signs.Blood_Pressure: Not well controlled (exact values not provided)

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate intervention to prevent recurrence of symptoms in a pediatric patient with hand pain and swelling.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department with bilateral hand pain and swelling that started 1 week ago, progressively worsening. Two weeks prior, she experienced a low-grade fever and a lace-like rash on her arms and trunk lasting several days.

Secondary_Symptoms: Lace-like rash on arms and trunk

Physical_.Findings: Erythematous, swollen, warm, and tender dorsum of hands and fingers

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the likely complication of a parasitic infection following recent travel to Southeast Asia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with abdominal pain, diarrhea, and weight loss following a recent backpacking trip in Southeast Asia. He does not smoke or consume alcohol.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of intermittent non-bloody diarrhea in a patient with dietary changes and a significant family history.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a two-month history of intermittent non-bloody diarrhea. She has been following a raw food diet for six months for weight loss. Her medical history includes anxiety treated with fluvoxamine and osteopenia. She has a family history of lactose intolerance and recent osteoporosis.

Cardiac_.Findings: New-onset systolic ejection murmur loudest at the left second intercostal space

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage abdominal pain in a young child with a family history of a blood disorder.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department for abdominal pain, refusal to eat, and clutching his stomach. No vomiting or diarrhea noted. Has not had a bowel movement in 3 days. Family recently moved from Namibia and has not established care. No known medical conditions or medications. Family history of a 'blood illness'.

Abdominal_.Findings: Mild distension with tenderness in bilateral lower quadrants without organomegaly

Ultrasound.Findings: 2 gallstones without gallbladder wall thickening or ductal dilation and a negative Murphy sign

Abdominal_Radiograph.Findings: Moderate stool burden in the large bowel and rectum

Hemoglobin_Electrophoresis.Findings: Hemoglobin S, increased levels of hemoglobin F, and no hemoglobin A

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and treat a patient with symptoms suggestive of biliary colic.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with abdominal pain for the last few months, specifically postprandial pain worsened by spicy foods, often located in the right upper abdomen and radiating to the shoulder blade. Episodes are sporadic and unpredictable. He denies any fevers.

Abdominal_.Findings: No abnormalities noted

Imaging.Abdominal Ultrasound: Not specified in the scenario, but typically shows gallstones or biliary abnormalities.

Objective_for_Doctor: Manage a patient with chemical exposure during the primary survey.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient arrived via EMS transport with a known history of gross contamination from an unknown dry/powder chemical due to a research laboratory accident.

Correct_Diagnosis: Brush off the gross amount of unknown chemical and then remove all of the patient's clothes

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the need for asthma treatment in a pediatric patient with intermittent cough.

Patient_Actor.History: The child is brought in by his mother due to concerns about his breathing. He has occasional bouts of coughing but does not experience significant difficulty breathing.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the absent element in the jugular venous pressure waveform due to mitral valve stenosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 2-month history of intermittent dyspnea and dizziness. She has a known history of mitral valve stenosis.

Echocardiogram.Findings: Doming of the anterior mitral valve leaflet during systole

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cause of a persistent dry cough in a patient with a history of hypertension, diabetes, and asthma.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 2-month history of intermittent dry, hacking cough. He has a medical history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and asthma. He is not a smoker and currently takes simvastatin, metformin, albuterol, and ramipril.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying cause of fever and abdominal tenderness in a pregnant patient following spontaneous rupture of membranes.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted to the hospital 1 hour after spontaneous rupture of membranes. The patient has a history of mild abdominal discomfort and nausea for a day. Her pregnancy is complicated by gestational diabetes controlled with a strict diet. Previous child delivered by lower segment transverse cesarean section due to placental abruption. Current medications include iron and vitamin supplements.

Abdominal_.Findings: Severe, diffuse tenderness throughout the lower quadrants

Speculum_.Findings: Rupture of membranes with drainage of malodorous, blood-tinged fluid

Ultrasonography.Findings: Fetus in cephalic presentation, fetal heart rate 175/min, reactive with no decelerations

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the etiology of severe chest pain following an episode of binge drinking and vomiting.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with severe chest pain that started 2 hours ago, preceded by severe retching and bloody vomiting. She has a past medical history of a gastric ulcer 5 years ago, which was surgically repaired.

Secondary_Symptoms: Crepitus over the left lower lobe

Cardiovascular_.Findings: Normal

Lung_.Findings: Crepitus heard over the left lower lobe

ECG.Findings: Unremarkable

Correct_Diagnosis: Rupture of the esophagus due to increased intraluminal pressure

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of the swelling behind the left knee and associated symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has noticed a swelling at the back of his left knee for 2 months. He experiences occasional pain when standing for prolonged periods and mild stiffness in the morning that resolves with movement.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Swelling at the back of the left knee
Secondary_Symptoms: Occasional pain at the back of the knee during prolonged standing

Knee_.Findings: 3-cm mildly tender, fixed mass at the medial side of the left popliteal fossa, more prominent on extension and disappears upon flexion. No local calf tenderness; forced dorsiflexion aggravates knee pain.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of progressive dysphagia and regurgitation in a patient with recent travel history and weight loss.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 6-month history of difficulty swallowing, initially with solids and now also with liquids. She reports occasional regurgitation when lying down, a weight loss of 3.5 kg (7.7 lbs) over the past 6 months, and has a history of smoking a pack of cigarettes daily for 25 years. She returned from a 3-week trip to the Amazon rainforest 3 months ago. She has no history of abdominal pain, blood in stools, or fever.

General_.Findings: No abnormalities noted during .

Imaging.Esophageal Manometry: Lower esophageal sphincter fails to relax during swallowing.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage the gastrointestinal symptoms in a patient with possible gastroparesis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and bloating that have worsened over several months. She occasionally vomits undigested food particles and experiences early satiety. Her medical history includes hypertension and type II diabetes mellitus.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the best intervention for hypotension in a patient with traumatic brain injury following a motor vehicle collision.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented to the emergency department after being involved in a head-on motor vehicle collision as an unrestrained driver.

Secondary_Symptoms: Low oxygen saturation (94% on room air)

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of delayed menarche and short stature in a teenage girl.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the pediatrician's office by her mother due to concerns about not achieving menarche. Denies significant weight loss, mood changes, or appetite changes. Not sexually active. Good student, enjoys sports. Born via spontaneous vaginal delivery at 39 weeks. Some discussion about mild birth defects, specifics unknown. Up to date on vaccines and meets all developmental milestones. Past medical history and family history are benign.

Secondary_Symptoms: Broad chest with widely spaced nipples

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess for possible genetic or hormonal causes of delayed menstruation and associated physical findings in a 14-year-old girl.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with delayed onset of menstruation. Pubic hair development began at age 9. She has a history of recurrent serous otitis media since early childhood.

Secondary_Symptoms: Lack of breast development with widely spaced nipples

Physical_.Findings: Hypoplastic nails, short 4th and 5th metacarpals, cubitus valgus bilaterally, widely spaced nipples, normal heart sounds without murmur, high arched palate, dental malocclusion, low hairline.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying cause of abdominal pain, vomiting, and rash in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department with abdominal pain and vomiting for the past day. The pain is intermittent, diffuse, and worse after meals. She has a non-pruritic rash on her legs and swelling of her ankles for 6 days. Treated with oral amoxicillin for a sore throat 2 weeks ago. Immunizations are up-to-date.

Secondary_Symptoms: Non-blanching, raised erythematous papules on legs
Swelling and warmth of the left ankle joint
Limited range of motion in the left ankle joint
Tenderness to palpation in the left lower quadrant

Lower_Extremities.Findings: Non-blanching, raised erythematous papules; swollen left ankle joint with limited range of motion

Abdominal_.Findings: Tenderness to palpation in the left lower quadrant without guarding or rebound

Objective_for_Doctor: Investigate the efficacy of thyroxine treatment in asymptomatic subclinical hypothyroidism and understand the reasons for the study results.

Patient_Actor.History: Patients had serum TSH levels of 5 to 10 µU/mL with normal serum thyroxine (T4) levels. Participants were randomized to receive either thyroxine 75 µg daily or placebo.

Secondary_Symptoms: No reported symptoms due to subclinical nature
Quality of life evaluated at follow-up

Follow_Up_Testing.Serum_T4_and_TSH: No difference found between treatment and placebo groups

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of neurological symptoms and facial abnormalities in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient experienced a 5-minute episode of repetitive, involuntary twitching movements of his left arm while playing. He began to stand with support at 18 months and has recently started walking with support. He speaks in bisyllables.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Repetitive, involuntary twitching movements of the left arm
Secondary_Symptoms: Purple-pink patch over the right cheek extending to the right eyelid
Absent bicep reflex on the left side
Cupping of the right optic disc

Neurologic_.Findings: Left arm hypotonia and absent bicep reflex on left side

Ophthalmologic_.Findings: Cupping of the right optic disc

Dermatologic_.Findings: Purple-pink patch over right cheek and eyelid

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying condition causing feeding problems and recurrent infections in a 4-month-old neonate.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is presented with feeding problems and recurrent infections. Physical  reveals multiple congenital anomalies.

Physical_.Findings: Cleft palate, malformed jaw, structural cardiac abnormalities, and diminished cell-mediated responses

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the site of the lesion causing progressive leg weakness and muscle atrophy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with leg weakness that has worsened over the past 3 months, along with spontaneous twitching in the arms and thighs.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Leg weakness significantly impairing walking ability
Secondary_Symptoms: Spontaneous twitching in arms and thighs
Moderate atrophy of arm and thigh muscles
Rigidity and resistance to movement in lower limbs

Muscle_Tone.Atrophy: Moderate atrophy of arm and thigh muscles, significant thenar atrophy bilaterally
Muscle_Tone.Rigidity: Resistance to movement in lower limbs

Neurological_.Findings: Pupillary light and accommodation reflexes are normal; patient can maintain balance with eyes closed.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of acute dyspnea, chest pain, and fainting in a patient with a history of infective endocarditis and drug abuse.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted with acute onset dyspnea, chest pain, and fainting. Significant history includes infective endocarditis at age 17 and intravenous drug abuse. Reports mild dyspnea on exertion. Current medication is duloxetine for depression.

Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased heart sounds with accentuated S2
Enlarged liver palpated 3 cm below the costal margin

Neurological_.Findings: Pupils are dilated, symmetrical, and reactive to light.

Cardiac_.Findings: Decreased heart sounds at S3, accentuated S2 best heard at tricuspid and pulmonary areas, pansystolic grade 2/6 murmur over the tricuspid area.

Abdominal_.Findings: Enlarged liver palpated 3 cm below the costal margin.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of abnormal vaginal discharge in a pregnant patient and initiate appropriate management.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-day history of abnormal vaginal discharge. She has no fever, chills, or abdominal pain. One week prior, her 2-year-old daughter had a urinary tract infection that resolved after antibiotic therapy. The patient reports being sexually active with one male partner and does not use condoms.

Secondary_Symptoms: Mucopurulent, foul-smelling discharge from the cervical os
No uterine or cervical motion tenderness

Pelvic_.Findings: Inflamed and friable cervix with mucopurulent, foul-smelling discharge

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the cause of progressive motor difficulties and falls in a 4-year-old boy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of multiple falls over the last 8 months. He was born at term with no perinatal complications and had normal developmental milestones until recently. He started walking at 17 months and climbing stairs at 2 years. His past medical history is unremarkable, and his vaccinations are up-to-date. His maternal uncle had a similar history and became bed-bound at 12 years of age.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Difficulty standing from sitting position and clumsiness while walking
Secondary_Symptoms: Multiple falls over the last 8 months

Physical_.Findings: Patient stood up from sitting position slowly by placing hands on his knees.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of increased diarrhea in a patient with irritable bowel syndrome and assess the efficacy of loperamide.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of irritable bowel syndrome and presents with increased diarrhea. Symptoms began after starting a new job. She reports no fever, bloody stools, nausea, or vomiting.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying immunodeficiency causing recurrent Staphylococcus aureus infections in the child.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with multiple skin abscesses due to recurrent infections with Staphylococcus aureus. A nitroblue tetrazolium test was performed, which remained clear.

Correct_Diagnosis: Inability to generate the microbicidal respiratory burst

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of recurrent infections and easy bruising in a 2-year-old boy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been hospitalized 3 times for severe skin and respiratory infections that responded to antibiotic treatment. He presents with recurrent infections and easy bruising.

Secondary_Symptoms: Diffuse petechiae scattered over the body

Skin_.Findings: Hypopigmented skin with diffuse petechiae

Peripheral_Blood_Smear.Findings: Giant cytoplasmic granules in granulocytes and platelets

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the underlying cause of joint pain, skin changes, and systemic symptoms in a middle-aged woman.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with joint pain and stiffness for the past few months, involving her hands, lower back, and left knee, with morning stiffness that improves throughout the day. She has noticed color changes in her fingers upon cold exposure and has tightening of the skin on her face and thinning of her lips. Additionally, she feels tired throughout the day and has a history of hypertension treated with hydralazine for the past year. She lost her parents in a road traffic accident 3 years ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: Color changes in fingers with cold exposure
Shiny and thickened skin on face and hands

Skin_.Findings: Shiny and slightly thickened skin, especially on the face and hands.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the psychological impact of parental divorce on a child and identify defense mechanisms in play.

Patient_Actor.History: The girl presents to the psychiatrist to discuss the recent divorce of her parents.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Expressions of extreme views about her parents
Secondary_Symptoms: Positive remarks about her mother as caring and loving
Negative remarks about her father, calling him 'evil' and expressing hatred

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the mechanism behind the color changes in a bruise following trauma to the left arm.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a follow-up evaluation after sustaining a bruise on his left arm and an injury to his left shoulder from a physical altercation two days ago. Initially, he observed a reddish-purple discoloration on his left upper arm.

Secondary_Symptoms: Changes in color of the bruise

Bruise_.Findings: Reddish-purple discoloration on left upper arm with changes in color observed over time.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and treat a patient presenting with symptoms of depression and assess the effects of prescribed medication.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been experiencing fatigue, low energy, and feelings of sadness for the past 3 years. He reports difficulty concentrating and excessive sleeping, with no manic or hypomanic symptoms. He denies suicidal ideation or preoccupation with death.

Physical_.Findings: Unremarkable

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue, back pain, and dark urine in a young woman after starting malaria prophylaxis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with 3 days of fatigue, back pain, and dark urine following the initiation of malaria prophylaxis. She has a past medical history significant for allergies and a broken elbow treated in a cast 10 years ago. She does not take any medications, does not smoke, and drinks socially.

Blood_Tests.Peripheral_Blood_Smear: Reveals both red blood cells with dark intracellular inclusions and abnormally shaped red blood cells.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of acute-onset left flank pain in a patient with a history of nephrolithiasis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with acute-onset left flank pain that started suddenly 4 hours ago and has progressively worsened. He has a history of nephrolithiasis diagnosed 4 years ago status post shockwave lithotripsy. The patient reports an allergy to many pain medications, but he usually receives one that starts with 'D' for similar pain.

General_.Findings: Writhing in pain and moaning, exquisite left costovertebral angle tenderness

Correct_Diagnosis: Non-contrast CT of the abdomen and pelvis

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of chronic anemia in a patient with inconclusive noninvasive diagnostic testing and bone marrow findings.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to a hematology clinic to discuss the results of a bone marrow biopsy performed about 4 weeks ago due to chronic anemia. All other noninvasive diagnostic tests were inconclusive.

Bone_Marrow_Biopsy.Findings: Erythroid precursors with multiple cytoplasmic structures highlighted with a Prussian blue stain

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of abnormal movements in a patient with a history of schizophrenia after a medication switch.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 2-year history of schizophrenia, previously controlled with fluphenazine, but was switched to risperidone two weeks ago. She presents with new symptoms of repetitive tongue twisting and abnormal movements.

Secondary_Symptoms: Abnormal movements of the hands and legs
Frequent tapping of the right foot

Neurological_.Findings: Protrusion of the tongue and lip smacking, abnormal arm and foot movements

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the respiratory status and identify potential complications following hip arthroplasty.

Patient_Actor.History: Three days after suffering a right hip fracture treated with hip arthroplasty, the patient developed shortness of breath and left-sided back pain. His medical history includes diabetes and hypertension, for which he takes metformin and lisinopril.

Secondary_Symptoms: Left-sided back pain (sharp and occurring with deep breathing)
Right calf swelling with erythema and induration
Friction rub best heard in the left lung base

Lung_.Findings: Friction rub best heard in the left lung base

Leg_.Findings: Swollen right calf with erythema and induration

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying mechanism for left ankle pain in a patient with recent Salmonella gastroenteritis and multiple comorbidities.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with left ankle pain for 2 days, worsened at night and with exercise. She has a history of ulcerative colitis, hypertension, and hypercholesterolemia. Current medications include mesalamine, hydrochlorothiazide, and simvastatin. She was recently diagnosed with Salmonella gastroenteritis and started on ciprofloxacin.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness above the left posterior calcaneus
Mild swelling of the left ankle
Normal range of motion of the left ankle

Ankle_.Findings: Tenderness above the left posterior calcaneus; normal range of motion with active and passive movement; calf squeeze does not elicit plantar flexion.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and recommend treatment for progressive hair loss in a male patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has experienced progressive hair loss over the past 5 years, initially noticing receding of the hairline over the bitemporal regions and subsequent thinning of hair on the crown of his head. He is otherwise healthy and takes no medications.

Secondary_Symptoms: Diffuse, nonscarring hair loss over the scalp

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the type of skin lesion on the patient's elbow during a wellness visit.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a past medical history significant for asthma and psoriasis. He presents for a wellness visit with no specific complaints.

Skin_.Findings: 3.3 cm (1.2 in) lesion overlying the left elbow with an erythematous border, covered with a silver scale.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the cause of acute right-sided weakness and slurred speech in a patient with a history of hypertension and recent increased stress.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department 1 hour after sudden onset of right-sided weakness while eating breakfast. She has experienced increased anxiety and fatigue over the past 4 months and has a history of hypertension. She has had increased work stress recently and takes lisinopril daily and alprazolam as needed.

Secondary_Symptoms: Lightheadedness and shortness of breath with exertion

Neurological_.Findings: Right facial droop, 2/5 strength in right shoulder, elbow, wrist, and fingers, diminished sensation in right face and arm

Cardiovascular_.Findings: S1 with variable intensity, lungs clear to auscultation bilaterally

Cardiac_Test.Findings: Irregularly irregular rhythm without P waves on ECG

Correct_Diagnosis: Irregularly irregular rhythm without P waves on ECG

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage the symptoms of intermittent joint pain and stiffness, considering the family history of autoimmune disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with an 8-month history of intermittent pain and stiffness in her hands and feet, occurring approximately three times a month after waking up. Episodes last for about one hour and are accompanied by fever and myalgia. She takes ibuprofen for relief, which is effective. The last episode occurred 5 days ago. No significant past medical history or current medications. Family history includes a sister with systemic lupus erythematosus.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Intermittent pain and stiffness in hands and feet
Secondary_Symptoms: Mild swelling and tenderness of wrists and proximal interphalangeal joints

Joint_.Findings: Mild swelling and tenderness of the wrists and proximal interphalangeal joints of both hands

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the cause of hemoptysis and progressive dyspnea in an elderly male with a significant smoking history.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a one-week history of coughing up bloody sputum and progressive shortness of breath over the last 6 months. He has a significant medical history of hypertension managed with lisinopril. Notably, he has lost 22 pounds without changes in diet or exercise. He has a 60-pack-year smoking history and drinks alcohol socially.

Radiological_Imaging.Findings: Mass in the right lower lobe of the lung

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of superficial erosions and blisters in a patient with significant buccal mucosa involvement.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with superficial erosions and blisters over the skin of her head and trunk. She has a history of tender sores on the oral mucosa and soft palate, initially treated as herpes simplex stomatitis, which worsened despite treatment, leading to eroded areas and a 10 kg weight loss.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Superficial erosions and blisters on skin
Secondary_Symptoms: Easily removable top layer of skin with pressure

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the appropriate treatment for the patient's respiratory illness related to HIV and assess preventive measures for opportunistic infections.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-week history of fatigue, nonproductive cough, and worsening shortness of breath. He appears ill and has a history of HIV.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the infant for potential congenital abnormalities causing vomiting and failure to pass stool.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought in for a routine checkup. The infant has been vomiting greenish-yellow fluid after every feeding and has not passed stool since leaving the hospital.

General_.Findings: Distended abdomen with high-pitched bowel sounds

Imaging.Abdominal_Radiograph: Film findings are not specified in the scenario, assumed to show signs consistent with bowel obstruction or congenital issue.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a pediatric patient with fever, sore throat, and rash.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the clinic with symptoms starting 3 days ago: high-grade fever, sore throat, vomiting, and malaise. The mother reports a rash appeared on the neck and spread to the trunk and extremities over 48 hours. The mother had a sore throat a week ago but denies chills, seizures, or sick contacts.

Skin_.Findings: Whole-body erythematous punctate maculopapular rash

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of worsening nocturia, fatigue, and shortness of breath in a patient with a history of hypertension.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening nocturia, fatigue, and shortness of breath on exertion. He has a history of hypertension managed with amlodipine and prazosin but has difficulty adhering to his medication regimen.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Worsening shortness of breath on exertion
Secondary_Symptoms: Need to use two pillows at night to avoid shortness of breath
Difficulty walking for longer than 5 minutes

Cardiovascular_.Findings: Laterally displaced apical heartbeat and S4 gallop

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a patient with suspected orbital cellulitis secondary to sinusitis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department with a severe right-sided temporal headache, conjunctival swelling, and anterior bulging of the left eye for 1 hour. She has had right-sided purulent nasal discharge and nasal congestion for the past 2 days. There is no personal or family history of serious illness, and she does not smoke or drink alcohol. The patient takes no medications.

Secondary_Symptoms: Anterior bulging of the left eye
Limited lateral gaze of the left eye
Periorbital edema and chemosis of the left eye

Ophthalmic_.Findings: Periorbital edema and chemosis of the left eye, bilateral ptosis, limited lateral gaze of the left eye

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient's chronic nasal congestion and discuss anesthesia options for potential surgical intervention.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with chronic nasal congestion, noting difficulty breathing through her nose and loud breathing during sleep. She denies frequent infections or allergies and has no chronic medical problems. She takes no medications, and her family history is insignificant.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the neurological deficits causing clumsiness and balance issues in a 45-year-old woman.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with complaints of clumsiness, feeling like she is tripping over her feet more often. She recently fell and sprained her wrist. Her medical history includes well-controlled diabetes and a strict vegan diet for over 20 years. She lives with her husband and two children.

Secondary_Symptoms: Diminished vibration sense in both feet

Neurological_.Findings: Diminished proprioception and vibration sense in both feet; positive Romberg sign; diminished Achilles reflexes bilaterally.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's aggressive behavior and self-injurious actions to determine the underlying genetic condition.

Patient_Actor.History: The mother reports that the child has a history of aggressive behavior and has recently started biting himself, causing injury and bleeding. The patient has a past medical history of mental retardation and episodes of severe joint pain.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Child attempting to bite his arms

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of confusion and lethargy in a patient with recent diarrhea and seizure activity.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department for confusion and lethargy for the past 2 hours. The husband reports that she was behaving weirdly and had difficulty waking up from a nap. No fever, weight loss, headaches, dizziness, chest pain, or gastrointestinal changes were noted. Frequent diarrhea over the past 3 days attributed to food poisoning.

Correct_Diagnosis: Increase the serum sodium slowly with hypertonic saline solution

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate treatment for a patient with a nondisplaced distal radial fracture and decreased bone mineral density.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient was brought to the emergency department after falling from a seated position, resulting in left wrist pain and swelling. She has been menopausal for 15 years.

Secondary_Symptoms: Nondisplaced fracture of the distal radial metaphysis

X-ray_Findings.Description: Nondisplaced fracture of the distal radial metaphysis and decreased bone mineral density

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying condition predisposing to recurrent fever and cardiac symptoms in a 64-year-old male.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with 4 weeks of recurrent fever, night sweats, malaise, and fatigue, associated with shortness of breath and orthopnea. Family and personal history are unremarkable.

Secondary_Symptoms: High-pitched holosystolic murmur over the lower end of the left sternal border

Cardiopulmonary_Auscultation.Findings: High-pitched holosystolic murmur over the lower end of the left sternal border radiating to the left axilla

Skin_.Findings: Skin lesions on palms

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's risk factors for completed suicide and evaluate the current mental health status.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with one week of suicidal ideation. She has a history of depression that began after her husband's death in a motor vehicle accident seven years ago. She previously attempted overdose on over-the-counter pills but recovered completely. Her depression was managed with sertraline until the last week. She also has a history of hypertension controlled with hydrochlorothiazide.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of recurrent skin lesions and infections in a young child.

Patient_Actor.History: The child has recurrent skin lesions since 3 months of age and has experienced several respiratory tract infections, enlarged lymph nodes, and recurrent fevers since birth. He attends daycare and his immunizations are up-to-date.

Secondary_Symptoms: Raised, erythematous lesions (some purulent) over face, neck, groin, and extremities

Skin_.Findings: Several raised, erythematous lesions of different sizes over face, neck, groin, and extremities; some lesions are purulent.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of muscle weakness, cramps, and exercise intolerance in a teenage patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with muscle weakness and cramps for 5 months, becoming easily fatigued and experiencing severe muscle pain and swelling after 15 minutes of playing basketball. Symptoms improve after rest, and he has episodes of reddish-brown urine after playing. There is no family history of serious illness.

Secondary_Symptoms: Severe muscle pain and swelling after exercise

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the bacterial cell component responsible for the staining characteristics observed in a patient with acute pancreatitis and respiratory symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: Hospitalized for acute pancreatitis, the patient develops a high-grade fever and productive cough with gelatinous sputum.

Sputum_Analysis.Microscopic_Staining: Gram stain using crystal violet, iodine, acetone, and safranin
Sputum_Analysis.Observed_Color: Pink color seen on the stain

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of high-grade fever and severe joint pain in a patient with recent travel history.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to the emergency department with high-grade fever and malaise for 3 days. He has severe generalized joint and body pains that do not respond to acetaminophen. He also reports a severe stabbing pain behind his eyes and recently returned from a trip to Taiwan 1 week ago.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: High-grade fever and severe joint pain
Secondary_Symptoms: Severe stabbing pain behind the eyes
Maculopapular rash over trunk and extremities

Physical__Findings.Findings: Nontender inguinal lymphadenopathy and maculopapular rash with sparing of back and groin

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a patient presenting with acute respiratory distress and wheezing.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of progressively worsening cough and difficulty breathing, with similar episodes since childhood. One prior episode required intubation with mechanical ventilation.

Respiratory_.Findings: Diffuse wheezes and diminished breath sounds bilaterally

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the enzyme deficiency in a 2-month-old infant presenting with hypotonia, poor suckling, and abnormal skin and hair pigmentation.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the pediatrician after parents noticed a 'floppy' appearance, poor suckling, vomiting, and spontaneous generalized movements a few weeks after birth. The infant was born at home, and routine newborn screening was normal.

Secondary_Symptoms: Inability to hold head straight while prone

Physical_.Findings: Hypotonic infant with poor suckling and developmental delays

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of vaginal bleeding at 32 weeks gestation in a patient with a history of cesarean sections.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted to the hospital with vaginal bleeding that started 4 hours ago during a nap. The current pregnancy has been uncomplicated, and the patient has a history of two previous cesarean sections. She did not undergo a scheduled ultrasound at 20 weeks gestation.

Secondary_Symptoms: Small amount of blood continues to pass

Abdominal_.Findings: Normal uterine tone and no tenderness

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue and thrombocytopenia in a patient with a history of alcohol consumption.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine health maintenance  after not seeing his primary care physician for 7 years. He reports feeling easily fatigued and has a history of drinking half a pint of liquor daily. No significant medical history is noted.

Abdominal_.Findings: No focal tenderness, difficult to assess due to distention

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the cause of neurological symptoms following a head injury.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department after falling from her bicycle and hitting her head. She experienced an initial loss of consciousness for a couple of minutes, followed by nausea and headache. She has no significant medical history and does not take any medications.

Secondary_Symptoms: Bruising on the right temporal side of the head

Neurological_.Findings: Oriented to person, place, and time. Seizure occurred during the .

Cardiac_.Findings: Bradycardia but no murmurs, rubs, or gallops.

Abdominal_.Findings: Soft and nontender abdomen.

Head_.Findings: Bruise on right temporal side of head.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of confusion and cardiac abnormalities in a patient with a suspected medication overdose.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient with a history of depression presents after a suspected ingestion. She is confused and reporting visual disturbances.

Test_Results.ECG: Cardiac abnormalities consistent with tricyclic antidepressant overdose

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the anatomical site of nerve damage causing impaired cough reflex in a patient with recurring pneumonia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has recurring pneumonia over the last 6 months following a surgical operation. He reports an inability to automatically cough when food enters the windpipe.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying causes of infertility in a patient with a history of miscarriages and medical issues.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for evaluation of infertility after trying to conceive for three years, during which she experienced five miscarriages. Past medical history includes anemia, bipolar disorder, and a blood clot in the right lower extremity during her first pregnancy. She reports fatigue, a weight gain of at least 10 pounds in the last two months, emotional distress related to her miscarriages, and sleep difficulties. She has a history of smoking, currently smoking about half a pack of cigarettes a day.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Unremarkable

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the management of an agitated patient with a history of schizophrenia exhibiting threatening behavior and lack of insight.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of schizophrenia and was found at a mall threatening harm to others. He was escorted to the emergency room by police.

Secondary_Symptoms: Chasing individuals in the parking lot

Correct_Diagnosis: Begin treatment due to patient's lack of decision making capacity.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with heartburn and epigastric pain.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been experiencing heartburn and mild epigastric pain after eating for the past 6 months. Symptoms occur within an hour after meals and last for about an hour, progressively worsening. Symptoms have recently started when lying supine. He has tried smaller meals and avoiding spicy foods without relief. He denies vomiting, difficulty swallowing, recent weight loss, or changes in stool color. Reports a 'sour' taste in his mouth when symptomatic.

Abdominal_.Findings: Abdomen is soft, non-tender, bowel sounds auscultated in all quadrants

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of episodic chest pain and shortness of breath in a pediatric patient with physical findings suggestive of connective tissue disorder.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 3-month history of episodic chest pain and shortness of breath on exertion. He is at the 99th percentile for height and 40th percentile for weight.

Cardiac_.Findings: Grade 2/6 late systolic, crescendo murmur with a midsystolic click

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a cat bite injury in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was bitten by a friend's cat while playing. He is generally healthy and up to date on vaccinations.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Moderate pain in the right hand and wrist
Secondary_Symptoms: Deep puncture wound that is actively bleeding
Full range of motion and strength in the affected hand

Wound_.Findings: Deep puncture wound with active bleeding

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying condition causing dyspnea and cough in a patient with a history of esophageal cancer and prior radiochemotherapy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was diagnosed with esophageal cancer 10 months ago and received radiochemotherapy. He has a history of atopic dermatitis and a significant smoking history of one pack of cigarettes daily for 30 years.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue and macrocytic anemia in a 72-year-old woman with a history of autoimmune disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient complains of fatigue for the last 6 months, struggling to complete morning chores and rarely climbing stairs. Past medical history includes Hashimoto's thyroiditis, hypertension, and hyperlipidemia. Current medications are levothyroxine, chlorthalidone, and atorvastatin. Family history includes a daughter with systemic lupus erythematosus. She lives alone in an old house, does not smoke, and drinks alcohol occasionally. Diet is balanced with oatmeal and protein.

General_.Findings: Patient appears frail

Lung_Auscultation.Findings: Lungs are clear to auscultation bilaterally

Cardiac_.Findings: Heart is tachycardic with a regular rhythm

Complete_Blood_Count.Findings: Macrocytic anemia, decreased red blood cell count, anisocytosis, poikilocytosis, occasional hypersegmented neutrophils.

Endoscopy.Findings: Thin and smooth gastric mucosa without rugae.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the genetic mutation responsible for the patient's skeletal dysplasia and worsening kyphoscoliosis.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted for placement of halo gravitational traction due to worsening kyphoscoliosis. The patient has a history of short stature, consistently below the 5th percentile for height since birth.

Secondary_Symptoms: Disproportionate shortening of the arms and legs

Physical_.Findings: Macrocephaly, frontal bossing, short arms and legs with disproportionate shortening of proximal segments, lumbar lordosis.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of frequent falling and gait abnormalities in a child with a history of ear infections.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has had increased difficulty walking over the last few months and has refused to eat solid foods for the past 2 weeks. He has had multiple ear infections since birth and has met all developmental milestones.

Secondary_Symptoms: Refusal to eat solid foods for 2 weeks
Wide-based gait with irregular and uneven steps

Physical__Findings.Findings: Foot inversion with hammertoes bilaterally; wide-based gait with irregular and uneven steps

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of persistent vomiting and weakness in a patient with recent dietary changes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with 3 days of non-bloody and non-bilious emesis occurring every time he eats or drinks. He has progressively become weaker and relates his symptoms to a recent event involving sampling many different foods.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Weak appearing man with dry mucous membranes, abdomen is nontender

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of palpitations and shortness of breath in a young male patient with a murmur.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-month history of palpitations and shortness of breath on exertion. He has no significant past medical history and does not smoke or use illicit drugs.

Secondary_Symptoms: Murmur along the left sternal border

Cardiac_.Findings: Murmur along the left sternal border

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the psychiatric condition of a pregnant woman exhibiting manic symptoms and assess potential medication risks.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was found wandering at 3 AM, displaying manic behavior and claims of significant accomplishments. She has a past medical history of suicidality and depression, with a recent admission three months ago. She was stabilized on fluoxetine but now denies taking any medications.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Manic episode with rapid speech and grandiosity
Secondary_Symptoms: Expectation of winning a Nobel Prize
Pregnancy (8 weeks) with beliefs about the fetus's significance

Correct_Diagnosis: Atrialization of the right ventricle in the patient's fetus

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of persistent knee pain and swelling following total knee replacement.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with persistent right knee pain and swelling for 2 weeks after undergoing total knee replacement due to osteoarthritis six months ago.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Persistent right knee pain and swelling
Secondary_Symptoms: Warmth and erythema of the right knee
Limited range of motion due to pain

Knee_.Findings: Warmth and erythema of the right knee; limited range of motion due to pain

Microbiological_Test.Blood_Cultures: Grow gram-positive, catalase-positive cocci that grow on mannitol salt agar without color change

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a patient presenting with respiratory distress and altered mental status following coronary artery stent placement.

Patient_Actor.History: Two days after coronary artery stent placement for a posterior myocardial infarction. History of atrial fibrillation managed with verapamil. Post-stent medications include aspirin and clopidogrel.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Difficulty breathing and retrosternal chest pain

Auscultation.Findings: Diffuse crackles heard in the chest

Cardiac_Monitor.Findings: Normal sinus rhythm with T-wave inversion

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of muscle cramps and weakness in a patient with hypertension on hydrochlorothiazide.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient has been on hydrochlorothiazide for four weeks for hypertension and is also taking amlodipine. He presents with muscle cramps and weakness.

General_.Findings: No abnormalities noted on physical .

ECG.Findings: Precordial leads of a 12-lead ECG were shown.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify components of an analytical process aimed at preventing wrong site surgery.

Patient_Actor.History: A hospital committee is established to respond to a national report on the dangers of wrong site surgery.

Secondary_Symptoms: Investigating systemic, design, process, and service issues.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's mental health and identify the presence of delusional disorder.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been married for 20 years and has been convinced for the last 2 months that his wife is cheating on him, despite no evidence and denials from private investigators.

Secondary_Symptoms: Stress on both sides of the family
Stable job and ability to provide for children

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of knee pain and swelling in a pediatric patient with a family history of bleeding disorders.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department with pain and swelling of the right knee joint for 1 day, with no history of trauma. Healthy since birth. Maternal uncle has a history of a bleeding disorder.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pain and swelling of the right knee

Knee_.Findings: Right knee is erythematous, swollen, and tender with limited range of motion.

X-ray.Findings: Effusion with no structural abnormalities of the joint.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the type of diarrhea and assess the potential causes based on travel history and symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with diarrhea and fatigue for the past 6 days, which began before leaving Thailand. He denies any recent history of laxatives, nausea, or vomiting.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the mechanism of action of anidulafungin in the treatment of esophageal candidiasis in a patient with HIV.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of multiple hospitalizations due to opportunistic infections and poor adherence to her antiretroviral regimen. She presents with an 8-day history of severe pain while swallowing.

Secondary_Symptoms: Extensive white, plaque-like lesions in the proximal esophagus (as seen on endoscopy)

Endoscopy.Findings: Extensive white, plaque-like lesions in the proximal esophagus

Culture.Findings: Candida albicans grown from biopsy specimen

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the type of bias represented by a 49-year-old man with a family history of colorectal cancer enrolling in a study on screening in patients younger than 50.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a family history of colorectal cancer and is personally concerned about developing cancer, prompting his interest in enrolling in the study.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's gastrointestinal symptoms and familial cancer history to identify the type of polyps present in the colon.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-week history of alternating constipation and diarrhea with blood in her stool. There is no history of fever or weight loss. Family history includes a father who died of gastric cancer at age 50.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Alternating constipation and diarrhea with blood in stool

Skin_.Findings: Blue-gray macules on lips and palms

Colonoscopy.Findings: Multiple polyps throughout the small bowel and colon, with one ulcerated polyp at the level of the sigmoid colon

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of flank pain and hypotension following percutaneous coronary intervention.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department with sudden onset retrosternal chest pain. She was diagnosed with myocardial infarction, confirmed by elevated troponin I levels. After undergoing percutaneous catheterization for 2 occluded vessels, she reported flank pain during post-procedure evaluation.

Secondary_Symptoms: Extensive ecchymoses in the flanks and loin

Physical_.Findings: Extensive ecchymoses in the flanks and loin

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of severe abdominal pain, bloating, and diarrhea in a young male patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 6-month history of severe abdominal pain, bloating, and episodic diarrhea. He has experienced a 5-kg (11-lb) weight loss during this period.

Abdominal_.Findings: Mildly distended abdomen, hyperactive bowel sounds, diffuse abdominal tenderness

Biopsy.Findings: Scattered areas of inflammation with fibrosis and noncaseating granulomas

Correct_Diagnosis: Increased activity of type 1 T helper cells

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the most suitable tracer for measuring the volume of a specific body fluid compartment in subjects for an experiment.

Patient_Actor.History: N/A

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with swelling and pain in the breast postpartum.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has swelling of the right breast for the past 4 days, malaise, and pain with breastfeeding. She delivered a healthy 3500-g (7.7-lb) girl three weeks ago. No history of serious illness is reported. Family history includes a mother who died of breast cancer at age 55. Current medication is a multivitamin.

Breast_.Findings: Tender, firm, swollen, erythematous right breast; left breast shows no abnormalities.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate for possible connective tissue disorder based on physical findings and family history.

Patient_Actor.History: Presenting for a routine physical exam and meningitis vaccination prior to attending college on a basketball scholarship. Accompanied by father who appears to be in his mid-sixties and is much shorter.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Mild diastolic murmur (II/VI) over aortic valve
Secondary_Symptoms: Numerous red-to-white linear markings on skin around lower back

Cardiovascular.Findings: Mild diastolic murmur (II/VI) over aortic valve

Skin_.Findings: Numerous red-to-white linear markings on lower back

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the skin condition based on the description and  findings.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents 3 months after noticing skin changes on his scalp. He had a mole removed on his right forearm 5 years ago and is a retired winemaker.

Skin_.Findings: Multiple rough patches on the scalp

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's hematological status and associated symptoms in early pregnancy.

Patient_Actor.History: Presenting for the first prenatal visit at 12 weeks estimated gestational age. The patient is uncertain about the pregnancy but has now decided to keep it. She reports experiencing constant fatigue.

Secondary_Symptoms: Anemia indicated by hemoglobin level of 10.1 g/dL

General_.Findings: Conjunctival pallor

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage joint pain and effusion in a pediatric patient with a history suggestive of a bleeding disorder.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with recurrent joint pain and effusion in both knees, with episodes following minor trauma and some occurring spontaneously. He has a family history of similar issues in his uncle and grandfather. He is a long-distance runner currently training for a track and field meet.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Joint pain in the right knee
Secondary_Symptoms: Multiple episodes of pain and effusion in both knees
Pain on both passive and active range of motion

Joint_.Findings: Right knee is warm and nonerythematous with a large effusion

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of jaundice and hepatomegaly in a 13-year-old boy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with yellow discoloration of the sclerae for one day and dark-colored urine for two days. He had a cough, cold, and fever the week prior, treated with over-the-counter medications. He reports fatigue, nausea, and poor appetite since then. There is no history of recurrent nausea, vomiting, jaundice, or abdominal pain, and no blood transfusions. He frequently eats at a roadside restaurant. Growth and development are normal for his age and sex.

Abdominal_.Findings: Tender hepatomegaly with firm, sharp, and smooth edge

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the complications associated with a pediatric patient presenting with signs of meningitis and positive lumbar puncture findings.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department with fever, nausea, and headache for 1 day.

Secondary_Symptoms: Involuntary flexion of the knees and hips when neck is flexed

Neurological_.Findings: Involuntary flexion of the knees and hips when neck is flexed (positive Brudzinski's sign)

Cerebrospinal_Fluid_Analysis.Findings: Numerous segmented neutrophils and decreased glucose concentration

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of diarrhea following recent travel to Peru and educate the patient on food safety.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with 3 days of diarrhea, which began after returning from a vacation in Peru. She enjoyed local food and drink on her last day of the trip.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Watery diarrhea occurring 3-5 times per day
Secondary_Symptoms: No blood or mucus in stool

General_.Findings: Well appearing in no acute distress

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the appropriate antiarrhythmic drug for a patient experiencing acute chest pain with ST-segment depression.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is healthy and was rushed to the emergency department after experiencing sharp chest pain radiating down his left arm. Pre-hospital ECG showed ST-segment depression.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Sharp chest pain radiating down left arm

ECG.Findings: ST-segment depression

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of hypoglycemic episode in a patient with a history of symptoms suggestive of insulin excess.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient lost consciousness while shopping. Symptoms prior include sweating, tremulousness, confusion, headaches, milky discharge from both breasts, and nausea if meals are delayed. She has a history of tuberculosis treated 10 years ago, and family history is unknown due to adoption.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the implications of HIV viral load and genotype results on the patient's treatment plan regarding drug resistance.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is on antiretroviral therapy and presents for a follow-up . His HIV viral load is 559 copies/mL, indicating ongoing viral replication. Previous history includes concerns about drug resistance.

Secondary_Symptoms: Ongoing viral replication indicated by viral load of 559 copies/mL
Reduced susceptibility to darunavir and ritonavir

HIV_Testing.Genotype_Testing: Reduced viral susceptibility to darunavir and ritonavir

Objective_for_Doctor: Establish the diagnosis of knee pain following a long flight and a recent history of ACL injury.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with right knee pain for the last week, first noticed after a long flight from Russia where she ran a marathon. She has a history of a torn anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) from a soccer injury three years ago and was treated for gonorrhea last month after intercourse with a new partner.

Secondary_Symptoms: Dull, aching pain localized to the front of the kneecap
Pain worsens with sitting but improves with standing

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying cause of right arm numbness and weakness in a young woman with recent family trauma.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with right arm numbness and weakness. Past medical history is unremarkable. Family history is significant for the unexpected death of both parents in a motor vehicle accident last week.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of lightheadedness in a patient presenting with symptoms of anxiety and hyperventilation.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented due to lightheadedness after experiencing anxiety during her first job interview since graduating from college 3 months ago. Symptoms began while waiting outside the interviewer's office, leading to rapid breathing and feelings of faintness.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of neurological symptoms following a right hip revision surgery complicated by severe blood loss.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient underwent right hip revision surgery for infected prosthesis 12 hours ago. He has a history of total right hip replacement 2 years ago, hypertension, and type 2 diabetes mellitus. His father had hypoparathyroidism. He has been a smoker for 40 years, consuming one pack of cigarettes daily.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Numbness in fingertips and around the lips
Secondary_Symptoms: Facial muscle contraction upon cheek tapping

Neurological_.Findings: Adducted thumb, flexed metacarpophalangeal joints and wrists, extended fingers, and facial muscle contraction upon tapping.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of decreased urinary output following emergent laparotomy and splenectomy.

Patient_Actor.History: Two days after undergoing emergent laparotomy with splenectomy for a grade IV splenic laceration sustained in a motor vehicle collision, the patient developed decreased urinary output.

Secondary_Symptoms: Healing surgical incision in the upper abdomen
Multiple large ecchymoses of the superior right and left abdominal wall

Physical_.Findings: Healing surgical incision and multiple large ecchymoses on the abdominal wall

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of fever and sore throat in a 15-year-old girl with positive monospot test.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with fever and sore throat for the past 4 days. She has a boyfriend at school with similar symptoms. She was born at 39 weeks gestation via spontaneous vaginal delivery, is up to date on all vaccinations, and is meeting all developmental milestones.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the patient's symptoms and identify potential complications related to cardiac function.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with decreased exercise tolerance and difficulty breathing on exertion and at night for the past 6 months. Requires 2 pillows to sleep at night due to shortness of breath. No chronic health problems reported. Smoked 15 cigarettes per day for the past 20 years and drinks alcohol occasionally.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Difficulty breathing on exertion and while sleeping
Secondary_Symptoms: Shortness of breath requiring 2 pillows at night

Cardiac_.Findings: Loud first heart sound and low pitched rumbling murmur best heard at the cardiac apex

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of vaginal bleeding in a 39-week pregnant patient with a history of cesarean section.
