Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented with acute chest pain radiating to the left arm. He has a history of hypertension, diabetes mellitus, erectile dysfunction, benign prostate hyperplasia, and panic disorder. Medications include aspirin, lisinopril, metformin, sildenafil, prazosin, and citalopram. He underwent catheterization for a complete blockage of the left circumflex artery, receiving a stent and later discharged with clopidogrel and isosorbide mononitrate.

Secondary_Symptoms: Acute substernal chest pain radiating to the left arm

Physical_.Findings: Unremarkable

Electrocardiogram.Findings: Lateral Q waves without ST or T wave abnormalities

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage respiratory distress in a premature newborn while addressing patent ductus arteriosus.

Patient_Actor.Demographics: Newborn male, delivered by emergency Cesarean section at 28 weeks gestation
Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a birth weight of 1.2 kg (2.5 lb) and developed rapid breathing 4 hours after birth.

Chest_Radiograph.Findings: Bilateral diffuse reticulogranular opacities and poor lung expansion

Echocardiography.Findings: Patent ductus arteriosus with left-to-right shunt and signs of fluid overload

Correct_Diagnosis: Decreased blood flow in the vasa vasorum of the ductus arteriosus

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of leg cramps and heaviness in a patient with risk factors for vascular disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for an annual check-up, reporting occasional leg cramps and heaviness in the legs after prolonged standing. His medical history includes hypertension controlled by metoprolol and lisinopril. He is a long-term smoker (half a pack daily for 30 years) and does not consume alcohol. Family history includes myocardial infarction in his father at age 55.

Secondary_Symptoms: Heaviness in legs after standing for long hours
Tortuous veins in lower limbs, more pronounced on left leg

Lower_Limb_.Findings: Tortuous veins over lower limbs, no skin changes, peripheral pulses 2+ in all extremities, strength 5/5 bilaterally, intact sensation, no pain on dorsiflexion.

Correct_Diagnosis: Valvular incompetence of lower limb veins and increased venous pressure

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the behavioral concerns of a child and assess for possible attention-related disorders.

Patient_Actor.History: The mother reports concerns about her son's behavior as noted by his teacher. He has been having difficulties with assignments and frequently forgets them. This behavior has been ongoing for about 8 months, with recent worsening prompting the teacher's intervention.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Difficulty sitting still and completing assignments

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a primigravid woman presenting with vaginal bleeding in early pregnancy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with vaginal bleeding and mild suprapubic pain 1 hour ago. The bleeding has subsided, and she now has mild brown spotting. She has been taking folic acid and a multivitamin. She has a 10-year history of smoking one pack of cigarettes daily and occasional alcohol use, which she ceased 6 weeks ago.

Pelvic_.Findings: Closed cervical os; uterus consistent in size with an 8-week gestation

Ultrasonography.Findings: Intrauterine pregnancy with normal fetal cardiac activity

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the patient's mental health and suitability for prescribing a partial nicotine agonist for smoking cessation.

Patient_Actor.History: Presenting for a checkup with complaints of anxiety and persistent mood issues. Comorbidities include chronic gastritis treated with Helicobacter pylori eradication therapy and chronic pyelonephritis with stage 1 chronic kidney disease. Family history includes a grandfather who passed away from metastatic lung cancer. The patient has an 8-year history of smoking and is concerned about the health consequences. He has attempted to quit smoking multiple times using nicotine patches but has been unsuccessful due to unpleasant withdrawal symptoms and increased anxiety.

Secondary_Symptoms: Increased tobacco use over the past 12 months
Concerns about health due to smoking

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with suspected infective endocarditis and associated complications.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 6-day history of fever, chills, generalized weakness, chest pain, and night sweats. He has a bicuspid aortic valve and a history of recurrent migraine attacks. He has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 5 years and has a history of intravenous drug use, but has not used illicit drugs in the last two months. Current medications include propranolol and a multivitamin.

Cardiac_.Findings: Grade 3/6 high-pitched, early diastolic, decrescendo murmur best heard along the left sternal border; S3 gallop; diffuse crackles heard in lungs

Correct_Diagnosis: Mechanical valve replacement of the aortic valve

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the mechanism contributing to the gastrointestinal symptoms in a patient with a history of Crohn disease and recent ileocecal resection.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has Crohn disease and presents with a 4-week history of nausea, bloating, and epigastric pain after meals, radiating to the right shoulder. She underwent ileocecal resection for an acute intestinal obstruction four months ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: Radiating pain to the right shoulder

Ultrasound.Findings: Multiple echogenic foci with acoustic shadows in the gallbladder

Correct_Diagnosis: Decreased biliary concentration of bile acids

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of postpartum bleeding and abdominal pain in a patient following spontaneous delivery.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient delivered a male newborn at 39 weeks' gestation. She was admitted 5 hours prior due to spontaneous rupture of membranes. During labor, she experienced inadequate contractions, which resolved with IV oxytocin. The placenta was extracted manually after multiple attempts of controlled cord traction and fundal pressure. No significant past medical history except for occasional nosebleeds.

Secondary_Symptoms: Brisk vaginal bleeding from a round mass protruding from the vagina

Abdominal_.Findings: Fundus not palpable on abdominal exam

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of sudden onset severe abdominal pain in a patient with significant vital sign abnormalities.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a sudden onset of severe, generalized abdominal pain rated 9 out of 10 in intensity. She has a history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and chronic lower back pain. Menstrual cycles are regular with moderate flow, last 4 days, and her last menstrual period was 2 weeks ago. She is sexually active with one male partner and uses condoms inconsistently. She has a long history of smoking (one pack daily for 15 years) and consumes 2-3 beers on weekends. Current medications include ranitidine, hydrochlorothiazide, atorvastatin, and ibuprofen.

Abdominal_.Findings: Distended, tympanic abdomen with diffuse tenderness, guarding, rebound tenderness, and absent bowel sounds

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the mechanisms of platelet function in hemostasis and the role of alpha-granules in platelet adhesion.

Patient_Actor.History: An investigator is studying the role of different factors in inflammation and hemostasis.

Secondary_Symptoms: Isolation of alpha-granules from activated platelets
Application of granules to inactive platelets

Test_Results.Findings: Binding of granules to GpIb receptors induces a conformational change in platelets.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of an itchy rash and provide preventive advice based on the patient's history of atopic dermatitis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with an itchy rash on his right arm for 1 day, which started as small papules and progressed into blisters with oozing. He has a history of atopic dermatitis at age 6.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of persistent fever and rash in a 5-year-old girl.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 5-day history of persistent fever (41.0°C / 105.8°F) not relieved by Tylenol and a rash that started on the trunk and has spread to palms and soles.

Secondary_Symptoms: Rash on trunk, palms, and soles
Significant swelling of distal upper and lower extremities bilaterally
Generalized edema with non-palpable cervical lymphadenopathy

Overall_.Findings: Agitated and ill-appearing, significant swelling of extremities, hyperemic pharynx, generalized edema

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the patient's persistent anxiety and paranoid thoughts following a traumatic event.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-month history of persistent thoughts and anxiety about being harmed after witnessing a pedestrian being hit by a car 2 weeks ago. He reports taking detours to avoid potential threats and feels burdened by coursework, fearing failure from professors.

Secondary_Symptoms: Avoidance behavior (leaving early to avoid people)

Mental_Status_Exam.Findings: Alert and oriented, full range of affect, organized thought processes and speech, normal memory and attention, denies hallucinations.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of blurry vision, headaches, and facial pain in a patient with a history of type 1 diabetes mellitus.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with blurry vision and headaches that started 2 days ago. She has had facial pain, initially thought to be related to a toothache, and is concerned about a black spot on her face that has been increasing in size over the last month. She has frequent urination and had a recent runny nose and cough that resolved spontaneously. She was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes mellitus at 13 years of age, is a non-smoker, and drinks beer occasionally.

Secondary_Symptoms: Black necrotic eschar lateral to the right nasal ala
Weight loss (2.7 kg / 6 lb since last visit)

Physical_.Findings: Normal  except for a black necrotic eschar lateral to the right nasal ala.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of symptoms related to potential hypersecretion from a sellar mass.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-month history of headache, palpitations, diarrhea, and weight loss. She is not taking any medications.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage exercise-induced asthma in a patient who experiences symptoms during volleyball practice.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a wellness checkup. She reports being well overall but unable to engage in exercise due to asthma symptoms that occur once a week during volleyball practice.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Inability to exercise due to asthma
Secondary_Symptoms: Uses albuterol inhaler once a month

Pulmonary_.Findings: Good bilateral air movement without wheezing

Correct_Diagnosis: Recommend she use her albuterol inhaler prior to exercise

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with a head injury and neurological deficits following a traumatic event.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted to the emergency room after being hit in the head with a hammer during a fight. Initially lost consciousness, regained it by the time emergency services arrived. He does not remember events prior to the loss of consciousness.

Secondary_Symptoms: Inability to elevate left hand and leg
Poor response of pupils to light
Decreased power in left upper and lower limbs

Neurological_.Findings: Bruising in the right frontotemporal region, hyperreflexia, decreased power in left limbs, no Kernig and Brudzinski signs

CT_Scan.Findings: Details not provided in the scenario

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the ultrasound findings in a pregnant patient and assess for potential risks of chromosomal abnormalities.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents for a prenatal visit at 12 weeks gestation. She has a history of stopping alcohol consumption at 10 weeks gestation due to pregnancy and does not smoke cigarettes.

Correct_Diagnosis: To increase the diagnostic accuracy of this result, the levels of free beta-hCG and pregnancy-associated plasma protein A (PAPP-A) should be determined.

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the etiology of a severe blistering skin condition with systemic symptoms and respiratory distress.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with fever, cough, tonsillar enlargement, and bleeding lips. She has a diffuse blistering rash covering 55% of her total body surface area (TBSA), which progresses to 88% TBSA involvement within 24 hours.

Skin_.Findings: Rash encompassing palms and soles with easy detachment of the upper epidermal layer upon slight rubbing

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of palpitations, anxiety, and weight loss in a previously healthy female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presented with palpitations and anxiety for the past 2 months, along with a weight loss of 3.1 kg (7 lbs).

Secondary_Symptoms: Fine resting tremor of the hands

Cardiac_.Findings: Normal heart sounds with a regular rhythm

Neurologic_.Findings: Fine resting tremor of the hands; patellar reflexes are 3+ bilaterally with a shortened relaxation phase

Correct_Diagnosis: ↓ TSH, ↑ Free T4, ↑ Free T3, Normal Thyroxine-binding globulin

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue, itchiness, and jaundice in a patient suspected of having liver disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with fatigue and itchiness for the past 2 months, worsening over the last month. She has tried body lotion with limited improvement and reports insomnia due to intense itching. She also complains of decreased appetite. No significant past medical history, and non-smoker with no alcohol use. Family history includes a father with diabetes and a mother with hypothyroidism.

Abdominal_.Findings: Negative

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of back pain in a 14-year-old boy, considering potential musculoskeletal disorders.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with back pain for the past six months, which worsens with exercise and when reclining. He participates in high school swimming and weightlifting. No history of trauma or joint issues; father has a disc herniation.

Secondary_Symptoms: Pain radiating down the ipsilateral leg with passive leg raising
Displacement of adjacent vertebrae at lumbosacral area

Musculoskeletal_.Findings: Palpation reveals displacement of two adjacent vertebrae at different levels; muscle strength is normal; sensation intact.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a patient with suspected meningitis following a seizure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents to the emergency room after a seizure. He had an upper respiratory infection complicated by sinusitis two weeks ago. His past medical history includes hypertension, for which he takes hydrochlorothiazide.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the cause of painless vaginal bleeding in early pregnancy, and assess the findings of an ultrasound indicating a potential molar pregnancy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with painless vaginal bleeding of sudden onset while currently in the 13th week of pregnancy. She has a history of hyperemesis gravidarum diagnosed during the 6th week of pregnancy.

Secondary_Symptoms: Increased uterine size for gestational age

General_.Findings: Pallor noted

Abdominal_.Findings: Uterine enlargement greater than expected for 13 weeks of gestation

Ultrasound.Findings: Absence of a fetus and presence of an intrauterine mass with multiple cystic spaces resembling a bunch of grapes

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of anemia and fatigue in a patient with a history of colonic polyps and family history of a bicuspid aortic valve.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-week history of fatigue and shortness of breath. A screening colonoscopy one year ago showed colonic polyps, and the patient's brother has a bicuspid aortic valve.

Secondary_Symptoms: Late systolic crescendo-decrescendo murmur at the right upper sternal border

Cardiac_.Findings: Late systolic crescendo-decrescendo murmur at the right upper sternal border

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of altered mental status and poor perfusion in a 5-day-old infant.

Patient_Actor.History: The infant was born via cesarean section due to preterm premature rupture of membranes (PPROM). He has gained little weight since birth and has been generally fussy. The mother called an ambulance after finding him grey and unarousable.

Findings: Wet rales in the inferior lungs bilaterally

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cause of microscopic hematuria in a patient with a history of hypertension and smoking.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has been generally healthy, with a history of elevated blood pressure but has declined medication. He is a long-term smoker (40 years) and consumes 1 beer daily. He has no current health complaints and enjoys time with his grandchildren.

General_.Findings: Well-appearing man with no physical abnormalities

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying process associated with eyelid lesions in a patient with a 1-month history of symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 1-month history of lesions on her eyelids. A photograph of the lesions is available for assessment.

Correct_Diagnosis: Autoimmune destruction of lobular bile ducts

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of right lower quadrant and flank pain in a patient with a history of atrial fibrillation and recent hypotension.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-day onset of right lower quadrant and right flank pain. He has experienced dizziness, light-headedness, and shortness of breath during this period. His medical history includes atrial fibrillation, hypertension, and hyperlipidemia, with medications including atorvastatin, losartan, and coumadin.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Right lower quadrant and right flank pain

Physical_.Findings: Bruising over the right flank and irregularly irregular heart rhythm

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with a skin rash and gastrointestinal symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has presented with a skin rash over both shoulders and elbows for the past 5 days, accompanied by severe itching and burning. He has a history of recurrent episodes of diarrhea and abdominal cramps over the past three months, describing his stools as greasy and foul-smelling.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Skin rash with severe itching and burning sensation

Skin_.Findings: Symmetrical rash over shoulders and knees, with no separation of upper epidermal layer on rubbing

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the causal organism of a painful lesion in a pediatric patient with lymphadenopathy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 2-day history of low-grade fever and a painful lesion on her right index finger. She was born at term and has been healthy except for a rash on her upper lip 2 weeks ago, which resolved without treatment. She lives at home with her parents, her 5-year-old brother, and two cats.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Painful lesion on right index finger

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the risk of chromosomal abnormalities in a fetus based on quad screen results and ultrasound findings.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents at 17 weeks gestation for routine follow-up. A quad screen was performed revealing elevated inhibin and beta HCG, decreased alpha-fetoprotein (aFP) and estriol. An ultrasound showed increased nuchal translucency.

Correct_Diagnosis: Epicanthal folds, macroglossia, flat profile, depressed nasal bridge, and simian palmar crease associated with Down syndrome (Trisomy 21)

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of seizures and failure to thrive in a 3-month-old boy with hypotonia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought in for evaluation due to seizures and failure to thrive. The mother reports that he is unable to hold his head up and does not follow the movement of her fingers. A family history of severe neurological impairments and early death in a maternal uncle is noted.

Neurological_.Findings: Hypotonia observed during physical

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the affected vessel in a patient with pain and swelling in the left leg, considering his history of pancreatic cancer and recent chemotherapy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with pain and swelling in his left leg. He has a history of pancreatic cancer and is currently receiving chemotherapy. He previously had a similar episode in his right arm three weeks ago that resolved without treatment.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pain and swelling in the left leg
Secondary_Symptoms: Tender, cord-shaped structure medial to the medial condyle of the femur

Leg_.Findings: Tender, cord-shaped structure medial to the medial condyle of the femur; erythematous skin overlying the area

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying process affecting hepatocyte health in a patient with fever, jaundice, and gastrointestinal symptoms following a recent trip to South America.

Patient_Actor.History: Admitted to the hospital with fever, yellowing of the skin, and nausea for 1 day after returning from a backpacking trip to Brazil and Paraguay. He had a 3-day episode of high fever during the trip that resolved spontaneously.

Physical_.Findings: Jaundice, epigastric tenderness, petechiae over the trunk

Liver_Biopsy.Findings: Eosinophilic degeneration of hepatocytes with condensed nuclear chromatin

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient with suspected thyroid carcinoma and associated symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with sudden shortness of breath. She reports 6 months of fatigue, depression, and flushing, which she attributed to menopause. A CT scan revealed multiple nodules in the left lung.

Thyroid_.Findings: Palpable nodule of 2.5 cm in the left lobe of the thyroid gland; firm and non-tender. Cervical lymphadenopathy is present.

Cytology.Findings: High likelihood of thyroid carcinoma from fine needle aspiration.

CT_Scan.Findings: Multiple nodules in the left lung.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of diarrhea and abdominal bloating in a patient with recent antibiotic use.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-month history of abdominal bloating, feeling full after small amounts of food, and has experienced diarrhea and occasional vomiting when trying to eat larger amounts. His diarrhea has become more profuse and affects his quality of life. He was treated with antibiotics for an ear infection one week ago. He is trying to eat healthier by replacing full-fat dairy with fat-free options and reducing meat consumption.

Secondary_Symptoms: Feeling full after small amounts of food

Objective_for_Doctor: Confirm the diagnosis of peritonitis in a patient presenting with severe abdominal pain.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with severe abdominal pain and has a past medical history significant for a peptic ulcer.

Secondary_Symptoms: Refusal to allow abdominal palpation due to pain

Abdominal_.Findings: Patient will not allow abdominal palpation due to pain.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of peripheral neuropathy and anemia in a patient with elevated serum homocysteine and methylmalonic acid levels.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a one-month history of numbness and tingling in fingers and toes, along with difficulty maintaining balance while walking.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Numbness and tingling in fingers and toes

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate treatment for spinal cord compression due to metastatic breast cancer.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient with known breast cancer presents with progressive motor weakness in bilateral lower extremities and difficulty ambulating. Neurologic  two weeks prior was normal.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Progressive motor weakness in bilateral lower extremities

Neurological_.Findings: 4 of 5 motor strength in legs and hyper-reflexia in patellar tendons

Imaging.MRI_Findings: Significant spinal cord compression by metastatic lesion and complete erosion of the T12 vertebrae

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the visual impairment in a young woman and evaluate the genetic implications for her children.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with new onset difficulty in seeing despite having perfect vision previously. There is a family history of visual loss in her two older brothers.

Visual_Exam.Findings: Bilateral loss of central vision with decreased visual acuity and color perception.

Pathological_.Findings: Degeneration of retinal ganglion cells bilaterally.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the risk factors and potential complications associated with a genetic mutation in a young patient presenting with severe myopia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with gradual worsening of her vision. Her father died at 40 years of age, raising concerns for hereditary conditions.

Correct_Diagnosis: Intimal tear of the aortic root

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose a pediatric patient with prolonged fever and systemic symptoms to identify potential complications.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the pediatrician with a 5-day history of fever and 3-day history of irritability, decreased appetite, vomiting, and swelling of the hands and feet. The patient has been taking antibiotics and antipyretics for the last 3 days without improvement.

General_.Findings: Bilateral edema of hands and feet, palpable nontender cervical lymph node (2.5 cm diameter) on the right side, conjunctival injection.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue and respiratory symptoms in an elderly woman with anemia and splenomegaly.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with increasing fatigue over the last month and shortness of breath during walks. She recently moved to an old house and started a new Mediterranean diet. Her past medical history includes hypertension and osteoarthritis, for which she underwent a right hip replacement 2 years ago.

Secondary_Symptoms: Shortness of breath during physical activity

Physical_Exam.Findings: Conjunctival pallor and splenomegaly

Peripheral_Blood_Smear.Findings: Spherical red blood cells and spontaneous aggregation at room temperature

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the cardiovascular status and management options for a pregnant patient presenting with palpitations.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient recently found out she was pregnant and is at 10 weeks gestation. She has no history of any major diseases.

Secondary_Symptoms: Diastolic decrescendo 3/6 murmur best heard at the apex

Cardiac_.Findings: Opening snap before S2 and diastolic decrescendo 3/6 murmur best heard at the apex; no jugular venous distension or peripheral edema noted.

Electrocardiogram.Findings: ECG findings are provided in the image (not specified in text).

Correct_Diagnosis: Beta-blockers are the preferable drug class for rate control in this case.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and determine the cause of a sudden, severe headache with accompanying symptoms.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a progressively generalized headache that started suddenly 2 hours ago, rating it as 10 out of 10 in intensity. He had a similar headache 1 week ago that resolved without treatment. He has a significant smoking history of one pack daily for 35 years.

Secondary_Symptoms: Aggravation of pain by lying down
Vomiting once en route to the hospital

Neurological_.Findings: Pupils equal and reactive to light, normal extraocular movements, no weakness or sensory loss, reflexes 2+ throughout, neck flexion causes worsening of the pain.

Correct_Diagnosis: CT scan of the head without contrast

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the appropriateness of influenza vaccination in a patient with a reported egg allergy.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient has never received an influenza vaccination due to an allergy to eggs, diagnosed many years ago after developing hives upon eating scrambled eggs.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Nervousness about receiving the influenza vaccine
Secondary_Symptoms: Reports of past hives from egg consumption

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage respiratory distress in a patient with HIV presenting with severe symptoms and low CD4 count.

Patient_Actor.History: Diagnosed with HIV infection 3 months ago, non-compliant with antiretroviral therapy, brought to the emergency department for respiratory distress.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a 7-year-old boy for signs of precocious puberty and determine the underlying cause.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the pediatrician by parents due to pubic hair growth and changes in voice. The patient has been developing in the 98th percentile for his age, and his vaccinations are up-to-date.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pubic hair growth and changes in voice

Physical_.Findings: Pubic and armpit hair; Tanner stage 2 with enlarged scrotum and testes

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of fatigue, skin changes, and joint pain in a patient with beta-thalassemia major.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-month history of fatigue, darkening of the skin, and pain in her ankle joints. She reports increased thirst and frequent urination for 2 weeks. She has beta-thalassemia major and receives approximately 5 blood transfusions per year, with the last transfusion being 3 months ago.

General_.Findings: Hyperpigmented skin, scleral icterus, and pale mucous membranes.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the risk of complications related to elevated calcium levels and plasma cell findings in a patient with possible plasma cell dyscrasia.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine checkup with no current complaints. Routine blood work shows slightly elevated calcium levels and the presence of plasma cells in a peripheral blood smear (less than 10%).

Secondary_Symptoms: Plasma cells found in peripheral blood smear

Blood_Tests.Plasma Cells: Less than 10% in peripheral blood smear
Blood_Tests.Serum Protein Electrophoresis: Slight increase in gamma protein, light chain predominant

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the etiology of acute breathlessness and hypoxemia in a young obese female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with acute breathlessness for the last hour and is unable to provide further history due to dyspnea.

Physical_.Findings: Obesity, labored breathing, decreased breath sounds, hyperresonance to percussion across all lung fields bilaterally

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of episodic abdominal pain following meals in an elderly female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has experienced episodic abdominal pain following meals for the past few years, with worsening episodes over the past month. She has a significant past medical history of type 2 diabetes mellitus diagnosed 30 years ago, managed with metformin. Her most recent HbA1C last month was 10%.

Secondary_Symptoms: Worsening abdominal pain over the past month

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of acute liver injury and determine appropriate management.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a history of osteoarthritis and presents with a 2-day history of nausea and vomiting. She has been taking painkillers for worsening knee pain over the past few weeks.

Abdominal_.Findings: Tender hepatomegaly

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the management plan for a pediatric patient with a recent episode of acute otitis media who is asymptomatic except for mild fullness in the left ear after antibiotic therapy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was diagnosed with her first episode of acute otitis media 10 days ago and was prescribed oral amoxicillin. Initial symptoms included ear pain, fever, and nasal congestion. No history of chronic nasal obstruction or chronic/recurrent rhinosinusitis.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Mild fullness in the left ear
Secondary_Symptoms: Asymptomatic after 10 days of antibiotic therapy

Otoscopic_.Findings: Presence of an air-fluid interface behind the translucent tympanic membrane and decreased mobility of the tympanic membrane.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of frequent and voluminous urination in an elderly female patient with a new medication history.

Patient_Actor.History: Recently moved to the US from Europe to live with her grandson. No prior medical records available. Reports taking aspirin, omeprazole, naproxen, and lithium daily.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Frequent and voluminous urination for 2 weeks
Secondary_Symptoms: Increased fluid intake (4-5 L of water daily)

Physical_.Findings: Dry mucous membranes

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a case of acute scrotal pain to rule out testicular torsion.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with sudden severe groin pain and swelling of the left testicle, starting roughly 5 hours ago. He has a history of multiple sexual partners but uses condoms regularly.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Sudden severe groin pain and swelling of the left testicle

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the definitive treatment for a patient with symptoms and findings suggestive of ulcerative colitis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with lower abdominal pain, bloating, bloody diarrhea, and fullness that have become more frequent over the last 3 months. A rectal  reveals a small amount of bright red blood.

Rectal_.Findings: Small amount of bright red blood

Colonoscopy.Findings: Extensive mucosal erythema, induration, and pseudopolyps extending from the rectum to the splenic flexure

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of a persistent rash in a 5-month-old boy.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the pediatrician for a new rash that started several weeks earlier and has not changed. No significant past medical, surgical, or family history. The boy has been breastfed since birth and started experimenting with soft foods at 4 months.

Secondary_Symptoms: Erythematous plaques with shiny, yellow scales over the scalp and external ears

Skin_.Findings: Erythematous plaques with shiny, yellow scales over the scalp and external ears

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the genetic risk for Tay-Sachs disease in a patient with a family history of the condition.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine health checkup with no complaints. Family history includes 2 siblings who died from Tay-Sachs disease. The patient and her parents are phenotypically normal.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the underlying cause of short stature and associated physical findings in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for short stature. She is in third grade and is the shortest child in her class. She is otherwise doing well in school with a good social life and has a history of mild hearing loss attributed to recurrent otitis media. Family history includes hypothyroidism in her mother and hypertension in her father.

Secondary_Symptoms: Broad chest with widely spaced nipples

Correct_Diagnosis: Continuous, flow murmur best heard in the interscapular region

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of altered mental status and initiate appropriate treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department by his son for odd behavior. He has a past medical history of constipation, seasonal allergies, alcohol abuse, and IV drug abuse. Current medications include diphenhydramine, metoprolol, and disulfiram.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Dry, red, and flushed skin; tachycardia; patient appears uncomfortable

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of sudden onset right-sided weakness and speech difficulties in a 15-year-old boy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with sudden onset right-sided weakness of his arm and face and difficulty speaking. Denies any history of chest pain, hypertension, or diabetes mellitus. No significant past medical history.

Secondary_Symptoms: Facial droop on the right side
Dislocated lens in the right eye
Positive Babinski reflex on the right

Neurological_.Findings: Strength 3 out of 5 in the right upper extremity

Ophthalmic_.Findings: Dislocated lens in the right eye

CT_Scan.Findings: No evidence of hemorrhage

Laboratory.Findings: Increased concentrations of a metabolic intermediate in serum and urine

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the appropriateness of exenatide therapy in a patient with type 2 diabetes and a history of cardiovascular disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a past medical history significant for type 2 diabetes mellitus and a history of myocardial infarction. Current medications include aspirin, lisinopril, metoprolol, atorvastatin, and metformin.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Elevated HbA1c and fasting blood glucose levels

Correct_Diagnosis: It does not decrease cardiovascular outcomes.

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the physiological mechanisms involved in temperature regulation during exposure to cold stimuli.

Patient_Actor.History: Volunteered for an experiment in the physiology laboratory where her oral temperature was recorded before and after exposure to ice cold water.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Pale and cold hands after immersion in ice cold water

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the respiratory condition and determine the underlying cause of acute shortness of breath in a severe smoker.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with progressive shortness of breath, productive cough, and fever for the past 2 days. He has a significant smoking history of 40 pack-years and has been hospitalized twice in the past year for similar symptoms.

Secondary_Symptoms: Wheezing and rhonchi in the right lung

Vital_Signs.Clinical_Status: Quickly stabilizes after supplemental oxygen is given

Auscultation.Findings: Wheezing and rhonchi detected in the right lung

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of the erythematous and swollen umbilical cord in a 1-month-old infant.

Patient_Actor.History: The infant was born to a primigravida with no complications and initially presented with an ear infection treated with antibiotics. He returned 1 month later with an erythematous and swollen umbilical cord still attached to the umbilicus.

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the cardiac condition of a patient with a history of myocardial infarction and current well-being.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for a routine check-up, feeling well. He has a history of hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, recurrent panic attacks, and a myocardial infarction 3 years ago. He underwent left inguinal hernia repair at age 25. A colonoscopy performed 2 years ago was normal. He has a family history of prostate cancer (father at age 70) and has a significant smoking history (one pack daily for 25 years, quit after MI). He consumes one to two beers on weekends and has never used illicit drugs.

Cardiac_.Findings: High-frequency, mid-to-late systolic murmur best heard at the apex

Lung_.Findings: Lungs clear to auscultation

Abdominal_.Findings: Soft and nontender abdomen

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of a pruritic rash in a 13-month-old girl following recent immunizations.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a pruritic rash for 2 days, with isolated skin lesions on her trunk that appeared after receiving routine immunizations 18 days ago. There are no known sick contacts, and the mother has been giving ibuprofen for symptoms.

Secondary_Symptoms: Maculopapular and pustular lesions on face and trunk

Skin_.Findings: Few maculopapular and pustular lesions distributed over the face and trunk, with excoriation marks and crusted lesions.

Correct_Diagnosis: Replication of the attenuated vaccine strain

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the behavioral issues of a 9-year-old boy and determine the most likely diagnosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The boy has shown progressively more disruptive behavior in class, poor academic performance, and difficulties with focus. He has a history of being destructive to classroom property and has been avoided by classmates.

Secondary_Symptoms: Destruction of a classmate's art project
Involved in an incident causing gangrene to a cat

Objective_for_Doctor: Select an appropriate sedating agent for a short surgical procedure with rapid onset and short duration.

Patient_Actor.History: N/A

Secondary_Symptoms: Preparation for a short surgical procedure

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a patient presenting with hyperthermia and signs of possible heat stroke.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department after collapsing at work. He experienced light-headedness, nausea, and a headache approximately 30 minutes prior to collapsing. He has no significant past medical history.

Neurological_.Findings: Equal and reactive pupils, 2+ deep tendon reflexes, neck supple

Urine.Findings: Dark brown urine collected via urinary catheter

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the site of nerve compression causing episodic tingling and numbness in the patient's right hand.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with episodic tingling and numbness in the right hand for the past 3 months, worsening in the evening. He has no history of trauma and is employed as a carpenter. He has a significant smoking history of 1 pack of cigarettes daily for the past 10 years and drinks a pint of vodka daily. He does not use illicit drugs.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Episodic tingling and numbness in the right hand
Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased pinch strength in the right hand
Decreased sensation over the little finger and both dorsal and palmar surfaces of the medial aspect of the right hand

Neurological_.Findings: Decreased pinch strength in the right hand and decreased sensation over the little finger and medial aspect of the right hand

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the psychiatric condition of a young man exhibiting signs of anxiety and psychosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient dropped out of graduate school and moved back home 8 months ago. His mother is concerned about his health and behavior.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Anxiety and preoccupation with thoughts of school and getting a job
Secondary_Symptoms: Odd behavior (wearing winter jacket in summer)
Auditory hallucinations (hears voices he cannot understand)
Paranoia (describes a plot to have him killed with poison seeping from the walls)

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of acute neurological symptoms and signs suggestive of increased intracranial pressure in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department 30 minutes after found screaming and clutching his head. He has had nausea and vomiting for 1 week, fever and left-sided headaches for 2 weeks, and increasing tooth pain for 3 weeks. No history of ear or sinus infections.

Neurological_.Findings: Confused, only oriented to person, pupils react sluggishly to light, fundoscopic  shows bilateral papilledema, extraocular movements normal, flexion of the neck causes hip flexion.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of developmental delays and malnutrition in a 5-year-old child from an immigrant family.

Patient_Actor.History: The child is brought in for a wellness visit. He appears indifferent, does not make eye contact, and keeps to himself.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Indifference and lack of eye contact
Secondary_Symptoms: Height and weight below the 5th percentile
Multiple zones of hyper- and hypopigmentation

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of excessive urination and initiate appropriate management.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with excessive urination, reporting urinating 10 times a day and multiple times at night. Symptoms worsened after increasing fluid intake upon advice from a physical trainer. He has a history of migraines and bipolar I disorder, and is taking metoprolol, lithium, and naproxen as needed.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of right upper quadrant pain and assess for potential liver pathology.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with dull right upper quadrant pain worsening over several weeks. Past medical history includes endometriosis managed with oral contraceptives and follicular thyroid cancer with total thyroidectomy. She consumes a six-pack of beer most nights and has a 20 pack-year smoking history. Recently visited cousins in Mexico with dogs.

Abdominal_.Findings: Soft and non-distended abdomen with tenderness in the right upper quadrant and palpable hepatomegaly

RUQ Ultrasound.Findings: Solitary, well-demarcated, heterogeneous 6 cm mass in the right lobe of the liver

CT Scan.Findings: Peripheral enhancement during the early phase with centripetal flow during the portal venous phase

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the pathophysiological changes occurring in a patient with acute myocardial infarction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a sudden onset of 'vice-like' chest pain associated with diaphoresis and pain radiating to the left shoulder. He has ST elevations on EKG and elevated cardiac enzymes.

Correct_Diagnosis: Decreased cardiac output; increased systemic vascular resistance

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of primary amenorrhea in a 17-year-old female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: Presented with concerns of primary amenorrhea. Denies any symptoms and appears unconcerned. Review of systems is negative.

General_.Findings: Age-appropriate development of secondary sexual characteristics; no significant abnormalities on heart, lung, or abdominal .

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and initiate management for a patient with hypertension and complications from diabetes.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with fatigue, weight gain of 5.5 kg (12.1 lb), and intermittent nausea over the past 4 months. She has had type 2 diabetes mellitus for 27 years, complicated by diabetic neuropathy.

Fundoscopic_.Findings: Bilateral micro-aneurysms and cotton wool patches

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the statistical significance of intelligence quotient scores in relation to crime rates.

Patient_Actor.History: Students were assessed for intelligence quotient and their criminal and disciplinary records were reviewed.

Correct_Diagnosis: 97.5% of students scored lower than him

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cardiovascular status of a 14-year-old male with exercise-induced shortness of breath and cyanosis.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with complaints of shortness of breath and easy fatigability during prolonged exercise. He reports a bluish-gray discoloration of his lower legs and feet during exercise. He has not seen a doctor since elementary school.

Secondary_Symptoms: Bluish-gray discoloration of lower legs and feet

Correct_Diagnosis: Continuous, machine-like murmur at the left infraclavicular area

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of severe diarrhea and electrolyte imbalances in a patient with an intra-abdominal mass.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 1-week history of severe diarrhea characterized by watery stools every 2-3 hours. There is no presence of blood in the stools.

CT_Scan.Findings: Small intra-abdominal mass

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of shortness of breath, chest pain, and cough in a patient with a history of cardiovascular and respiratory conditions.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with shortness of breath, chest pain, and cough for 2 days. Relevant medical history includes congestive heart failure, hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and hyperlipidemia. He has a significant smoking history of half a pack of cigarettes daily for 25 years. Current medications include metoprolol, lisinopril, spironolactone, metformin, and simvastatin.

Secondary_Symptoms: Chest pain exacerbated by deep inspiration

Findings: Dullness to percussion in right lower lung field
Increased tactile fremitus in right lower lung field
Bronchial breath sounds over right lower lung field
Whispered pectoriloquy over right lower lung field

Objective_for_Doctor: Understand the vascular anatomy relevant to sleeve gastrectomy and identify the artery that will need to be ligated during the procedure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for weight loss surgery after unsuccessful attempts with multiple dietary and exercise regimens.

Secondary_Symptoms: Weight loss attempts with dietary changes

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the impact of stress on hormonal regulation and metabolic enzyme activity following a head injury.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department after slipping on ice and hitting her head on the pavement. She retained consciousness and was brought to the ER within an hour of the incident.

Secondary_Symptoms: Potential signs of stress response due to the incident

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of fever, sore throat, nausea, vomiting, and bloody diarrhea in a pediatric patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-day history of high fever, sore throat, nausea, vomiting, and bloody diarrhea. Symptoms began approximately 3 weeks after the family got a new dog. Several other children at the patient's preschool have been sick with similar symptoms.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of penile discharge and determine appropriate treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a complaint of yellowish watery penile discharge for one week. He experiences painful urination in the mornings and persistent genital pain throughout the day. He denies fever, body aches, or joint pains. No significant past medical history or current medications. He has regular intercourse without always using condoms.

Secondary_Symptoms: Lingering pain in the genital region

Physical_.Findings: Unremarkable

Microbiological_Test.Findings: Penile discharge collected and sent for analysis

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of sore throat and associated systemic symptoms in a 16-year-old male.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents with a sore throat, preceded by several days of malaise and fatigue. He has a history of seasonal allergies and asthma and is a high school student on the wrestling team. Current medications include cetirizine and albuterol.

Physical_.Findings: Splenomegaly and posterior cervical lymphadenopathy

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the origin of a pulmonary thrombus in a patient with recent travel history and risk factors for thromboembolism.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was brought to the emergency department by her husband due to chest pain and a cough productive of blood-tinged sputum that started 1 hour ago. She returned from a trip to China two days prior and has a history of smoking 1 pack of cigarettes daily for 35 years. Her only home medication is oral hormone replacement therapy for postmenopausal hot flashes.

Physical_.Findings: Distended neck veins

ECG.Findings: Sinus tachycardia, right bundle branch block, T-wave inversion in leads V5-V6

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying mechanism of renal failure in a patient presenting with generalized fatigue and malaise.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has generalized fatigue and malaise for 3 months. Four months ago, she was treated for a urinary tract infection with trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole. Medical history includes hypertension, asthma, chronic lower back pain, and chronic headaches. Current medications are hydrochlorothiazide, an albuterol inhaler, naproxen, and an aspirin-caffeine combination.

Physical__Findings.Findings: Conjunctival pallor

Ultrasound.Findings: Shrunken kidneys with irregular contours and papillary calcifications

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and manage a patient with symptoms of depression and evaluate treatment response.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 1-month history of depressed mood, difficulty sleeping, feelings of worthlessness, decreased interest in his hobby, and difficulty performing at work. No significant past medical history or substance use is noted.

Secondary_Symptoms: 7% unintentional weight gain over the past month

Physical_.Findings: Unremarkable

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with excessive daytime sleepiness, potential narcolepsy symptoms, and obesity.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient complains of feeling sleepy all the time with an uncontrollable urge to take multiple naps during the day. She experiences hypnagogic hallucinations (seeing strange shadows) before falling asleep and has sleep paralysis (feeling 'stuck' after waking). No significant past medical history or current medications. Denies smoking, alcohol, or recreational drug use. Family history of obesity and hypertension.

Physical_.Findings: Unremarkable

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of chronic pelvic pain and vaginal discharge in a sexually active young woman.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with chronic pelvic pain, especially during sexual intercourse, and new onset yellowish vaginal discharge. She has no significant past medical history and does not take contraceptive pills due to a copper intrauterine device. She smokes 2-3 cigarettes daily and drinks beer on weekends. She admits to being sexually active with over 10 partners since the age of 14.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Chronic pelvic pain during sexual intercourse

Bimanual_.Findings: Tender adnexa and uterus with cervical motion tenderness

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the complications of type 1 diabetes mellitus, particularly focusing on neuropathy and potential autonomic dysfunction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has type 1 diabetes mellitus with a 10-month history of nighttime tingling in his feet and two recent falls. He underwent retinal laser photocoagulation three years ago. Current medications include insulin and lisinopril, but he admits to non-adherence with his insulin regimen. He does not smoke or drink alcohol.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Tingling of the feet at night
Secondary_Symptoms: Decreased sense of vibration and proprioception in toes and ankles

Neurological_.Findings: Decreased sense of vibration and proprioception in toes and ankles bilaterally

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of nausea and weakness in a sexually active female patient presenting with right costovertebral angle tenderness.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient has a 1-day history of nausea and weakness. She is sexually active with 2 male partners, uses oral contraceptives, and uses condoms inconsistently. Her last menstrual period was 4 days ago.

Pelvic_.Findings: Normal

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the developmental concerns and identify the underlying cause of delayed menstruation and virilization in a prepubescent girl.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient developed normally throughout childhood but has not yet menstruated and has noticed a deepening of her voice. She has no other health issues.

Pelvic_.Findings: Blind vagina with slight clitoromegaly and two palpable testes

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying pathological process following a thrombotic stroke.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the emergency department 30 minutes after the onset of right-sided weakness and impaired speech. Diagnosed with thrombotic stroke and treated with alteplase. Neurologic  four weeks later shows residual right hemiparesis.

Neurological_.Findings: Residual right hemiparesis

CT_Scan.Findings: Hypoattenuation in the territory of the left middle cerebral artery

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the possibility of child abuse in a young patient with a head injury and inconsistent history.

Patient_Actor.History: Brought to the office with a large head contusion and altered mental status. Initial story of injury from a pot falling, later changed to tripping over a football. Father mentions a fall down the stairs.

Secondary_Symptoms: Cracks in the suture lines of the skull

Neurological_.Findings: Altered mental status, signs of head trauma

Skull_.Findings: Cracks in suture lines, flattened bone appearance

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of severe headache and associated symptoms following recent sinus infection.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a severe headache that has progressively worsened over the last 24 hours, primarily located in the left forehead and eye. The headaches have woken him from sleep and are not relieved by over-the-counter medications. He is recovering from a sinus infection that started 1 week ago. His medical history includes type 1 diabetes and a 10 pack-year smoking history.

Secondary_Symptoms: Waking from sleep due to headache

Imaging.Findings: Thrombosis of a sinus above the sella turcica

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the most appropriate clinical trial subtype for evaluating the efficacy of a new over-the-counter medication for upper respiratory infections.

Patient_Actor.History: The doctor is interested in developing a new treatment for symptomatic relief of viral upper respiratory infections and plans to compare outcomes between treated and untreated groups.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a patient with intermittent palpitations and anxiety.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with several episodes of palpitations lasting 5-10 seconds, which began a couple of days ago. She has been staying up late for her final s and denies alcohol or illicit drug use.

Secondary_Symptoms: Feeling of heart 'spinning out of control'

General_.Findings: No abnormalities noted

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management for a patient with abdominal pain and positive hCG without visible intrauterine pregnancy.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with worsening abdominal pain that started last night. She reports being otherwise healthy, does not use drugs, and has never had sexual intercourse.

Transvaginal_Ultrasound.Findings: No gestational sac within the uterus

Correct_Diagnosis: Ultrasound and serum hCG in 48 hours

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of dysphagia, hoarseness, and muscle weakness in a middle-aged male patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 2-month history of hoarseness and drooling. Initially had difficulty swallowing solid food, now struggles even with soft foods like oatmeal. He has also experienced weakness in both arms and an 8.2 kg (18 lb) weight loss.

Secondary_Symptoms: 3+ deep tendon reflexes in all extremities

Findings: Diffuse muscle atrophy in all extremities
Intact sensation to pinprick, light touch, and vibration

Correct_Diagnosis: Destruction of upper and lower motor neurons

Objective_for_Doctor: Prescribe a prophylactic agent to minimize retention of radioactive substances in the body following a radioactive waste leak.

Patient_Actor.History: A semi-truck carrying radioactive waste toppled over due to a blown tire, causing a small leak into a nearby river.

Secondary_Symptoms: Community concerns about health hazards from radioactive exposure

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of lower extremity edema, shortness of breath, and fatigue in a patient with a history of sickle cell disease and HIV infection.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a 3-week history of lower extremity edema, shortness of breath, fatigue, and weight gain. Her past medical history includes sickle cell disease and HIV infection, for which she is currently on combination therapy.

Physical_Exam.Findings: Periorbital and lower extremity edema

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the appropriate management strategy for a patient with traumatic brain injury and signs of increased intracranial pressure.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient was involved in a motorbike accident, hitting his head on a pole without wearing a helmet. Initially responsive but later became less responsive, only opening his eyes to painful stimuli.

Secondary_Symptoms: Laceration and bruising on the left side of the head
Anisocoria (left pupil 3 mm more dilated than the right)
Sluggish reaction of both pupils to light
Increased tone and hyperreflexia in right upper and lower extremities

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of palpitations in a patient with pneumonia and determine the next appropriate management step.

Patient_Actor.History: Two days after being admitted for pneumonia, the patient experiences repeated episodes of palpitations and nausea. He does not feel lightheaded and has no chest pain. He appears mildly distressed.

Physical__Findings.Findings: No abnormalities noted

ECG.Findings: ECG taken during an episode of palpitations (specific findings not provided)

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and determine the appropriate treatment for a patient presenting with intrusive thoughts and compulsive behaviors suggestive of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).

Patient_Actor.History: The patient is a college student admitted to an inpatient psychiatric unit due to thoughts about killing his girlfriend. He experiences overwhelming thoughts and auditory hallucinations urging him to harm her, which he finds distressing. He has no personal history of violence but has a family history of psychotic disorders. Previous treatments with haloperidol and fluoxetine were not effective.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Intrusive thoughts about killing his girlfriend
Secondary_Symptoms: Anxiety and guilt after experiencing intrusive thoughts
Compulsion to share thoughts with girlfriend for temporary relief
Worries about girlfriend's safety and repetitive prayers as a coping mechanism

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the cause of lower abdominal pain and kidney dysfunction in a patient following allogeneic kidney transplantation.

Patient_Actor.History: Two hours after undergoing allogeneic kidney transplantation for polycystic kidney disease, the patient developed lower abdominal pain.  reveals tenderness in the area where the donor kidney was placed.

Secondary_Symptoms: Tenderness to palpation in the donor kidney area
Diffuse tissue edema noted on ultrasound

Ultrasound.Findings: Diffuse tissue edema of the donor kidney

Correct_Diagnosis: Preformed antibodies against class I HLA molecules

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of chronic diarrhea and abdominal pain in a young female patient.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with several months of diarrhea, crampy abdominal pain, and has made dietary modifications without improvement. She reports many watery, non-bloody bowel movements per day and fatigue. She has not traveled outside of the country recently and has lost 10 pounds since her last visit.

Skin_.Findings: Skin tags and anal fissure

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cardiac function and determine the cause of fatigue, shortness of breath, and swelling in an elderly patient with a history of myocardial infarction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a week of fatigue, headache, and bilateral ankle swelling. She reports increased shortness of breath while walking and at night, requiring her to sleep in a recliner. Past medical history includes hypertension and a myocardial infarction three years ago with a stent placement. Current medications include hydrochlorothiazide, aspirin, and clopidogrel.

Peripheral_.Findings: Bilateral pitting edema in lower extremities and marked elevation of neck veins

Objective_for_Doctor: Assess the psychological impact of recent personal trauma on the patient's emotional and cognitive functioning.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient presents for a routine health maintenance . Recently learned about his wife's affair, which led to her leaving him for another partner. Currently caring for two children after reducing work hours and giving up tennis.

Secondary_Symptoms: Feelings of loss related to wife leaving
Change in lifestyle due to increased responsibility
Engagement in intellectual pursuits to cope with emotions

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the pathogen responsible for the neonate's chorioretinitis and brain calcifications, and determine the additional microorganism that can be prevented by the same drug.

Patient_Actor.History: Born full-term with chorioretinitis and swelling and calcifications in the brain due to an in utero infection.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of episodic abdominal pain and bleeding tendencies in a previously healthy child, considering family history of autoimmune disease.

Patient_Actor.History: The boy has a 3-month history of episodic abdominal pain, increased tiredness, and has been experiencing bulky stools for the past 2 months. His family history includes a maternal aunt with systemic lupus erythematosus.

Secondary_Symptoms: Bulky stools that are difficult to flush
Scattered ecchymoses across bilateral knees, left forearm, and upper back

Abdominal_.Findings: Mildly distended abdomen; hyperactive bowel sounds

Skin_.Findings: Scattered ecchymoses across bilateral knees, left forearm, and upper back

Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the part of the respiratory system from which a biopsy sample showing simple cuboidal cells and smooth muscle was obtained.

Patient_Actor.History: The investigator is conducting a study on histological changes in the respiratory tree of a chronic smoker. Multiple biopsy samples were taken from the respiratory system.

Secondary_Symptoms: Histological changes due to chronic smoking

Histopathology.Findings: Simple cuboidal cells with a surrounding layer of smooth muscle; chondrocytes and goblet cells are absent

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of frequent episodes of blanking out in a pediatric patient and determine appropriate treatment.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with frequent episodes of blanking out or daydreaming that last for less than 10 seconds. He is unaware of his surroundings during these episodes and does not respond to questions or his name, but resumes his previous activity afterward.

Objective_for_Doctor: Diagnose the cause of pneumonia in an elderly patient presenting with fever and cough.

Patient_Actor.History: Patient was brought to the emergency department with fever and a cough producing yellow-green sputum. He resides in an assisted living facility.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Fever and cough with yellow-green sputum
Secondary_Symptoms: Diffuse crackles over the right lung fields
Consolidation in the right lower lobe on chest x-ray

Lung_.Findings: Diffuse crackles over the right lung fields

Chest_X-Ray.Findings: Consolidation in the right lower lobe

Sputum_Culture.Findings: Organism that produces blue-green pigments and smells of sweet grapes

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of acute chest pain and identify elevated biochemical markers following a potential myocardial infarction.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient arrived at the emergency department due to intense central chest pain lasting for 30 minutes. She has a history of atrial fibrillation and type 2 diabetes mellitus.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Intense central chest pain radiating down the left arm

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the underlying cause of fatigue, muscle cramps, and neurological symptoms in a patient with a history of osteoarthritis and hypertension.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports 6 weeks of fatigue and muscle cramps, with episodes of tingling around the mouth and in the fingers and toes. He has a history of osteoarthritis of the knees and hypertension. Current medications include ibuprofen and ramipril, and he has a significant smoking history of one pack daily for 35 years.

Secondary_Symptoms: Facial muscle twitching upon tapping over the facial nerve area

Vital_Signs.ECG_Findings: Sinus rhythm with a prolonged QT interval

ECG.Findings: Sinus rhythm with prolonged QT interval

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate the cause of an itchy rash in a 4-week-old infant and provide appropriate advice regarding skin care.

Patient_Actor.History: The mother reports a new, itchy rash on the infant's body. The infant has no significant past medical history and has an older sister who experienced similar symptoms at the same age. The mother has been bathing the infant at least twice a day.

Skin_.Findings: Confluent erythematous patches and plaques with tiny vesicles and scaling over lower back and abdomen

Correct_Diagnosis: Hot baths that are too long, or too frequent, can dry out the skin.

Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a patient with urinary leakage and assess for pelvic organ prolapse.

Her medical history includes a 12 pack-year smoking history, chronic bronchitis for 3 years, and arterial hypertension for 3 years. Objective_for_Doctor: Identify the underlying condition associated with acute tearing chest pain and subsequent death.

Symptoms.Primary_Symptom: Acute tearing chest pain radiating to the back

Autopsy_Findings.Description: Increase in mucoid extracellular matrix and loss of smooth muscle cell nuclei in the media of large arteries.

Objective_for_Doctor: Determine the cause of anemia in a patient with recent symptoms of fatigue and lightheadedness, particularly in the context of heavy menstrual bleeding.
